proverbs.proverb: Ká dijú ká ṣe bí ẹní kú, ká wo ẹni tí yóò sunkún ẹni; ká sáré ṣẹ́ṣẹ́ ká fẹsẹ̀ kọ, ká wo ẹni tí yóò ṣeni pẹ̀lẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Close your eyes and feign death to see who'll mourn you; run and be ensure you trip to see those who truly care.
proverbs.wisdom: Adversities often show true friends.

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá fara pamọ́, ló máa ńgbó.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that gets to grow to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: Drawing undue attention to oneself isn't always a smart move; flying under the radar has its merits and can prove beneficial, sometimes.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó ńpa olóko l'ẹ́kún, ni àparò fí ńṣe ẹ̀rin rín, nínú igbó.
proverbs.translation: What troubles the farmer is what amuses the patridge in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what challenges one, is what inspires another.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í sọ òkò sí ẹyẹ tó ńwá ọ̀nà àti fò.
proverbs.translation: Do not throw stones at a bird that wants to fly away.
proverbs.wisdom: Wisdom is it: do not pre-empt or worsen an already deplorable situation.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànná yànná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹ̀rẹ̀ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, can't enjoy the glittering (beauty) of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Adùn-uń-ṣe bí ohun tí Ọlọ́run lọ́wọ́ sí; aṣòroóṣe bí èyí tí Ọlọ́run kò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: As easy to do as what God supports, and as difficult to achieve as what He opposes.
proverbs.wisdom: If God is in it, it will work out; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Tí òjò bá dá tán, ti abẹ́ igi kì í dá bọ́rọ́.
proverbs.translation: When the rain subsides, the (rain water) dripping under trees seldom cease on time.
proverbs.wisdom: Consequences far outlive actions: let's be mindful of the potential consequences of our actions.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá fẹ́ fò gbọ́dọ̀ kọ́kọ́ sáré.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to fly, must first run.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing comes from nothing: outstanding outcomes, don't just happen, they have to be prepared for; we must sow, if we want to reap.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ológìnní bá gun àjà, ojú u rẹ̀ á tó ilé, á tó oko.
proverbs.translation: If the cat can climb unto the attic, it will have a view of both the home and the farm.
proverbs.wisdom: Aspire to go up, to be more: if you go up, you will see more; remaining on the ground limits our vision.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán àrẹ̀mọ tó ńdé fìlà, tó bá gorí ìtẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀, á dé ohun tó ju àrán lọ.
proverbs.translation: A royal heir who is wearing a cap is simply in haste; he will get to don far more than velvet caps upon ascending his father's throne.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; don’t force issues before their time.

proverbs.proverb: A kò lè tìtorí pé ọ̀nà jìn, kí a wá padà sẹ́yìn.
proverbs.translation: No one should abort a journey simply because the destination is far.
proverbs.wisdom: Finish whatever you start: be steadfast, be undaunted: keep your eyes on the goals,  always.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tó rí'bi tí kò fọ́, ire ló ńdúró de.
proverbs.translation: The eyes that saw evil and did not go blind are waiting to see good.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í tán n'ígbá osùn ká máà rí fi pa ọmọ lára.
proverbs.translation: The camwood powder container cannot be so exhausted as not to contain enough powder to rub on the baby.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; there is always a way forward, regardless of how things appear.

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch-dark night, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Darkness won't be forever: look beyond to the coming dawn; keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ḿbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come. Keep hope alive and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín igbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun.
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver stops carving calabashes, those already carved will remain.
proverbs.wisdom: Even if we refrain from kind acts, which we shouldn't, those rendered remain; keep sowing kindness: the harvest will come.

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed it will positively impact two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success can be contagious.

proverbs.proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jìyà, bó bá dàgbà tán, á máa tó ọdẹ ẹ́ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyẹ kò bá fín ẹyẹ níràn, ojú ọ̀run tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì fara kanra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: No one needs to go down for you to rise; see the world as endowed enough for us all, because it is.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni táa fún lóbì tí ò ṣọpẹ́, báa fun lọ́mọ kò ní ṣàna.
proverbs.translation: A person who isn't thankful when given kolanut won't pay his dues if given a bride.
proverbs.wisdom: Gratitude is it; whoever isn't grateful for small favours won't be grateful for big ones.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò mọ bí ẹgbẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ ṣe là, á sá àsákú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever unduly bothers about his or her peers' relative successes, will hustle himself or herself to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; compare yourself to no one: you don't know anyone's story: stay in your lane.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ká a.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed will be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; answers can be so complete as to be overwhelming.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀tún wẹ òsì, òsì wẹ ọ̀tún, lọwọ́ fi ńmọ́.
proverbs.translation: The right hand washing the left hand and vice versa is how both hands become thoroughly clean.
proverbs.wisdom: Reciprocate kindness: we all win when we do; cooperate; collaborate; be willing to give: we all can, and we should

proverbs.proverb: Olúkálùkù ló mọ bó ṣe ńrìn tí ilẹ̀ fi ńṣú u.
proverbs.translation: Everyone knows how he or she walks until the night falls.
proverbs.wisdom: To each their own; people have (and are entitled to) their choices, and have their reasons: let them be; be hesitant to play the expert in another's matter.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún ata nínú odó, báa lọ̀ ọ́ lórí ọlọ, ìwà ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀
proverbs.translation: Whether pounded in a mortar or ground on a grinding stone, pepper would remain inseparable from its character.
proverbs.wisdom: We can't pretend to be who we aren't for long: eventually, one's real self will show through

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọ́mọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom:
Prevention is better than cure; it's good to seek help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: Focus on where you are going, not where you had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be focused; be forward-looking; let go of past failures and hurts: keep your eyes on the goals.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tó bá kù díẹ̀ kí ọmọ olóore jìn sí kòtò, mànàmáná á ṣiṣẹ́ ìmọ́lẹ̀ fún un
proverbs.translation: Even if it's just a little before a kind person stumbles into a ditch, the lightning will strike to light up his or her path.
proverbs.wisdom:
Kindness pays; help always abounds for a good person
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àpọ̀jù ọ̀rọ̀ ni í mú'ni pe ọba lẹ́nìkejì ẹni.
proverbs.translation: Excessive talk is what makes one refer to the king as a colleague.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; too much of anything, even if good, can be detrimental; exercise self control, always.

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀kùn tí kò bá ní alùgbàgbà, kó yára dẹ́kun àpárá dí dá.
proverbs.translation: A door with no frame, had better cease all pranks.
proverbs.wisdom: Exercise self-control; operate within your means; don't make an open show of your weaknesses.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a fẹ́ rí, la fẹ́ rí; kò sí ọjọ́ táa jí, táà rí èèyàn.
proverbs.translation: The person we love to see is the only one who interests us; there is no day we wake up without people around.
proverbs.wisdom: Love can be choosy; to be lonely or miss anyone is not for want of people around.

proverbs.proverb: Bí à ó ti tó ni kì í jẹ́ ká ṣìwà hù; bí à ó ti mọ ni kì í jẹ́ ká mọ ìwà á hù.
proverbs.translation: How great we hope to be in life, keeps us from misbehaving; how great we will actually be, limits how well-behaved we are.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, we act in a manner consistent with our destiny.

proverbs.proverb: Bí akòko bá ńsọ igi láì jáwọ́, bó pẹ́ bó yá, á rí nǹkan gbà lọ́wọ́ igi.
proverbs.translation: If the woodpecker persistently pecks a tree without relenting, it will get something from the tree, eventualy.
proverbs.wisdom: Virtually nothing is impossible to the persistent; if we won't give up, we can't but win

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún'ni.
proverbs.translation: Whatever (blessing) is sweet, whatever is much and whatever is enduring are all gifts from God.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately all blessings are from God - if it has been good and enduring, it is from Him; give Him thanks.

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ajá bá fi ogún ọdún sá, ìrin fàájì ni fún ẹṣin.
proverbs.translation: A race that takes dogs twenty years, is a mere leisurely walk to horses.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what proves a challenge to one, may well be a walkover to another.

proverbs.proverb: Oò ṣá igi lọ́gbẹ́, oò ta ògùrọ̀ lọfà, o dé ìdí ọ̀pẹ o ńgbẹ́nu sókè; ṣé ọ̀fẹ́ ló ńro ni?
proverbs.translation: You didn't hack an oil palm nor stab a raffia palm, yet you opened up your mouth under the tree; does the wine drip freely?
proverbs.wisdom: No free lunch: pay the price; to reap, you need to sow

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá fi ìkà kan oníkà lójú, áá ní òun un wọn ní wón jọ ńtún ìlú ṣe.
proverbs.translation: If we don't show the wicked his or her wicked deeds, he or she will claim to be among those developing the town.
proverbs.wisdom: Objective self-appraisal can be difficult: wicked fellows seldom accept that they are.

proverbs.proverb: Agídí inú ejò, ni kì í jẹ́ kí ejò rí ọmọ gbéjó.
proverbs.translation: Snake's stubborness is why it seldom enjoys the company of its offspring.
proverbs.wisdom:
Broad-mindedness and flexibility are crucial; shun needless stubbornness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí àkàrà bá dé eyín akáyín, á di egungun ni.
proverbs.translation: When the bean fritter gets to the mouth of a toothless person, it would seem like bone.
proverbs.wisdom:
Preparation is crucial; a simple task is always complex to anyone ill-prepared for it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó yẹ'ni ló yẹ'ni, okùn ọrùn ò yẹ adìyẹ; ó dẹ̀ yẹ adìyẹ, ẹni tó mú u dání lojú máa tì.
proverbs.translation: What is fitting is what is fitting; a leash does not suit the hen; even if it does, the shame is on the person handling it.
proverbs.wisdom: Some things are not proper & befitting; avoid them

proverbs.proverb: Etí mẹ́ta ò yẹ orí; èèyàn mẹ́ta ò lè dúró ní méjì-méjì.
proverbs.translation: Three ears do not suit the head; three people cannot stand in groups of twos.
proverbs.wisdom: There is always a right and wrong way to do anything: focus on the right way.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dé ejò mọ́ fìlà ká jayé ire.
proverbs.translation: One cannot put on a cap with a snake in it, and be at peace.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be conscious of the risks in your choices; avoid intolerably high risks or scenarios with zero way out.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù, kì í pa ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A stone thrown in anger can hardly kill the bird.
proverbs.wisdom:
Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results; tone that fury down: it can be self-defeating.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa náwó, kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun, kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: Generosity does not necessarily make anyone poor, neither does stinginess make anyone rich.
proverbs.wisdom: Be generous; kindness pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò lè ṣe iṣẹ́ oníṣẹ́, kò ní lè ṣe tara rẹ̀
proverbs.translation: Whoever won't do someone else's work well, won't do his or hers well, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: How we work for someone else, good or bad, is how we'll work for ourselves, ultimately; it pays to do our very best, always

proverbs.proverb: Orí ò mọ ibùsùn; ìbá tún ibẹ̀ ṣe láàárọ̀.
proverbs.translation: No one knows his or her future for certain; else one would have prepared for it, ahead of time.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes; no one knows the future for certain: hope absolutely on Him who does.

proverbs.proverb: O jó ní Ifọ́n, Ifọ́n tú; o jó ní Èjìgbò, Èjìgbò fà ya bí aṣọ; o wá dé Ọ̀ràngún o tún ńjùdí; ṣé gbogbo ìlú lo fẹ́ bàjẹ́ ni?
proverbs.translation: Your dance desolated Ifon and shredded Ejigbo like clothes; yet at Orangun you were twerking your hips; must you destroy all towns?
proverbs.wisdom: Goodness is it

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no end to learning: be open to it; age is no barrier to learning.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ìpọ́njú là ńmọ ọ̀rẹ́; ọjọ́ tó bá burú là ńmọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni
proverbs.translation: It's during tough times that true friends are known; when things are really difficult is when you'll know those who truly care.
proverbs.wisdom: Difficult times have one good purpose: they help reveal those who truly care

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wà á ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Handle complex issues patiently and calmly; it's not very smart to further complicate an already complicated situation.

proverbs.proverb: Òòrùn tó kù lókè tó aṣọ ọ́ gbẹ.
proverbs.translation: The (hours of) sunlight remaining is still good enough to dry clothes.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive and give no room to despair; keep working with what you have, right where you are: it's not over yet. #MondayMotivation

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God, the Creator, has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.
#Yorubas

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ tó bà lórí igi àgbọn, eré ló lọ ṣe, kì í ṣe omi àgbọn ló fẹ́ mu.
proverbs.translation: A bird that perches on a coconut palm is not out to drink coconut water, but simply to while away time.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions speak louder than words; it is fruitless to engage in potentially fruitless pursuits.

proverbs.proverb: Olè tó bẹ́ gìjà sí inú ilé onílé, bí onílé rí í, bí kò rí i, gìjà rẹ̀ tún ku ẹ̀ẹ̀kan.
proverbs.translation: A thief who hopped into someone else's property, whether or not the owner notices, still has one more hopping (out) to do.
proverbs.wisdom: Personal integrity is it: Ill-gotten benefits seldom last.

proverbs.proverb: A kò gbọdọ̀ kúnlẹ̀ pa òkété, kúnlẹ̀ ta òkété, kí a tún wá kúnlẹ̀ gba owó òkété.
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't have to genuflect to kill bush rat, genuflect to sell it, and still have to genuflect to be paid for it.
proverbs.wisdom: Service shouldn't be servitude; be fair: deny no one his

proverbs.proverb: Bí àáké ṣe lágbára tó, kò leè ṣiṣẹ́ abẹfẹ́lẹ́.
proverbs.translation: As strong as the axe is, it cannot replace the blade.
proverbs.wisdom: We are all uniquely gifted in our own ways; envy no one - be contented to stay in your lane.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó lórí ò ní fìlà; ẹni tó ní fìlà ò lórí; ẹni tó lórí, tó ní fìlà, kò rí òde dé e lọ
proverbs.translation: A man with a head has no cap; the one with a cap has no head; the man with both head and cap, has no where to go.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; we are all differently endowed

proverbs.proverb: Ẹlẹ́rù ló ńgbé ẹrù ẹ̀ kí a tó báa fọwọ́ kún un
proverbs.translation: The owner has to first pick up his (or her) luggage before others will extend hands of support.
proverbs.wisdom: Take responsibility and ownership, before seeking help; don't expect support from others, if you're unwilling to do all you can

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá kò pa, kó má a dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; remain ever grateful to God: whatever is bad, could have been worse, were it not for Him.

proverbs.proverb: Dídùn ló dùn tá ḿbá ọ̀rẹ́ j'ẹ̀kọ; ti ilé oge tó oge é jẹ.
proverbs.translation: One eats with a friend because of the pleasure of friendship not necessarily because one lacks.
proverbs.wisdom:
Take no one for granted: friendly overtures are not necessarily attempts at currying favours.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: O rí àgbébọ̀ adìyẹ lọ́jà, o sáré sí i; tó bá ńyé ogún tó ńpa ogún ṣé aládìyẹ á tà á?
proverbs.translation: You found a fully grown hen in the market and rushed to buy it; were it to be great at breeding, would the owner sell it?
proverbs.wisdom: Think twice about anything cheap or free; it can prove costlier

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ gún ẹṣin ní kẹ́ṣẹ́, ẹ ló ńtà'pá, baba ta ni wọ́n máa ki irin bọ̀ ní'kùn tí kò ní ju apá?
proverbs.translation: You spurred a horse and wondered why it kicked; who would be struck with steel in the belly and not react?
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; be considerate; treat others as you would want to be treated

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tó bá máa kún, á gba ẹ̀gbin mọ́'ra.
proverbs.translation: A dunghill that would be filled up would be tolerant of filth.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is, nor indeed can be, perfect: it is human to err - be tolerant; intolerance constrains our growth: have a large and forgiving heart.

proverbs.proverb: Àìfarabalẹ̀ ojú ni kì í fi rí imú bọ̀rọ̀; bí ojú bá fara balẹ̀, á rí imú.
proverbs.translation: Their lack of calmness is why the eyes are unable to see the nose, easily; if the eyes can be calm, they'll get to see the nose.
proverbs.wisdom: Calmness and patience are crucial to resolving any complex issue.

proverbs.proverb: Ìyànjú là ńgbà; bá ò gbìyànjú, bí ọ̀lẹ là ńrí; ojojúmọ́ ni í rẹ'ni
proverbs.translation: One must make effort; if not, one would seem lazy: everyone gets tired every day.
proverbs.wisdom: We all get tired; making effort regardless is what, oftentimes, makes the difference; always do your best: excuses limit us

proverbs.proverb: Ogbe orí àkùkọ, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ ọ́n ṣe àkùkọ; Ọlọ́run ló dá àkùkọ lọ́lá
proverbs.translation: The comb on the head of the cock was not acquired by it's prowess; it is the blessing of God.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest & thankful; our blessings are more from God than from our individual knowhow

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n díẹ̀, òmùgọ̀ díẹ̀, l'ọba fi ńto ìlú.
proverbs.translation: Applying a little wisdom and a little stupidity is how a king administers his kingdom.
proverbs.wisdom:
There's some sense in nonsense; often, what seemed stupid could well be a reflection of untold wisdom.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwò rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is turn by turn; a season goes, another comes; nothing lasts forever; humility is it.

proverbs.proverb: Ijó tí kì í ṣe ijó ẹni, ìwọ̀n là ńkó gbẹ̀du ẹ̀ lójúde ọba.
proverbs.translation: Be moderate in a dance you are not adept at, in the king's presence.
proverbs.wisdom: Be smart:  don’t make a public display of your weakness or ignorance.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀ kékeré létí àwo gbẹ̀gìrì, tí a nù kúrò, bó bá kúrò lójú, kô lè tán lọ́kàn.
proverbs.translation: A tiny turd on the edge of a plate of bean soup that is wiped off, even if  overlooked by the eyes, hardly leaves the mind.
proverbs.wisdom: A little indiscretion easily messes up a good reputation.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ta eyín lójú ẹni tí ebi ńpa.
proverbs.translation: Do not pick your teeth in the presence of a hungry person.
proverbs.wisdom: Be courteous, considerate and tactful; be sensitive to the effect of your choices on others.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ḿbá máa kú, kí nkú, lọmọkùrin fi ńdi alágbára; mi ò lè wá kú, lọmọkùnrín fi ńya ọ̀lẹ.
proverbs.translation: If I perish, I perish, is how a young man becomes a strong man; I can't come and kill myself, is how he becomes lazy.
proverbs.wisdom: Be bold, be courageous; confront challenges with grit

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom:
God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kò gbọdọ̀ tìtorí kòkòrò kó síni lójú, kí a wá ki igi bọ ojú ọ̀hún.
proverbs.translation: No one pokes a stick into his or her eye simply because an insect entered the eye.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be moderate; adopt extreme measures with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Afọwọ́fọnná kan kì í mú ọwọ́ dúró.
proverbs.translation: No one packs live coals with his or her hands and maintain steady hands.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue peace: anyone with the proclivity for trouble cannot but be troubled, and vice versa; we get whatever we give, and in abundance, too.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ọdún mẹ́ta ò tó ẹni tí à ńgbára á lé; ọ̀tá oṣù mẹ́fà ò tó ẹni tí à ńsà lóògùn
proverbs.translation: A friend of three years is not one to be fully trusted and an enemy of six months is not one to be grievously assaulted.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive and measured; avoid rashness.

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain; be willing to pay the price tag.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà lẹ̀sìn; bí a bá ṣe mọ̀ ọ́ hù ni í ṣeé gbe’ni.
proverbs.translation: Character is like religion; how good one's character is, that is how well it favours one.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character attracts good fortune; bad character repels it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Handle anger with caution; avoid rashness.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; excessive talk was how the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; be moderate even in a good cause

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀lẹ a máa fà lórí ìrìn, tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí kì í pẹ́ kí òṣì tó bá a.
proverbs.translation: The lazy person can be so sluggish in walking that poverty soon catches up with him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Indolence can be costly: do your best; do the best with what you have, right where you are.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a fi ẹ̀sọ̀ mú kì í bàjẹ́; ohun a fi agbára mú ní ńnini lára.
proverbs.translation: What we handle with calmness seldom presents issues; what we forcefully address is what gives us much stress.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; don't force issues before their times: undue haste can prove costly, at the end.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We are inseparable from our character.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can pretend to be who he or she is not for very long; with patience, the real character will show through, ultimately. ##proverb

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ tó bà lórí igi tí kò ké, ẹ̀yìn ọ̀rọ̀ ló ńrò.
proverbs.translation: A bird that perched on a tree, but made no sound was simply mindful of the consequences.
proverbs.wisdom: it is always better to think deeply about both intended and unintended consequences, before one acts.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ní orí rere tí kò níwà rere, ìwà ẹ ló máa ba orí rere ẹ̀ jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Anyone with a good destiny but a bad character, will soon lose his destiny to his bad character.
proverbs.wisdom: Bad character traits can impose limitations.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó ńpa olóko l'ẹ́kún, ni àparò fí ńṣe ẹ̀rin rín, nínú igbó.
proverbs.translation: An issue that troubles the farmer is what amuses the patridge in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what challenges someone may be an object of amusement to another.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èkúté bá fara balẹ̀, á jẹ nínú owó ológbò.
proverbs.translation: If the rat can be reasonably calm (and patient), it would eat out of the cat's wealth.
proverbs.wisdom: With patience, virtually nothing is impossible.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water (you have) in the trough, simply because you heard the rumbling of the cloud.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't be presumptuous; never jump the gun; it's never wise to count one's chickens before they are hatched.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Omidan tó lóun yóò jẹ oyè abọ́bakú, òwe burúkù ló ńpa fún Olorì l'áàfin
proverbs.translation: A young lady who insists she'd like to die with the king,  is really sending the queen a lousy message.
proverbs.wisdom: Not all positive gestures are noble: look beyond the surface; don't be naive.

proverbs.proverb: Oríṣiríṣi ọ̀bẹ là ńrí lọ́jọ́ ikú erin.
proverbs.translation: All manner of knives show up upon the death of the elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: A major setback can be humbling and make one vulnerable to all sorts of situations.

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún'ni.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is sweet, whatever is much and whatever endures are all from God.
proverbs.wisdom:
If it is going to be good and sustainable, it will have to come from God; ultimately all blessings are from Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Orí ò mọ ibùsùn; ìbá tún ibẹ̀ ṣe láàárọ̀.
proverbs.translation: No one knows his or her future for certain; else, one would have prepared well for it, ahead of time.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows the future for certain; put your hands in the hands of God who does. #Happy #Independence #Anniversary

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tí a jí adìyẹ bí, yóò jí adìyẹ ju ìyá a rẹ̀ lọ.
proverbs.translation: A child whose mother used to steal chickens while pregnant with him or her, will steal more chickens than the mother.
proverbs.wisdom: Evil, uncurtailed, will fester; harvests will exceed the seeds sown: nothing remains the same.

proverbs.proverb: Ewúrẹ́ tó lè kígbe jù, kọ́ lebi ńpa jù.
proverbs.translation: The goat that bleats the loudest is not necessarily the most famished.
proverbs.wisdom:
Look beyond the obvious: appearance is not necessarily reality; noise or drama is not necessarily substance.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í pẹ̀lú ọ̀bọ já'ko.
proverbs.translation: Do not  join the monkey to roam the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain the high ground; never descend to join anyone do despicable things.s

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ ló lésì, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ là ńf'èsì sí
proverbs.translation: There is always an appropriate response to every statement, but it's not every statement that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't be distracted: not all issues deserve your attention: don't major on minors

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi oró san oró; aforósanró kì í jẹ́ k'óró ó tán láyé; afìkàsànkà kì í jẹ́ ki ìkà ó tán bọ̀rọ̀
proverbs.translation: Do not repay evil with evil; those who repay evil with evil or wickedness with wickedness make them fester.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't seek to get even: forgive & just move on; let go & let God

proverbs.proverb: Adẹ́tẹ̀ ò lè fún wàrà, ṣùgbọ́n ó lè da wàrà nù.
proverbs.translation: A leper cannot express milk, but can very well waste it.
proverbs.wisdom: Underestimate no one: those who cannot build, may be able to destroy.

proverbs.proverb: Ìka tó bá ńfún'ni lóúnjẹ, a kì í gé e jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Do not bite the fingers that feed you.
proverbs.wisdom: Do not repay good with evil; never be unkind to your benefactors; remember tomorrow.

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́, làá wà, táà rí èyí tó tọ́.
proverbs.translation: It's while on the crooked tree that one will find the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Where we are; quite often, is a stepping stone to where we'd like to be: don't despise where you are.

proverbs.proverb: Agbẹ́-igi-lére kan kò lè gbẹ́ inú u rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No sculptor can carve the internals of the statue he or she is carving.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a limit to what anyone can do: be reasonable in your expectations; most people are doing the very best they can, regardless of how it seems.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsá fún iṣẹ́ tó lóun ò fẹ́ ya akúùṣẹ́, ta ni ìṣẹ́ tọ́ sí bikòṣe ẹni tó ńsá fún iṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A person who dodges work, but says he doesn't want to be poor; who else deserves poverty, but the one who dodges work.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays; there's nothing in doing nothing.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A leaf can't drop off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom:
Nothing surprises God; nothing and no one escape His attention; keep hope alive: He will get to you.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Èpè ilá, kì í mú àgbọ̀nrín.
proverbs.translation: Okro's curses have no impact on the antelope (okro is one of antelope's natural food).
proverbs.wisdom: Often, not all the things we forbid are wrong and not all the things we embrace are right; no one knows it all.

proverbs.proverb: Ọkùnrin tó rí ogun tó sá, tó rí iṣẹ́ tí kò ṣe, bí wọ́n bá kó ilé láàdúgbò, wọ́n a fura sí i.
proverbs.translation: A man who sees war and dodges, sees work and refuses,  will be suspected, if there's a theft in the neighbourhood.
proverbs.wisdom: There's nothing in doing nothing; do something: be engaged.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe igúnnugún tó fi pá lórí, tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi yọ gẹ̀gẹ̀ lọ́rùn, tó bá ṣe àgbò bọ̀lọ̀jọ̀, á ti fa ìwo ẹ̀ tú.
proverbs.translation: If what balded the vulture and gave the crow goiter had befallen the full-grown ram, it'd have lost its horns.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people are different

proverbs.proverb: A kì í kánjú tu olú ọrán; igba a rẹ̀ kò tó ó sè lọ́bẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: The oran mushroom is not to be harvested in haste; two hundred pieces of it are not sufficient for (a pot of) soup.
proverbs.wisdom: Handle complex issues calmly and methodically; hurried actions are prone to errors.

proverbs.proverb: Bí igi bá rorò, ó níláti bá igbó gbé.
proverbs.translation: Even if a tree is ferocious, it must still cohabit with the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Peace is crucial and better pursued at all times.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbín ò lè sáré bí Ajá; ìyẹn ò ní kó máà de ibi tó ńlọ.
proverbs.translation: The snail cannot run as fast as the dog; that won't stop the snail from getting to wherever it's going.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́ irọ́; ọmọ èyàn ò fẹ́ òdodo; bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ ò pé mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: God hates lies; man hates truths; yet there is no third option in a discourse.
proverbs.wisdom: Better to stick with the truth, even when there are no easy options.

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé é sọ.
proverbs.translation: Hunger should not be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious matter should not be casually handled.

proverbs.proverb: Òjò tó rọ̀ sí ewúro, náà ló rọ̀ sí ìrèké
proverbs.translation: The same rain that fell on the bitter-leaf, fell on the sugarcane (yet bitter-leaf is bitter while sugarcane remains sweet)
proverbs.wisdom: Let's be better: our reactions tell of who we really are deep down; bitter or vengeful responses are by choice

proverbs.proverb: Àdàbà ò náání à ńkùn'gbẹ́; pápá ńjó, ẹyẹ oko fò lọ.
proverbs.translation: The dove is unmoved by the bush being set ablaze; once the bush is on fire, the dove simply flies away.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; have an assured plan B, always: it engenders calm in the midst of a storm

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sí'nú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun, sooner or later (when the sun sets), the shade will come.
proverbs.wisdom: Be persistent and keep hope alive: tough times won't last forever; if you won't quit, you can't but win.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a ṣe lóore tí kò dúpẹ́, bí ìgbà tí ọlọ́ṣà kó'ni lẹ́rù lọ ni.
proverbs.translation: An ungrateful recipient of one's kindness, makes one feel like one has been robbed.
proverbs.wisdom:
Pay attention - never trivialize a kind act; show gratitude; ingratitude inhibits kindness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìbàjẹ́ ènìyàn, kò lè dá iṣẹ́ Olúwa dúró.
proverbs.translation: Man's wicked acts cannot stop God's work (or purpose).
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; man cannot be more than man, yet God remains God; keep moving forward, undeterred.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ẹni tó di ojú kọ́ ló ńsùn; gbogbo ojú tí a là sílẹ̀ kọ́ ló ń ríran.
proverbs.translation: Not all those who closed their eyes are sleeping; not all eyes that are wide open are seeing.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious, always.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ kì í pẹ́ lórí igi tí kò l'éso.
proverbs.translation: Birds hardly perch for long on a tree with no fruits.
proverbs.wisdom:
People hardly value what has no value; consistently add value and you won't lack attention.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀yà tí kò bá dá iná ọ̀dẹ mọ̀ yàtọ̀ sí ìmọ́lẹ̀ òṣùpá, yóò f'ara gba ọta ìbọn lọ́wọ́ ọlọ́dẹ.
proverbs.translation: A grasscutter that can't differentiate between the hunter's camp fire and the moonlight will soon bear the hunter's gun shots.
proverbs.wisdom: Be sensitive to high risk endeavours.

proverbs.proverb: Àgùtàn ò ní sùn láàrín ajá, kó má fi ara kó eégbọn.
proverbs.translation: A sheep won't lie in the midst of dogs and not get dog ticks on itself.
proverbs.wisdom: Association matters; ultimately, we cannot but reflect the company we keep.s

proverbs.proverb: Ojúbọ̀rọ̀ kò ṣeé gba ọmọ lọ́wọ́ èkùrọ́.
proverbs.translation: Extricating the kernel from the palm kernel nut is not an easy task.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things don't always come easy: be willing to pay the price; looking for the easy way can be inefficient: give it what it takes.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni táa fún lóbì tí ò ṣọpẹ́, báa fun lọ́mọ kò ní ṣàna.
proverbs.translation: A person who isn't thankful when given kolanut won't pay his dues if given a bride.
proverbs.wisdom: Whoever is ungrateful for minor favours won't be grateful for major ones.

proverbs.proverb: Àpa àímú délé ni kò jẹ́ kí a mọ̀ pé ológbò ńṣe ọdẹ.
proverbs.translation: Its penchant for not bringing home its games, is why the cat is not known for hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: Think strategically; the future is more important than the present.

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kótópó gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, bí ìfẹ́ bá wà láàárín in wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is good enough for 20 friends, if there is love among them.
proverbs.wisdom:
Little is much when love is in it; with love, other concerns pale.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọmọdé bá rí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tó ńgun ẹṣin lọ níwájú, ó yẹ kó wo ẹgbẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀ tó ńfi ẹsẹ̀ rìn bọ̀ lẹ́yìn
proverbs.translation: A youngster who is bothered about his or her mates riding horses ahead, should look back to see his or her father's peers trudging behind.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹyẹ ò bá fín ẹyẹ ní'ràn, ojú ọrun tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì f'ara kan'ra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: Live and let live; no need to pull anyone down to rise: there is enough room for all

proverbs.proverb: Ara ẹni ò dára; ìwà dúndùn ò sunwọ̀n; ara ẹni ní ká fura sí.
proverbs.translation: If everyone around is bad, even a sweet disposition is unpleasant, look inward and be wary of your own character.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Á ka owó tì lálẹ́, oníbárà tó ńṣe ẹ̀ẹ́kẹ́ èébú
proverbs.translation: A quarrelsome street beggar would find few alms to count at the end of the day.
proverbs.wisdom: Courtesy and civility go a long way.

proverbs.proverb: O jó ní Ifọ́n, Ifọ́n tú; o jó ní Èjìgbò, Èjìgbò fà ya bí aṣọ; o wá dé Ọ̀ràngún o tún ńjùdí; ṣé gbogbo ìlú lo fẹ́ bàjẹ́ ni?
proverbs.translation: Your dance desolated Ifon and shredded Ejigbo like clothes; yet at Orangun you were twerking your hips; must you destroy all towns?
proverbs.wisdom: Goodness is it

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán àrẹ̀mọ tó ńdé fìlà, tó bá gorí ìtẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀, yóò dé ohun tó ju àrán lọ.
proverbs.translation: A royal heir who is wearing a cap is simply in haste; he'll get to don far more than velvet caps upon ascending his father's throne.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; don’t force issues before their time.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá ti ńbínú jù, kó má ṣiṣẹ́ mọ́, nítorí, iṣẹ́ tí o fi ojú ọwọ́ ṣe, ẹ̀yìn ọwọ́ ló máa fi dà á nù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever often gets overly angry, should simply no longer work, as he or she will throw away with the backhand whatever his or her open hand achieved.
proverbs.wisdom: Tame anger.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; promptly take advantage of opportunities.

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì; kò lè já;
proverbs.translation: The rams testicles are merely dangling; they won't fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Hang in there; never ever give up; tough times won't be forever.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is man’s adornment.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character beautifies; it is adorable and attractive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Èkúté tó dúró sí ọ̀ọ́kán tó ńṣẹ́'wọ́ sí ológbò pé kó máa bọ̀, ó ti rí inú isà tó máa kó sí ni
proverbs.translation: A mouse that stays afar off and dares the cat to come, has a burrow close by to dash into.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive: look beyond the obvious; people are daring, when a plan B exists.

proverbs.proverb: Tí òjò bá kọ̀ tí kò rọ̀, ìyẹn ò ní ká sọ pé, kí omi òkun ya wọ ìlú.
proverbs.translation: That the rain refuses to fall, is no reason to wish that the sea would flood the town.
proverbs.wisdom:
Moderation is it: reactions should be commensurate; adopt extreme measures with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ewúrẹ́ oko kò ṣe é sìn nílé.
proverbs.translation: The wild goat is not to be reared at home.
proverbs.wisdom:
There is a place and a right approach for everything: one size does not fit all.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà tí èèyàn tọ̀ tó ṣubú, bí èèyàn bá ní sùúrù, èyàn lè tọ̀ọ́ là.
proverbs.translation: A path that one treads and fails, with patience, one may well tread it to success.
proverbs.wisdom: No closed case and no impossibility: if you won't give up, you will win; be open-minded, be patient and be persistent.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling will find rising pretty tough.
proverbs.wisdom:
Nothing ventured, nothing gained; be bullish; take calculated risks.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pleads (his case) with God, won't need to plead with man.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable and nothing is beyond Him; you can count on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá wo dídùn ifọ̀n, àá họ ara dé egun
proverbs.translation: If we give in to the pleasure of scratching our rashes, we'll scratch ourselves to the bone.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; exercise self-control, always.

proverbs.proverb: Àjọjẹ ò dùn bí ẹnìkan ò bá ní; ọjọ́ a ní la ńṣe àjọjẹ.
proverbs.translation: Sharing isn't pleasant when one party consistently lacks; it is happily done when all can give.
proverbs.wisdom: Good to give to others, but it's better to empower them; better to teach others how to fish than to give them fish

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ra aṣọ ẹgbẹ̀fà, tí a sì nà á han eèyàn ẹgbẹ̀fà, aṣọ ọ̀hún ò níyì mọ́.
proverbs.translation: If we buy an expensive item of clothing and show it to lots of people, the clothes no longer command respect.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt; often, what is excessively exposed loses value.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí òbúrẹ́wà kan ńbì kan; òṣì ló ńmú ẹwà á ṣì.
proverbs.translation: No one is ugly; deprivation is what mars inherent beauty.
proverbs.wisdom:
With access to the right resources and support, everyone can go far: despise no one.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó láṣọ tí ò léèyàn, ìhòhò ló wà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever has clothes, but has no one is naked, already.
proverbs.wisdom: Human relationships matter; people are superior to things.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó wà láyé tó ní inú òun bàjẹ́; ẹni tó ti kú ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: A person who is alive, yet complains of being unhappy; what about those who are dead?
proverbs.wisdom: Be thankful in every situation: it could've been worse; with life, everything good is still possible: keep up hope

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tó rí ibi tí ò fọ́, ire ló ńdúró dè.
proverbs.translation: The eyes that saw evil and did not go blind, are waiting to see good.
proverbs.wisdom:
The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run kì í ṣe nǹkan, kó má fi àyè ọpẹ́ sí i; tó bá pá baba lórí, a sì fi irùngbọ̀n rọ́po.
proverbs.translation: God never does a thing without leaving rooms for thanksgiving; if God makes a man bald, He'll give him the beard in replacement.
proverbs.wisdom: There'll always be reasons to be thankful to God

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò lówó lọ́wọ́ tó lóun ní ìwà, ìwà oníwà ló ńyá á lò.
proverbs.translation: Anyone who is not wealthy, but claims to be of good character, certainly has borrowed someone else's character.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive: you'll never know who anyone really is, until he or she is wealthy.

proverbs.proverb: Ogún ọmọdé ò lè ṣeré fún ogún ọdún; ọgbọ̀n àgbà ò lè ṣe àṣàrò fún ọgbọ̀n oṣù.
proverbs.translation: Twenty youngsters cannot play together for twenty years; thirty elders cannot hold discussions for thirty months.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever: change is inevitable; it's wise to anticipate it.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èèyàn gún iyán bọ́ ìlú yóò lọ́ọ̀tá; bó sì sọ òkò s’ọ́jà, yóò lọ́ọ̀rẹ́ tirẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If you feed the whole town, you will have enemies; yet, even if you are notoriously wicked, you will have friends.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't please (nor displease) everyone; do your best and move on

proverbs.proverb: Ogbe tí àkùkọ fi ńṣakọ ni kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ fi ńpanu.
proverbs.translation: The comb, an object of pride to the cock, is a mere snack to the fox.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what matters to one may well be of no consequence to another.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá máa jẹ́ Ọ̀ṣákálà, a jẹ́ Ọ̀ṣákálá; ẹni bá máa jẹ́ Òṣokolo, a jẹ́ Òṣokolo; Ọ̀ṣákálá-ṣokolo kò yẹ ọmọ èyan?
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to bear Oṣakala, should bear it; whoever wants to bear Oṣokolo, should bear it, too; Oṣakala-Ṣokolo befits no one.
proverbs.wisdom: No duplicity.

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò leè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things do not always come easy: no pain, no gain; hang in there: don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í s'òótọ́ inú, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni má d'ayọ̀, báyé ẹni bá dojúrú ìwà èèyàn ló yẹ ká wò
proverbs.translation: An honest life can't but end well; if a life remains unpleasant, the person's character needs to be examined.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character, quite often, determines our experience; we reap what we sow

proverbs.proverb: Òótọ́ korò, ṣùgbọ́n bí a bá gbé itọ́ ọ rẹ̀ mì, a máa ṣe ara lóore.
proverbs.translation: Truth is bitter, but beneficial, if it can be swallowed.
proverbs.wisdom: Truth may be inconvenient, but it results in ultimate good, if embraced.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó sùn là ńjí, a kì í jí apirọrọ; táa bá jí apirọrọ, kò ní dáhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's the person sleeping one wakes, not the one pretending to be asleep; the one pretending won't respond, if one wakes him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Unsolicited help is quite often, taken for granted.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water (you have) in the trough, simply because you heard the rumbling of the cloud.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't be presumptuous; never jump the gun; it's never wise to count one's chickens before they are hatched.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yàgò fún ẹlẹ́ṣin àná.
proverbs.translation: No one gives way (or defers) to someone who owned a horse, in the past.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't live in the past: past glories are not as crucial as the present and future ones; have a strategic-mindset and focus.

proverbs.proverb: Àti rán'mú u gáńgan, kò ṣẹ̀yìn èékánná.
proverbs.translation: The nasal sound of the talking drum isn't without the cooperation of the finger nails.
proverbs.wisdom: Achieving sustained success will always require the cooperation and collaboration of others: build trust and bridges.

proverbs.proverb: Olójú kan kì í mọ'yì Ọlọ́run à fi tí nǹkan bá gbọ̀n sí i.
proverbs.translation: A person with only one good eye is seldom thankful to God, until a speck enters the eye.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; we all have reasons to be ever thankful.

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n díẹ̀, òmùgọ̀ díẹ̀, l'ọba fi ńto ìlú.
proverbs.translation: Applying a little wisdom and a little stupidity is how a king administers his kingdom.
proverbs.wisdom: One may have to act like a monkey to catch one; often, there is some sense in nonsense.

proverbs.proverb: Àìrìn jìnnà làì rí abuké ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́; báa bá dé igbó tó tó igbó, àá rí ẹranko tó ńtiro.
proverbs.translation: Not travelling far enough is why one may not have seen a humpy squirrel; if one can get deep into the forest, one will see animals that tiptoe.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of exposure makes for narrow-mindness.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán owó tó sọnù; ìgbà wo ni níná ò ní kàn án tẹ́lẹ̀?
proverbs.translation: The sum of money that got lost is merely in haste; would it not be spent, eventually?
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; never prematurely force issues before their due time.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà àdó ni í mú àdó mu ẹ̀jẹ̀: akèrègbè baba àdó, omi ni wọ́n fi ńpọ́n
proverbs.translation: The tiny gourd is associated with bloodletting of its own volition: even the bigger and fully grown gourd is simply used for fetching water.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character, good or bad, is by choice: choose to be better

proverbs.proverb: Bí alákàrà ò kà á, agbada rẹ̀ ńkà á
proverbs.translation: If the person frying àkàrà (bean cakes) is not counting the àkàrà, her frying pan is counting them.
proverbs.wisdom: Be considerate and fair; be empathetic: those adversely affected by your actions will definitely feel their negative impact

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gba àkàtà lọ́wọ́ akítì; a kì í gba ilé baba ọmọ lọ́wọ́ ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: No one can stop monkeys from squatting; no one should deprive a child of his or her patrimony.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; deprive no one of what is rightly his or hers.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run àdàbà náà ló dá ẹyẹlé; ẹyẹlé ńsun ilé, àdàbà ńsun ìgbẹ́.
proverbs.translation: God who created the dove also created the pidgeon; the pidgeon finds its abode in the city, while the dove dwells in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: God rules; He has the final say in the lives of all.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnìkan ò ní bí ọmọ rẹ̀, kó sọ ọ́ ní Baálẹ̀; kíkàn ló ńkan'ni.
proverbs.translation: No one names his or her child, Head Chief (of a town) at birth; one attains unto being a town's Head Chief, turn by turn.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is in phases: one goes, another comes; be patient.

proverbs.proverb: Bí kùkùté ṣé kéré tó, kò sí ẹni tó lè fi ẹsẹ̀ fà á tu.
proverbs.translation: As small as the tree stump is, no one can uproot it with the foot.
proverbs.wisdom: Judge nothing by it's appearance; what is deemed inconsequential may well pack a hefty punch.

proverbs.proverb: Wọ́n fi ẹ́ ṣe ẹẹ̀kẹrin ìlú, ò ńbínú, ṣé ẹ̀yin mẹ́rin lẹ̀ wà ní ìlú ni?
proverbs.translation: You were displeased when designated the fourth (to the throne) in a town; are there only four of you in the town?
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of contentment can be self-limiting

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìṣẹ́ bá ńṣẹ́ ọ̀dọ́ láàṣẹ́jù, kó lọ sí igbó erin; bó bá pa erin, ìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ á tán; bí erin bá paá, ìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ á tán
proverbs.translation: Let the youngster in deprivation go hunt an elephant; if he kills it, his poverty will end; if it kills him, his poverty will end.
proverbs.wisdom: Be audacious

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyin adìyẹ ò bá fọ́, oromọadìyẹ ò leè wáyé.
proverbs.translation: If the chicken's (incubated) egg did not crack, the chick could not have been hatched.
proverbs.wisdom: Adversity may well be a stepping stone; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ḿbá a lù ú, áḿbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow, had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his on a tree branch and walked away.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence is it; no complacency

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó lórí rere tí kò ní ìwà rere, ìwà a rẹ̀ ló máa ba orí rere rẹ̀ jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Anyone blessed with good fortune, but who lacks good character will soon lose his good fortune to his bad character.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character invariably shapes our altitude.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó rí jẹ, kó fún ẹni tí kò rí jẹ; Ọlọ́run tó dá ilẹ̀ tó ńyọ̀, náà ló dá ohun táa máa fọwọ́ mú.
proverbs.translation: Let those who have, give to those who lack; God who created the slippery ground, also created what to hold on to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be a blessing, when you can; God blesses those who do

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ ti ọmọdé nàró kọ́ ni í rìn.
proverbs.translation: The day a baby stands up for the first time is not the day he (or she) walks.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; good things take time.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ní kí ọ́mọ ẹni máà d'ẹ́tẹ̀, tó bá ti lè dá'gbó gbé.
proverbs.translation: Never restrain your child from becoming leprous, as long as he or she can live in the forest alone.
proverbs.wisdom: Live and let live: let people be; everyone is entitled to his or her choices and the consequences thereof.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Handle anger with caution; avoid rash decisions.

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ tí orí bá ti kúrò lára ejò ló di okùn lásán.
proverbs.translation: The day the head leaves the body is when the snake becomes a mere rope.
proverbs.wisdom: Leadership is ever crucial to a body or team: at the very least, it gives life, points in a clear direction and harnesses strengths effectively.

proverbs.proverb: Ọdẹ-afifìlà-perin ọjọ́ kan n'iyì i rẹ̀ ẹ́ mọ; tó bá ti di ọjọ́ kejì, ó ti di olóògùn ìkà.
proverbs.translation: A hunter who killed an elephant with a mere cap, would be honoured for just one day; the next, he would be denigrated as a wicked sorcerer.
proverbs.wisdom: Success can elicit both awe and envy.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ́ láàpa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè láàpa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; there's always a price tag: be willing to pay it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú ú rò, á mọ ọpẹ́ ẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: The thoughtful are ever grateful.
proverbs.wisdom:
Let's maintain an attitude of gratitude, always.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ti asín yé asín kó tó ṣẹnu gbọọrọ; ti ọ̀kùn yé ọ̀kùn kó tó fi igba ẹsẹ̀ rìn.
proverbs.translation: The moonrat has its reasons for having a long mouth; the millipede has its reasons for moving with hundreds of legs.
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons: give them the benefit of the doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Bí àáké ṣe lágbára tó, kò leè ṣiṣẹ́ ti abẹfẹ́lẹ́ màa ṣe.
proverbs.translation: As powerful as the axe is, it cannot do the work the razor blade will do.
proverbs.wisdom: We all have our strengths and our places; envy no one: embrace and love your uniqueness.

proverbs.proverb: A ní kí ohun tó wu'ni wá, ohun tó dára ló yọjú; tó bá dára tí ò wu'ni ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: We beckon on what we desire, but the beautiful shows up; what if it's beautiful but not desired?
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever we desire is always what we prefer; beauty is in the eye of the beholder.

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ ńjẹ yangan, ó ńmu omi ó ńgbé ókúta mì, ó tún ńsunkún àìléyín; ṣé òbúkọ tó léyín ńjẹ irin ni?
proverbs.translation: Hens eat corns, drink water, and swallow stones, yet lament lacking teeth; do goats, with teeth, chew pieces of iron (with theirs)?
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; greed breeds stress.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó kọ orin tí ò dùn, òun ńáà ńfi etí ara rẹ̀ gbọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is singing an unpleasant song, very well knows that the song is unpleasant.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; not everything need be spelt out: lousy acts are seldom unintentional: those involved very well know.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànná yànná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹ̀rẹ̀ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, cannot enjoy the glittering beauty of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Àrẹ̀mọ má jobì, má ròde ẹmu, kí ọmọ lè dé ipò bàbá rẹ̀ ni
proverbs.translation: That the royal heir should desist from rioutous living, it's so he can succeed his father, the king.
proverbs.wisdom: Happy #FathersDay2022 to all faithful fathers and fathers-to-be out there. Thank you so much for your sacrifices

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ ẹ́ dùn tó bá pọ́n, ṣùgbọ́n tó bá pọ́n láàpọ́njù, oúnjẹ ni fún ẹyẹ oko.
proverbs.translation: Banana is sweet when ripe, but if it's overripe, it will become food for the birds.
proverbs.wisdom: Even in a good thing, moderation is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwó rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes, now on the refuse dump, was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is inevitable: a season must need go and another must need come; nothing lasts forever.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyẹ kò bá fín ẹyẹ níràn, ojú ọ̀run tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì fara kanra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: Live and let live: the world is endowed enough for all.

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ kan a máa yí ìpinnu ogún ọdún padà.
proverbs.translation: A single sentence often well does turn around a decision of twenty years.
proverbs.wisdom: Words are powerful; use them wisely. #prpverb

proverbs.proverb: Òṣìkà ì bá là, á ba ìlú jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Were a wicked fellow to be wealthy, he would wreck the town.
proverbs.wisdom: The prosperity of a wicked person is a risk to everyone.

proverbs.proverb: Sísan ló san ọsàn, lọmọ aráyé fi la ọ̀nà nínú igbó lọ báa nínú oko.
proverbs.translation: The orange is simply favoured, which is why people created a path in the bush to get to it in the farm.]
proverbs.wisdom: Destiny, sometimes, makes the difference; when one is favoured, things simply work right.

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ àánú Olúwa kì í ṣú.
proverbs.translation: God's mercy never runs out.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility with God; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Kànnìké tìtorí oókan bẹ́ wọ ìgbẹ́; ó ní ibi tó bọ́ sí ni kò tẹ́ òun lọ́rùn.
proverbs.translation: Kannike jumped into the forest in search of his lost one cowrie (money); he insisted that he wasn't satisfied with where it dropped.
proverbs.wisdom: Be efficient: don't waste needless resources over trifles.

proverbs.proverb: Àì fi nǹkan pe nǹkan ló ńba nǹkan án jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Lack of regard for something is why it is easily abused.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever we value seldom suffer neglect nor is it easily exposed to abuse.

proverbs.proverb: Ìṣín wò ó; ìkòrò wò ó; ohun tí a bá jìjọ wò, gígún ni í gún
proverbs.translation: Let the fingerlings consider it (an issue); let all the big fishes assess it too; whatever we all join hands to assess, typically gets thoroughly defined.
proverbs.wisdom: All points of view are crucial; discount and dismiss no one

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ ò dun ọmọ ẹṣin; a mú ìyá a rẹ̀ so, ó ńjẹ oko kiri.
proverbs.translation: The colt has no shame; it's mother mare is tethered down, yet it goes about foraging.
proverbs.wisdom: Prioritise: Handle first things, first; don't major on minors.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni
proverbs.translation: Even if one pounds yam and prepares yam flour meal for a difficult fellow, he'll yet remain difficult.
proverbs.wisdom: Regardless of what you do or say, a difficult fellow can't but be irrational; do your best & move on

proverbs.proverb: Jàmbá tó ńkó ẹyin lórí àba, tí a bá dákẹ, gbogbo àkùkọ ìlú ló máa lọ si
proverbs.translation: If we condone the calamity that claims eggs during brooding, all the cocks in the town will go for it.
proverbs.wisdom: May God comfort the families of those murdered in the Owo massacre; may the slain find rest in Him

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni gbé ọkàn lé Olúwa kò ní jogún òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever places his or her hope on God won't hope in vain.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; absolutely nothing is too difficult for God.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni gbé ọkàn lé Olúwa kò ní jogún òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever places his or her hope on God won't hope in vain.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; absolutely is too difficult for God.

proverbs.proverb: Obìnrin kì í dàgbà jù lọ́wọ́ ọkọ rẹ̀; bí eyín bá ku méjì lẹ́nu ìyá, ọmọge ni lójú baba.
proverbs.translation: A woman is never too old to her husband; even if she's lost all her teeth, a maiden she remains to her man.
proverbs.wisdom: Love is it; with love, other concerns pale.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbà tó so yangan mọ́ ìdi ló sọ ara rẹ̀ di aláwàdà fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: An elder who tied maize to his pants beckoned on the derision from the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Our experiences reflect our choices: we must tweak our choices, if we must better our experiences.

proverbs.proverb: Bí irọ́ bá lọ lógún ọdún, ọjọ́ kan ṣoṣo ni òótọ́ máa  bá a.
proverbs.translation: Even, if a lie has gone for twenty years, the truth will catch up with it in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom:
Regardless of how long, the truth always prevails; dishonesty does not pay: it always disappoints.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí èbù ò rà, a kò lè fi ojú kan ègbodò.
proverbs.translation: If the yam seedlings are not left to rot (when planted), no new yams can be harvested.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time and some things may have to get worse before they get better: be patient - be prepared to wait things out.

proverbs.proverb: Tẹ̀tẹ̀ tí kò bá fẹ́ tẹ́ l'áwùjọ ẹ̀fọ́, á yẹ'ra fún àwọn ewékéwé.
proverbs.translation: The spinach that won't be dishonoured in the gathering of vegetables will steer clear of strange leaves.
proverbs.wisdom: Association matters: we are defined, nay made or marred, by the company we keep.

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to glitter must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag: be willing to pay; no pain no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Àti mọ ọ̀nà ẹ̀dá láyé, kò ṣẹ̀hìn Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: Man's quest to seek his or her path (to success) in life is not beyond God.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing is beyond God: no one, but Him, has the final say; don't just give up hope yet.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́ irọ́; ọmọ èyàn ò fẹ́ òdodo; bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ ò pé mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: God hates lies; man hates truths; yet there is no third option in a discourse.
proverbs.wisdom: It is better to always stick with the truth, even when there are no easy options.

proverbs.proverb: Ológùńná kan, kì í rìn létí odò.
proverbs.translation: A person with a single ember ought not to walk by the river bank.
proverbs.wisdom: Be cautious; hedge against intolerably high risks or scenarios with zero way out.

proverbs.proverb: Ogún ọdún tí ebí ti ńpa ọ̀gà, ìrin fàájì ò kúrò lẹ́sẹ̀ ẹ rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: For the twenty years that the chameleon has been in hunger, it has not ceased its leisurely gait.
proverbs.wisdom: Slowness is not indicative of lack of enthusiam nor is it a proof of indolence: people are simply different.

proverbs.proverb:
Ṣòkòtò gbọọrọ ò dọlà; abí'ni ní ìlú Èkó ò
di owó.
proverbs.translation: Appearance does not confer sustained honour neither does pedigree bring lasting riches.
proverbs.wisdom: Sustained difference requires more than superficial considerations; focus more on substance.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó ro oko tí kò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró
proverbs.translation: A farmer who ploughed his farm, but planted no corn, claims he's hurting the ground squirrel; he really hasn't hurt any squirrel, but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Vindictive actions can be self-defeating

proverbs.proverb: Akèrègbè tí kò tí ì fọ́, kò ti ì mọ oye omi tí yóò pọn.
proverbs.translation: A gourd, as long as it is not yet broken, cannot really tell how much water it can still fetch.
proverbs.wisdom: As long as there is life, there is hope; write-off no one, including yourself.s #MondayMotivation

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìṣẹ́ ò bá jẹ́ ká sọ òdodo; àìṣòdodo kò ní jẹ́ ká bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: If fear of poverty does not make us live honestly; dishonest living will keep us entrenched in poverty, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Honesty pays; personal integrity is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Àlùya ni ìlù ọ̀fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A free drum gets beaten until it's bursted.
proverbs.wisdom: People hardly treat whatever is free with respect; what's cheap or costs nothing is easily abused.

proverbs.proverb: Alágbẹ̀dẹ tó ńlu irin lójú kan, lóhun tó fẹ́ fà yọ ńbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A blacksmith who kept hitting a piece of iron at a single spot had his reasons.
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons: give them the benefit of the doubt; often, we'll see some sense in nonsense, if we'll look closely enough.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour, but easily lord it over their benefactors, once satisfied.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Eṣinṣin ò mọ ikú; jíjẹ ni tirẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: The fly is ignorant of deadly risks; all it desires is to eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Be wary of greed and inordinate appetites: they blindfold; tame your appetites and desires and curb greed.

proverbs.proverb: Òwú tí ìyá bá gbọ̀n ni ọmọ yóò ran.
proverbs.translation: The (harvested) cotton the mother fluffs is the one her daughter spins.
proverbs.wisdom: Let's be mindful of what we do: those who look up to us, often take off from where we left off; like father, like son; like mother, like daughter.

proverbs.proverb: Nínú òfíì, nínú ọ̀láà ni ọmọ páńdọ̀rọ̀ ńdàgbà.
proverbs.translation: It is in the midst of their being blown here and there, that the pendulous fruits of the sausage tree mature, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Quitting is the bane of success: it makes losing certain; don't quit and you can't but win, eventually

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó làná, tó lòní, kò leè ni ọ̀la; Ọlọ́run nìkan ló lọjọ́ gbogbo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever called the shots yesterday and calls the shots today, cannot call the shots tomorrow; only God calls the shots at all times.
proverbs.wisdom: No season lasts forever: change is ever certain; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ tí àlejò wọ̀ tó ńgan apá, onílé náà ní irú rẹ́, óde ni kò tì í kàn.
proverbs.translation: The clothes that a guest wears exuding arrogance are owned by the host as well; the occasion to wear them simply hasn't arisen.
proverbs.wisdom: Humility is it; pride and arrogance, can be deflating.

proverbs.proverb: Ológìnní tó sùn bí ọ̀lẹ, ọgbọ́n inú u rẹ̀ pé igba.
proverbs.translation: A cat that lies in repose, looking lazy, is yet filled with countless cunning ways.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance can be quite deceptive; it can prove costly to mistake calmness for naivety or gentleness for stupidity.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Owú pa'ni ju kùmọ̀ lọ.
proverbs.translation: Jealousy kills faster than cudgels.
proverbs.wisdom:
Jealousy in whatever form is unhealthy: tame it; be secure in who you are and what you have.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A ní kí ẹ jẹẹ́, ẹ léegun lásán ni; a ní kí ẹ sọọ́ nù; ẹ lẹ́ran díẹ́ wà ńbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Asked to eat it, you complained it's just a mere bone; yet when asked to throw it away, you insisted it still has a little meat.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be decisive; no vacillation. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kò lè tìtorí pé omi pá ẹnìkan lórí, kí a má mu omi mọ́.
proverbs.translation: We cannot cease from drinking water simply because someone choked on it.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid hasty and sweeping generalisations; don't put yourself in chains over an isolated case.

proverbs.proverb: Tó bá kù díẹ̀ kí ọmọ olóore jìn sí kòtò, mànàmáná á ṣiṣẹ́ ìmọ́lẹ̀ fún un.
proverbs.translation: Just before a kind person would stumble into a ditch (in darkness), the lightning would light up his or her path to save the day.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness pays: it's good to be good; kind acts are never lost.

proverbs.proverb: Bó lé lógún ọdún táa ti fi adẹ́mun jọba, kò ní yé é ọrùn ọ̀pẹ ẹ́ wò.
proverbs.translation: Even after 20 years of being crowned a king, the palmwine tapper won't cease gazing at the palm tree with nostalgia.
proverbs.wisdom:
Old habits die hard.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ tó fi ara rẹ̀ wé igún, ẹ̀yìn ààrò ló máa sùn.
proverbs.translation: A bird that compares itself to vultures will end up (being roasted) at the fireplace.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't compare yourself to others: you don't know their stories.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ní láti ìgbà tóun ti dáyé ìyà ò jẹ òun rí, ohun tí ìyà ńjẹ lẹ́nu ni ò tíì kúnná
proverbs.translation: Whoever claims not to have ever faced a challenge, perhaps challenge is not yet through with what it"s currently chewing.
proverbs.wisdom: Challenges are common: everyone has them; accept & resolve yours

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà ba kọ́'ni lẹ́sẹ̀ téèyan ṣubú, tí ìgbà míràn bá dé, èèyàn á dìde.
proverbs.translation: If a season causes one to trip and fall, when another season comes, one will rise.
proverbs.wisdom: It is never over; tough times are not forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà ba kọ́'ni lẹ́sẹ̀ téèyan ṣubú, tí ìgbà míràn bá dé, èèyà á dìde.
proverbs.translation: If a season causes one to trip and fall, when another season comes, one will rise.
proverbs.wisdom: It is never over; tough times are not forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: T'ẹní bẹ́gi lójù, igi á rúwé.
proverbs.translation: The shame is on the one who cuts a tree; it will sprout leaves (and grow back) again.
proverbs.wisdom:
Ignore wicked folks and their distractions: be steadfast; be open minded and keep moving forward.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí akòko bá ńsọ igi láì jáwọ́, bó pẹ́ bó yá, á rí nǹkan gbà lọ́wọ́ igi.
proverbs.translation: If the woodpecker persistently pecks a tree without relenting, it will get something from the tree, ultimately.
proverbs.wisdom: Virtually nothing is impossible to the persistent; if you won't give up, you will win.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá kò pa, kó má a dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude is it; remain ever grateful: things could have been worse.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọmọdé bá ńjẹ èèwọ̀ tí ẹnìkan ò bi í, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ohun tí ńbi'ni ò ní ṣàì bi'ni.
proverbs.translation: If a youngster indulges in abominable acts uncautioned, eventually, what normally cautions people can't but caution him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Mind what you do: nothing can be done with impunity.

proverbs.proverb: Ara bàbá ò yá, ara bàbá ò yá; àkàṣù ẹkọ ńwọ'lé, ewé ńjáde.
proverbs.translation: Father is gravely sick, father is unwell, yet lots of wraps of food go in (unto him), but the wrappers come out empty.
proverbs.wisdom: Think critically; facts on ground don't always support obvious conclusions.

proverbs.proverb: Oníbàtà ló ńfojú di ẹ̀gún; ẹni táa bá fẹ́ ló ńfojú dini.
proverbs.translation: Those with shoes easily despise thorns; those we love easily take us for granted.
proverbs.wisdom: Knowledge breeds power and disarms fear; we hadly fear who or what we know inside out.

proverbs.proverb: Àìfini peni àìfèyàn pèèyàn, ló ńmú ara oko sán bàǹtẹ́ wọ̀lú.
proverbs.translation: It's lack of civility that would make a village dweller come into town dressed only in a loincloth.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of regard for someone will reflect in how he or she is treated.

proverbs.proverb: Odò tí a bá fi ojú ré ni í gbé'ni í lọ.
proverbs.translation: The river one belittles is the river one drowns in.
proverbs.wisdom: Underestimate nothing and no one; don't be presumptuous: always keep an open mind and a level head.

proverbs.proverb: Ìdí iṣẹ́ ẹni la ti ńmú'ni l'ọ́lẹ.
proverbs.translation: You will know a lazy person by the manner he (or she) performs his (or her) duties.
proverbs.wisdom:
Diligence is it; diligence or lack of it is far more transparent than it seems.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Rírò ni t'ènìyàn; ṣíṣe ni t'Olúwa.
proverbs.translation: Man may only propose; it is God who disposes.
proverbs.wisdom:
Only God has the final say; keep your hope alive: it's not over, yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ikú kì í bá’ni ṣọ̀rẹ́ kó má pa’ni.
proverbs.translation: Death cannot be so friendly with someone and not take the person.
proverbs.wisdom: Some human experiences are inevitable; we must accept what we cannot change.

proverbs.proverb: Àjùmọ̀bí ò kan t'àánú; ẹni orí rán sí'ni ló ńṣe'ni lóore.
proverbs.translation: Blood ties don't always result merciful support; help comes only from those divinely sent to us.
proverbs.wisdom: When help comes, it may not necessarily be from expected sources; keep an open mind & keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Àì rìn jìnnà, làì rí abuké ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́; afọ́jú ẹyẹ ńbẹ lóko kárinkése
proverbs.translation: Not travelling far enough is why one may not have seen a squirrel with a hump; blind birds really can be found deep in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of exposure results in narrow-mindness; exposure broadens the mind

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́, làá wà, táà rí èyí tó tọ́.
proverbs.translation: It's while on the crooked tree that one would find the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Bloom wherever you are planted; always do your best with what you have, right where you are.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know Him for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable; He is a present help to those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Dúrógbadé tó ńdẹ isà ejò, bí kò bá dúró gba adé, ọmọ mí ì yóò gbà á.
proverbs.translation: A royal heir who unconscionably places himself at risk, hunting snakes, will find someone else crowned king in his stead.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid needless and avoidable risks; opportunities lost by one is gained by another

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa ná'wó kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ sí i.
proverbs.translation: Generous lifestyle does not necessarily make anyone poor nor does miserly behaviour make anyone rich.
proverbs.wisdom: Generosity is it; be a giver: those who do seldom lack what to give.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò dá kainkain tóbi; àtapa niì bá máa tèèyàn
proverbs.translation: It's for a reason that God did not create the ant big; it would have been stinging people to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Quite often, our characters limit us.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fura sí ẹni tí a ńbá rìn; ẹni tí a bá ńfura sí, a kì í bá irú wọn rìn.
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't be suspicious of those we associate with; those we are suspicious of should not be our close associates.
proverbs.wisdom: Build trust; don't be paranoid; be positive and forward-looking.

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tan ni'jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Your palm (the result of your effort) cannot deceive you.
proverbs.wisdom: To avert disappointments, depend less on anyone; take personal responsibility for your life.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ẹní máa là, á rí ìyọnu.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would be successful would experience challenges.
proverbs.wisdom: Challenges are not unusual: overyone has them; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Màlúù tí kò ní ìrù, Ọlọ́run ni í lé eṣinṣin fún un.
proverbs.translation: It is God who invariably fends off flies for a cow that has no tail.
proverbs.wisdom: God helps those who can't help themselves.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a kò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you can't be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; rely less on appearance, but more on substance; appearance, are quite, often deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ewu lẹ́gbẹ̀rún ẹ̀kọ, à fi àìdùn ọbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: To consume a thousand wraps of eko (corn meal) is a breeze, except the soup is not tasty enough.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone loves good things; remove the stress from anything, make it appealing, and it won't lack patrons.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dámọ̀nràn àti tà'kìtì lágbàlá ọ̀bọ, nítorí ọ̀bọ fúnra'ra rẹ̀, ọba òkìtì ni
proverbs.translation: Never toy with the idea of somersaulting in the vicinity of a monkey: monkeys themselves, are experts at somersaulting.
proverbs.wisdom: Modesty is it;  Not wise to make an open show of one's ignorance.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a gún iyán nínú ewé, tí a se ọbẹ̀ nínú èpo ẹpà, ẹni máa yó, á yó
proverbs.translation: If we pound yam in a leaf, and prepare the soup in a groundnut pod, those who will be full, will be full.
proverbs.wisdom: Regardless of any factor, those who will succeed, will succeed; don't limit yourself with excuses

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbọ́n ṣe lóró tó, oúnjẹ ni fún aláǹgbá.
proverbs.translation: As venomous as the wasp is, it is food for the lizard.
proverbs.wisdom: It's a question of perspectives: what is a venomous insect to one is a potential pet food to another; quite often, what you see is what you get.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sínú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun, eventually, the shade will come (when the sun sets).
proverbs.wisdom: Tough times wont last forever; keep hope alive: be patient, be steadfast.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyé ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God, the Creator, has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: O bá ẹfọ̀n lábàtà, o yọ ọ̀bẹ tì í, ṣé omi lo rò pó mu kú ni?
proverbs.translation: You found a buffalo dead by the river bank and pulled your knife (to take some); did you think it drowned?
proverbs.wisdom: Be circumspect to exploit whatever seems too good to be true; don't be naive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò dodo làgbàdo ńwọ ilẹ̀; tó bá jáde tán, ló ńdi onígba aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The maize seed does go into the soil absolutely bare; nonetheless, it still ends up with multiple peelings after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Bì èèwọ̀ ò bá pa'ni a máa pọ́n'ni láṣọ.
proverbs.translation: Even if an objectionable act does not kill, it may weaken one, financially.
proverbs.wisdom: Good or bad, actions come with inviolable consequences; choose and act wisely.

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ńsá nínú omi gbígbóná, tó bá sáa lọ́dàn ni, kò ní wọ omi gbígbóná
proverbs.translation: Had the frog been as fleet-footed in the fields as it is now in the hot water pot, it won't have entered the pot
proverbs.wisdom: A stitch in time saves nine; be strategic: see & plan ahead

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n àgbọ́njù ni í pa òdù ọ̀yà.
proverbs.translation: Unbridled craftiness is what kills the grasscutter.
proverbs.wisdom: Craftiness and unmoderated mental sharpness can prove costly; any strength not suitably controlled and moderated easily becomes a weakness and a liability.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Never carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Never compare your life with anyone's; stay in your lane and be focused.

proverbs.proverb: Àìdúpẹ́ oore àná a máa mú oore sú'ni í ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Ingratitude for yesterday's kindness makes future acts of kindness tiresome.
proverbs.wisdom: Gratitude begets more kindness; ingratitude inhibits them.

proverbs.proverb: Òkè lọwọ́ afún'ni ńgbé; ìsàlẹ̀ lọwọ́ ẹni tó ńgbà á ńwà.
proverbs.translation: The hands of a giver always reside above; those of the receiver must need stay below.
proverbs.wisdom: Giving elevates; generosity pays.

proverbs.proverb: Oore kéré, oore tóbi, oore loore yóò máa jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whether small or big, a kind act remains a kind act (and deserves to be recognised as such.)
proverbs.wisdom: Be appreciative and remain grateful; never discount favours received; never repay good with evil.

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: I am hungry is not to be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious matter shouldn't be treated with levity

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ní òtùtú òwú ò tó ẹrù, ìwọ̀nba tó fẹ́ fi tan iná ló mú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever says cotton wool is not heavy must have taken just enough for a lamp wick.
proverbs.wisdom: In good quantity or right condition, virtually nothing is inconsequential; don't be presumptuous; underestimate nothing.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ aláṣetì; aláṣeyọrí là ńkí.
proverbs.translation: No one appreciates a person who abandons a task, but the one who completes it.
proverbs.wisdom: To start anything is not as crucial as finishing it: "finishiative" is superior to initiative.
