proverbs.proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: God's messenger never grows weary.
proverbs.wisdom: God cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs; absolutely nothing is too hard for Him.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní bí ejò ṣe gùn la ṣe fẹ dá'ná sun ún, à á dá'ná sun'lé.
proverbs.translation: If we were to set a snake on fire as its length is, we may burn the house down.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it: it's wise to be tempered in our reactions; adopt drastic measures with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Ṣẹ̀kẹ̀rẹ̀ tó bá fẹ́ gbayì lóde kì í dìtẹ̀ mọ́ owó ẹyọ.
proverbs.translation: The shekere (cowrie shell gourd shaker) that wants to do well on its outing won't rebel against cowrie shells
proverbs.wisdom: A good workman won't blame his tools; be positive, be forward-looking: the vindictive hardly goes far.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀kàndínlógún tó lóun ò bá oókan ṣe, à ti di ogun rẹ̀ á nira
proverbs.translation: The number 19 that refused to be added to 1 will find it tough to become 20.
proverbs.wisdom: Build bridges and foster collaboration; we need one another: together each achieves more.

proverbs.proverb: A-rí-jẹ-níjà ò níṣẹ́ míràn, àfi ìjà.
proverbs.translation: A person who profits from fights, has no other preoccupation, but instigating fights.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive: not every advice or motive is noble; self-centered ulterior motives do exist.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọ́mọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom: Prevention is better than cure; good to look for help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan
proverbs.translation: If we won't relent, our hustling will one day come to an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast, be persistent; If we won't quit, we will win.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá Ọlọ́run ṣòwò ká pàdánù.
proverbs.translation: You can't trade with God and lose.
proverbs.wisdom: God is faithful; you can depend on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Kòkòrò tó ńjẹfọ́ ara ẹfọ́ ló wá; iná tó ńjẹni ńbẹ lábẹ́ aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The insect that is eating the vegetable is right on it; the louse living off anyone is under his or her garment.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive, be vigilant; often the solution to an issue is closer than imagined.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó jẹun yó tó fọ́ akèrègbè, ti gbàgbé pé ọjọ́ òǹgbẹ ṣì ńbọ̀
proverbs.translation: A farmer who ate, had his fill, and broke the water gourd forgot that days of thirst are still ahead.
proverbs.wisdom: Never slam the door on your way out: you may need it opened again; take no one & nothing for granted

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìtàkùn bá lè pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n ámú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants could unite, they would  easily tie up an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Collaborate more; together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìyà ńlá bá gbé'ni ṣán'lẹ̀, kéékèèké á máa g'orí ẹni.
proverbs.translation: Tripped by a major setback, one easily becomes vulnerable to minor ones.
proverbs.wisdom: Be sympathetic and give others the benefit of the doubt; you never know what unseen major issue someone is grappling with.

proverbs.proverb: Tèmi ò ṣòro, tí kì í jẹ kí ọmọ alágbẹ̀dẹ ní idà.
proverbs.translation: Mine is not an issue, is why the blacksmith ends up not owning a sword.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; no procrastination.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó dá ẹnu, ti dá ohun tí kálukú máa fi sí i
proverbs.translation: God who created the mouth had also created what we'd be putting into it.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; patience is it.

proverbs.proverb: Wọ́n ní kí olókùnrùn ṣe 'tó' ó lóun ò lè ṣe 'tó tò tó'.
proverbs.translation: A sick man, asked to merely say 'to', profusely insisted he could not say 'to to to'.
proverbs.wisdom: Wisdom is it; don't make a fuss to reject what could have been accepted with just mild, less onerous, concessions.

proverbs.proverb: Kí èèmọ̀ wọlé, kí ajá máà gbó, gbogbo ajá kọ́ lara ẹ̀ lé gbà á.
proverbs.translation: Not all dogs can be quiet and not bark in the face of a strange act.
proverbs.wisdom: People are different; you can't paint everyone with the same brush.

proverbs.proverb: Pé a lágbára bí òmìrán, ìyẹn ò ní kí a jà bí òmìrán.
proverbs.translation: That you are as powerful as a giant, does not imply that you should fight like one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tempered: just because you can, does not mean you should; cooler heads should always prevail.

proverbs.proverb: Kòkòrò tó ńjó lẹ́ẹ̀bá ọ̀nà, onílù rẹ̀ ńbẹ nínú igbó.
proverbs.translation: The insect that is dancing by the bush path has its drummer right in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Things are often not quite as they appear; don't jump to conclusions before thorough and critical reviews.

proverbs.proverb: Ìjì layé; tó bá fì síwájú, á tún fì sẹ́hìn ni.
proverbs.translation: Life is a storm; if it blows forward, it will blow backward, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: A season goes, another comes; no condition is permanent; nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó mú iṣẹ́ jẹ, ò lè mú ìṣẹ́ jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got away with indolence, cannot get away with poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run kì í ṣe nǹkan, kó má fi àyè ọpẹ́ sí i; tó bá pá baba lórí, a sì fi irùngbọ̀n rọ́po
proverbs.translation: God never does anything, without the rationale for thanksgiving; if he makes a man bald, he'll give the beard in replacement.
proverbs.wisdom: We'll always have reasons to be thankful to God.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if you pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a cantankerous person, he or she will yet remain cantankerous.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking, be positive; do your best and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Tí nani-nani bá ńnani, tí gbani-gbani kọ̀ tí kò gbani, á jẹ́ pé gbani-gbani  ló ní kí nani-nani máa nani.
proverbs.translation: If the beater, beats one, but the deliverer refuses to deliver one, the beating must have been endorsed by the deliverer.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be naive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour, but easily lord it over their benefactors, once satisfied.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't claim to truly know anyone, deep down.

proverbs.proverb: Orí ò mọ ibùsùn; ìbá tún ibẹ̀ ṣe láàárọ̀.
proverbs.translation: No one knows his future for certain; else one would have prepared for it, ahead of time.
proverbs.wisdom: Only God knows the future

proverbs.proverb: Òjò ò bá ẹnìkan ṣọ̀tá; ẹni ejí rí leji ńpa.
proverbs.translation: The rain holds enmity with no one; it beats anyone within it's area of coverage.
proverbs.wisdom: Discriminate against no one.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńgun ẹṣin, kó sọ ìpàkọ́ mọ ní'wọ̀n; ìbẹ́kẹ́ṣẹ́ ẹṣin á máa la’ni mọ́’lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: When on a horse, fling your head backward with restraint; sudden jump of horses often throw riders.
proverbs.wisdom: Never abuse privileges: exercise self-control; safeguards against abuse do exist.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún ata ńnú odó, báa lọ̀ ọ́ lórí ọlọ, iwa ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀
proverbs.translation: Whether pounded in a mortar or ground on a grinding stone, pepper would remain inseparable from its character.
proverbs.wisdom: We can hardly pretend to be who we are not for long: with time, who we are will show through

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes loving relationships endure.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; tolerance is crucial. Happy Valentine Day to everyone.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is what adorns a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character beautifies; it is attractive and adorable

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní ká dijú kí ẹni burúkú kọjá, a kò ní mọ ìgbà tí ẹni rere máa lọ.
proverbs.translation: If we were to close our eyes so we would not see a wicked person pass by, we may miss a good person as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; vidictiveness can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: Omidan tó lóun yóò jẹ oyè abọ́bakú, òwe burúkù ló ńpa fún Olorì láàfin.
proverbs.translation: A maiden who says she's prepared to die with the king is actually sending the queen a nasty proverbial message.
proverbs.wisdom: Not all positive gestures are noble; be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water in your trough on the rumbling of the cloud.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; never count your chickens before they are hatched.

proverbs.proverb: Akèrègbè ni yóò júwe ibi tí wón máa fi okùn sí lára rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: It's the gourd itself that will indicate where on its body the rope (to carry it) should be affixed.
proverbs.wisdom: People themselves will indicate to you how you should treat them; and when they do, believe them.

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò kì í gbóná títí kó má tutù.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long the fireplace has been hot, it will become cold eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is hot today, will one day become cold; tough times won't last forever; keep hope alive, it's not over yet.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńse ọbẹ̀, kò kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom: Never lose hope; nothing is beyond God.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks inordinately will misspeak; inordinate talk made the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial; exercise self-control, always

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A dunghill that's intolerant of filth won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom:
Intolerance imposes limitations
#Yorubs

proverbs.proverb: Ẹran tí a kò bá ni í jẹ, a kì í fi eyín dán an wò.
proverbs.translation: Stop taking nips at a piece of meat that you have no intention of eating.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won't finish; finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: Iṣu ẹni kì í fi'ni pe ọmọdé, kó má ta.
proverbs.translation: A yam plant cannot refuse to grow well, simply because the farmer (planter) is too young.
proverbs.wisdom: Age is no barrier to success; impossibility is a figment.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ yín ò ṣ'àgbàfọ̀, ó ńk'aṣọ wá'le; ẹ r'ójú olè ẹ ò mu!
proverbs.translation: Your son is not a washerman, yet brings lots of clothes home; you are beholding a thief, yet you are not apprehending him.
proverbs.wisdom: Have zero tolerance for questionable lifestyle and source of living; a stitch in time...

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣán'pá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; promptly exploit opportunities.

proverbs.proverb: O jó ní'fọ́n, Ifọ́n tú; o jó l'Èjìgbò, Èjìgbò fà ya bí aṣọ; o wá dé Ọ̀ràngún o tún ńjùdí; ṣé gbogbo ìlú lo fẹ́ bàjẹ́ ni?
proverbs.translation: Your dance desolated Ifon & shredded Ejigbo like clothes; yet at Orangun you were twerking your hips; must you destroy all towns?
proverbs.wisdom: Decrying notoriety

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn kan lè ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́; gbólóhùn kan náà lè tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: One sentence can mess up a discussion and one sentence can make it better.
proverbs.wisdom: Words are powerful: they can build up and can pull down; use them wisely.

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́ kọ́ loògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; adopt radical measures with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi dẹ́kun ẹ̀rin rínrín, tó bá ṣe igúnnugún, á wokoko mórí ẹyin ni
proverbs.translation: If what took laughter away from the crow had befallen the vulture, it would have been stuck brooding on its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; different stroke for different folks

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀dùnkún ì báà mọ tíńtín, dandan ni kó dùn dé'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Even if sweet potato is just a tiny bit, it certainly must be sweet, all through.
proverbs.wisdom: We remain true to who we really are deep down, ultimately; we can hardly pretend to be who we are not for long.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that desires to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag; good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: No leaf drops off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing surprises God; nothing is beyond Him; lean on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Asúùfé ya àgbàdo; ó f'ojú jọ olè, óf'ojú jọ olókó.
proverbs.translation: The one who harvests corn in a farm whistling (carefreely), could very well be the farm owner and could very well be a thief.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Àpa àímú délé ni kò jẹ́ kí a mọ̀ pé ológbò ńse ọdẹ.
proverbs.translation: Its penchant for not bringing home its games, is why the cat is not known for hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; don't eat your future; don't sacrifice it for the present.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ ibi tí à ńlọ kí ọrùn ó wọ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One can't be certain of one's destination and yet be weighed down by the load carried.
proverbs.wisdom: Clear definition of goals makes their achievement less stressful: seek and foster clarity.

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kì í níyì lọ́ọ̀sán, ṣùgbọ́n a máa gba'yì lọ́jọ́ alẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A lamp is not valued in the afternoons, but does get appreciated at night.
proverbs.wisdom:
There's always a right time and place for everything; solutions are most appreciated during tough times.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God  hasn't forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn.
proverbs.translation: Those who plead their cases with God, seldom need to plead with man.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable and nothing is beyond Him; you can count on Him.

proverbs.proverb: À fi ẹni tí yóò bá pẹ̀gàn Àjànàkú, lá lóun rí nǹkan fìrí; báa bá rí erin ká wí.
proverbs.translation: Only those who would deride the elephant would claim they saw it in a jiffy; its presence is unmistakable.
proverbs.wisdom: Give credit where credit is due; deride no one.

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò kì í gbóná títí kó máà tutù.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long the hearth gets hot, it will become cold eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is hot will one day become cold; whatever has a beginning will have an ending: nothing lasts forever: change is certain; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ogún ọmọdé ò lè ṣeré fún ogún ọdún; ọgbọ̀n àgbà ò lè ṣe àṣàrò fún ọgbọ̀n oṣù
proverbs.translation: Twenty youngsters cannot play together for twenty years; thirty elders cannot hold discussions for thirty months.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; change is inevitable: anticipate and prepare for it

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ká a.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; God's response is always so complete as to be overwhelming.

proverbs.proverb: Àkùrọ̀ ti lómi tẹ́lẹ̀, kí òjò tó rọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: The river bank was damp with water, even before the rain fell on it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be humble; don't arrogate to yourself what is essentially God's blessing.

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ata ò ṣe é fi bọ́jú; ọwọ́ epo ò ṣe é fi mú àlà.
proverbs.translation: A hand that has handled pepper cannot be used to wash the face; the one with palm oil cannot be used to handle a white cloth.
proverbs.wisdom: Even with the best of intentions, some things are just inappropriate.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú sí ẹni tí a kò rí.
proverbs.translation: Do not be angry with someone you have not heard out.
proverbs.wisdom: Never rush to judgment; there is always a chance you could be wrong; always give people the benefit of the doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà ọ̀lẹ ló ńba ọ̀lẹ lẹ́rù; ọ̀lẹ ṣe tán, ó ní wọn ò fẹ́ràn òun
proverbs.translation: An indolent is preceded by his character, but complains that he or she is not accepted.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character often confronts us with unpleasant consequences; change your character to change any unwanted outcome

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ní k'ọ́mọ ẹni má d'ẹ́tẹ̀, tó bá ti lè dá'gbó gbé.
proverbs.translation: You never restrain your child from becoming leprous, as long as he can live in the forest alone.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone bears the consequences of his or her choices.

proverbs.proverb: Ilá kì í ga ju onírè lọ; èyí tó bá ga ju onírè lọ, a sì tẹ́ẹ ká.
proverbs.translation: An okro plant should not outgrow the farmer; whichever does will be bent low to be plucked.
proverbs.wisdom: Pride goes before a fall; humility is it.

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ l'oògùn ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Hardwork is the antidote for poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays; hardwork is a sure-fire remedy for poverty.

proverbs.proverb: O rí àgbébọ̀ adìyẹ lọ́jà, o sáré sí i; tó bá ńyé ogún tó ńpa ogún, ṣé aládìyẹ á tàá?
proverbs.translation: You saw a matured hen in the market and jumped at it; had it been very good at laying and hatching, would it have been sold?
proverbs.wisdom: If it is too good to be true, it usually is.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò tíì kúrò láyé, kò lè mọ irú ẹni tí òun yó dà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever still has life, cannot be limited in what he or she can become.
proverbs.wisdom: With life, there's no impossibility; it's not over yet: keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò leè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain; hang in there: don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyẹ ò bá fín ẹyẹ níràn, ojú ọrun tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì fara kanra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: Be positive; live and let live.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi kan ṣoṣo kọ́ la ti ńrí ọ̀run.
proverbs.translation: The sky is not seen from only one single spot.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternative approaches exist; there are many ways to achieve a goal: don't be fixated on one.

proverbs.proverb: Ajá tó máa sọnù kì í gbọ́ fèrè ọlọ́dẹ.
proverbs.translation: A dog destined to get lost won't hear the hunter's (redeeming) whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: Those bent on a course of action won't listen to wiser contrary counsels; keep an open mind: there is some sense in nonsense.

proverbs.proverb: Ìrèké ò ní ibùdó; ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: Sugarcane has no specific place of refuge; every situation suits a diligent fellow just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnu ẹyẹ ni í pẹyẹ; ẹnu òrofó ni í pa òrofó; òrofó bímọ mẹ́fà, ó ní ilé òun kún ṣọ́ṣọ́.
proverbs.translation: The mouth of a bird is its undoing; the wild pidgeon hatches just six chicks and brags that its nest is completely filled up.
proverbs.wisdom: Modesty is it; inordinate bragging can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear.

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ ńbá àṣá ṣeré, ó rò pé ẹyẹ oko lásán ni.
proverbs.translation: The chick gullibly plays with the hawk believing it to be an ordinary bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be risky, if not fatally costly; it is wise to invest in knowledge.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe igúnnugún tó fi pá lórí, tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi yọ gẹ̀gẹ̀ lọ́rùn, tó bá ṣe àgbò bọ̀lọ̀jọ̀, á ti fa ìwo rẹ̀ tu.
proverbs.translation: If what balded the vulture and gave the crow goiter had befallen the full-grown ram, it would have lost its horns.
proverbs.wisdom: People are different.

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́ kọ́ ni oògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; adopt radical measures with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ńbáa lùú, áḿbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ.
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow still had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his on a tree (branch) and walked away.
proverbs.wisdom: No complacency.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà mọ̀sá ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ
proverbs.translation: Warriors must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight, but not when to retreat will perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom:
Know when to pursue, defer or quit
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù, kì í pa ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A bird is seldom killed by a stone thrown in anger.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results; tone down the fury: it can be self-defeating.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí imú ṣe lè tóbi tó, kó lè gba ọ̀rọ̀ ẹnu sọ.
proverbs.translation: No matter how big the nose is, it can't take over the speaking role of the mouth.
proverbs.wisdom: We all are unique with our different strengths; envy no one: stay in your lane.

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wà á ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; complex issues must be calmly handled: cooler heads must always prevail.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Don't carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Compare yourself with no one: you don't know anyone's story; stay in your lane; be focused.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling will find rising pretty tough.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; be bullish; be open to taking calculated risks.

proverbs.proverb: Oko dùn ún ro l'àgbẹ̀dẹ ṣe ńrọ ọkọ́.
proverbs.translation: If farming were that fantastic, would blacksmiths opt to make hoes (for others)?
proverbs.wisdom: Look beyond the surface: think critically; don't be naive or simplistic; things are often not quite as they appear.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó máa di akàn, bí ẹja ni í kọ́kọ́ máa ńrí.
proverbs.translation: What will turn out favourable eventually, often starts out with much challenges.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't quit; keep hope alive; if you won't give up, you will win, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó máa di akàn, bí ẹja ni í kọ́kọ́ máa ńrí.
proverbs.translation: What will turn out favourable eventually, often starts out with much challenges.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't quit; keep hope alive; if you won't give up, you will win, eventually.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá fi sílẹ̀ lẹnu ewúrẹ́ ńtó.
proverbs.translation: What is left unattended, is what the goat's mouth can get to.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, we lose whatever we neglect.

proverbs.proverb: Àjọjẹ ò dùn bí ẹnìkan ò bá ní; ọjọ́ a ní la ńṣe àjọjẹ.
proverbs.translation: Sharing a meal isn't pleasant when one party persistently lacks; we are usually happy to share, when we all can give.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to give to others, but better to empower them to help themselves.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó roko tí ò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró
proverbs.translation: A farmer who ploughed his farm, but planted no corn claimed he's hurting the ground squirrel; he hasn't hurt any squirrel, but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Vindictive actions can be costly:be forward-looking

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if you pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a contentious person, he or she will yet remain contentious.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking, be positive; do your best and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Híhó ọṣẹ la fi í bọ̀wọ̀ fún un; ọ̀ṣẹ tí ò hó ò ní'yì mọ́.
proverbs.translation: To lather is the beauty of soap; any soap that won't lather has no honour.
proverbs.wisdom: Develop and hone your talent and uniqueness, and be a blessing with them; and your honour beckons.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin town, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: No one, and nothing is irreplaceable; alternatives always exist, if we look well enough.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that desires to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag; good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá gbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused: ignore distractions; not all issues should get our attention.

proverbs.proverb: Agbọ́n sẹ́, oyin sẹ́, ojú olóko rè é gòdògbò godogbo.
proverbs.translation: The wasp denies (stinging the farmer), the bee denies, yet the farmer's face remains heavily swollen.
proverbs.wisdom: What we say pales to what we do: our actions define and expose who we really are; be true in fact and in appearance.

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwó rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom:
Change is inevitable: a season must need go and another must need come; nothing lasts forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kọ́ l'onísẹ́, à fi ẹni tó bá fi orí tì í  d'ópin.
proverbs.translation: To start anything is not as crucial as seeing it through to completion.
proverbs.wisdom: 'Finishiative' is superior to initiative: don't start what you won't finish; finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: Kiní yì í, kiní i wa ni, ó yàtọ̀ sí kiní yì í, kiní ì mi ni.
proverbs.translation: This item is ours is different from this item is mine.
proverbs.wisdom: You can only have absolute claim on what is wholly yours.

proverbs.proverb: Akàn etí odò, kò tí ì jìnnà sí'lé.
proverbs.translation: The crab on the bank of the river is not far gone from home yet.
proverbs.wisdom: If you are in a hole, stop digging; don't double down on stupidity; it's never too late to do the right thing.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹyẹ oko ò mọ bíntín lọ eré e kó  kọ́lé ló máa máa bá kiri.
proverbs.translation: No matter how tiny a bird is, it's attention would be riveted on building it's home.
proverbs.wisdom: Focus on tangibles; depth is superior to breadth; substance is better than appearance.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyé ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God, the Creator, hasn't forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọdẹ bá ro ìṣẹ́, tó bá ro ìyà, tó bá pa ẹran, kò ní fún ẹnìkan jẹ.
proverbs.translation: If a hunter were to consider the hardship of his (hunting) expedition, he won't share his games with anyone.
proverbs.wisdom: Any kind of giving is tough (and quite often sacrificial); be appreciative.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ aráyé ri'ni ni wọ́n ńpe'ni; tí wọ́n ò bá rí'ni, wọ́n á pe ọmọ ẹlòmíràn.
proverbs.translation: You are available is why the world beckons on you; else, they'll beckon on someone else.
proverbs.wisdom: Humility is it; no one is indispensable.

proverbs.proverb: Ìdọ̀bálẹ̀ kì í ṣè'wà; ohun t'ólúkálùkù máa jẹ ló ńwá.
proverbs.translation: Prostrating does not necessarily connote good manners; people are simply after what they can get.
proverbs.wisdom: Excessive genuflection or servility, is often nothing, but an attempt at sycophancy; appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ká a.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; God's response is always so complete as to need no addition.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a kò bá jẹun sẹ́hìn àwo, èèrà ò lè gun ibi ta ti ńjẹun.
proverbs.translation: If one hasn't dropped one's food, ants can't be attracted to where one is eating.
proverbs.wisdom: Every problem has a cause; get rid of the cause and you will eliminate the problem; there is no smoke without fire.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá da omi sí'wájú, á tẹ ilẹ̀ tútù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever waters the ground ahead, will get to step on a wet ground.
proverbs.wisdom: One good turn always beckons on another; sowers harvest; givers receive; seek opportunities to give. #SuccessSecret

proverbs.proverb: Tó bá kù díẹ̀ kí ọmọ olóore jìn sí kòtò, mànàmáná á ṣiṣẹ́ ìmọ́lẹ̀ fún un.
proverbs.translation: Just before a kind person would stumble into a ditch (in darkness), the lightning would light up his or her path to save the day.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness pays: it's good to be good; kind acts are never lost.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ìpọ́njú là ńm'ọ̀rẹ́; ọjọ́ tó bá burú la ńm'ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: It is during difficult times that true friends are known; when things are really tough is when those who truly care can be identified.
proverbs.wisdom: Difficult times can be useful: they help identify those who truly care

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ṣe fáàrí ẹ̀ṣẹ́ dídì, si ọmọ adẹ́tẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Do not brag about fists in the presence of a leper.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't show off: be considerate, courteous and tactful.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹṣin bá dá'ni, a máa ńtun ùn gùn ni.
proverbs.translation: If one is thrown by a horse, one ought to remount it again.
proverbs.wisdom: If you try and fail, try again; it's not how many times you fall that counts, but how many times you get up: if you won't give up, you will win, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí bíńtí ò tó, púpọ̀ yóò jìnnà sí i.
proverbs.translation: Abundance will be far from whoever is not contented with a little.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; it makes for increase.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà mọ̀sá l'akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ
proverbs.translation: A good warrior must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to retreat will die in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Timing is crucial; know when to pursue, defer or quit

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan, bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; good things take time;  don’t force issues before their time.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í rẹ ológbò, kó má lè ṣe ọdẹ eku.
proverbs.translation: A cat cannot be too tired to hunt mice.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast, be persistent, be resilient; never quit: quitting is the only way to fail.

proverbs.proverb: Ká panupọ̀ lé ẹlẹ́yọ́rọ́ lọ ná, kí a tó wá fàbọ̀ sí adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: We ought to come together to chase away the fox first, before reverting to the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Better to handle the most pressing of two problems first rather than inefficiently attempt the two at once.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ṣe fáàrí ẹ̀ṣẹ́ dídì, si ọmọ adẹ́tẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Don’t brag about fists in the presence of a leper.
proverbs.wisdom: Be considerate, courteous and tactful. Be sensitive and show empathy.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbín ò lè sáré bí Ajá; ìyẹn ò ní kó máà de ibi tó ńlọ.
proverbs.translation: The snail cannot run as fast as the dog; that won't stop it from getting to wherever it's going.
proverbs.wisdom:
We are all uniquely endowed, and complete enough to live out our lives; stay in your lane: envy no one.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wà á ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient; complex issues should be carefully and patiently handled.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ gún ẹṣin ní kẹ́ṣẹ́, ẹ ló ńtà'pá, baba ta ni wọ́n máa ki irin bọ̀ ní'kùn tí kò ní ju apá?
proverbs.translation: You spurred a horse and wondered why it kicked; who would be struck with steel in the belly and not react?
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; be considerate; treat others as you would want to be treated

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sínú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun, eventually, the shade will come (when the sun sets).
proverbs.wisdom: Tough times cannot last forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò leè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain; hang in there: don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í mọ iyì ohun tó ní, à fi tó bá sọ ọ́ nù.
proverbs.translation: We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose the thing.
proverbs.wisdom:
Take nothing desired for granted: we lose, sometimes permanently, whatever we take for granted; treasure whatever you wish to keep.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àbá làá kó dànù; ẹnìkan kì í kó aláàbá dànù.
proverbs.translation: You may only discard a suggestion, but not the one who made it.
proverbs.wisdom:
A case against ad hominem; question and attack ideas not personalities.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Odò tó ńṣàn kì í b'ojú w'ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: A flowing stream never looks (or flows) backward.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be forward-looking; be focused: no one drives forward with eyes on the rearview mirror.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò fẹ́ wọ àkísà, kì í bá ajá ṣe eré e géle.
proverbs.translation: Don't play rough with a dog, if you don't want to end up in tatters.
proverbs.wisdom:
Look before you leap; think before you act: actions come with consequences
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kí a tó dé ibi tí à ńlọ, a máa ńkọ́kọ́ dé ibi tí a kò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Before getting to our destination, we may have to get to where we'd rather not be.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be focused, be strategic: always look ahead; don't lose the forest for the trees.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Màlúù tí ò n'írù, Ọlọ́run ni í lé eṣinṣin fún un.
proverbs.translation: It's God that fends off flies for a cow that has no tail.
proverbs.wisdom: God helps those who can't help themselves; whatever is impossible to man, is possible with God.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ògiri ò bá la'nu, aláǹgbá ò lè r'áyè wọ̀ ọ́.
proverbs.translation: If there are no crevices in the wall, the lizard cannot penetrate into the wall.
proverbs.wisdom:
Actions beckon, and quite often, compel reactions; to stop an effect, eliminate the action causing it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá ara ẹni tan kí á fa ara ẹni n'ítan ya.
proverbs.translation: To be related to someone is no excuse to be unconscionably dependent on him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Good to take personal responsibility; never abuse your privileges: there is a limit to everything.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ ẹ̀ jù sí inú eèrùn, bí inú ẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú eèrùn lè má rọ̀
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rashness; be wary of taking crucial decisions in anger

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Ignore distractions; stay focused and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá akitiyan wa á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: If we won't give up, our hustling will one day end.
proverbs.wisdom: Finish whatever you start: never give up, never quit; if we won't quit, we will win.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ́ láàpa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè láàpa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Àìsanra tó ajá ológìnní kì í ṣe ti àìjẹun ká'nú; bí ìran rẹ̀ ṣe mọ ni.
proverbs.translation: The smaller frame of cats' relative to dogs isn't for want of food; that's cats' genetic makeup.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance can be deceptive; often, there is more than is immediately obvious.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kékeré gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, tí ìfẹ bá wà láàárín wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is sizable enough for twenty friends, if there is love in their midst .
proverbs.wisdom: Love is it: little is much if love is in it; with love, a cottage may well pass for a castle.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú u rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would calmly and patiently dismember an ant would see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be calm, be even keeled, and be patient: virtually nothing is impossible, with these.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà tí èèyàn tọ̀ tó ṣubú, bí èèyàn bá ní sùúrù, èyàn lè tọ̀ọ́ là.
proverbs.translation: A path that one treads and fails, with patience, one may well tread it to success.
proverbs.wisdom: No closed case and no impossibility: if you won't give up, you will win; be open-minded, be patient and be persistent.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; excessive talk made the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial; exercise self-control, always.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà bá ńgbá'ni ká máa rọ́'jú; bó pẹ́ bó yà ìgbà ńbọ̀ wá gba'ni.
proverbs.translation: If a season afflicts, we ought to persevere; the good times will soon come.
proverbs.wisdom: Persevere and keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever; change is inevitable.

proverbs.proverb: Ò yẹ kí ìdí gbé àtàrí wò, kó mọ iṣẹ tí eṣinṣin ńṣe.
proverbs.translation: The buttocks should trade places with the head, to appreciate what flies do (to it).
proverbs.wisdom: Be hesitant to criticise: you can't be too sure of what others are going through, if you've never been in their shoes.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We are inseparable from our character.
proverbs.wisdom:
No one can pretend to be who he or she is not for very long; be patient, ultimately, the real character will show through.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún ata nínú odó, báa lọ̀ ọ́ lórí ọlọ, iwa ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound it in a mortar or grind it on the grinding stone, pepper will remain inseparable from its character.
proverbs.wisdom: Old habits die hard; we can hardly pretend to be who we are not, for long.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no end to learning: be open to it; age is no barrier to learning.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ò kú, ìṣe ò tán.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is no end to what one can still achieve.
proverbs.wisdom:
With life, there is hope; no impossibility; never ever give up.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kíkéré l'abẹ́rẹ́ kéré, kì í ṣe mímì fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A needle may be tiny, but it’s not an object to be swallowed by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't judge a book by its cover: never judge by appearance; underestimate no one.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jìyà, bó bá dàgbà, á tó ọdẹ ẹ́ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ọ̀rẹ́ dà, kó má ṣe bí'nú; ẹni abínibí ńda'ni
proverbs.translation: Those betrayed by friends shouldn't be offended; even siblings betray one another.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it; forgive and forget; don't hold on to hurts.

proverbs.proverb: Àlejò bí òkété là ńfi èkùrọ́ lọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A guest like bush rat is the one offered palm kernel.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance matters: how you appear dictates how you'll be received.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán nínú ewé, táa se ọbẹ̀ nínú èpo ẹpà, ẹni máa yó, á yó.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound yam in a leaf and prepare the soup in a groundnut pod, those who would be full, would be.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A refuse dump that won't tolerate filth won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be tolerant; intolerance can impose limitations. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Yinni yinni kí ẹni ṣè'mí ì.
proverbs.translation: Praise a kind person and he or she will be spurred to do more.
proverbs.wisdom:
Praise and appreciation inspire and bring increase.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú ṣe kéré tó, ó fi ààyè gba ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: As small as the belly is, it has room for the baby (the foetus).
proverbs.wisdom:
We always make room for what is important to us.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A ní kí ẹ jẹ ẹ́, ẹ léegun lásán ni; a ní kí ẹ gbé e sọnù ẹ lẹ́ran díẹ́ wà ńbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Asked to eat it, you claimed it is a mere bone; yet when asked to discard it, you insisted it still has some meat.
proverbs.wisdom: Greed spurs indecision & discontentment; the greedy is seldom contented

proverbs.proverb: Bí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed, it will positively impact two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom:
Success can be contagious; a well-targeted intervention can positively affect several others.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ẹkún kọ́ làpẹrẹ ìbànújẹ́; gbogbo ẹ̀rín sì kọ́ ló túmọ̀ sí ìdùnnú.
proverbs.translation: Not all tears signify sadness; not all laughters imply happiness.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Agbẹ́-igi-lére kan kò lè gbẹ́ inú u rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No sculptor can carve the internals of the statue he or she is carving.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a limit to what anyone can do: be reasonable in your expectations; most people are doing the very best they can, regardless of how it seems.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ṣe ohun tó dun'ni lóòní le ṣe ohun tí yóò dùn mọ́ni l'ọ́la.
proverbs.translation: A person who hurts one today may well be a blessing to one tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one; quit being vindictive: be forward-looking; there are no permanent enemies, only permanent interests.

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín'gbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver stops carving calabashes, those already carved will remain.
proverbs.wisdom: Even if we refrain from kind acts, those rendered still live on; keep up the kindness: they are never wasted or lost

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá pẹ́ lórí imí, eṣinkéṣin a máa bá’ni níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever takes unduly long in open defecation, may well play host to strange flies.
proverbs.wisdom:
Undue tardiness often results in unexpected outcomes; make hay while the sun shines.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹlẹ́rù ló ńgbé ẹrù ẹ̀ kí a tó báa fọwọ́ kún un
proverbs.translation: The owner has to first pick up his (or her) luggage before others will extend hands of support.
proverbs.wisdom: Take responsibility and ownership, before seeking help; don't expect support from others, if you're unwilling to do all you can

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó sùn là ńjí, a kì í jí apirọrọ; táa bá jí apirọrọ kò ní dáhùn.
proverbs.translation: The person sleeping is the person one wakes, not the person pretending to be asleep; the person pretending won't respond, if one wakes him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Unsolicited advice or assistance is seldom appreciated.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan, bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time: be patient, but be dogged;  don’t force issues before their time, but keep feeding the issues without relenting.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gba àkàtà lọ́wọ́ akítì; a kì í gba ilé baba ọmọ lọ́wọ́ ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: No one can stop monkeys from squatting; no one should deprive a child of his patrimony.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; don't deprive people of what is rightly theirs.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọmọdé bá rí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tó ńgun ẹṣin lọ níwájú, ó yẹ kó wo ẹgbẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀ tó ńfi ẹsẹ̀ rìn bọ̀ lẹ́hìn.
proverbs.translation: A youngster who's anxious at his (or her) peers riding horses ahead, will do well to look back to see his father's mates trudging behind.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it

proverbs.proverb: Bí ará ilé ẹni bá ńjẹ kòkòrò búburú, ó yẹ ká sọ fún un, nítorí hùrù hẹrẹ rẹ̀ kò ní jẹ́ ká sùn lóru
proverbs.translation: If your companion is eating a harmful insect, caution him(her); else, the effect on him won't let you sleep at night.
proverbs.wisdom: Be proactive; to be forewarned is to be forearmed

proverbs.proverb: Àìní ìforítì àparò ló sọ ọ́ di aláṣọ pípọ́n.
proverbs.translation: Patridge's lack of perseverance is what gave it its dirty garb.
proverbs.wisdom:
Perseverance is it; Lack of perseverance may deprive you of what ought to rightfully be yours.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò dúpẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀fà, bẹ́ igi dí ọ̀nà egbèje.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not grateful for small favours, blocks the path to bigger ones.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude is it; kindness calls for gratitude; and gratitude beckons on more kindness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ mí só, èmi náà yóò só; olúwarẹ̀ yóò kàn ṣu sára ni.
proverbs.translation: My friend farts, I must fart; you will simply end up defecating on yourself.
proverbs.wisdom: Stay in your lane and embrace your uniqueness; be secure in who you are: don't compare yourself with anyone.

proverbs.proverb: Ìkòkò ńse iṣu ẹnìkan ò gbọ́, ṣùgbọ́n iṣú dé inú odó tán ariwo ó ta.
proverbs.translation: While the pot was cooking the yam, no one heard a thing, but no sooner had the yams got into the mortar than noise broke out.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid obtrusive grandstanding: empty vessels make the most noise.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ̀ọ́ rìn mọ̀ọ́ yan kí orí má mì l'ọ́rùn.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be so good at walking and marching that the head won't shake.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it; no one is perfect

proverbs.proverb: A ki ẹsẹ̀ kan bọ odò, ọ̀nì fà á, tí a bá fi ẹsẹ̀ méjèjì s'ódò kí la mọ̀ pó fẹ́ ṣẹ'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We dipped a leg into the river and the crocodile snapped at it; who knows what would have happened had we dipped the two.
proverbs.wisdom: To be forewarned is to be forearmed.

proverbs.proverb: Ipá ńmú ẹṣin lọ sódò, ipá ò fún lómi mu
proverbs.translation: You can force a horse to the river but you can't force it to drink water.
proverbs.wisdom: You can provide opportunities, but you can't force anyone to take or make the best of them; you can't force anyone to do what he or she is determined not to do

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yàgò fún ẹlẹ́ṣin àná.
proverbs.translation: No one gives way (or defers) to someone who used to own a horse.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't live in the past: where we have been is not as crucial as where we are going; have a strategic-mindset and focus.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ṣe'ni lóore, ọpẹ́ là ńdá.
proverbs.translation: If one has been favoured with kindness, one ought to give thanks.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water in the trough simply because the cloud rumbles.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; never count your chickens before they are hatched.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ikú ilé ò pa'ni, t'òde ò leè pa'ni.
proverbs.translation:
If there is no enemy within, the ones outside can do us no harm.
If there is no enemy within, the one outside can do us no harm.
proverbs.wisdom:
Choose your friends wisely; worry less about the enemies without.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ìyẹ́ adìyẹ nílẹ̀, kí a wá fi ìrù àkèekèé rin etí.
proverbs.translation: No one has a hen's feather within reach and opt to scratch his or her inner ear with a scorpion's stinger.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid needless exposures to high risks.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ aráyé ńp'àtẹ́wọ́ fún yànmùyánmú, inú ẹ̀ ńdùn; kò mọ̀ pé òun ńfi ikú ṣeré ni.
proverbs.translation: People clap for mosquito and it rejoices, oblivious that it is toying with death.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive: not all positive gestures are noble.

proverbs.proverb: Ọba tí kì í fẹ́ gba ìmọ̀ràn, irú wọn kì í pẹ́ fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Any king who despises counsels, hardly takes long before stumbling.
proverbs.wisdom:
It's smart to be open to and treasure good counsels: those who spurn them needlessly expose themselves to avoidable errors.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá ńgbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Stay focused: ignore distractions; not all issues should get our attention.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́ irọ́; ọmọ èyàn ò fẹ́ òdodo; bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ ò pé mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: God hates lies; man hates truths; yet there is no third option in a discourse.
proverbs.wisdom: It is better to always stick with the truth, even when there are no easy options.s

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour, but easily lord it over their benefactors, once satisfied.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọlọ́wọ́ ò lè yó ẹnu ẹlẹ́nu.
proverbs.translation: Never expect the hands of someone else to feed you to satisfaction.
proverbs.wisdom:
Depend less, possibly not at all, on anyone: go catch your own fish.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Jẹ́ kí ńfìdí hẹẹ́, ni àlejò fi ńti onílé sóde
proverbs.translation: Let me just hang in here, is how the guest takes over the house from the host.
proverbs.wisdom:
Think well about that inch you want to give, it may well become a mile: be perceptive, be circumspect.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá pẹ́ ní ààtàn a máa rí abuké eṣinṣin.
proverbs.translation: If we can tarry long at the refuse dump, we will get to see a humpy housefly.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient: with time and patience, virtually nothing is impossible; whatever seems unresolvable may well need a bit more time.

proverbs.proverb: À ti gbé ìyàwó ò tóó pọ́n; owó ọbẹ̀ ló ṣòro.
proverbs.translation: Getting married is not an issue; meeting the marriage responsibility is the tough nut.
proverbs.wisdom: Look before you leap; think well before you act; it's easy to start some things, but tough to sustain it.

proverbs.proverb: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kọ́ l'onísẹ́, à fi ẹni tó bá fi orí tì í  d'ópin.
proverbs.translation: To start anything is not as crucial as seeing it through to completion.
proverbs.wisdom:
'Finishiative' is superior to initiative: don't start what you won't finish: finish whatever you start.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí kòkó ẹ̀ yè, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ ọ́ ṣe ẹ̀, bíkòṣe Elédùà.
proverbs.translation: A farmer with a thriving cocoa farm owes this not to his or her effort, but to God.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no self-made person: we are all God-made:; we must remain small in our very own eyes; we must be ever so modest.

proverbs.proverb: Ká dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ọrùn tó gbé orí dúró; ọ̀pọ̀ ẹran ló sún mọ́ orí tí ò ṣe nǹkankan.
proverbs.translation: Wẹ ought to be thankful to the neck for supporting the head; many tissues are close to it, yet do nothing.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be thankful, even for small favours.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fura sí ẹni tí a ńbá rìn; ẹni tí a bá ńfura sí, a kì í bá irú wọn rìn.
proverbs.translation: Do not be suspicious of those you associate with; those you'd be suspicious of, should not be your close associates.
proverbs.wisdom:
Build trust; avoid paranoia; be positive; be forward-looking.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tó bá kù díẹ̀ kí ọmọ olóore jìn sí kòtò, mànàmáná á ṣiṣẹ́ ìmọ́lẹ̀ fún un.
proverbs.translation: Just before a kind person would stumble into a ditch (in darkness), the lightning would light up his or her path to save the day.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness pays: it's good to be good; kind acts are never lost.

proverbs.proverb: Apẹ́kótójẹun kò ní jẹ̀ bàjẹ́.
proverbs.translation: The one who tarries to eat won't necessarily eat a lousy meal.
proverbs.wisdom:
Delay is not necessarily denial; often delays imply the perfection of the object hoped for; keep hope alive: it is not over yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá bò, ló ńníyì.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is covered up (or not easily accessible) is what is respected and honoured.
proverbs.wisdom:
Familiarity breeds contempt: whatever is easily available typically loses value and worth.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bópẹ́ bóyá akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: If one won't give up trying, one's hustling will one day come to an end.
proverbs.wisdom:
Never give up, never quit; if we won't quit, we will win eventually.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; hang on there: the best is yet to come.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú sí ẹni tí a kò rí.
proverbs.translation: Don't get mad at someone you have not seen (or heard out).
proverbs.wisdom: Never rush to judgment; there is always a chance you could be wrong; always give people the benefit of the doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Òjò tó rọ̀ sí ewúro, náà ló rọ̀ sí ìrèké.
proverbs.translation: The same rain that fell on the bitter-leaf, fell on the sugarcane (yet bitter-leaf is bitter while sugarcane remains sweet.)
proverbs.wisdom: Our reactions tell of who we really are deep down; bitter or vengeful responses are by choice.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá ọba pa àlà, kí ọkọ́ ọba má ṣán’ni lẹ́sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: You cannot share (farm) boundaries with the king and not get your feet wounded by his hoes.
proverbs.wisdom: Those who are not careful in riding the back of a tiger ends up inside; deal with positions of power with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Oò ṣá igi lọ́gbẹ́, oò ta ògùrọ̀ lọfà, o dé ìdí ọ̀pẹ, o ńgbẹ́nu s'ókè; ṣé ọ̀fẹ́ ló máa ńro ni?
proverbs.translation: You neither hacked a palm nor stabbed a raffia, yet you opened up your mouth under a palm for wine; does it drip freely?
proverbs.wisdom: No free lunch; take responsibility; pay the price

proverbs.proverb: Àìdúpẹ́ oore àná a máa mú oore sú'ni í ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Lack of gratitude for yesterday's kindness does make future acts of kindness tiresome.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; take nothing for granted: whatever is taken for granted diminishes; whatever is appreciated increases.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold (ornament) is seldom appreciated until it gets lost.
proverbs.wisdom:
We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose it; the available is easily taken for granted.
#yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Etí mẹ́ta ò yẹ orí; èèyàn mẹ́ta ò lè dúró ní méjì-méjì.
proverbs.translation: Three ears do not suit the head; three people cannot stand in groups of twos.
proverbs.wisdom: There is always a right and wrong way to do anything: focus on the right way.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá ní kí ọ̀rẹ́ òun má jọba ni kò ní lọ̀rẹ́ ọba.
proverbs.translation: Whoever blocks his friend from becoming a king won't have a king as a friend.
proverbs.wisdom:
Foster goodness: those plotting evil for others often share in the evil results; we reap whatever we sow.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà kan ò wọ ọjà.
proverbs.translation: Not just one route leads to the market.
proverbs.wisdom:
Alternative approaches exist; there are many ways to achieve an end; don't be fixated on one.
#Yorubas

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànnà yánná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹrẹ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire, the searing glare of the sun, can't hope to enjoy the glittering beauty of brass.
proverbs.wisdom:
No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìṣẹ́ ò bá jẹ́ ká sọ òdodo, àìṣòdodo kò ní jẹ́ ká bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: If fear of poverty makes us lie, lying will keep us entrenched in poverty, as well.
proverbs.wisdom:
Honesty pays; dishonest lifestyle does exact hefty fees, at the end.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ikú fẹ́ pa alápatà ó ńkígbe; ọmọ ẹranko tó ti dá lóró ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: Death stalks the butcher and he screams; what about the animals he's butchered?
proverbs.wisdom: Exact from no one what you are unwilling to impose on yourself; be fair and considerate.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í sọ òkò sí ẹyẹ tó ńwá ọ̀nà àti fò.
proverbs.translation: Do not throw stones at a bird that seeks to fly away.
proverbs.wisdom: Act in wisdom: do not pre-empt or worsen an already deplorable situation.

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù kí ojú kan tóbi tó, ojú méjì sàn ju ojú kan lọ.
proverbs.translation: No matter how big an eye is, two eyes are better than one.
proverbs.wisdom:
Team effort is superior.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if you pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a contentious person, he or she will yet remain contentious.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be forward-looking, be positive; do your best and keep moving.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ ẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú ẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be hasty in anger: calm down; avoid rashness

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ẹ̀tẹ̀ sílẹ̀ pa làpálàpá.
proverbs.translation: Do not leave leprosy unattended while preoccupied with treating ringworm.
proverbs.wisdom: Think perceptively & strategically: don't lose sight of the forest for the trees: look at the bigger picture; things are often more than they seem

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn.
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes for an enduring loving relationship.
proverbs.wisdom: If it is wrong, love will not see it; tolerance is crucial. A kú ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ olólùfẹ́ ọdún o.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńlé nǹkan níwájú, ńfi àwọn nǹkan míràn sẹ́hìn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is pursuing something ahead, is actually leaving some other things behind.
proverbs.wisdom:
There's always a price tag: we must let go of what is behind, if we want to lay hold of what is ahead.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Èyí wù mí, ò wù ọ́, lọmọ ìyá méjì ṣe ńfẹ́ ìyàwó ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
proverbs.translation: What appeals to me does not necessarily appeal to you is the reason two maternal brothers have different wives.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; people are entitled to their choices: live and let live.

proverbs.proverb: Bí afọ́jú bá lóun yóò fọ́'ni lójú, ó yẹ ká fura, nítorí tí kò bá mú nǹkan lọ́wọ́, ó lè tẹ nǹkan mọ́lẹ̀
proverbs.translation: If a blind man threatens to make you blind, be wary; if he has nothing in his hands, he may have something under his feet
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; underestimate no one

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ ńbá àṣá ṣeré, ó rò pé ẹyẹ oko lásán ni.
proverbs.translation: The chick gullibly plays with the hawk believing it to be an ordinary bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be risky, if not fatally costly.

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n ju agbára lọ.
proverbs.translation: Wisdom is better than strength..
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue wisdom

proverbs.proverb: Ṣiṣẹ́ ṣiṣẹ́ ò gọ̀, ó fẹ́ jàre ìṣẹ́ ni; ẹni tó kọ̀ tí ò ṣiṣẹ́ fẹ́ yan ìṣẹ́ láàyò ni.
proverbs.translation: The diligent isn't stupid, he or she simply wants to defeat poverty; the person who refuses to work, really seeks to partner with poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence is a choice: choose right

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwó rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom:
Change is inevitable: a season must need go and another must need come; nothing lasts forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àdàbà ò náání à ńkùn'gbẹ́; pápá ńjó ẹyẹ oko fò lọ.
proverbs.translation: The dove is unmoved by the bush being set on fire; once on fire, it simply flies away.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; in every situation, always have an assured plan B: it engenders calm in the midst of a storm

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dámọ̀nràn àti tà'kìtì lágbàlá ọ̀bọ, nítorí ọ̀bọ fúnra'ra rẹ̀, ọba òkìtì ni
proverbs.translation: Never toy with the idea of somersaulting in the vicinity of a monkey: monkeys themselves, are experts at somersaulting.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest; it is unwise to make a needless show of one's ignorance.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí àtùpà ṣe lè lágbára tó, kò lè ríran rí ìdí ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No matter how strong a lamp is, it cannot light up it's base.
proverbs.wisdom:
No matter how strong anyone is, he or she will always need the input of others; no one is wholly self-sufficient, nor indeed can be.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ tí a bá sọ ajá ẹni lọmọ aráyé ńbá ni í pèé.
proverbs.translation: Whatever name one calls one's dog, that is the name others will call it as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Speak positively: words objectify themselves; never describe yourself or what you do in negative terms.s

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ àánú Olúwa kì í ṣú.
proverbs.translation: God's mercy never runs out.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility with God: He cannot be contained or cornered; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Àbàtà takété bí ẹni pé kò bá odò tan.
proverbs.translation: The marshy place keeps aloof as if it is unrelated to the river.
proverbs.wisdom:
When the going gets tough, pretty few will stick with you: mentally prepare for this; everybody loves the winner, but when you lose, you are on your own.
#Yorubas

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọ́mọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom:
Prevention is better than cure; it's good to seek help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò lówó lọ́wọ́ tó lóun ní ìwà, ìwà oníwà ló ńyá á lò.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not wealthy and claims to be of good character, must have borrowed someone else's character.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive: you'll never know who anyone really is, until he or she no longer needs you.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí òjò bá dá tán, ti abẹ́ igi kì í dá bọ́rọ́.
proverbs.translation: When the rain subsides, the (rain water) dripping under trees seldom promptly cease.
proverbs.wisdom:
Consequences do far outlive actions: be mindful of the potential consequences of whatever you do.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Never carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Never compare your life with that of anyone: stay in your lane; be focused.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá dé ìlú táà léèyàn, ìwà rere làá ní.
proverbs.translation: If one is a complete stranger in a town, one ought to simply be of good character.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character pays: it attracts favour.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kòkòrò tó ńjó lẹ́ẹ̀bá ọ̀nà, onílù rẹ̀ ńbẹ nínú igbó.
proverbs.translation: The insect that is dancing by the bush path has its drummer right in the bush.
proverbs.wisdom:
Look beyond the obvious; what we perceive or know, quite often, is not all there is.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí iná bá ńjó lóko, màjàlá á ṣe òfófó.
proverbs.translation: When a farm goes aflame, the flakes fly home to bear the tale.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing can be covered up, permanently: hidden things get unravelled eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn kan lè ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́; gbólóhùn kan náà lè tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: One sentence can mess up a discussion; one sentence can also make it better.
proverbs.wisdom:
Words are powerful: they can build up and can pull down; use them wisely.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀wọ́n irin ni í mú abẹ́rẹ́ wọ iná.
proverbs.translation: Scarcity of iron is why a needle gets dipped into the blacksmith forge.
proverbs.wisdom:
When the preferred is not available, the available often becomes the preferred; we make do with what we have when we can't have what we want.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí èbù ò rà, a kò lè fi ojú kan ègbodò.
proverbs.translation: If the yam seedling is not left to rot (when planted), no new yam can be harvested.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good things take time: persevere; some things have to get worse before they get better.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Pírí l'olongo ńjí; a kì í rí olókùnrùn ẹyẹ lórí ìtẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Robins wake up in a snap; you'll never find a sick one cocooned in its nest.
proverbs.wisdom:
Diligence is it: be on the go; the diligent hardly whines and is seldom tardy.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí kòkó ẹ̀ yè, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ ọ́ ṣe ẹ̀, bíkòṣe Elédùà.
proverbs.translation: A farmer with a thriving cocoa farm owes this not to his or her effort, but to God.
proverbs.wisdom:
Modesty is it; never arrogate to yourself what is evidently God's blessing.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀dá ò l'áròpin.
proverbs.translation: No one can be written off.
proverbs.wisdom:
Write-off or underestimate no one, including yourself; you absolutely have no idea what you or anyone can become, tomorrow: it's not over, yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Rírò ni t'ènìyàn, ṣíṣe ni t'Olúwa.
proverbs.translation: Man may only propose, it is God who disposes.
proverbs.wisdom:
No one knows tomorrow for sure: we all plan and hope; keep your hope alive and don't you ever give up; it is not over, yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ọdún mẹ́ta ò tó ẹni tí à ńgbára á lé; ọ̀tá oṣù mẹ́fà ò tó ẹni tí à ńsà lóògùn.
proverbs.translation: A three year old friendship is not to be fully relied upon; an enemy of six months is not to be grievously assaulted.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive and measured; avoid rashness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ṣe ohun tó dun'ni lóòní, lè ṣe ohun tí yóò dùn mọ́'ni lọ́la.
proverbs.translation: A person who hurts one today may still be a blessing to one tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom:
No closed case: write-off no one; be positive and be open-minded: don't get shackled with vindictiveness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom:
No pain, no gain; there's always a price tag.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún ni.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is sweet, whatever is much and whatever endures are all gifts from God.
proverbs.wisdom:
Ultimately all blessings are from God; if it is going to be good and enduring, it will have to come from Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣe é fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: I am hungry is not to be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom:
A serious matter shouldn't be treated with levity.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kò gbọdọ̀ torí kòkòrò kó sí'ni lójú, ká wá ki igi bọ ojú ọ̀hún.
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't poke a stick into one's eye simply because an insect entered the eye.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be circumspect; adopt radical reactions with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá ní òun yóò fọ ìlú mọ́, òun lọmọ aráyé máa fi ṣe kànrìnkàn
proverbs.translation: Whoever insists he'll singlehandedly wash a town clean will find himself being used as the sponge.
proverbs.wisdom: Walk in wisdom: manage lofty goals with discretion; no matter how fat a tree is, it can't make a forest

proverbs.proverb: Ìfura loògùn àgbà; àgbà tó lóògùn tí kò ní ìfura, kò ní nǹkàn kan.
proverbs.translation: Perceptivity is the secret weapon of elders; an elder who has charms but is not perceptive has nothing.
proverbs.wisdom: Matured minds are perceptive: they see what has not been shown and hear what has not been said.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi táa ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: Focus on where you are going, not where you had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be focused; be forward-looking; let go of past failures and hurts: keep your eyes on the goals.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí èyàn ò bá tí ì dé ibi tó ńlọ, kì í dúró.
proverbs.translation: If one has not reached one's destination, one should not stop.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep moving; go forward; don't become a spot.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńse'bẹ̀, kò tí ì kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; never give up.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a ńwò kì í wò'ran.
proverbs.translation: The person others are watching should not join in the watching, as well.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be active, be involved: don't be an onlooker in your own game; don't be a spectator: dive in.
#Yoruba proverb

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí yóò ròhìn ogun ò ní kú s'ógun.
proverbs.translation: A warrior destined to recount war stories won't perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; better days are still ahead.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà bá ńgbá'ni ká máa rọ́'jú; bó pẹ́ bó yà ìgbà ńbọ̀ wá gba'ni.
proverbs.translation: We should persevere, if a season afflicts; no matter how long it takes, the good times will soon come.
proverbs.wisdom: Persevere and keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever; change is inevitable.

proverbs.proverb: Bíbíire kò ṣeé fi owó rà.
proverbs.translation: Good pedigrees cannot be bought with money.
proverbs.wisdom: Money isn't everything; it's not everything that wealth can confer.

proverbs.proverb: Ikú tí yóò bá pa'ni, tó bá ṣí'ni ní fìlà, ọpẹ la ńdá.
proverbs.translation: If what would have killed one, merely removed one's cap, one should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: If you are reading this, in the year 2020, regardless of your peculiar story, you have every reason to be thankful; we all do.

proverbs.proverb: Òkè lọwọ́ afúnni ńgbé; ìsàlẹ̀ lọwọ́ ẹni tó ńgbà á ńwà.
proverbs.translation: The hand of a giver is always at the top; the hand of the receiver stays underneath.
proverbs.wisdom: Giving elevates; generosity pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ò lọ bí òréré; ayé ò lọ bí ọ̀pá ìbọn.
proverbs.translation: No season goes on endlessly; life isn't always as straight as the barrel of a gun.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is inevitable; may this day marks the beginning of a fresher and better air for us all. Merry Christmas everyone.

proverbs.proverb: Àrẹ̀mọ má jobì, má ròde ẹmu, kó lè dé ipò bàbá rẹ̀ ni.
proverbs.translation: That the royal heir should desist from rioutous living, it's so he can succeed his father, the king.
proverbs.wisdom: Be humble and be open to good advices, even if inconvenient: they are more for the benefit of the person advised.

proverbs.proverb: A kò lè tìtorí pé a fẹ́ kí ẹṣin kú iṣẹ́, ka wá ní k'órí adé rin'sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We cannot ask the king to trek, simply because we want to appreciate the horse.
proverbs.wisdom: Decorum is it; there is a limit to everything.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; talking excessively was how the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial, even in a good thing.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ó ku èní ku ọ̀la kí òǹgbẹ pa agílítí kú, òjò á rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If the iguana lizard would die of thirst, within a day or two,  the rain would fall.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; it is not over yet; better times are still ahead.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch-dark night, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Darkness can't be forever: look beyond it to the coming dawn; keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá fi iṣu tí kò jinná gún'yán, o di dandan kó jẹ iyán tó lẹ́mọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever prepares pounded yam with yams that are not fully cooked, will certainly eat lumpy pounded yam.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience is it: good things take time; don’t force issues before their time.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í pẹ̀lú ọ̀bọ já'ko.
proverbs.translation: Don't join a monkey to roam the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't stoop low, aim high; don't descend low to do untoward things.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejìnrìn, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If a bus won't go to Ejìnrìn town, thousands others will.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternatives exist: be open-minded enough to consider them; there is always a way out: keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ó rọrùn fún ológbò mẹ́ẹ̀rin láti se ọdẹ eku kan; ìgbà tí wọ́n bá fẹ́  pín in, ni yóò di ìjà.
proverbs.translation: Four cats may well hunt a rat; Sharing it is what will put them at loggerheads.
proverbs.wisdom: The more those who'd share a reward are, the less satisified they'd be.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá da omi síwájú, á tẹ ilẹ̀ tútù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever waters the ground ahead, will step on a wet ground.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give and take; to reap, we ought to sow.

proverbs.proverb: Àǹfàní ò nírù, bó bẹ́ wọ igbó, kò sí ohun táà á fi fàá
proverbs.translation: Opportunity has no tail, once it dashes into the forest, there's nothing with which to pull it out.
proverbs.wisdom:
Promptly take advantage of opportunities; make hay while the sun shines; procrastination can be costly
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán nínú ewé, táa se ọbẹ̀ nínú èèpo ẹpà, ẹni máa yó, á yó.
proverbs.translation: If we pound yam in a leaf and cook the soup in a groundnut pod, those who will (eat and) be full, will be full.
proverbs.wisdom: Determination is it; we are limited not by circumstances, but by ourselves.

proverbs.proverb: Kò yẹ kí obì aláwẹ́ mẹ́ta díjà sílẹ̀ láàrín in ọmọ ìyá mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: Sharing a kolanut with 3 parts should not put 3 maternal siblings at loggerheads.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair: take advantage of no one; be contented: live and let live.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ ló lésì, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ làá fèsì sí.
proverbs.translation: There is always an appropriate response to every statement, but it's not every statement that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Not all issues deserve our attention: be focused; ignore distractions.

proverbs.proverb: Ọdẹ-afifìlà-perin ọjọ́ kan n'iyì i rẹ̀ ẹ́ mọ, tó bá ti di ọjọ́ kejì, ó ti di olóògùn ìkà.
proverbs.translation: A hunter who killed an elephant with a mere cap, would be honoured for just one day; the next, he would be denigrated as a wicked sorcerer.
proverbs.wisdom: Success can elicit both awe and envy.

proverbs.proverb: Tèmi ò ṣòro, tí kì í jẹ́ kí ọmọ alágbẹ̀dẹ ní idà.
proverbs.translation: Mine is not an issue, is how a blacksmith ends up not making a sword for himself.
proverbs.wisdom:
It's good to care for others, but don't ignore your own needs, as well.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kọ́ l'onísẹ́, à fi ẹni tó bá fi orí tì í  d'ópin.
proverbs.translation: To start anything is not as crucial as seeing it through to completion.
proverbs.wisdom: 'Finishiative' is superior to initiative: don't start what you won't finish; finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í s'òótọ́ inú, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni má d'ayọ̀, b'áyé ẹni bá dojúrú ìwà èèyàn ló yẹ ká wò.
proverbs.translation: A honest life cannot but end well; if a life remains unpleasant, the person's character need to be examined.
proverbs.wisdom: Quite often, our character, good or bad, determines our experience.

proverbs.proverb: Èéfín ni ìwà; kò ṣeé fi pamọ́.
proverbs.translation: Character is like smoke; it cannot be covered up.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can pretend to be who he isn't for long.s

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní ká dijú kí ẹni burúkú kọjá, a kò ní mọ ìgbà tí ẹni rere máa lọ
proverbs.translation: If we were to close our eyes so as not to see a wicked person passing by, we won't know when a good person will pass as well.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be tolerant; be forward-looking: don't be vindictive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Wọ́n ní kí ẹyẹ ká lọ sódó, ká lọ sun omi jẹ; ó yẹ kí ẹyẹ mọ̀ pé, òun ni wọ́n fẹ́ lọ sun jẹ lódò.
proverbs.translation: A bird asked to come along to the river to join in roasting water to eat, should be wise to know that it's the one to be roasted and eaten at the river
proverbs.wisdom: Wisdom is it

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ Ọ̀yọ́ ju ọlỌ́yọ̀ọ́ lọ.
proverbs.translation: One should not claim to be more proficient at Oyo dialect than an Oyo indigene.
proverbs.wisdom:
Humility is it; to claim to know more about an issue, than those in the thick of it, is to end up making an open show of one's ignorance
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Iná la fi ńmọ òórùn tùràrí
proverbs.translation: The assault of fire is (what ignites and) how we perceive the fragrance of incense.
proverbs.wisdom:
Adversities, quite often, are stepping stones to greater heights: keep hope alive, it's not over yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́ tí yóò gun igi ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀, èékánná rẹ̀ yóò mú ṣáṣá.
proverbs.translation: A squirrel that hopes to climb the plantain tree must have sharp claw nails.
proverbs.wisdom: Success comes, not by accident, but by careful preparation and right subsequent steps: success doesn't just happen, it is caused.

proverbs.proverb: Àjùmọ̀bí ò kan t'àánú; ẹni orí rán sí'ni ló ńṣe'ni l'óore.
proverbs.translation: Blood ties do not guarantee merciful support; help comes only from those divinely sent to us.
proverbs.wisdom:
Arms of flesh can be unreliable: place your hope in no one, but on God who cannot fail.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àparò kan ò ga jù kan lọ, à fi èyí tó bá gun orí ebè.
