proverbs.translation: One patridge isn't taller than another except the one on a mound.
proverbs.wisdom:
Discrimination is vanity: we are more alike than we are different; envy no one, but be humble.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí òbúrẹ́wà kan ńbì kan; òṣì ló ńmú ẹwà á ṣì.
proverbs.translation: There is no ugliness anywhere; deprivation is what messes up beauty.
proverbs.wisdom:
With access to the right resources and support, everyone can go far: despise no one.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ìpọ́njú là ńmọ ọ̀rẹ́; ọjọ́ tó bá burú là ńmọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni
proverbs.translation: It's during tough times that true friends are known; when things are really difficult is when you'll know those who truly care.
proverbs.wisdom: Difficult times have one good purpose: they help reveal those who truly care

proverbs.proverb: Ṣàṣà ènìyàn ni í fẹ́ni lẹ́hìn báà sí nílé; tajá tẹran ni í fẹ́ni lójú ẹni.
proverbs.translation: Precious few will love you behind your back; everyone loves you to your face.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive; not all that glitters is genuine; not everyone who is hailing you truly meant it
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Igbá ọmọdé sọnù, ó lóun fi àmì sí i; ṣebí ó di ìgbà tó bá rí igbá kó tó rí àmì?
proverbs.translation: A youngster who lost a calabash claimed he made a mark on it; is it not when he's found the calabash that he'll see the mark on it?
proverbs.wisdom: Don't count your chickens before they are hatched.

proverbs.proverb: Bí Ọlọ́run bá ńṣe rere, à á ló ńṣe ibi.
proverbs.translation: When God is doing good, we often misconstrue Him (in our limited view and understanding) as doing evil.
proverbs.wisdom:
God works in mysterious ways: a disappointment may well be a stepping stone; don't give up hope: hang in there.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Etí mẹ́ta ò yẹ orí; èèyàn mẹ́ta ò lè dúró ní méjì-méjì.
proverbs.translation: Three ears do not suit the head; three people cannot stand in groups of twos.
proverbs.wisdom:
There is a right and wrong way to do anything: always focus on the right way.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Láníntán kan kò lè ni ìwo ẹṣin.
proverbs.translation: No one can be so wealthy as to own the horn of a horse (since horses don't have horns).
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it: absolutely no one has (nor indeed can have) it all together; we will always have unsatisfied wants: human wants are insatiable.

proverbs.proverb: Bí irùngbọ̀n alágbàṣe bá gùn títí tó ńwọ́lẹ̀, ẹni gbé oko fún un lọ̀gá a rẹ̀
proverbs.translation: Even if the beard of a hired hand is so long as to sweep the floor, his hirer remains his boss.
proverbs.wisdom: Humility is it; recognise and honour those ahead of you; give honour to whom it is due.

proverbs.proverb: Àìfarabalẹ̀ ojú ni kì í fi rí imú bọ̀rọ̀; bí ojú bá fara balẹ̀, á rí imú.
proverbs.translation: Their hurried state is why the eyes are unable to see the nose, easily; if the eyes can be calm, they'll get to see the nose.
proverbs.wisdom: Calmness and patience are crucial to resolving complex issues.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo èèyàn oníwà tùtù kọ́ lonínúure.
proverbs.translation: Not everyone with a pleasant disposition is kind-natured.
proverbs.wisdom:
Niceness is not necessarily goodness; appearance can be deceptive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànnà yánná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹrẹ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, can't enjoy the glittering (beauty) of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; there's nothing in doing nothing.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó kọ orin tí ò dùn, òun ńáà ńfi etí ara rẹ̀ gbọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is singing a lousy song, very well knows that the song is lousy.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive; untoward acts are seldom unintentional: those involved very well know these acts are untoward.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Oúnjẹ tí a ó jẹ pẹ́, a kì í bu òkèlè rẹ̀ tóbi.
proverbs.translation: The morsels of the food one will eat for long, should not be excessively big in size.
proverbs.wisdom:
Moderation is it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo inú ìgò, ó di àwòmọ́jú fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The corns in a bottle are viewed with disdain by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom:
People belittle what they can't have.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá purọ́, á á jalè.
proverbs.translation: Whoever lies (habitually) will steal.
proverbs.wisdom:
Nip those moral failings in the bud; they hardly remain the same: they grow and worsen to exact hefty fees, at the end.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lè jẹ ìyà tó kún ahá, kò lè gbádùn ọrọ̀ tó kún inú àmù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever won't endure a cup-filled deprivation cannot enjoy a pot-filled wealth.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast; be patient; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò lè ṣe iṣẹ́ oníṣẹ́, kò ní lè ṣe tara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever cannot do someone else's work well, won't do his or her own well, too.
proverbs.wisdom:
Diligence pays: how we work for someone else, good or bad, is how we'll work for ourselves; put in your very best, always
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom:
God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àìtètè mú olè, olè á mú olóko.
proverbs.translation: If a thief (in a farm) is not promptly apprehended, he or she will (be emboldened to) accuse the farm owner as the thief.
proverbs.wisdom:
Tardiness can be costly; falsehoods not promptly challenged would pose as truths.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ ló lésì, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ làá nfèsì sí.
proverbs.translation: There is always an appropriate response to every statement, but it's not every statement that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be focused; not all pursuits deserve our energy: don't major on minors.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá ní ká tì í kó dúró; tí a bá tì í tó bá ṣubú, ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: If we would like to push it to stand; what if we push it and it falls?
proverbs.wisdom: Think well before you act; don't be presumptuous.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá wo dídùn ifọ̀n, àá họ ara dé egun
proverbs.translation: If we give in to the pleasure of scratching our rashes, we will scratch ourselves to the bone.
proverbs.wisdom:
Patience and moderation are crucial; what pleases too soon often comes with bitter aftertaste.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kíkéré l'abẹ́rẹ́ kéré, kì í ṣe mímì fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: Though a needle may be tiny, it is not to be swallowed by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Underestimate no one; judge nothing by its appearance; what we deem inconsequential may well pack a hefty punch.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò leè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá dúpẹ́ oore àná yóò rí òmíràn gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever gives thanks for yesterday's kindness, will receive another.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude makes for increase; let's be grateful for where we are and what we have.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a kò jẹ lẹ́nu kì í rùn lọ́nà ọ̀fun ẹni.
proverbs.translation: What one has not eaten cannot be reflecting in one's breath.
proverbs.wisdom: One thing always leads to another; no one reaps what he or she has not sown.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ilé ńjó, tí òjò ńrọ̀, ẹni ebi ńpa ò leè dákẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Even if the house is on fire and the rain is pouring, a hungry man cannot be quiet.
proverbs.wisdom: No one ignores a pressing or an existential issue; it's wise to expect those deeply affected by an issue to take steps to address it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá da omi sí'wájú, á tẹ ilẹ̀ tútù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever waters the ground ahead, will get to step on a wet ground.
proverbs.wisdom: One good turn always beckons on another; sowers harvest; givers receive; choose to be a giver and seek opportunities to give. #SuccessSecret

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó roko tí kò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró
proverbs.translation: A farmer who ploughed his farm, but planted no corn claims he's hurting the ground squirrel; he hasn't hurt any squirrel, but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Vindictive actions can be self-defeating.

proverbs.proverb: Àbùkún layé gbà.
proverbs.translation: The world (seeks and) rewards only those who make it better.
proverbs.wisdom:
Energetically seek to make life better, in some respect, for as many as possible and you won't be in want. #SuccessSecret
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tan'ni jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Our palms cannot cheat (or deceive) us.
proverbs.wisdom: Only what we achieve by our sweat and effort will endure: all others are temporary; they will go, the same way they came, eventually. #MoralRevival

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá ja'lè lẹ́ẹ̀kan, tó bá daṣọ àrán bo orí, aṣọ olè ló dà bo'ra
proverbs.translation: Whoever steals, even just once, if covered with velvet, remains a thief, still.
proverbs.wisdom: Dishonesty permanently stains; looting, in whatever form or guise, is stealing and #LootersAreThieves #MoralRevival

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ rere ṣ'àgbà oyè.
proverbs.translation: A good name is superior to any chieftaincy title.
proverbs.wisdom: A good name is to be cultivated and protected; positions or achievements, as good they are, ultimately trail a good name. #MoralRevival

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà bá ńgbá'ni ká máa rọ́'jú; bó pẹ́ bó yà ìgbà ńbọ̀ wá gba'ni.
proverbs.translation: If a season afflicts, we ought to persevere; the good times will soon come.
proverbs.wisdom:
Persevere and never give up; tough times won't last forever; change is inevitable.
#Yoruba#proverb

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, akọ̀pẹ yóò wálẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long, the palmwine-tapper will dismount, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient, be hopeful; always take the long view: absolutely nothing lasts forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Adùn ńbẹ lẹ́hìn ewúro.
proverbs.translation: There is sweetness in bitter-leaf, at the end.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch darkness, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom:
No matter how it looks, there is always light at the end of the tunnel: keep hope alive & hang in there; it's not over yet; tough times are not forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀wà kò l’óun ò kún ìkòkò, àwọn tó jókò tì í, ni kò jẹ́ kó tó gbogbo ilé é jẹ
proverbs.translation: The beans would have filled the pot but for those around it who make it insufficient for the whole house.
proverbs.wisdom: There is enough in the land for all, if we #EndSARS, #EndSWAT and #EndBadGovernance Now!

proverbs.proverb: Ìrọ̀rùn igi ni ìrọ̀rùn ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The peace of the tree is what engenders peace to the birds that perched on it (and vice versa).
proverbs.wisdom: It is never too late to do the right thing: #EndSARS, #EndSWAT and #EndBadGovernance Now; no further lives need be lost.

proverbs.proverb: Ọba tó jẹ tí ilù tòrò, orúkọ rẹ̀ ò ní parẹ́; ọba tó sì jẹ tí ilù túká, orúkọ rẹ̀ náà ò ní parẹ́
proverbs.translation: A king who ushered in peace will never be forgotten and so is the one who brought in turmoil and desolation.
proverbs.wisdom: Legacy matters; #EndSARS, #EndSWAT and #EndBadGovernance Now!

proverbs.proverb: Màlúù tí ò ní ìrù, Ọlọ́run ni í lé eṣinṣin fún un.
proverbs.translation: God, Himself, is the one who fends off flies for a cow that has no tail.
proverbs.wisdom: God is the helper of the helpless; He is faithful and always come through; you can hang on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: Hunger should not be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious matter should not be casually handled; we must all collectively #Sọ̀rọ̀Sókè to #EndSARS, #EndSWAT and #EndBadGovernance; #EnoughIsEnough #ÓtóGẹ́ẹ́

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnìkan kì í jẹ, kí ìlú fẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: One person eating (satisfyingly) never translates to a town's progress.
proverbs.wisdom:
Common good is it; the good of a few is never the good of all; a win-win scenario is always the most sustainable in the long run.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n pẹ̀lú sùúrù la fi ńmú erin wọ̀'lú
proverbs.translation: It will take both wisdom and patience to get an elephant into the city.
proverbs.wisdom:
Complex issues can be resolved; let the elders arise and speak: calm frayed nerves, comfort the land and chart the post-#ENDSARS path forward
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Báa bá ńwá owó lọ, báa bá pàdé iyì lọ́nà, ńṣe ló yẹ ká padà, nítorí báa bá rí owó ọ̀hún tán, iyì làá fi rà
proverbs.translation: If honour comes while seeking wealth, one should stop the quest, as the ultimate purpose of seeking wealth is honour.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused & determined, but know when to stop

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling will find rising pretty tough.
proverbs.wisdom:
Nothing ventured, nothing gained; be bullish; be open to taking calculated risks.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbà kì í wà l'ọ́jà, k'órí ọmọ tuntun wọ́.
proverbs.translation: An elder cannot be in the market place and the head of a child (backed by the mother) will be awkwardly positioned.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is not working calls for urgent attention; let the elders arise and #ENDSARS Now!

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; hang in there: God will soon get to you.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ti imú yé imú tí imú fi ńfọn.
proverbs.translation: The nose has its reasons for being noisy (when blown).
proverbs.wisdom:
People have their reasons: give them the benefit of the doubt; be tolerant: there is some sense in nonsense.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Onísùúrù ló lè fún wàrà kìnìún.
proverbs.translation: Only a patient person can milk a lioness.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be wary of impatience when faced with a complex and high-risk issue; with patience, virtually nothing is impossible.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water in the trough simply because the cloud rumbles.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't be presumptuous; never count your chickens before they are hatched.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jẹ kísà níyà, bó bá dàgbà tán, a máa tó ọdẹ ẹ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting.
proverbs.wisdom:
The best is yet to come; keep hope alive. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kí a dé igbó kí a má fọ'hùn ló ńmú ẹyẹ oko ṣu sí'ni lórí.
proverbs.translation: To get to the forest and make no sound is how bird droppings land on one's head.
proverbs.wisdom: Inactivity is risky: keep moving, keep engaging; don't become a spot: spots can easily be wiped off.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá ní tòún bàjẹ́, tó bá rí ti ẹlòmíì á yin Ọlọ́run lógo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever believes his or her case is deplorable will glorify God on learning of another's.
proverbs.wisdom: Be thankful of who you are and where you are; no one has it perfectly made: we all have our issues and challenges.

proverbs.proverb: Bí àṣedànù ò bá ní í pọ̀, ẹni a ṣ'oore fún ò ní mọ̀ ọ́.
proverbs.translation: If waste (of one's resources) won't be significant, a recipient of one's benevolence will prove ungrateful.
proverbs.wisdom:
Always show gratitude; to take kindness for granted is to limit or eliminate it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kótópó gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, bí ìfẹ́ bá wà láàárín in wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is good enough for 20 friends, if there is love among them.
proverbs.wisdom:
Little is much when love is in it; with love, other concerns pale.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ńbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.
proverbs.wisdom:
The best is yet to come. Keep moving; it's not over yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ra aṣọ ẹgbẹ̀fà, tí a sì nà á han eèyàn ẹgbẹ̀fà, aṣọ ọ̀hún ò níyì mọ́.
proverbs.translation: If we buy an expensive item of clothing and we show it to tons of people, the clothes no longer command respect.
proverbs.wisdom:
Familiarity breeds contempt.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ́ láàpa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè láàpa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom:
Nothing ventured, nothing gained; diligence pays.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A leaf won't drop off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom:
Nothing surprises God; nothing and no one escape His attention; keep hope alive, He will get to you.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Igbá oró kì í fọ́; ìkà ńbọ̀ wá padà fi jẹun.
proverbs.translation: The plate of wickedness never wholly breaks; the wicked will yet eat out of it.
proverbs.wisdom:
We will reap whatever we sow, ultimately; sow good seeds.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold (ornament) is seldom appreciated until it gets lost.
proverbs.wisdom:
We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose it; the available is easily taken for granted.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wà á ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient; complex issues should be carefully and patiently handled.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí aáyán bá ṣi ijó jó, á máa fi ara káṣá adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: If a cockroach dances unconscionably, it may expose itself to the sword (or attack) of the hen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Even in a good course, moderation is crucial; be prudent, be moderate.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ ti ọmọdé nàró kọ́ ni í rìn.
proverbs.translation: It's not the day a baby stands up for the first time that he or she walks.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience is it: good things take time.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sí'nú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun, sooner or later (when the sun sets), the shade will come.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be persistent: tough times won't last forever; if we won't quit, we will win, eventually.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ká a.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom:
Prayers work; God's response is always so complete as to be overwhelming.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀tún wẹ òsì, òsì wẹ ọ̀tun, lọwọ́ fi ńmọ́.
proverbs.translation: The right hand washing the left hand and the left hand washing the right hand make both hands clean.
proverbs.wisdom:
Reciprocate acts of kindness: we all win when everyone gives; everyone has something to give others. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ikú fẹ́ pa alápatà ó ńkígbe; ọmọ ẹranko tó ti dá lóró ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: Death stalks the butcher and he screams; what about the animals he's butchered?
proverbs.wisdom: Exact from no one what you are unwilling to impose on yourself; be fair and considerate.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ l'ẹran dùn mọ; kò dé'nú.
proverbs.translation: The sweetness of meat is only felt within the cheeks; it doesn't get to the stomach.
proverbs.wisdom:
Some things are gratifying only for a moment; they hold no such promise for long; don't focus on trivialities: don't major on minor.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí èèyàn bá gún iyán bọ́ ìlú, yóò lọ́ọ̀tá; bó sì ńsọ òkò s’ọ́jà, yóò lọ́ọ̀rẹ́ tirẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Even if you feed the entire town (with pounded yam), you will have haters; yet if you pelt the market with stones, some will still pick you as a friend.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't please everybody.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà, mọ̀sá, ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ
proverbs.translation: A good warrior must know when to fight and when to run; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to run will perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Timing is crucial; know when to pursue, defer or quit

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsá fún iṣẹ́ tó lóun ò fẹ́ ya akúùṣẹ́, ta ni ìṣẹ́ tọ́ sí bikòṣe ẹni tó ńsá fún iṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Someone who dodges work, but insists he doesn't want to be poor; who else deserves poverty, but the one who dodges work.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays; there's nothing in doing nothing.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́ irọ́; ọmọ èyàn ò fẹ́ òdodo; bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ ò pé mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: God hates lies; man hates truths; yet there is no third option in a discourse.
proverbs.wisdom: Stick with the truth, always, even when there are no easy options.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí imú ṣe lè tóbi tó, kó lè gba ọ̀rọ̀ ẹnu sọ.
proverbs.translation: No matter how big the nose is, it can't take over the speaking role of the mouth.
proverbs.wisdom:
We all are unique and have our different strengths; envy no one: stay and bloom in your place.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìkòkò ńse iṣu ẹnìkan ò gbọ́; iṣú dé inú odó tán, ariwó ta.
proverbs.translation: While the pot was cooking yams, no one heard; no sooner had the yams got into the mortar that noise broke out.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what stresses someone may well be calmly handled by another.

proverbs.proverb: Ká dijú ká ṣe bí ẹní kú, ká wo ẹni tí yó sunkún ẹni; ká sáré ṣẹ́ṣẹ́ ká fẹsẹ̀ kọ, ká wo ẹni tí yóò ṣeni pẹ̀lẹ́
proverbs.translation: Close your eyes and feign death to see who will mourn you; run and ensure you trip to observe those who'll truly care.
proverbs.wisdom: Adversities do show true friends

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín'gbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver stops carving calabashes, those he or she already carved will remain.
proverbs.wisdom: Even if we refrain from kind acts, the impact of those rendered still lives on; keep up being kind: it's never lost

proverbs.proverb: Àgbà tó so yangan mọ́di ló sọ ara ẹ̀ di aláwàdà fádìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: An elder who tied maize to his pants, is the one who made himself an object of derision to the hen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Action begets reaction; be mindful of your actions, they may result in reactions you least expect.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ẹni máa là, á rí ìyọnu.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would be wealthy would experience challenges.
proverbs.wisdom:
Challenges are not unusual; they come with the territory, if you aim for success: persist and you will win, eventually.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá kò pa, kó má a dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but was not struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitide is it; remain thankful in every situation: things could have been worse.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ewé ṣe tóbi tó, kọ́ ló ṣe wúlò tó.
proverbs.translation: How big a leaf is, is not necessarily how useful it is.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance can be deceptive; quite often, size is irrelevant.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú u rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would calmly and patiently dismember an ant would see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be calm, be even keeled, and be patient: not a few tough nuts will get cracked; with patience, virtually nothing is impossible.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi oró san oró; aforósanró kì í jẹ́ k'óró ó tán láyé; afìkàsànkà kì í jẹ́ ki ìkà ó tán bọ̀rọ̀
proverbs.translation: Do not repay evil with evil; those who repay evil with evil or wickedness with wickedness make them fester.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't seek to get even: forgive & just move on; let go & let God

proverbs.proverb: Ajá kì í rorò títí, kó ṣọ́ ojú'lé méjì.
proverbs.translation: A dog cannot be so ferocious as to watch over two separate houses.
proverbs.wisdom:
Regardless of how competent anyone is, there is a limit to what any one person can do: cooperate and collaborate more.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òòrùn tó kù lókè tó aṣọ ọ́ gbẹ.
proverbs.translation: The (hours of) sunlight remaining is still good enough to dry clothes.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive: give no room to despair; what is left can still go far: keep working with what you have, right where you are.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àdán tó sùn sí ìdí ọsàn, ò rí he, bèlèté odídẹrẹ́ tó lóun jí dé.
proverbs.translation: The bat, which slept by the orange tree found no orange; yet, the parrot that came at dawn grumbled.
proverbs.wisdom:
Make hay while the sun shines; be quick to exploit opportunities: time waits for no one.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá Ọlọ́run ṣòwò ká pàdánù.
proverbs.translation: No one trades with God and lose.
proverbs.wisdom:
You cannot deal with God and remain the same; God makes things better: trust Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kò gbọdọ̀ kúnlẹ̀ pa òkété, kúnlẹ̀ ta òkété, kí a tún wá kúnlẹ̀ gba owó òkété
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't have to genuflect to kill bush rat, genuflect to sell it, & still have to genuflect to collect the sales proceeds.
proverbs.wisdom: Service shouldn't be seen as servitude; deny no one his

proverbs.proverb: A kò gbọdọ̀ kúnlẹ̀ pa òkété, kúnlẹ̀ ta òkété, kí a tún wá kúnlẹ̀ gba owó òkété
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't have to genuflect to kill bush rat, genuflect to sell it, & still have ro genuflect to collect the sales proceeds.
proverbs.wisdom: Service shouldn't be seen as servitude; deny no one his

proverbs.proverb: Ẹran tí a ò bá ní í jẹ, a kì í fi eyín dán an wò.
proverbs.translation: Don't take nips at a piece of meat that you have no interest in eating.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't start what you won't finish; finish whatever you start.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ibi gbogbo là ńdá iná alẹ́, ọbẹ̀ ló kàn dùn ju ara wọn lọ.
proverbs.translation: Supper is prepared in every home; some stews are simply tastier than others.
proverbs.wisdom:
We are all blessed, albeit in different ways and to different extents; keep hope alive and remain grateful.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kọ́ni ò ní ká ṣìkà bí a kò níkà nínú; tani ńkọ́ni kí a tó ṣe rere?
proverbs.translation: That one was so advised is no reason to be wicked, if one isn't inherently wicked; who teaches us to do good?
proverbs.wisdom: Advices we accept reflect who we are deep down; we always embrace what sits down well with us

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ aráyé ńpàtẹ́wọ́ fún yànmùyánmú, inú ẹ̀ ńdùn; kò mọ̀ pé òun ńfi ikú ṣeré ni.
proverbs.translation: Mosquito rejoices when people clap for it, not realising that it is toying with death.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive: naivety can prove costly; not all doors open to great rooms.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá, akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: If we won't quit trying, our hustling will one day come to an end.
proverbs.wisdom:
Giving up too soon is the bane of success: persistence is it; if we won't quit, we will win, eventually.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ogbe orí àkùkọ, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ ọ́n ṣe àkùkọ; Elédùà ló dá àkùkọ lọ́lá.
proverbs.translation: The cock did not acquire its comb by dint of its prowess; it is the blessing of God.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be modest and thankful; our blessing are not necessarily from our efforts, but from God.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbín ò lè sáré bí Ajá; ìyẹn ò ní kó máà de ibi tó ńlọ
proverbs.translation: The snail cannot run as fast as the dog; that won't stop it from getting to wherever it's going.
proverbs.wisdom:
We are all differently endowed; stay in your lane and run your own race; envy no one. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù, kì í pa ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A bird is seldom killed by a stone thrown in anger.
proverbs.wisdom:
Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results; tone down the fury: it can be self-defeating.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnu tó bá ti jẹ dòdò, kò ní lè sọ òdodo.
proverbs.translation: The mouth that has been compromised with sweet things can hardly speak the truth.
proverbs.wisdom:
Personal integrity is it; keep it intact; to be compromised with favours is to be compelled to compromise one's objectivity.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó bá ṣe ohun tí ẹnìkan ò ṣe rí,á á rí ohun tí ẹnìkan ò rí rí.
proverbs.translation: Whoever does what no one has done, will experience what no one has experienced.
proverbs.wisdom:
To experience exceptional results, take exceptional steps; think big, aim high.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom:
Make hay while the sun shines; promptly take advantage of opportunities.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pleads (his case) with God, won't need to plead with man.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable and nothing is beyond Him; you can count on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́ kọ́ ni oògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom:
Moderation is it; adopt radical measures with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kò gbọdọ̀ tìtorí kòkòrò kó síni lójú, kí a wá ki igi bọ ojú náà.
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't poke a stick into one's eye simply because an insect entered the eye.
proverbs.wisdom: Adopt extreme measures with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Adẹ́tẹ̀ ò lè fún wàrà, ṣùgbọ́n ó lè da wàrà nù.
proverbs.translation: A leper cannot express milk, but can very well waste it.
proverbs.wisdom:
Ignore or underestimate no one: those who cannot build, may be able to destroy.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọkùnrin tó rí ogun tó sá, tó rí iṣẹ́ tí kò ṣe, bí wọ́n bá kó ilé láàdúgbò wọ́n a fura síi
proverbs.translation: A man who dodges war and balks at working will be suspected in a case of theft in the neighbourhood.
proverbs.wisdom: Be engaged: do something, anything; there's absolutely nothing in doing nothing

proverbs.proverb: Ìrèké ò ní ibùdó; ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: Sugarcane has no specific place of refuge; every situation suits a diligent fellow just fine.
proverbs.wisdom:
Diligence pays.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: God's messenger never grows weary.
proverbs.wisdom:
God cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yangan bàtà, lójú ẹni tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Do not brag about shoes around someone who has no legs.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be courteous, considerate and tactful; do not deliberately expose anyone to embarrassments.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àì rìn jìnnà, làì rí abuké ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́; afọ́jú ẹyẹ ńbẹ lóko kárinkése
proverbs.translation: Not travelling far enough is why one may not have seen a squirrel with a hump; blind birds can be found deep in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of exposure does result in narrow-mindness; exposure broadens the mind.

proverbs.proverb: Àyè kì í há adìyẹ kó mà lè dé ìdí àba rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A hen is never too busy to brood over its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom:
We always make time for what is crucial to us.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó máa di akàn, bí ẹja ni í kọ́kọ́ máa ńrí.
proverbs.translation: What will turn out well at the end, often starts out as unpleasant.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't give up: it may sometimes get worse before it gets better; keep hope alive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọsàn tó rí gbajúmọ̀ tí kò bọ́, ẹyẹkẹ́yẹ ni yóò fi jẹ.
proverbs.translation: An orange that refuses to be plucked by a famous person will get eaten by some strange birds.
proverbs.wisdom:
Promptly take advantage of opportunities; don't be unduly fussy.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò mọ bí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ ṣe là, á sá àsákú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever unduly bothers about his or her peers' relative successes, will hustle himself or herself to death.
proverbs.wisdom:
Compare yourself to no one; stay in your lane.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Olójú kan kì í mọ'yì Ọlọ́run, à fi tí nǹkan bá gbọ̀n sí i.
proverbs.translation: A one-eyed person is seldom thankful to God, until a speck enters the eye.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude is it; be ever thankful for wherever you are and whatever you have.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa ná'wó kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ sí i.
proverbs.translation: Generous lifestyle does not necessarily make anyone poor nor does miserly behaviour make anyone rich.
proverbs.wisdom:
Generosity is it; choose to be a giver: those who do seldom lack what to give.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òótọ́ korò, ṣùgbọ́n bí a bá gbé itọ́ ọ rẹ̀ mì, a máa ṣe ara lóore.
proverbs.translation: Truth is bitter, but beneficial, if it can be swallowed.
proverbs.wisdom: Truth may be inconvenient, but it results in ultimate good, if embraced.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí a ṣe tọ́'jú ìgbálẹ̀ tó tí kò ní di èrò orí àkìtàn, lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: No matter how well we keep a broom, it will also end up on a refuse dump, one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Those who 'sweep' others will also, one day, be 'swept'. We will reap whatever we sow: sow good deeds, always.

proverbs.proverb: Òní la rí, kò sí ẹni tó m'ọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: Today is what we all know; no one knows tomorrow for certain.
proverbs.wisdom:
No one can predict the future for certain: write off no one, including yourself; remain positive and hopeful, always.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is man’s adornment.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character beautifies; it is adorable and attractive; seek to be better.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Omidan tó lóun yóò jẹ oyè abọ́bakú, òwe burúkù ló ńpa fún Olorì l'áàfin
proverbs.translation: When a young lady insists she'd like to die with the king (whenever he dies), she's really sending the queen a lousy message.
proverbs.wisdom: Not all positive gestures are noble: look beyond the surface; don't be naive

proverbs.proverb: Àrẹ̀mọ má jobì, má ròde ẹmu, kó lè dé ipò bàbá rẹ̀ ni.
proverbs.translation: That the royal heir should desist from rioutous living, it's so he can succeed his father, the king.
proverbs.wisdom: Be humble and be open to good advices, even if inconvenient: they are more for the benefit of the person advised.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ ẹ̀ jù sí inú eèrùn, bí inú ẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú eèrùn lè má rọ̀
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his kid into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Decisions taken in anger are likely to be rash & regrettable

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá tìtorí èyàn burúkú di'jú, a kò ní mọ ìgbà tí ẹni rere máa kọjá lọ.
proverbs.translation: If we insist on closing our eyes because of a wicked fellow, we won't know when a good person will pass us by.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be easily forgiving: vindictiveness often packs a hefty punch.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Do not carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't run your life on someone else's  agenda: never compare your life with anyone's; stay in your lane; be focused.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fura sí ẹni tí a ńbá rìn; ẹni tí a bá ńfura sí, a kì í bá irú wọn rìn.
proverbs.translation: Do not be suspicious of those you associate with; those you'd be suspicious of, should not be your close associates.
proverbs.wisdom: Build trust; avoid paranoia; be positive and forward-looking.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí òròmọadìyẹ ṣe gbọ́n tó, kò lè mọ àwòdì bí ìyá a rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No matter how smart the chick is, it can't know the (ways of the) hawk as its mother hen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be humble to learn from those ahead; it's risky to assume you know more.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ilá kì í ga ju onírè lọ, èyí tó bá ga ju onírè lọ, à á sì tẹ́ẹ ká.
proverbs.translation: Okro plants should not grow taller than the farmer; whichever does will be bent low to be plucked.
proverbs.wisdom:
Humility is it; pride and arrogance court resentments from others.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í d'àgbà kí a má lè lá'bẹ̀, eegun ẹran nìkan l'àgbà ò le fọ́.
proverbs.translation: No one is too old to lick soup; cracking of bones is what may be an issue.
proverbs.wisdom: Age is no barrier; get going.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a gún ata nínú odó, bí a lọ̀ ọ́ lórí ọlọ, ìwà ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Even if pounded in a mortar or ground on the grinding stone, pepper would remain inseparable from its character.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can feign who he or she isn't, for long; who we are ultimately show through.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that wants to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom:
There's always a price tag: be willing to pay the price; no pain, no gain.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà lẹ̀sìn; bí a bá ṣe mọ̀ ọ́ hù ni í ṣeé gbe’ni.
proverbs.translation: Character is like religion; how good one's character is, that is how well it favours one.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character attracts good fortune; bad character repels it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni á ńgbé ìyàwó bọ̀ wá bá, kì í ga’rùn.
proverbs.translation: A groom should not be craning his neck to peek at his bride.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient; avoid undue haste to force issues before their time.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ogún ọmọdé ò lè ṣeré fún ogún ọdún; ọgbọ̀n àgbà ò lè ṣe àṣàrò fún ọgbọ̀n oṣù.
proverbs.translation: Twenty youngsters cannot play together for twenty years; thirty elders cannot hold discussions for thirty months.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever: change is inevitable; it's wise to anticipate it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ kì í pẹ́ lórí igi tí kò l'éso.
proverbs.translation: Birds seldom perch for long on a tree that has no fruit.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance attracts, but content sustains; if we constantly add value to ourselves we won't need to seek attention.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bó lé lógún ọdún táa ti fi adẹ́mun jọba, kò ní yé ọrùn ọ̀pẹ ẹ́ wò.
proverbs.translation: Even after 20 years of being crowned a king, the palmwine tapper won't cease gazing at the palm tree with nostalgia.
proverbs.wisdom:
Old habits die hard.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ ẹ́ dùn tó bá pọ́n, ṣùgbọ́n tó bá pọ́n láàpọ́njù, oúnjẹ ni fún ẹyẹ oko.
proverbs.translation: Banana is sweet when ripe, but if it's overripe, it will become food for the birds.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be temperate; even in a good thing, moderation is it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹyẹ oko ò mọ bíntín lọ, eré e kó kọ́lé ló máa máa bá kiri.
proverbs.translation: No matter how tiny a bird is, its attention will be riveted on building its home (or nest).
proverbs.wisdom:
Focus on tangibles not trivialities; don't major on minor things.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í s'òótọ́ inú, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni má d'ayọ̀, báyé ẹni bá dojúrú ìwà èèyàn ló yẹ ká wò.
proverbs.translation: An honest life cannot but end well; if a life remains unpleasant, the person's character should be examined.
proverbs.wisdom: Quite often, our character determines our experience; we reap what we sow.

proverbs.proverb: Dídùn ló dùn tá ńbá ọ̀rẹ́ j'ẹ̀kọ; ti ilé oge tó oge é jẹ.
proverbs.translation: One eats with a friend because of the pleasure of friendship not necessarily because one lacks.
proverbs.wisdom:
Take no one for granted: friendliness is not necessarily an attempt to seek favours.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; excessive talk was how the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it: it's crucial in all things.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ojú ọwọ́ ṣiṣẹ́ tán, káa tún wá fi ẹ̀hìn ọwọ̀ dà á nù.
proverbs.translation: Never destroy with your backhand what your open hand had accomplished.
proverbs.wisdom:
Avoid rash decisions: think issues through; handle drastic decisions with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́, làá wà, táà rí èyí tó tọ́.
proverbs.translation: It's while on the crooked tree that one will find the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive: don't despair; where you are is still good enough as a stepping stone.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan, bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; good things take time;  don’t force issues before their time.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà tí èèyàn tọ̀ tó ṣubú, bí èèyàn bá ní sùúrù, èyàn lè tọ̀ ọ́ là.
proverbs.translation: A path that one treads and fails, with patience, one may tread it to success.
proverbs.wisdom:
No closed case and no impossiblity: be patient, be steadfast and be persistent. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìyànjú l'àgbẹ̀ ńgbìn, Elédùà nìkan ló mọ b'íṣu ṣe ńta.
proverbs.translation: Farmers merely sow efforts; God alone knows how the yams are formed.
proverbs.wisdom:
We simply do our best; the ultimate result is from God; whatever is good must be from Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a kò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you can't be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive..

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó lórí ò ní fìlà, ẹni tó ní fìlà ò lórí, ẹni tó lórí, tó ní fìlà, kò rí òde dé wọn lọ.
proverbs.translation: Someone who has a head has no cap, the one with a cap has no head, and the person that has both head and cap has no where to go with them.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks.

proverbs.proverb: Èébú àlọ ni ti ahun; àbọ̀, ti àna rẹ̀ ni
proverbs.translation: The initial shame is for the tortoise; the subsequent ones are for its in-law (who exposed it to the shame, in the first instance).
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive: ultimately, we embarrass ourselves when we expose those close to us to embarrassments

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ gún ẹṣin ní kẹ́ṣẹ́, ẹ ló ńtà'pá, baba ta ni wọ́n máa ki irin bọ̀ ní'kùn tí kò ní ju apá?
proverbs.translation: You spurred a horse and wondered why it kicked; who would be struck with steel in the belly and not react?
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; be considerate; treat others as you would want to be treated

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣe é fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: I am hungry is not to be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom:
A serious matter shouldn't be treated with levity.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ṣ'ọ̀rẹ́ èrò kà yó; bó pẹ́ bó yá, oníkálùkù á gba ọ̀nà ilé rẹ̀ lọ.
proverbs.translation: You'll never get fulfilled relating with a crowd; eventually everyone will go to his or her home (leaving you alone).
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; a few deep friends trumps large number of feckless relationships.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlá àbàtà ni í mú odò ó ṣàn, ọlá baba ọmọ ni í mú ọmọ ọ́ yan.
proverbs.translation: As the bank spurs the flow of a river so the honour of a father inspires his child.
proverbs.wisdom: Happy #FathersDay to all faithful fathers and fathers-to-be out there. Thank you so much for your sacrifices.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ajá wọ agbádá iná, tí àmọ̀tẹ́kùn wọ ẹ̀wù ẹ̀jẹ̀, tí ológìnní sán àkísà mọ̀ ìdí, ẹgbẹ́ apẹranjẹ ni wọ́n ńṣe.
proverbs.translation: If the dog dons a fiery robe, the tiger a bloodied vest, and the cat could only put on ragged loincloth, carnivores they still all are.
proverbs.wisdom: Modesty is it.

proverbs.proverb: A ki ẹsẹ̀ kan bọ odò, ọ̀nì fà á; tí a bá fi ẹsẹ̀ méjèèjì s'ódò kí la mọ̀ pó fẹ́ ṣẹlẹ̀?
proverbs.translation: One dipped a leg into the river and the crocodile snapped at it; what would have happened had the two been dipped?
proverbs.wisdom: Often, it's wise to test the waters before going the whole hog.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá rí fún ọmọ, kì í gba t'ọwọ́ ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is unable to give to a child should not deprive the child of what he or she has.
proverbs.wisdom:
If you can't give, don't deprive; if you can't make better, don't worsen.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣán'pá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom:
Make hay while the sun shines; promptly take advantage of opportunities. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí omi ẹni ò bá tí ì tó'ni í wẹ̀, á máa fi ńbọ́'jú ni.
proverbs.translation: If the amount of water one has won't do for a bath, one ought to wash the face with it.
proverbs.wisdom:
Leverage on available opportunities and resources; make the best of what you have, right where you are.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ńbá a lù ú, áǹbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow still had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his on a tree and played away.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún'ni.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is sweet, whatever is much and whatever endures are all from God.
proverbs.wisdom:
Ultimately all blessings are from God; if it is going to be good and enduring, it will have to come from Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀tún wẹ òsì, òsì wẹ ọ̀tún, lọwọ́ fi ńmọ́.
proverbs.translation: The right hand washing the left hand and vice versa is how both hands become thoroughly clean.
proverbs.wisdom:
Do and reciprocate kind acts: we all win when we do; we all can give, and we should.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọsán tó já ló sọ ọrún di ọ̀pá.
proverbs.translation: The bowstring that got broken was what turned the bow into a mere baton.
proverbs.wisdom:
A minor issue may produce a far reaching consequence; there is a cause to every effect: to tackle an issue, seek out the true cause.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó fẹ́ bá ẹni tó wà lórí ẹṣin dọ́gba, aá tiro
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to be of the same height as someone already on a horse will stand on his or her tiptoes
proverbs.wisdom: Run your race, in your lane: compare yourself with no one; running one's life by another's can be needlessly stressful

proverbs.proverb: Ká dá apá àpà, kò ní ká'pà máà ní'pá láti hùwà àpà, nítorí inú àpà nì'wà àpà rẹ ẹ̀ wà.
proverbs.translation: Even if you restrain a spendthrift, he or she cannot but be wasteful still; the wasteful trait is ingrained right in him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: We act in consistency with who we really are, deep down.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá ní ká tì í kó dúró, tí a bá tì í tó bá ṣubú, ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: If we plan to push it so it stands, but what if we push it and it falls?
proverbs.wisdom:
Things aren't always how they  first appear; think well before you act: consider all sides; drastic approaches need caution
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànná yànná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹ̀rẹ̀ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, can't enjoy the glittering (beauty) of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tí Ọlọ́run ò ṣe fún, à fi ẹni tó bá ni tòun ò tó.
proverbs.translation: There is no one God has not blessed; there are only those who still crave for more.
proverbs.wisdom:
Everyone has reasons to be thankful; we've all been blessed, even if in different ways.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour, but easily lord it over their benefactors, once satisfied.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; you never know who anyone truly is.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ti ńṣe níbì kan, èèwọ̀ ibòmíràn ni.
proverbs.translation: What is perfectly acceptable in one place is an abomination in another.
proverbs.wisdom:
Different strokes for different folks; broad-mindedness is it: often, what seems inappropriate may not be, if put in proper context.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò dodo làgbàdo ńwọ ilẹ̀; tó bá jáde tán ló ńdi onígba aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The maize seed goes into the soil absolutely naked; it ends up with multiple peelings only after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom:
The best is yet to come; keep hope alive. 
#Yorubas

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ ńjẹ yangan, ó ńmu omi ó ńgbé ókúta mì, ó tún ńsunkún àìléyín; ṣé òbúkọ tó léyín ńjẹ irin ni?
proverbs.translation: Hens eat corns, drink water and swallow stones, yet lament lacking teeth; do goats that have teeth chew pieces of iron (with them)?
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; greed breeds stress.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá ńsọ òkò sí adìyẹ igba, òkò ló máa sọ tí ilẹ̀ á fi ṣú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is trying to stone two hundred hens simultaneously, will be at it until night falls.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't spread yourself too thin.

proverbs.proverb: Òòrùn tó kù lókè tó aṣọ ọ́ gbẹ.
proverbs.translation: The remaining sunlight is still good enough to dry the clothes.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive: don't despair; what is left can still go far: work with what you have, right where you are.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a ṣe lóore tí kò dúpẹ́, bí ìgbà tí ọlọ́ṣa ko ni lẹ́rù lọ ni.
proverbs.translation: To be kind to a person who isn't thankful is akin to being robbed by a thief.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude is it; be ever thankful.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi abẹ fá orí igún, ká fi fá orí àkàlàmàgbò kó wá di orí àtíòro, ká wá ní abẹ kú.
proverbs.translation: You cannot use a blade to scrape the vulture's head, use it to scrape the crow's head, but claim that the blade is blunt, when it comes to the  tassel's turn.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; no hypocrisy.

proverbs.proverb: Ebi kì í wọ'nú kí ọ̀rọ̀ mí ì wọ̀ ọ́.
proverbs.translation: Once hunger enters a stomach, no other issue will be permitted entry.
proverbs.wisdom:
Put first things first: clear up important (or existential) issues first, then other matters will easily receive desired attention.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Díẹ̀ leyín tó ńjẹ ẹran; ìyókù kí ẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ má báa papó ni
proverbs.translation: Only a few teeth are really used to chew meat; the rest simply keep up the cheeks from folding up.
proverbs.wisdom:
Most will be achieved by the few, but the others have their places, too: write-off no one.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ńsá nínú omi gbígbóná, tó bá sáa lọ́dàn ni, kò ní wọ omi gbígbóná.
proverbs.translation: Had the frog been as fleet-footed in the fields as it is now inside hot water, it won't have found itself in the hot water.
proverbs.wisdom: A stitch in time saves nine.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbin tó wá ẹ̀jẹ̀ lọ sí ilé alákàn, bó ti wọlé ni yóò padà jáde.
proverbs.translation: Any snail that goes to the crab's burrow in search of blood, will come out the same way it goes in (empty-handed, as crabs have no blood).
proverbs.wisdom:
Be result-oriented; avoid fruitless pursuits.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó ro oko tí kò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró
proverbs.translation: A farmer who ploughed his farm, but refused to plant any corn claimed he's hurting the ground squirrel; he hasn't hurt any squirrel but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Seek no one's hurt: be positive.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá Ọlọ́run ṣòwò ká pàdánù.
proverbs.translation: No one trades with God and lose.
proverbs.wisdom:
God is faithful and dependable; you cannot lose with Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Olè tó bẹ́ gìjà sí inú ilé onílé, bí onílé rí i bí kò rí i, gìjà rẹ̀ tún ku ẹ̀kan.
proverbs.translation: A thief who hopped into someone else's property, whether or not the owner notices, still has one more hopping (out) to do.
proverbs.wisdom: Personal integrity is it: Ill-gotten benefits seldom last.

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kì í níyì lọ́ọ̀sán, ṣugbọ̀n a máa gba'yì lọ́jọ́ alẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Lamps are not valued in the afternoons, but do get appreciated at night.
proverbs.wisdom:
There's always a right time and place for everything; solutions are most appreciated during tough times.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Alágbẹ̀dẹ tó ńlu irin lójú kan, lóhun tó fẹ́ fà yọ ńbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A blacksmith who kept hitting a piece of iron at a single spot had his reasons.
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons: give them the benefit of the doubt; often, we'll see some sense in nonsense, if we'll look closely enough.

proverbs.proverb: Àìsanra tó ajá ológìnní kì í ṣe ti àìjẹun ká'nú, bí'ran rẹ̀ ṣe mọ ni.
proverbs.translation: Cats relative smallness to dogs isn't for want of food; that's how cats are.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance can be deceptive; respect what at first sight is not clearly obvious.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà àdó ni í mú àdó mu ẹ̀jẹ̀: akèrègbè baba àdó, omi ni wọ́n fi ńpọ́n
proverbs.translation: The tiny gourd is associated with bloodletting of its own volition: even the bigger and fully grown gourd is simply used for fetching water.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character, good or bad, is by choice: choose to be better

proverbs.proverb: A kò lè tìtorí pé ọ̀nà jìn kí a wá padà sẹ́hìn.
proverbs.translation: Because the destination is far, is no reason to abort a journey.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be steadfast, be undaunted: resolve challenges and keep the focus on the goals; finish whatever you start.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìṣẹ́ ò bá jẹ́ ká sọ òdodo, àìṣòdodo kò ní jẹ́ ká bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: If fear of poverty makes us lie, lying will keep us entrenched in poverty, as well.
proverbs.wisdom:
Honesty pays; personal integrity is crucial.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Láníntán kan kò lè ni ìwo ẹṣin
proverbs.translation: No one can be so wealthy as to own the horn of a horse (since horses don't have horns)
proverbs.wisdom:
Contentment is it: absolutely no one has (nor indeed can have) it all together; we all will always have unsatisfied wants, albeit different
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá f'ara pamọ́, ló máa ńgbó.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that grows to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom:
It makes sense to be socially distant or unavailable sometimes; you can't be affected with what you are  not exposed to.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Agbọ́n tí géńdé rí tó ńsá, ni aláàmù ńṣà jẹ lẹ́ẹ̀gbẹ́ ògiri.
proverbs.translation: The same wasp that a youngster sees and flees is what lizards, crawling on walls, easily snap up and eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Often, perspectives matter: looked at differently, a challenge may well be an opportunity in disguise.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀kàndínlógún tó lóun ò bá oókan ṣe, à ti di ogun rẹ̀ á nira
proverbs.translation: The number 19 that refused to be added to 1 will find it tough to become 20.
proverbs.wisdom:
Build bridges and foster collaboration; we need one another: together each achieves more.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tẹ̀tẹ̀ tí kò bá fẹ́ tẹ́ láwùjọ ẹ̀fọ́, á yẹra fún àwọn ewékéwé.
proverbs.translation: Any spinach that won't want to be in shame in the midst of other vegetables will steer clear of lousy leaves.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive: we cannot but be defined and significantly affected by the company we keep.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sí'nú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun, sooner or later (when the sun sets), the shade will come.
proverbs.wisdom: Be persistent and keep hope alive: tough times do not last forever; if we will not quit, we will win, at the end.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.
#Yorubas

proverbs.proverb: Tí iná ò bá tán l'áṣọ, ẹ̀jẹ̀ kì í tan léèkánná.
proverbs.translation: If the lice won't cease to be on clothes, blood (from efforts to remove them) can't cease from the finger nails.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be steadfast and persistent: until an issue is resolved, efforts to address it must not abate.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ òkèèrè, bí kò bá lé kan, yóò dín kan.
proverbs.translation: Words heard from afar, if they are not overstated, they will be understated.
proverbs.wisdom:
Quite often, hearsays are unreliable.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn kan lè ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́, gbólóhùn kan náà lè tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: One sentence can mess up a discussion, and one sentence can make it better.
proverbs.wisdom: Words are powerful; use them wisely.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ ò dun ọmọ ẹṣin: a mú ìyá rẹ̀ so, ó ńjẹ oko kiri.
proverbs.translation: The foal really has no shame: it grazes about indifferently while its mother horse remains tethered down.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive; take responsibility; important matters are not to be treated with levity.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: T'oró t'oró l'ejò ńrìn; ejò ò ní padà lọ mú oró wá ní'lé.
proverbs.translation: Snakes slither around with their venoms; they'll never go back home for them.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be prepared; live ready: opportunities and issues seldom give advance notice.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom:
There is no end to learning: be open to it; age is no barrier to learning.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò, á mọ ọpẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever can reason well will know how (and why) to be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom:
We'll always have reasons to be thankful; maintain a heart of gratitude always; be ever grateful.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàrá ńba ọ̀nà jẹ́, ó rò pé òun ńtún un ṣe.
proverbs.translation: The flood water is destroying the road, but thinking it is beautifying it.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive and cautious: some actions that appear constructive, may really be destructive. #KeepSafe
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò kì í gbóná títí kó má tutù.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long the fireplace is hot, it will become cold eventually.
proverbs.wisdom:
Tough times won't last forever; keep hope alive. #StaySafe #HappyWorkersDay
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìjàlọ ò tóbi tó òmìrán, ṣùgbọ́n báa bá fojú di í, a máa gb'aṣọ lára ẹni.
proverbs.translation: The soldier ants are nothing in size to a giant, but they may easily disrobe anyone who disregards them.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; issues ignored, may well become major concerns. #StaySafe

proverbs.proverb: Ohun a fi ẹ̀sọ̀ mú kì í bàjẹ́ ohun a fi agbára mú ní ńni'ni lára.
proverbs.translation: What is handled with calmness hardly presents issues; what is forcefully addressed is what comes with much stress.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient; don't force issues before their time.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Má bà á loògùn ẹ̀tẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Avoiding contact is the antidote to leprosy.
proverbs.wisdom:
A surefire way to solve a problem is to avoid having it in the first place. #StaySafe. 
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹyẹ ò bá fín ẹyẹ ní'ràn, ojú ọrun tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì f'ara kan'ra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be positive; live and let live.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá kò pa, kó má a dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude is it; remain ever grateful: things could have been worse.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwó rí.
proverbs.translation: The pair of shoes now on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom:
Life is turn by turn; a season goes, another comes; humility is it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kò gbọdọ̀ tìtorí kòkòrò kó síni lójú, kí a wá ki igi bọ ojú ọ̀hún.
proverbs.translation: You shouldn't poke a stick into your eye simply because an insect entered it.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be moderate; adopt extreme measures with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ò lọ bí òréré; ayé ò lọ bí ọ̀pá ìbọn.
proverbs.translation: A season does not go on endlessly; life isn't always as straight as the barrel of a gun.
proverbs.wisdom:
Change is inevitable: nothing lasts forever; life often comes with twists and turns.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgùtàn tó fẹ́ máa dún bi ìkokò, á múra sílẹ̀ fún ọfà ọlọ́dẹ.
proverbs.translation: A sheep that wants to howl like wolves should be expecting the hunters' arrows.
proverbs.wisdom:
Choices always come with their consequences.
#Yoruba.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó jẹun yó tó fọ́ akèrègbè, ti gbàgbé pé ọjọ́ òǹgbẹ ṣì ńbọ̀.
proverbs.translation: The farmer who ate and had his fill, but who then broke the gourd (water container), forgot that days of thirst are ahead.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be strategic; think ahead: never lose sight of the future.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá gbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be focused: ignore distractions; not all issues should get our attention.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́ irọ́; ọmọ èyàn ò fẹ́ òdodo; bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ ò pé mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: God hates lies; man hates truths; yet there is no third option in a discourse.
proverbs.wisdom: It is better to always stick with the truth, even when there are no easy options.

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ọ̀sán gangan tó ohun tí gbogbo àwọn àgbàlagbà ńpéjọ wò.
proverbs.translation: A star that shows up at noon merits the undivided attention of all the elders.
proverbs.wisdom:
An unprecedented issue deserves unusual attention.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí òjò bá kọ̀ tí kò rọ̀, ìyẹn ò ní ká sọ pé, kí omi òkun ya wọ ìlú.
proverbs.translation: That it has not rained for a while is no reason to wish the sea would flood the city.
proverbs.wisdom:
Moderation is it; adopt extreme and radical measures with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ bá le títí, ó ńpadà bọ̀ wá rọ̀ ni
proverbs.translation: If the plantain fruit remains hard for long, it will eventually become soft (when it ripens).
proverbs.wisdom: Keep up hope: no matter how long an issue tarries, it will eventually get resolved; hang in there: absolutely nothing lasts forever

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ní òtùtú òwú kò tó ẹrù, ìwọ̀nba tó lè fi tanná ló mú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever says cotton wool is not heavy must be referring to just the bit needed for an oil lamp.
proverbs.wisdom:
Underestimate nothing: in sufficient concentration, what seems trivial may prove overwhelming.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wà á ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient; complex issues need to be patiently handled; regardless of whatever is at stake, cooler heads must always prevail.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Oore kéré, oore tóbi, oore loore yóò máa jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whether small or big, a kind act remains a kind act (and deserves to be recognised as such.)
proverbs.wisdom:
Be appreciative and remain grateful; never discount favours received.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àjùmọ̀bí ò kan t'àánú; ẹni orí rán sí'ni ló ńṣe'ni lóore.
proverbs.translation: Blood ties do not guarantee merciful support; help comes only from those divinely sent to us.
proverbs.wisdom:
Arm of flesh often fail: place your hope in no one; look unto God as your ultimate source.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àṣá kì í rá bàbà, kí adìyẹ gbé kòkòrò dání.
proverbs.translation: A hen won't be preoccupied with an insect, while the kite hovers above.
proverbs.wisdom: First thing first; no one focuses on trifles while danger looms; a crucial issue must be given the deserved attention.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ńbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.
proverbs.wisdom:
The gift of life is undoubtedly the most crucial; with it, every other good is possible; with it, we can hope; hang in there: it's not over yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí èèyàn ngún iyán bọ́ ìlú yóò lọ́ọ̀tá; bó sì ńsọ òkò s’ọ́jà, yóò lọ́ọ̀rẹ́ tirẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Feed the whole nation, you can't but have enemies; yet be notoriously wicked, you'll still have your own friends.
proverbs.wisdom: You'll never be loved (nor hated) by everyone; do your best and move on

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tó ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ tí kò ní lópin.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing that has a beginning that won't have an ending.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive: nothing lasts forever; everything is only for a time: change is certain.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ẹ̀tẹ̀ sí'lẹ̀ pa làpálàpá.
proverbs.translation: Wẹ ought not to leave leprosy unattended and focus on treating ringworm.
proverbs.wisdom:
Prioritise properly: first things first. attend to crucial matters, first.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òjò òru kì í pa ẹni ire; tí kò bá pa wéré, á pa dọ́kọ dọ́kọ.
proverbs.translation: The midnight rain never beats a comely fellow; if the fellow is not a mad person, he or she will be an adulterer.
proverbs.wisdom: Our lifestyles often dictates our experiences.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi iná sí orí òrùlé sùn.
proverbs.translation: No one goes to sleep with the roof of his house on fire.
proverbs.wisdom:
A serious issue requires prompt attention; a stitch in time saves nine.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Màlúù tí kò ní ìrù, Ọlọ́run ni í lé eṣinṣin fún un.
proverbs.translation: God, Himself, is the one who fends off flies for a cow that has no tail.
proverbs.wisdom:
God helps those who can't help themselves; absolutely nothing is too hard for Him: hang on Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọ̀rọ̀ bá pẹ́, á dìtàn.
proverbs.translation: When an issue tarries, it will eventually become history.
proverbs.wisdom:
No matter how long an issue takes, it will one day come to an end; regardless of how it looks, #COVID19 certainly has an expiry date; keep hope alive: nothing lasts forever
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìtàkùn bá lè pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n á mú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants could unite, they would easily tie up an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom:
United we stand; divided we fall;  together we can do more; the world will bury #COVID19 faster, if nations can just unite on this.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ilé ò bá kan ilé, wọn kì í jó àjóràn.
proverbs.translation: If houses are not in close proximity, they cannot be engulfed with fire together.
proverbs.wisdom: #TheLockDown makes sense: if you are not physically close to someone with #COVID-19, you cannot be infected with this killer. #StayAtHome and #StayAlive

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà bá ńgbá'ni ká máa rọ́'jú; bó pẹ́ bó yà ìgbà ńbọ̀ wá gba'ni.
proverbs.translation: If a season afflicts, we ought to persevere; the good times will soon come.
proverbs.wisdom:
Persevere and keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever; change is inevitable.
#Yorubas

proverbs.proverb: Bí kùkùté ṣé kéré tó, kò sí ẹni tó lè fi ẹsẹ̀ fà á tu.
proverbs.translation: As small as the tree stump is, no one can uproot it with the foot.
proverbs.wisdom:
Judge nothing by it's appearance; underestimate nothing; what we deem inconsequential may well pack a hefty punch.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A ńkíyèsí gẹ̀gẹ̀ ni, kó má báa gba ọrùn ká.
proverbs.translation: One ought to promptly attend to goiter, less it overwhelms the neck.
proverbs.wisdom:
A serious matter merits serious and prompt attention.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńse ọbẹ̀, kò tí ì kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; absolutely nothing is beyond God.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ gbogbo kì í sé lórí alábahun.
proverbs.translation: Every issue cannot but involve the tortoise.
proverbs.wisdom: Walk in wisdom: don't be notorious; be even-tempered and unobtrusive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwákúùwá là ńwá nǹkan tó sọnù.
proverbs.translation: Lost items are searched for anyhow (and anywhere.)
proverbs.wisdom:
Think outside the box; place no limit or boundary in the search for what is not known; exclude no possibility: look everywhere.
#Covid-19 #Antidote

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bi ààrò ṣe gbóná to, yóò tutù kẹ́hìn ni.
proverbs.translation: No matter how hot the hearth is, it will grow cold, ultimately.
proverbs.wisdom:
Whatever is hot today, will one day become cold: tough times won't last forever; keep hope alive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbé inú ilé ẹni ká fi ọrùn rọ́.
proverbs.translation: One cannot stay in one's home and strain one's neck.
proverbs.wisdom:
You cannot suffer from a risk you are not exposed to: you'll never #StayAtHome and get into trouble; avoid needless exposure to high risks: #COVID-19 is real.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tó le tí kì í rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing that is hard that cannot become soft.
proverbs.wisdom:
No impossibility; no irredemmable situation; keep up hope: never say never.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Atẹ́gùn tó wọlé tó ńká'ṣọ ní yàrá, ẹni tó wọ ti ẹ̀ kó má ṣ'àfira.
proverbs.translation: The wind that blew into the house, and cleared the clothes in the rooms cautioned those who wore theirs not to be tardy.
proverbs.wisdom: To be forewarned is to be forearmed; promptly do the right thing.

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch darkness, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive: hang in there; it's not over yet; tough times are not forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó pamọ́ lójù èyàn, kedere ló hàn sí Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is hidden to man, is glaringly clear to God.
proverbs.wisdom:
God is all-seeing and all-knowing; nothing surprises Him and nothing is beyond Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ṣ'ọ̀rẹ́ èrò ká yó; bó pẹ́ bó yá, oníkálùkù á gba ọ̀nà ilé rẹ̀ lọ
proverbs.translation: You'll never get fulfilled relating with a crowd; eventually, everyone will go to his or her home (leaving you alone).
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; few deep friends are better than lots of meaningless relationships

proverbs.proverb: Ní tútù là ńká ẹja kò; ẹja gbígbẹ ò ṣeé ká.
proverbs.translation: Fish may be bent (and formed into shapes) only while fresh; dried fish cannot be bent.
proverbs.wisdom:
Address issues promptly to forestall complications; once complicated, issues can be tough to resolve.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a contentious person, he or she will yet remain contentious.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be forward-looking; do your best and keep moving.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńlé ará iwájú, èrò ẹ̀hìn ńtọ̀ òun náà lẹ́hìn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is pursuing those ahead, is also being pursued by those behind him or her.
proverbs.wisdom:
What goes around comes around; expect to receive in abundance, good or bad, whatever you give to others.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom:
Ignore distractions; stay focused.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom:
God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Rí'rú omi òkun, kò ní kí ẹja má sùn, kó má han'run.
proverbs.translation: The storms of the sea won't stop the fish from sleeping and even snoring.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dámọ̀nràn àti tà'kìtì lágbàlá ọ̀bọ, nítorí ọ̀bọ fúnra'ra rẹ̀, ọba òkìtì ni.
proverbs.translation: Never toy with the idea of somersaulting in the vicinity of a monkey; monkeys, themselves, are experts at somersaulting.
proverbs.wisdom: Be measured; it's not smart to needlessly display one's ignorance

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ọdún mẹ́ta, kò tó ẹni tí à ńgbára á lé; ọ̀tá oṣù mẹ́fà kò tó ẹni tí à ńsà lóògùn
proverbs.translation: A friend of three years is not one to be fully trusted; an enemy of six months is not one to be grievously assaulted.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive and measured; avoid rashness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: O jó ní Ifọ́n, Ifọ́n tú; o jó ní Èjìgbò, Èjìgbò fà ya bí aṣọ; o wá dé Ọ̀ràngún o tún ńjùdí; ṣé gbogbo ìlú lo fẹ́ bàjẹ́ ni?
proverbs.translation: Your dance desolated Ifon and shredded Ejigbo like clothes; yet at Orangun you were twerking your hips; must you destroy all towns?
proverbs.wisdom: Goodness is it

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kótópó gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, bí ìfẹ́ bá wà láàárín wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is good enough for 20 friends, if there is love amongst them.
proverbs.wisdom: With love, virtually nothing is impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Báa ó ti tó ni kì í jẹ́ ká ṣìwà hù; báa ó ti mọ ni kì í jẹ́ ká mọ ìwà á hù.
proverbs.translation: Our aspiration keeps us from improper conducts, but our destined height in life also limits how proper we act.
proverbs.wisdom: Our aspirations are circumscribed by our purpose in life (or destiny).

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó làná, tó lòní, kò leè ni ọ̀la; Ọlọ́run nìkan ló lọjọ́ gbogbo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever called the shots yesterday and calls the shots today, cannot call the shots tomorrow; only God calls the shots at all times.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever: change is ever certain; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Kò lè burú títí kó má ku ẹnìkan mọ́'ni, ẹni tí yóò kù la o mọ.
proverbs.translation: Things can never be so bad that one will be left with no one, but who he or she will be is what one may not know.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; you are never alone: it only seems so.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Oko kì í jẹ́ ti baba àti ti ọmọ, kó máà ní àlà.
proverbs.translation: A farm cannot belong to both father and son, and not have a line of demarcation (separating the portion of each party.)
proverbs.wisdom:
Private spaces exist: respect them; don't run roughshod over anyone; don't intrude.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó máa di akàn, bí ẹja ni í kọ́kọ́ máa ńrí.
proverbs.translation: What will turn out favourable eventually, often starts out with much challenges.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't quit; keep hope alive; if you won't give up, you will win, eventually.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá lè dijú kan ọmọ ẹni ní ìkó, ojú làá là sílẹ̀ tí wọ́n máa fi kàn án lọ́mọrí-odó lórí
proverbs.translation: If we won't close our eyes and hand knock our child's head, our eyes will be wide open later when his or her head will be knocked with the pestle.
proverbs.wisdom: A stitch in time saves nine

proverbs.proverb: Mo ti ńfo èyí, mo ti ńfo tọ̀hún lo ńmú ológbò kó sínú épo gbígbóná.
proverbs.translation: I can hop over this, I can hop over that, is how a cat ends up diving into a hot oil.
proverbs.wisdom:
Moderation is it; tone down the hubris; often, pride goes before a fall.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò l'àgbàdo ńwọ ilẹ̀; tó bá jáde tán ló ńdi onígba aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The maize seed really does go into the soil absolutely naked; it is adorned with multiple peelings only after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom:
The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run kì í ṣe nǹkan, kó má fi àyè ọpẹ́ sí i; tó bá pá baba lórí, a sì fi irùngbọ̀n rọ́po.
proverbs.translation: God never does a thing without leaving rooms for thanksgiving; if God makes a man bald, He'll give him the beard in replacement.
proverbs.wisdom: There'll always be reasons to be thankful to God

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi dẹ́kun ẹ̀rin rínrín, tó bá ṣe igúnnugún, á wokoko mọ́ orí ẹyin ni.
proverbs.translation: If what took laughter away from the crow had befallen the vulture, it would've been stuck, brooding on its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; we are different in capabilities and capacities.

proverbs.proverb: Orí kan ṣoṣo ni ejò ní tó fi ńtú igba orí ká.
proverbs.translation: The snake has only one single head, yet, with this, routs two hundred other heads.
proverbs.wisdom:
Not just the numbers, but the substance behind them that counts; not the quantity, but the quality that matters.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó yá ẹgbẹ̀fà, tí ò san án, bẹ́ igi dí ọ̀nà egbèje ni.
proverbs.translation: Whoever borrowed a small sum, but refused to repay it, has blocked the path to future bigger loans.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be faithful; actions have consequences.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgùntàn ò ní sùn láàárín ajá, kó má fi ara kó eégbọn.
proverbs.translation: A sheep cannot lie in the midst of dogs and not get dog ticks on itself.
proverbs.wisdom:
Ultimately, we cannot but reflect the company we keep; walk with the wise to be wise.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àìrìn jìnnà làìrí abuké ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́; báa bá dé igbó tó tó igbó, àá rí ẹranko tó ńtiro
proverbs.translation: Not travelling far enough is why one may not have seen a squirrel with a hump; if one can get deep into the forest, one will see animals that limp.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of exposure makes for narrow-mindness

proverbs.proverb: Ìṣín wò ó; ìkòrò wò ó; ohun tí a bá dìjọ wò, gígún ni í gún
proverbs.translation: Let all the fingerlings consider it (an issue); let all the big fish assess it too; whatever we all join hands to assess, typically gets thoroughly defined.
proverbs.wisdom: All points of view are crucial; discount and dismiss none

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling will find rising pretty tough.
proverbs.wisdom:
Nothing ventured, nothing gained; be bullish; take calculated risks.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pleads (his case) with God, won't need to plead with man.
proverbs.wisdom:
God is dependable and nothing is beyond Him; you can count on Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín'gbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun.
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver no longer carves calabashes, those already carved will remain.
proverbs.wisdom:
We are outlived by our legacy; the effect of what we do, good or bad, lives on.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo inú ìgò, ó di àwòmọ́jú fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The corns in a bottle are viewed with disdain by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom:
People are wont to belittle what is out of their reach.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán àrẹ̀mọ tó ńdé fìlà, tó bá gorí ìtẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀, yóò dé ohun tó ju àrán lọ
proverbs.translation: A royal heir who's wearing a cap is simply in haste; he'll get to don far more than velvet caps upon ascending his father's throne.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; don’t force issues before their time

proverbs.proverb: Kí a fi gègé gún ara ẹni wò, kí a tó fi gún ọmọ ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: We ought to prick ourselves with the penpoint first, before using it on a bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair and considerate; don't impose on anyone what you are unwilling to accept; do unto others as you'd want them to do unto you.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni táa fún ló'bì tí kò ṣ'ọpẹ́, báa fún un lọ́'mọ kò ní ṣà'na.
