proverbs.translation: A person who gave no thanks when offered kolanut, wouldn't pay his dues if given a bride.
proverbs.wisdom:
Whoever showed no appreciation for small favours is unlikely to reciprocate major acts of kindness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom:
No pain, no gain; there's always a price tag.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà lẹ̀sìn; bí a bá ṣe mọ̀ọ́ hù ni í ṣeé gbe’ni.
proverbs.translation: Character is like religion; how well one practises it, that is how well it favours one.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character pays; it commends favour.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Igbá ọmọdé sọnù, ó lóun fi àmì si; ṣebí ó di ìgbà tó bá rí igbá kó tó rí àmì?
proverbs.translation: A youngster who lost a calabash claimed he had a mark on it; is it not when he's found the calabash that he'll see the mark on it?
proverbs.wisdom:
Be sensible; undue presumptuousness is not it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìfẹ́ fọ́jú; obìnrin táa bá fẹ́ràn kì í ní àlébù.
proverbs.translation: Love is blind; a woman one really loves seldom has blemishes.
proverbs.wisdom:
If it is wrong, love will not see it; where love exists, other concerns pale
A kú ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ olólùfẹ́ ọdún 2020 o.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí ojú bá rí mọ, òun lòpin ìrìn àjò.
proverbs.translation: However far one sees, marks the end of a journey.
proverbs.wisdom:
Think big and see far; the depth of vision determines destination; it's virtually impossible to scale a height one cannot see.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́gbọ́n ni í fi ọ̀ràn elòmíràn kọ́gbọ́n, òmùgọ̀ á fi tirẹ̀ kọ́gbọ́n.
proverbs.translation: It is a wise person who learns from the experience of others; fools learn from theirs.
proverbs.wisdom:
It's wise to learn from the experience of others; it's less risky and less costly.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n díẹ̀, òmùgọ̀ díẹ̀, l'ọba fi ńto ìlú.
proverbs.translation: Applying a little wisdom and a little stupidity is how a king administers his kingdom.
proverbs.wisdom:
There's some sense in nonsense; often, what seemed stupid could well be a reflection of untold wisdom.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: If a fish sleeps, it will be eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep moving; be diligent; complacency is risky.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tó bá kù díẹ̀ kí ọmọ olóore jìn sí kòtò, mànàmáná á ṣiṣẹ́ imole fún un.
proverbs.translation: Just before a kind person would stumble into a ditch (in darkness), the lightning would light up his or her path.
proverbs.wisdom: A kind person will always abound in help; sow good seeds and harvest good fruits.

proverbs.proverb: Ìfura loògùn àgbà; agbọ́n ò fura, kò lóyin; ọ̀bọ ò fura, kò dèèyàn
proverbs.translation: Perceptivity is elders' secret weapon; not being perceptive, wasps are unable to make honey; not being perceptive, monkeys never evolve into humans
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; strive to see what is not ordinarily visible

proverbs.proverb: Ohun a fi ẹ̀sọ̀ mú kì í bàjẹ́ ohun a fi agbára mú ní ńni'ni lára.
proverbs.translation: What is gently handled hardly presents a problem; what is forcefully addressed is what puts one under stress.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient; take the long view; don't force issues before their time.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àìnísùúrù ìnàkí, ló sọọ́ di ará inú igbó.
proverbs.translation: Gorilla's impatience is what made it an inhabitant of the forest.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient; impatience can exact a heavy price.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ńbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.
proverbs.wisdom:
The best is yet to come. Keep moving; it's not over yet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: We ought to focus on where we are going, not where we had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be focused; look ahead and keep moving; leave the past where it belongs: in the past.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àìdúpẹ́ oore àná a máa mú oore sú'ni í ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Lack of gratitude for yesterday's kindness makes future acts of kindness tiresome.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude is it; ingratitude inhibits kindness.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọba tí kì í fẹ́ gba ìmọ̀ràn, irú wọn kì í pẹ́ fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Any king who despises wise counsel, hardly takes long before stumbling.
proverbs.wisdom:
No one knows it all: be humble to learn from anyone; to spurn good counsels is to expose oneself to avoidable errors.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí yóò sọ irọ́ di òótọ́ yóò ja'gun ẹnu.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wishes to present lies as truths will have to war with his or her mouth.
proverbs.wisdom:
Truth needs no defence; to peddle lies is to expose oneself to needless stress.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó ya wèrè bí ẹṣin ò wọ́pọ̀: ẹṣin fi ọmọ rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ ó ńgbé ọmọ ọlọ́mọ kiri.
proverbs.translation: Not many animals are as stupid as the horse: it left its offspring unattended and carried those of others around.
proverbs.wisdom: Care for others, but, by all means, don't neglect yours, either.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó gbọ́n bí ajá ò sí; ajá mọ ọmọ tirẹ̀ ńfún lọ́mú, ó mọ ti òdù ọ̀yà ńkì mọ́'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No animal is as crafty as the dog; it knows how to suckle its offsprings, but pounce on those of the grass-cutters.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive to recognise unbridled craftiness.

proverbs.proverb: Ewúrẹ́ tó lè kígbe jù, kọ́ lebi ńpa jù.
proverbs.translation: The goat that bleats the loudest, is not necessarily the most famished.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance isn't necessarily reality; noise or drama isn't necessarily substance.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà mọ̀sá ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ
proverbs.translation: Warriors must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight, but not when to retreat will perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom:
Know when to pursue, defer or quit
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is man’s adornment.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character beautifies; it is adorable and attractive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọwọ́ kan pàtẹ́wọ́.
proverbs.translation: We cannot clap with one hand.
proverbs.wisdom:
Team spirit is it; seek to cooperate and collaborate more; together each achieves more.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ewu lẹ́gbẹ̀rún ẹ̀kọ, à fi àìdùn ọbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: To consume a thousand wraps of "ẹ̀kọ" (corn meal) is a breeze, except the soup is not tasty.
proverbs.wisdom:
We all love good things; remove the stress from something, make it appealing, and it won't lack patrons.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òjò tó rọ̀ sí ewúro, náà ló rọ̀ sí ìrèké.
proverbs.translation: The same rain that fell on the bitter-leaf, fell on the sugarcane (yet bitter-leaf is bitter while sugarcane remains sweet.)
proverbs.wisdom: Our reactions tell of who we really are deep down; quite often, bitter or vengeful responses are by choice.

proverbs.proverb: Oò ṣá igi lọ́gbẹ́, oò ta ògùrọ̀ lọ́fà, o dé ìdí ọ̀pẹ, o ńgbẹ́'nu s'ókè, ṣé ọ̀fẹ́ ló máa ńro ni?
proverbs.translation: You neither slash an oil palm nor punctured a raffia palm, yet under a palm you opened up your mouth for wine; does the wine drip freely?
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained

proverbs.proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jìyà, bó bá dàgbà, á tó ọdẹ ẹ́ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting.
proverbs.wisdom:
The best is yet to come; keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í s'òótọ́ inú, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni má d'ayọ̀, báyé ẹni bá dojúrú ìwà èèyàn ló yẹ ká wò.
proverbs.translation: An honest life cannot but end well; if a life remains unpleasant, the person's character needs to be examined.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character quite often determines our experience; we reap what we sow

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ ò lè fi apá kan fò.
proverbs.translation: A bird cannot fly with one wing.
proverbs.wisdom:
We need one another; team spirit is it: together, each achieves more.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ikú ilé ò pa'ni, t'òde ò leè pa'ni.
proverbs.translation: If there is no enemy within, the one outside can do us no harm.
proverbs.wisdom:
Worry less about the enemy without, but more about the unfriendly friend within.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá ńgbọ́ gbe gbè gbe, tí ò bá bá wọn gbée, wọ́n le gbe nǹkan ọ̀hún sí ẹ́hìnkùlé olúwarẹ̀
proverbs.translation: If one refuses to heed repeated calls to join to carry something, it may well be dumped in one's backyard.
proverbs.wisdom: Participate; not to do so, quite often, puts one at a disadvantage

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Never carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom:
Envy no one; compare yourself with no one; stay in your lane.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water (you have) in the trough, simply because you heard the rumbling of the cloud.
proverbs.wisdom:
Don't be presumptuous; never jump the gun; it's never wise to count one's chickens before they are hatched.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àìṣedédé ará ayé, ló ńmú’ni rántí ará ọ̀run.
proverbs.translation: The untoward behaviour of those alive is what makes one pines for those who had gone.
proverbs.wisdom:
Good character is it; a good legacy, which typically results from a good character is enduring.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; excessive talk is how the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; exercise self-control, always.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá di'jú tẹ àbàtà mọ́'lẹ̀, yóò bá'ni l'áṣọ jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: If one steps on the marshy place with closed eyes, the marsh will soil one's clothes.
proverbs.wisdom: Handle complex situations with care and caution; carelessness can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú eèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú eèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rashness; be wary of crucial decisions when angry

proverbs.proverb: Ajá tó máa sọnù, kì í gbọ́ fèrè ọlọ́dẹ.
proverbs.translation: A dog that is destined to get lost won’t hear the hunter's (redeeming) whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: Those bent on adopting a course of action, seldom listen to wiser contrary counsels; remain objective always: there is often some sense in nonsense.

proverbs.proverb: Ìyànjú l'àgbẹ̀ ńgbìn, Elédùà nìkan ló mọ b'íṣu ṣe ńta.
proverbs.translation: Farmers merely sow efforts; God alone knows how the yams are formed.
proverbs.wisdom:
If it is good, it is from God; our blessings are not so much a result of our efforts, as from His favour.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò tó ni í nà tó ńdè'nà de’ni, àjẹkún ìyà ni yóò jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever cannot defeat someone in a fight, but decides to waylay the person, courts severe purnishment.
proverbs.wisdom:
Exercise self-control; don't be presumptuous.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí akòko bá ńsọ igi láì jáwọ́, bó pẹ́ bó yá, á rí nǹkan gbà lọ́wọ́ igi.
proverbs.translation: If the woodpecker persistently pecks a tree without relenting, it will get something from the tree, ultimately.
proverbs.wisdom: Virtually nothing is impossible to the persistent; if you won't give up, you will win.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo igi tí elégbède bá lù dídún ni í dún.
proverbs.translation: Whatever tree the monkey pats, responds.
proverbs.wisdom:
Precious little is impossible to whoever, backed by competence, confidently and persistently dares; go ahead, make your move; have no expectation & make no room for failure.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò, á mọ ọpẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever can reason well will understand why he or she should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be ever grateful; maintain an attitude of gratitude, always.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í kán'jú lá'bẹ̀ gbígbóná; tí a bá kán'jú lá'bẹ̀ gbígbóná, á bó'ni l'ẹ́nu; tí ọbẹ̀ bá wá tutù tán ẹnu wo la ó fi j'ata?
proverbs.translation: Never sip hot soup in haste, else you'll scald your mouth; and how will you lick the soup when it cools?
proverbs.wisdom: Handle complex issues patiently & calmly

proverbs.proverb: This is a contraction of the proverb: Àràkún laṣọ Gbági; ọ̀kan la máa wọ̀ dé'bẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Clothes to be bought at Gbagi market must be additional (as popular as the market then was); one will still need to be worn to it.
proverbs.wisdom: No one and nothing can do it all; no one is self-sufficient.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá pẹ́ láyé, àá jẹ ẹran tó ju erin lọ.
proverbs.translation: If we live long enough, we will eat such an amount of meat (cumulatively) larger than an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom:
Patience is it: virtually nothing is impossible, if we are patient.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Adùn ńbẹ lẹ́hìn ewúro.
proverbs.translation: There is sweetness in bitter-leaf, at the end.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; it may start out bitter, but it will end in joy.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ kì í pẹ́ kó máà dé, à fi àìmọ̀ọ́kà.
proverbs.translation: A set date cannot be so far off and not come to pass, except there is a mistake in counting it.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ọ̀rẹ́ dà kó má ṣe bí'nú; ẹni abínibí ńda'ni
proverbs.translation: Those betrayed by friends shouldn't be offended; even siblings betray one another.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be tolerant; forgive and forget. Don't hold on to hurts.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọsàn bá dúdú, ó ńpadà bọ̀ wá pọ́n ni.
proverbs.translation: An unripe orange will most assuredly become ripe, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom:
Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come; tough times will not last forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: God's messenger never grows weary.
proverbs.wisdom:
God cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Obìnrin kì í dàgbà jù lọ́wọ́ ọkọ rẹ̀; bí eyín bá ku méjì lẹ́nu ìyá, ọmọge ni lójú baba.
proverbs.translation: A woman is never too old to her husband; even if she's lost all her teeth, a maiden she remains to her man.
proverbs.wisdom:
Love is it; with love, other concerns pale.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ọdún mẹ́ta ò tó ẹni tí à ńgbára a lé; ọ̀tá oṣù mẹ́fà ò tó ẹni tí à ńsà lóògùn.
proverbs.translation: A friend of three years is not one to be completely trusted; an enemy of six months is not one to be grievously assaulted.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive, reflective and deliberate; avoid rashness.

proverbs.proverb: Tí òjò bá kọ̀ tí kò rọ̀, ìyẹn ò ní ká sọ pé, kí omi òkun ya wọ ìlú.
proverbs.translation: If the rain refuses to fall, this is no reason to say that the sea should flood the city.
proverbs.wisdom:
Moderation is it; reactions should be commensurate; adopt extreme measures with caution.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a  ńbá ná'jà la ńwò; a kì í wo ariwo ọjà.
proverbs.translation: One ought to focus on the party with whom one is trading and not on the din of the marketplace.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be focused; ignore distractions.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ká a.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom:
Prayers work: never cease to pray; answers to prayers may be so complete as to be overwhelming.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed it will positively impact two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom:
Success can be contagious; a well-targeted assistance can positively affect several others; conversely, a poorly directed intervention may well be a waste.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn.
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes loving relationships endure.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be tolerant: no one is perfect.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo àwọn tó ńsun kọ́ ló ńhanrun.
proverbs.translation: Not all those who are sleeping snore.
proverbs.wisdom:
Appearance can be deceptive; read between the lines, see beyond the obvious, and hear beyond what is said; drill down: often, there is more, just below the surface.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ tí onínú líle bá fi ogún ọdún ṣe, ọjọ́ kan ni yóò bà á jẹ́
proverbs.translation: A hot-tempered person will easily destroy in just one day, all he or she achieved in twenty years.
proverbs.wisdom: When uncontrolled, anger can prove detrimental to its carrier; hold off important decisions when angry.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìyà ńlá bá gbé'ni ṣán'lẹ̀, kéékèèké á máa gun orí ẹni.
proverbs.translation: When tripped by a major setback, one easily becomes vulnerable or falls prey to minor ones.
proverbs.wisdom:
A major setback can be unsettling and, quite often, makes us vulnerable to minor ones.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí omi ẹni ò bá tí ì tó'ni í wẹ̀, á fi í bọ́'jú ni.
proverbs.translation: If the quantity of water one has won't do for a bath, one simply uses it to wash the face.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it: make the most of what you have; not exactly what you have, but what you do with what you have is what counts.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A leaf won't drop off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing surprises God and absolutely nothing is beyond Him.

proverbs.proverb: Bí irọ́ bá lọ lógún ọdún, ọjọ́ kan ṣoṣo ni òótọ́ yóò ba.
proverbs.translation: If a lie has gone for twenty years, the truth will catch up with it in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom:
Regardless of how long, truth ultimately prevails.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a kò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you can't be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive; rely less on words, but more on deeds.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní bí ejò ṣe gùn tó la ṣe fẹ́ dá'ná sun ún, à á dá'ná sun ilé.
proverbs.translation: If we were to burn a snake as its length is, we will set the house ablaze.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it: don't be rash; adopt drastic measures with caution: always think well and deeply before you act.

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́, làá wà, táà rí èyí tó tọ́.
proverbs.translation: It's while on the crooked tree that one will find the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Do your best with what you have, right where you are; where you are is a stepping stone to your next level.

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́, làá wà, táà rí èyí tó tọ́.
proverbs.translation: It's while on the crooked tree that one will find the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Do your best with what you have, right where you are; where you is a stepping stone to your next level.

proverbs.proverb: Ogbe orí àkùkọ, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ ọ́n ṣe àkùkọ; Elédùà ló dá àkùkọ lọ́lá.
proverbs.translation: The comb on the cock's head is not of its own making; it is the blessing of God.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest and thankful; our endowments much more reflect God's favour on us than our efforts.

proverbs.proverb: Ilé san mi dùn ju oyè lọ.
proverbs.translation: To be at peace in one's home is better than (compromising this for) positions or titles.
proverbs.wisdom:
Precious little is worth compromising our peace of mind for; contentment is it.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ojú kọ́ ló ńṣe ipin; gbogbo igi kọ́ ló ńhu olú.
proverbs.translation: Not all eyes are rheumy; not all (dead) trees sprout mushrooms.
proverbs.wisdom:
No hasty generalisations: you can't tar everyone (or everything) with the same brush; appearance can be deceptive.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Èmi ló lòní, èmi ló lọ̀la, lọmọdé fi ńdi onígbèsè.
proverbs.translation: I own today and I will own tomorrow, is how a youngster runs into debt.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is constant: don't be presumptuous about the future; plan and prepare for it, today.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ra aṣọ ẹgbẹ̀fà, tí a sì nà á han eèyàn ẹgbẹ̀fà, aṣọ ọ̀hún ò níyì mọ́.
proverbs.translation: If we buy an expensive item of clothing and show it to tons of people, the clothes no longer command respect.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt; often, what is excessively exposed loses value.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá lé eku méjì á p'òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever chases two rats simultaneously, will catch none.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't spread yourself too thin.

proverbs.proverb: Àti mọ ọ̀nà ẹ̀dá láyé, kò ṣẹ̀hìn Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: Man's quest to know his or her path (to success) in life is not beyond God.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep your hope and trust in God; he is an assured source.

proverbs.proverb: Èébú ò so.
proverbs.translation: Abusive words never (grow and) fruit on anyone.
proverbs.wisdom: Disparaging attacks are defused when ignored; keep moving: don't major on minors.s

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í mọ iyì ohun tó ní, à fi tó bá sọ ọ́ nù.
proverbs.translation: We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose the thing.
proverbs.wisdom: Realise that familiarity tends to breed contempt, but take nothing and no one for granted; quite often, whatever we take for granted is just about to be lost.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá dé ìlú táà léèyàn, ìwà rere làá ní.
proverbs.translation: If one is new in a town, knowing no one, one ought to be of good character.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character is attractive and, quite often, makes all the difference.

proverbs.proverb: Àbùkún layé gbà.
proverbs.translation: The world seeks (and rewards) those who improve it.
proverbs.wisdom: Make the world a better place and you'll be highly placed.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í júbà afìmọ̀sínúkú.
proverbs.translation: There is no honour for anyone who died with his or her knowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: To bless others with one's endowments is honourable and ultimately rewarding; make your knowledge

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that wants to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There is always a price tag; no pain; no gain; don't seek shortcuts.

proverbs.proverb: Igi tí Ọlọ́run bá gbìn, kò sẹ́ni tó lè fàá tu.
proverbs.translation: No one can uproot the tree planted by God.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can stop what God has sanctioned; only Him has the final say.

proverbs.proverb: Mo gbọ́n tán, mo mọ̀ ọ́ tán, l'agbọ́n ò ṣe l'óró bí oyin.
proverbs.translation: Wasps' claim to be the wisest and the best is why they have less potent venom than bees.
proverbs.wisdom: Pride and arrogance limit us; recognise that no one knows it all; be willing to learn from everyone.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọdẹ bá ro ìṣẹ́, tó bá ro ìyà, tó bá pa ẹran, kò ní fún ẹnìkan jẹ
proverbs.translation: If a hunter were to consider the hardship of his (hunting) expedition, he won't share his games with anyone.
proverbs.wisdom: Any kind of giving is tough (and quite often sacrificial); be appreciative

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe igúnnugún tó fi pá lórí, tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi yọ gẹ̀gẹ̀ lọ́rùn, tó bá ṣe àgbò bọ̀lọ̀jọ̀, á ti fa ìwo ẹ̀ tu
proverbs.translation: If what balded the vulture and gave the crow goiter had befallen the full-grown ram, it'd have lost its horns.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people are different

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo èèyàn oníwà tútù kọ́ lonínúure.
proverbs.translation: It is not everyone with quiet disposition who is kind-natured.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí bíńtín ò tó, púpọ̀ yóò jìnnà sí i.
proverbs.translation: Abundance will be far from whoever is not contented with a little.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; it makes for increase.

proverbs.proverb: Màlúù tí kò ní ìrù, Ọlọ́run ni í lé eṣinṣin fún un.
proverbs.translation: God, Himself, is the one who fends off flies for a cow that has no tail.
proverbs.wisdom: God helps those who can't help themselves; He is faithful and always come through; you can hang on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Ọba rán'ni ní iṣẹ́, odò Ọbà kún, iṣẹ́ Ọba ò ṣeé kọ̀, odò Ọbà rèé, kò ṣeé ki orí bọ̀.
proverbs.translation: The king sends one on an errand and the Oba river (enroute) overflows its banks; the king's task cannot be declined and the river cannot be rushed into.
proverbs.wisdom: Dilemmas can be stressful

proverbs.proverb: Kì í burú títí, kó má ku ẹnìkan mọ́'ni, ẹni tí yóò kù la ò mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Things can't be so bad that one won't be left with someone; it's who he or she will turn out to be that one may not know.
proverbs.wisdom: You are not alone, it merely seems so; keep up hope.

proverbs.proverb: Bí aṣeni bá ní ibi mẹ́fà, yóò fi ọ̀kan tàbí méjì, ṣe ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A wicked person who has up to six evil ways (to hurt others), will invariably hurt himself (or herself) with one or two.
proverbs.wisdom: Seeking to hurt others does not pay; we will reap whatever we sow.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ tó bà lórí igi tí kò ké, ẹ̀hìn ọ̀rọ̀ ló ńrò.
proverbs.translation: A bird that perched on a tree, but made no sound was simply mindful of the aftermath.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it; people have their reasons, give them the benefit of doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àkàrà bá dé eyín akáyín á di egungun ni.
proverbs.translation: When the bean fritters get to the mouth of a toothless person, they'll seem like bones.
proverbs.wisdom: A simple task is always complex to anyone ill-prepared for it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lè jìyà tó kún ahá, kò leè gbádùn ọrọ̀ tó kúnnú àmù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever cannot endure a cup-filled deprivation cannot enjoy a pot-filled wealth.
proverbs.wisdom:
No pain, no gain; no sweat, no sweet.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá dúpẹ́ oore àná, á rí òmíràn gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is thankful for yesterday's kindness, will be favored with another.
proverbs.wisdom:
Attitude of gratitude attracts further acts of kindness
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìdùnnú òbí lọmọ fi ńṣe oríire; ọmọ tó ńba òbí nínú jẹ́, irú wọn kì í ṣe àṣeyọrí.
proverbs.translation: Making one's parents happy opens one up to life's good fortune; those who sadden their parents seldom excel.
proverbs.wisdom: Be in good standing with your parents: your sustained rising depends on it.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ ìwà fún oníwà lòògùn ọ̀rẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Accepting each person's peculiar character with understanding is the lubricant for friendship.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it; respect others: give them their spaces.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó lórí rere tí kò ní ìwà rere, ìwà a rẹ̀ ló máa ba orí rere rẹ̀ jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Anyone blessed with good fortune, but who lacks good character will soon lose his good fortune to his bad character.
proverbs.wisdom: Far more than our aptitude, our attitude shapes our altitude.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìṣẹ́ bá ńṣẹ́ ọ̀dọ́ láàṣẹ́jù, kó lọ sí igbó erin; bó bá pa erin, ìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ á tán; bí erin bá paá, ìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ á tán
proverbs.translation: Let the youngster in deprivation go hunt an elephant; if he kills it, his poverty will cease; if it kills him, his poverty will cease.
proverbs.wisdom: Be audacious

proverbs.proverb: Bí ńmáa kú, kí nkú, lọmọkùrín fi ńdi alágbára; mi ò lè wá kú, lọmọkùnrín fi ńya ọ̀lẹ.
proverbs.translation: If I perish I perish, is how a young man becomes a strong man; I won't kill myself, is how a young man becomes lazy.
proverbs.wisdom: Be bold, be courageous; confront challenges with grit.

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Báa pẹ́ láyé àá d'ìtàn, bá ò pẹ́ láyé àá d'ìtàn.
proverbs.translation: If we live long, we'll become history; if we don't live long, we'll become history.
proverbs.wisdom: Regardless of our station in life, we all have one destination: no one is getting out of this world alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìpa à ńpa oṣè, ara ló fi ńsan.
proverbs.translation: Every attempt to destroy the baobab tree keeps making it stronger.
proverbs.wisdom: Not everyone can be pulled down; wicked attacks make some stronger; be positive and forward-looking: ignore wicked souls.

proverbs.proverb: Inú ilé ẹni la ti ńjẹ èkúté onídodo.
proverbs.translation: It's in the seclusion of one's home that one eats a rat with an outsized navel.
proverbs.wisdom: Some issues are better kept private.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò kú ló ni igbó òkè ọ̀hún.
proverbs.translation: Only the person who is alive really gets to own the farmland up yonder (eventually).
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; as long as there is life, virtually nothing is impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún'ni.
proverbs.translation: What is sweet, what is much and what endures are all from God.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, all blessings are from God; we ought to acknowledge and be thankful to Him.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ejò bá ti bùjẹ rí, bó bá rí ekòló, yóò họ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever had once been bitten by a snake, would flee at the sight of an earthworm.
proverbs.wisdom: Once bitten, twice shy.s

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọdé ò l'áyà akẹ́bọjẹ; àgbàlagbà ò l'érìgì àá fi j'obì.
proverbs.translation: A child lacks remarkable courage; an (aged) elderly person lacks the molar teeth to eat kolanuts.
proverbs.wisdom: Team spirit is it; no one has it all, but together we complement one another

proverbs.proverb: Ẹran tí a ò bá ní í jẹ, a kì í fi eyín dán an wò.
proverbs.translation: Do not nip at a piece of meat that you have no interest in eating.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won't finish.

proverbs.proverb: Òótọ́ korò, ṣùgbọ́n bí a bá gbé itọ́ ọ rẹ̀ mì, a máa ṣe ara lóore.
proverbs.translation: Truth is bitter, but if it can be swallowed, it is good for the body.
proverbs.wisdom:
Truth may be inconvenient, but it is ultimately beneficial, if embraced.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àdán tó sùn sí ìdí ọsàn,  kò rí he, bèlèté odídẹrẹ́ tó lóun jí dé.
proverbs.translation: The bat that slept by the orange tree found none (to eat), yet the parrot complained it came early.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; be prompt to exploit opportunities.

proverbs.proverb: Adùn-ún-ṣe bí ohun tí Ọlọ́run ṣe tán; aṣòroóṣe bí ohun tí Ọlọ́run kò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: As easy to do as what God has completed, and as difficult to achieve as what He detests.
proverbs.wisdom: If God is in it, it will work out; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀kọ àsìkò sàn ju iyán ewú lọ.
proverbs.translation: Fresh pap is better than stale pounded yam.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive to choose wisely.

proverbs.proverb: Kàǹga tó jìn kì í pariwo.
proverbs.translation: A deep well is seldom noisy.
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure in who you are; no grandstanding; only empty vessels are needlessly noisy.

proverbs.proverb: Aáyán tó ba ṣi ijó jó, a máa fi ara káṣá adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A cockroach that dances unconscionably, may fall prey to the hen's sword.
proverbs.wisdom: Even in a good thing, moderation is crucial; immoderation can exact hefty fees.

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ajá bá fi ogún ọdún sá, ìrin fàájì ni fún ẹṣin.
proverbs.translation: A race that takes dogs twenty years, is a mere leisurely walk to horses.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what proves a challenge to one, may well be a walkover to another.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọmọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom: Prevention is better than cure; It's good to seek help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọ́mọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom: Prevention is better than cure; It's good to seek help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.

proverbs.proverb: Ìtàkùn tó ní kí erin má wọ odò, t'òun t'erin ló ńlọ.
proverbs.translation: A creeping plant that insists the elephant will not enter the river, will find itself in the river with the elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Be determined; virtually nothing is impossible where determination exists.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí kòkó ẹ̀ yè, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ọ́ ṣe ẹ̀, bíkòṣe Elédùà.
proverbs.translation: A farmer with a thriving cocoa farm owes this not just to his effort, but to God.
proverbs.wisdom: We owe all to God; be modest and be thankful to Him.

proverbs.proverb: Orí ejò lè kéré, ṣùgbọ́n kò ṣe é fi họ imú.
proverbs.translation: The head of a snake may be small, but it is not to be used to scratch the nose.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; underestimate nothing and no one.

proverbs.proverb: Àìjẹun sàn ju àìni ìsinmi lọ.
proverbs.translation: To lack food is better than to lack peace.
proverbs.wisdom: Wealth and other possessions lose meaning when they compromise peace; pursue peace.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èèyàn ngún iyán bọ́ ìlú yóò lọ́ọ̀tá; bó sì ńsọ òkò s’ọ́jà, yóò lọ́ọ̀rẹ́
proverbs.translation: If you feed the whole town with pounded yam, you will have haters; yet if you pelt the market with stones, you will have (some) friends.
proverbs.wisdom: You will never please everyone; do your best and move on

proverbs.proverb: Bí èèrà bá fi'ni pe'gi, àá fi ọwọ́ wọ dànù ni.
proverbs.translation: If an ant takes one for a tree, one simply brushes it off with the hand.
proverbs.wisdom: Courtesy and self-respect are crucial; to be unconscionably discourteous is to court humiliation.

proverbs.proverb: Ìrèké ò ní'bùdó; ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: Sugarcane has no specific place of sprouting; every situation suits the diligent person just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strong; be diligent; diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́ làá wà, tí àá ti rí èyí tó tọ́.
proverbs.translation: It's while on a crooked tree that one will discover the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't despise wherever you are; it may well be a stepping stone to greater heights.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í sòótọ́ inú, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni má d'ayọ̀, báyé ẹni bá dojúrú, ìwà èèyàn ló yẹ ká wò.
proverbs.translation: A honest life cannot but end well; if a life remains unpleasant, the person's character should be examined.
proverbs.wisdom: Quite often, attitude determines altitude; we are limited by our character.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ̀ọ́ rìn, mọ̀ọ́ yan, kí orí má mì l'ọ́rùn.
proverbs.translation: No one is so adept at walking and marching that the head won't shake on the neck.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; mistakes do happen: be tolerant.

proverbs.proverb: Àfi ẹni tí yóò bá pẹ̀gàn Àjànàkú lá lóun rí nǹkan fìrí; báa bá rí erin ká wí.
proverbs.translation: Only those who would deride the elephant would claim they saw it in a jiffy; its presence is unmistakable.
proverbs.wisdom: Give credit where credit is due; recognise the contributions of others.

proverbs.proverb: Bi iná ba ńjó lóko, màjàlá a ṣe òfófó.
proverbs.translation: When a farm goes aflame, the flakes (fly home to) bear the tale.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing can be covered up, permanently; the truth has a way of showing up, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: À ńjù wọ́n ò ṣe é wí lẹ́jọ́; ìjà ìlara ò tán bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: To claim to be superior to anyone is not a sensible defence; the envy-fuelled quarrel (resulting from such) cannot be easily and conclusively settled.
proverbs.wisdom: Modesty and humility go a long way; pride is counter-productive.

proverbs.proverb: Ọdẹ tó bá ṣiyèméjì, òun lẹranko ńpa.
proverbs.translation: An indecisive hunter easily gets killed by an animal (in the forest).
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive; indecision can come with intolerable risks.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ ló lésì, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ làá fèsì sí.
proverbs.translation: There is always an appropriate response to every statement, but it's not every statement that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; not all pursuits deserve our energy: don't major on minors.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tó pọ̀ tí kì í tán, àfi ọlá Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: Nothing, but the grace of God, can be so much in abundance and not be exhausted, ultimately,
proverbs.wisdom: Only the blessings from God endure.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ìpọ́njú là ńm'ọ̀rẹ́; ọjọ́ tó bá burú la ńm'ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: It is during difficult times that true friends are known; when things are really tough is when those who truly care can be identified.
proverbs.wisdom: Difficult times can be useful: they help identify those who truly care

proverbs.proverb: Eṣinṣin tí kò bá gbọ́ ìkìlọ̀ ló ńbá ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ wọ ẹnu ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Only a disobedient housefly accompanies (a bite of) banana into the monkey's mouth.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; lack of self-control can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: Èyí wùn mí, ò wùn ọ́, lọmọ ìyá méjì ṣe ńfẹ́ ìyàwó ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Because what pleases one does not please the other is why two brothers have different wives.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; people are entitled to their choices; live and let live.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńwá ẹni tó jẹ bàbá ẹ̀ lówó, àfàìmọ̀, kó má pàdé ẹni tí bàbá ẹ̀ jẹ lówó.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is seeking his father's debtors, may well find his father's creditors.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate; life can be full of twists and turns.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ò re Ejìnrìn, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún rẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin (a town), thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternative courses of action exist; no one (and nothing) is irreplaceable.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò bá mọ bí ẹgbẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ ṣe là, onítọ̀hún á sá àsákú
proverbs.translation: Those unduly bothered about their peers' relative successes, would hustle themselves to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Assess your life by no one's attainment; we all have different paths and timing: stay in your lane

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Worry less: the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa náwó, kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun, kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: Generosity does not necessarily make one poor nor does stinginess make one rich.
proverbs.wisdom: Generosity is it; kindness pays. s

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni í bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú u rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever carefully dismembers an ant will see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient: patience can achieve the impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńgun ẹṣin kó sọ ìpàkọ́ mọ ní'wọ̀n; ìbẹ́kẹ́ṣẹ́ ẹṣin á máa la’ni mọ́’lẹ̀
proverbs.translation: When on a horse, fling your head backward in moderation; horses do  throw their riders
proverbs.wisdom: Exercise self-control; never abuse privileges; safeguards against abuse do exist#proverb

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tó máa gun ẹṣin tí kò ní ju ìpàkọ́; tí kò bá fẹ́ jù ú, ẹṣin tó gùn a jẹ́ kó jù ú
proverbs.translation: No one will ride a horse and not fling his head backward; even if he doesn't want to, the horse will make him do it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people are often influenced by their privileges

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbín ò lè sáré bí Ajá; ìyẹn ò ní kó máà de ibi tó ńlọ
proverbs.translation: The snail is truly not as fast as the dog; yet, this won't stop the snail from getting to its destination.
proverbs.wisdom: Compare yourself with no one; we are all differently endowed; stay in your lane and envy no one

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà tí èèyàn tọ̀ tó ṣubú, bí èèyàn bá ní sùúrù, èyàn lè tọ̀ ọ́ là.
proverbs.translation: A path that one treads and fails, with patience, one may tread it to success.
proverbs.wisdom: No closed case and nothing is impossible; be patient and persistent.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni èyàn ò kí kó yọ̀; ẹni Ọlọ́run ò kí kó ṣọ́ra.
proverbs.translation: Those shunned by man should rejoice; but, those shunned by God should be worried.
proverbs.wisdom: Without God, we cannot go far; seek Him.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán nínú ewé, táa se ọbẹ̀ nínú èpo ẹ̀pà, ẹní máa yó, á yó.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound yam in a leaf and prepare the soup in a groundnut pod, those who will be full, will be.
proverbs.wisdom: Regardless of conditions, those who will thrive, will; be positive, be hopeful.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í pẹ̀lú ọ̀bọ já'ko.
proverbs.translation: No one joins the monkey to roam the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain the high ground, always; never descend low to join anyone do despicable things.

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ ti ọmọdé nàró kọ́ ni í rìn.
proverbs.translation: The day a baby stands up for the first time is not the day he (or she) walks.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; good things take time.

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì; kò lè já.
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling; they cannot fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; it's not over yet.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá Ọlọ́run ṣòwò ká pàdánù.
proverbs.translation: No one trades with God and lose.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable; you cannot lose with Him; trust Him.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We are inseparable from our character.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot pretend to be who we are not for very long; ultimately, our character will show through.

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kì í ní'yì lọ́ọ̀sán, ṣùgbọ́n a máa gba'yì lọ́jọ́ alẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A lamp is not valued in the afternoons, but does get appreciated at night.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a right time and place for everything; solutions are most appreciated during trying times.

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kì í ní'yì lọ́ọ̀sán, ṣugbọ̀n a máa gba'yì lọ́jọ́ alẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A lamp is not valued in the afternoons, but does get appreciated at night.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a right time and place for everything; solutions are most appreciated during trying times.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í so ẹran mọ́ ẹran kí ìkan kan ìkan pa.
proverbs.translation: That two rams were tethered together is no reason for one to butt the other to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Respect and give people their space; never abuse privileges granted.

proverbs.proverb: Ikú fẹ́ pa alápatà ó ńkígbe; ọmọ ẹranko tó ti dá lóró ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: Death stalks the butcher and he screams; what about the animals he's butchered?
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair and considerate; exact from no one what you are unwilling to impose on yourself.s

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo nǹkan làgbà lè rí, gbogbo nǹkan làgbà lè sọ, ṣùgbọ́n ki í ṣe gbogbo nǹkan tí àgbà rí làgbà ńsọ
proverbs.translation: An elder may see all things, talk about all things, but, not all that an elder sees, that an elder talks about
proverbs.wisdom: Wisdom is it; a matured mind should be prudent and tactful

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà lẹ̀sìn; bí a bá ṣe mọ̀ ọ́ hù ni í ṣe é gbe’ni.
proverbs.translation: Character is like religion; how good one's character is, that is how well it favours one.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character pays; it attracts favour.

proverbs.proverb: Tí owó ò bá tí ì dé ọwọ̀ èyàn, ìwà oníwà ló máa máa hù.
proverbs.translation: You will never know who anyone really is until he or she becomes wealthy.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; never presume to really know who anyone is until he or she is financially independent.

proverbs.proverb: O rí àgbébọ̀ adìyẹ lọ́jà, o sáré sí i; tó bá ńyé ogún tó ńpa ogún ṣé aládìyẹ á tà á?
proverbs.translation: You saw a matured hen in the market and jumped at it; had it been very good at laying and hatching, would it have been sold?
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be too hasty to exploit what seems too good to be true

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n pẹ̀lú sùúrù, la fi ńmú erin wọ ìlú.
proverbs.translation: Both wisdom and patience are required to take an elephant into a city.
proverbs.wisdom: Solving a complex problem requires not just wisdom, but patience as well; exceptional outcomes take time.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A leaf won't drop off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing surprises God and absolutely nothing is beyond Him.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyin adìyẹ ò bá fọ́, oromọadìyẹ ò leè wáyé.
proverbs.translation: If the chicken's (incubated) egg did not crack, the chick could not have been hatched.
proverbs.wisdom: Adversity may well be a stepping stone; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìjàlọ ò tóbi tó òmìrán, ṣùgbọ́n bí a bá fojú di í, a máa gb'aṣọ lára ẹni.
proverbs.translation: The soldier ants are nothing in size compared to a giant, but they may well disrobe anyone who underrates them.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; quite often, issues initially ignored, became major concerns

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a mọ̀ délé délé là ńfẹ́, ẹni fẹ́ ọmọ ní ijù á fẹ́ ẹbọra
proverbs.translation: Marry someone whose family backgound you know reasonably well; whoever marries someone found in a wilderness (not well-known) will marry a ghost (strange spouse).
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be flippant with serious issues.

proverbs.proverb: Orí ò mọ ibùsùn, ì bá tún ibẹ̀ ṣe láàárọ̀.
proverbs.translation: We do not know our future for certain, else we would have prepared for it, well ahead of time.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows the future, for certain; man proposes, God disposes.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tó gbọ́n fi tirẹ̀ ṣ'òwò, èyí tí kò gbọ́n fi tirẹ̀ jẹ àkàrà òwúrọ́.
proverbs.translation: The wise son invests his (inheritance) in a trade, but the foolish one expends his own on trifles.
proverbs.wisdom: Think and act strategically; invest in your future.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ lápa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè lápa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá ò pa, kó máa dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Be ever grateful; whatever is bad could have been worse.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ìyẹ́ adìyẹ nílẹ̀, kí a wá fi ìrù àkèekèé rin etí.
proverbs.translation: No one has a hen's feather within reach and choose to scratch his or her inner ear with a scorpion's stinger.
proverbs.wisdom: Never pursue a high risk solution when equally effective ones with low risks exist.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní sùúrù, ohun tí kò tó, ṣì ńbọ̀ wá ṣẹ́kù.
proverbs.translation: If we are patient, whatever is insufficient would be excessive, soon enough.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Tí omi bá pọ̀ ju okà lọ, ọkà a máa dí kókó.
proverbs.translation: Excessive water makes the yam flour meal lumpy.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial; too much of even a good thing can be detrimental

proverbs.proverb: Ogbe tí àkùkọ fi ńṣakọ ni kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ fi ńpanu.
proverbs.translation: The cock's comb, an object of pride to the cock, is a mere snack to the fox.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what matters to one may well be of no consequence to another.

proverbs.proverb: Ogbe tí àkùkọ fi ńṣakọ ni kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ fi ńpanu.
proverbs.translation: The cock's comb, an object of pride to it, is a mere snack to the fox.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what matters to one may well be of no consequence to another.

proverbs.proverb: Tí omi ẹni ò bá tí ì tó'ni í wẹ̀, á máa fi ńbọ́'jú ni.
proverbs.translation: If the amount of water one has won't do for a bath, one ought to wash the face with it.
proverbs.wisdom: Leverage on available opportunities; make the best of what you have, right where you are.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó làná, tó lòní, kò leè lọ̀la; Ọlọ́run nìkan ló lọjọ́ gbogbo
proverbs.translation: Whoever called the shots yesterday and calls the shots today, cannot call the shots tomorrow; only God calls the shots at all times.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; change is certain; keep up hope#Yorubas

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ṣe fáàrí ẹ̀ṣẹ́ dídì, si ọmọ adẹ́tẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Do not brag about fists to the child of a leper.
proverbs.wisdom: Be courteous and tactful. Be sensitive to show empathy. s

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: I am hungry is not to be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious matter shouldn't be treated with levity

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán ewúrẹ́ tó ńjẹ àlùbọ́sà; ṣebí àlùbọ́sà náà ni wọ́n máa fi sè é.
proverbs.translation: The goat that is eating onions is simply in haste; it certainly would be cooked with onions, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience is it; never be in haste to force issues before their due time.#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ogún ọdún tí ebí ti ńpa ọ̀gà, ìrin fàájì ò kúrò lẹ́sẹ̀ ẹ rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Even after remaining famished for twenty years, the chameleon still did not cease its leisurely gait.
proverbs.wisdom: Habits die hard; we always act in a manner consistent with who we really are, deep down.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi òdì àdá ṣán igbó dídí.
proverbs.translation: No one uses the blunt side of a cutlass to clear a thick forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Always use the right tools and resources; use of wrong tools can prove inefficient.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Do not carry out your duties using someone else's timepiece.
proverbs.wisdom: Never compare yourself with anyone; stay in your lane; envy no one.s

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot know God's name (or really know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is a present help, for those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńkó ẹyin jẹ ò mọ̀ pé ìdí ńro adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: Those eating eggs seldom appreciate how tough egg-laying can be to the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Be empathetic; be considerate.s

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n àgbọ́njù ni ńpa òdù ọ̀yà.
proverbs.translation: Unbridled craftiness is what kills the grasscutter.
proverbs.wisdom: Crafty people eventually self-destruct #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà kí a má lè lábẹ̀; eegun ẹran nìkan làgbà ò le fọ́.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be too old to lick soup; cracking of bones is what may present an issue.
proverbs.wisdom: Age is never a barrier; don't make it one. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àjọjẹ ò dùn bí ẹnìkan ò bá ní; ọjọ́ a ní la ńṣe àjọjẹ.
proverbs.translation: Sharing isn't pleasant when one party lacks; we are usually happy to share, when we all can give.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to give to others, but better to empower them; it's better to teach people to fish than give them fish

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ bà l'ókùn; ara ò rọ okùn; ara ò rọ adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The hen perches on the line and neither the hen nor the line is at ease.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue peace; to foment trouble is not to be at peace, as well. #owe

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹ̀dá bá mọ iṣẹ́ àṣelà ni, ìwọ̀nba ni làálàá máa mọ.
proverbs.translation: If we know our destined path to success for sure, we will hustle less.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́ irọ́; ọmọ èyàn ò fẹ́ òdodo; bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ ò pé mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: God hates lies; man hates truths; yet there is no third option in a discourse.
proverbs.wisdom: Always stick with the truth, even when there are no easy options. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá wo dídùn ifọ̀n, àá họ ara dé egun
proverbs.translation: If we give in to the pleasure of scratching our rashes, we'll scratch ourselves to the bone.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; exercise self-control, always. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ò tó'ràwọ̀ ni kúrò lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, káyé ó rí mi.
proverbs.translation: Only a less than sparkling star strives for attention.
proverbs.wisdom: We ought to be secure in who we are; no grandstanding. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a contentious person, he or she will yet remain contentious.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; do your best and keep moving. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A fish that sleeps will be eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep moving; complacency makes us vulnerable: the complacent is easily overtaken and outsmarted. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ṣe'ni lóore, ọpẹ́ là ńdá; ẹni tí kò dúpẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀fà, bẹ́ igi dí ọ̀nà egbèje.
proverbs.translation: We should give thanks for every favour; to be ungrateful for minor favours is to block the path to major ones.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness calls for gratitude; and gratitude beckons on more kindness #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í pẹ̀lú ọ̀bọ já'ko.
proverbs.translation: No one joins the monkey to roam the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain the high ground; never descend to join anyone do despicable things. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tí ojú bá rí kọ́ ni ẹnu ńsọ.
proverbs.translation: It is not all that the eyes see that the mouth utters.
proverbs.wisdom: Wisdom is it; some things are better left unsaid. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kótópó gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, bí ìfẹ́ bá wà láàárín wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is good enough for twenty friends, if there is love among them.
proverbs.wisdom: With love, virtually nothing is impossible. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú sí ẹni tí a kò rí.
proverbs.translation: Never be angry with someone you have not seen (or first heard out).
proverbs.wisdom: Never rush to judgment; hear out the other person, first; there is always a chance you could be wrong. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ aláṣetì; aláṣeyọrí là ńkí.
proverbs.translation: No one appreciates a person who abandons a task, but the one who completes it.
proverbs.wisdom: Finish whatever you start. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńse ọbẹ̀, kò tí ì kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; absolutely nothing is beyond God. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Òkè lọwọ́ afúnni ńgbé; ìsàlẹ̀ lọwọ́ ẹni tó ńgbà á ńwà.
proverbs.translation: The hand of a giver is always at the top; the hand of the receiver stays beneath.
proverbs.wisdom: Giving elevates; generosity pays. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour, but easily lord it over their benefactors, once satisfied.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot claim to truly know anyone, deep down.

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ tí ìlù bá ńlu onílù, iṣẹ́ míràn yá.
proverbs.translation: When the drum begins to beat its drummer, it's time for the drummer to change vocation.
proverbs.wisdom: Service is not servitude; when one's kind acts or good gestures get to the point of being taken for granted, it is time to do a rethink. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àpọ̀jù ọ̀rọ̀ ni í mú'ni pe ọba lẹ́nìkejì ẹni.
proverbs.translation: Talking excessively is what makes one (inadvertently) refers to the king as a colleague.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; too much of anything is bad; exercise self control, always. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ìbàjẹ́ ọjọ́ kan kì í tán lógún ọdún.
proverbs.translation: An indiscretion of one day does not get forgotten in twenty years.
proverbs.wisdom: A little indiscretion can be costly; we must jealously guard our good reputation. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ìgbẹ́ kọ́ lọdẹ ti ńpa ọ̀yà; gbogbo ogun kọ́ lakíkanjú ti ńyege.
proverbs.translation: Hunters do not always kill grasscutters in every expedition nor do warriors win every battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Win some, lose some; remain undeterred; there'll always be another day; rise up and give it another shot.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìṣẹ́ ò bá jẹ́ ká sọ òdodo, àìṣòdodo kò ní jẹ́ ká bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: If fear of poverty makes us lie, lying will keep us entrenched in poverty, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Honesty pays; dishonesty often exacts hefty fees, at the end. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bíbíire kò ṣeé fi owó rà.
proverbs.translation: A good pedigree cannot be purchased with money.
proverbs.wisdom: Money isn't everything; it's not everything that wealth can confer. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Èéfín ni ìwà; kò ṣeé fi pamọ́.
proverbs.translation: Character is like smoke; it cannot be covered up.
proverbs.wisdom: No hypocrisy; we cannot pretend to be what we are not for very long; ultimately, who we really are will show through. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kò lè tìtorí pé ọ̀bọ àti ìbejì jọ ńjẹ́ ẹdun, kí ọ̀bọ jẹ ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ lóko kí a wá gbá ìbejì létí ní'le.
proverbs.translation: The monkey should not eat up some bananas at the farm and we'd come home to slap the twins, simply because monkeys and twins share the same name.
proverbs.wisdom: Be just; be fair.

proverbs.proverb: Afọwọ́fọnná kì í mọ́wọ́ dúró.
proverbs.translation: Whoever packs live coals with his or her hands cannot maintain steady hands.
proverbs.wisdom: Seek peace, always; anyone with the proclivity to foment trouble cannot but be under stress.#òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán àrẹ̀mọ tó ńdé fìlà, tó bá gorí ìtẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀, yóò dé ohun tó ju àrán lọ
proverbs.translation: A royal heir who's wearing a cap is simply in haste; he'll get to don far more than velvet caps upon ascending his father's throne.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; don’t force issues before their time #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànnà yánná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹ̀rẹ̀ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, can't enjoy the glittering (beauty) of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyé ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep you hope in God alive; the best is yet to come. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn.
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes for an enduring loving relationship.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; tolerance is crucial. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n ọlọ́gbọ́n ni kì í jẹ́ kí a pe àgbà ní wèrè.
proverbs.translation: By adopting wise counsels from others, elderly persons generally avoid looking foolish.
proverbs.wisdom: Be humble to take lessons from anyone; it's what matured people do. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó bá máa kan ará ilé, kan ará oko, ìwọ̀nba l’ẹnìkan ńd’ojú kọ ọ́ mọ.
proverbs.translation: A matter that affects everybody must be cautiously confronted singlehandedly by one person.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't make a general problem a personal one; there's strength in numbers; cooperate and collaborate #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; promptly take advantage of opportunities. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Tèmi ò ṣòro, ní kì í jẹ kí ọmọ alágbẹ̀dẹ ní idà.
proverbs.translation: Mine is not an issue, is why the blacksmith ends up not owning a sword.
proverbs.wisdom: Procrastination limits us; Do not put off till tomorrow what today can achieve. #owe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pleads (his case) with God, won't need to plead with man.
proverbs.wisdom: Place your hope in God; He can never fail. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àkùkọ tí yóò kọ lágbà, àṣá kò ní gbe lóròmọ adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A cock that would crow when grown, wouldn't be picked up by a hawk as a chick.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; it is not over yet. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó láṣọ tí ò léèyàn, ìhòhò ló wà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is well clothed, but lack human relationships is naked, nonetheless.
proverbs.wisdom: Human networks are crucial. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ dúdú ò yá á bùṣán, ọmọ burúkú ò yá lùpa.
proverbs.translation: As it is tough to take a bite of an unripe plantain, so it is tough to beat a stubborn child to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Complex situations can hardly be addressed with unduly radical actions. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá ní òun yóò fọ ìlú mọ́, òun ni ọmọ aráyé máa fi ṣe kànrìnkàn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever swore he would wash a town clean is the one the world will use as the sponge.
proverbs.wisdom: Radical actions could be self-limitting. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àgùtàn ò ní sùn láàárín ajá, kó má fi ara kó eégbọn.
proverbs.translation: A sheep cannot lie in the midst of dogs and not get dog ticks on itself.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot but reflect the company we keep; show me your friends and I'll tell you who you are. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Omi tó tán lẹ́hìn ẹja ló sọọ́ di èrò ìṣasùn.
proverbs.translation: Absence of water's backing is what made the fish an item in a cooking pot.
proverbs.wisdom: Good support matters; seek and cultivate it; one may be helpless, without it. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àìdúpẹ́ oore àná a máa mú oore sú'ni í ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Lack of gratitude for yesterday's kindness makes further acts of kindness tiresome.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; it encourages further acts of kindness. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ńbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; with life, there is no impossibility. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí àgbẹ̀ ò bá gbin akèrègbè, kí ni aluṣẹ̀kẹ̀rẹ̀ fẹ́ rí lù?
proverbs.translation: Had the farmer not planted the gourd plant, what would the player of Sekere instrument (beaded gourd) play with?
proverbs.wisdom: We are all interconnected and interdependent; collaborate more; no man or woman is an island #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan, bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; good things take time;  don’t force issues before their time. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù, kì í pa ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A stone thrown at a bird in anger hardly could kill the bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí òjò ò pa, tí òrùn ò pa, ebi ni yóò paá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not beaten by rain and not beaten by the sun, will be beaten by hunger.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays; don't shy away from inconveniences. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà lẹ̀sìn; bí a bá ṣe mọ̀ ọ́ hù ni í ṣeé gbe’ni.
proverbs.translation: Character is like religion; how well our character is, that is how well it brings us favour.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character attracts favour. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàlagbà tó so yangan mọ́ ìdí, ló sọ ara rẹ̀ di aláwàdà fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: An elderly person, who tied maize to his pants, caused himself to be seen as an object of derision by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Self-respect and self-discipline are crucial; our appearance dictates how we are received #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọyẹ́ ló ńkìlọ̀ fún onítòbí; ebi ló ńkìlọ̀ fún ọ̀lẹ.
proverbs.translation: Harmattan will ultimately reprove the wearer of the short under-skirt; hunger will ultimately reprove the indolent.
proverbs.wisdom: The resulting negative consequence will ultimately reprove whoever is engaged in a vice.

proverbs.proverb: Adé orí ọ̀kín kò lè ṣe déédé orí ẹyẹkẹ́yẹ.
proverbs.translation: The crest on the head of the peacock simply won't fit any other bird.
proverbs.wisdom: We are all differently endowed; be secure in who you are; envy no one. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Omi gbígbóná kì í pẹ́ lẹ́nu; nínú ká gbé e mu tàbí ká tu ú dànù, àá fọwọ́ mú'kan nínú u méjèjì
proverbs.translation: Hot water cannot be long in the mouth; either it is swallowed or spat out, we have to chose one out of the two.
proverbs.wisdom: A stressful or difficult situation cannot be endured for long.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo inú ìgò, ó di àwòmọ́jú fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The corns in a bottle are viewed with disdain by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: We tend to belittle what we can't have. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Pẹ́pẹ́yẹ ńlérí lásán ni, kò ní kọ.
proverbs.translation: The duck is simply being pretentious; it won't crow.
proverbs.wisdom: Be undaunted; most things we worry about never happen. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Ignore distractions; stay focused. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Èyí ó wù á wí, t'Olúwa làṣẹ.
proverbs.translation: We may say what we please, it's God's will that will get done.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbọ́n ṣe lóró tó, oúnjẹ ni fún aláǹgbá.
proverbs.translation: Despite how venomous the wasp is, it is food for the lizard.
proverbs.wisdom: What someone considers a risk is what another embraces as an opportunity. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Kíkéré l'abẹ́rẹ́ kéré, kì í ṣe mímì fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: Though a needle may be tiny, it is not to be swallowed by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Underestimate no one; judge nothing by its appearance. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom:
Willingness to learn is it; there is no end to learning. #òwe

#òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ igbó kì í mọ fífò ọ̀dàn.
proverbs.translation: Forest birds seldom know how to fly on grasslands.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows it all; an expert in one area is often a novice in another.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyẹ kò bá fín ẹyẹ níràn, ojú ọ̀run tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì fara kanra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no need to pull anyone down in order to rise; the world is endowed enough for all. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó dá ẹnu, ti dá ohun tí kálukú máa fi síi.
proverbs.translation: God who created the mouth had also created what we would all be putting into it.
proverbs.wisdom: Worry less; keep hope alive; there is no mistake with God. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí ajá rí tó ńgbó, kò tó èyí tí ágùntàn fi ńṣe ìran wò.
proverbs.translation: What makes the dog barks is nothing to what the sheep ignores.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what is an issue to someone may well be of no consequence to another. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Oókan ni wọ́n ńta ẹṣin lọ́run, ó ku ẹni ti yóò lọ rà á.
proverbs.translation: Horses sell for one kobo each in heaven, but who's prepared to go buy it?
proverbs.wisdom: Benefits should be matched against associated risks; any benefit that comes with intolerably high risks easily loses it’s appeal. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A refuse dump that's intolerant of filth won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; intolerance can impose limitations. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó mọ iyì obì ló ńjá ewé bòó.
proverbs.translation: The person who appreciates kolanuts strives to protect them with a covering of leaves.
proverbs.wisdom: We keenly care for what we value; whatever is valued seldom suffer neglect. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ogbe orí àkùkọ, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ ọ́n ṣe àkùkọ; Elédùà ló dá àkùkọ lọ́lá.
proverbs.translation: The comb on the cock is not by dint of its prowess; it is the blessing of God.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest and thankful; our blessing is, quite often, way more than the results of our effort. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a ṣe lóore tí kò dúpẹ́, bí ìgbà tí ọlọ́ṣa ko ni lẹ́rù lọ ni.
proverbs.translation: To be kind to a person who isn't thankful is akin to being robbed by a thief.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ ńjẹ yangan, ó ńmu omi ó ńgbé ókúta mì, ó tún ńsunkún àìléyín; ṣé òbúkọ tó léyín ńjẹ irin ni?
proverbs.translation: Hens eat corns, drink water and swallow stones, yet lament lacking teeth; do goats chew pieces of iron with theirs?
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; shun greed. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ewúrẹ́ tó lè kígbe jù, kọ́ lebi ńpa jù.
proverbs.translation: The goat that bleats the loudest, is not necessarily the most famished.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance isn't necessarily reality; noise or drama isn't necessarily substance. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tó bá mọ ọwọ́ ọ́ wẹ̀, yóò bá àgbà jẹun.
proverbs.translation: A child who knows how to wash his or her hands will get to eat with the elders.
proverbs.wisdom: A well-behaved person will enjoy uncommon privileges; civility and courtesy do open doors. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ogun là ńmọ̀; ẹni kan kì í mọ ìparí í rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: The beginning of war is what anyone knows; no one knows how it will end.
proverbs.wisdom: Always seek peace; no one ever knows the full ramifications of a quarrel at the beginning. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fura sí ẹni tí a ńbá rìn; ẹni tí a bá ńfura sí, a kì í bá irú wọn rìn.
proverbs.translation: Do not be suspicious of those you associate with; those you'd be suspicious of, should not be your close associates.
proverbs.wisdom: Build trust; don't be paranoid; be positive; be forward-looking. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tí ẹnu ò bá ká, aṣọ kànkan ò lè ka.
proverbs.translation: No amount of cloth will be sufficient for a child who spurns good counsel.
proverbs.wisdom: Disobedience and wastefulness go arm in arm; whoever is disobedient will be wasteful. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀kàn mọ̀kàn loyè ńkàn; oyè tó kan ará Ìwó, ó ńbọ̀ wá kan ará Ẹdẹ.
proverbs.translation: Chieftancy titles are given turn by turn; the chieftancy title given to an Iwo indigene would soon be given to someone from Ede.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is in phases; be patient. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Mo ṣe é tán ló níyì; a kì í dúpẹ́ aláṣekù.
proverbs.translation: I've finished it, is what is honorable; no one gives thanks for an incomplete job.
proverbs.wisdom: Finish whatever you start; it's good to start a thing, but better to complete it. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Olójú kan kì í mọ'yì Ọlọ́run, à fi tí nǹkan bá gbọ̀n sí i.
proverbs.translation: A person with a single good eye is seldom thankful to God, until a speck enters the eye.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; in every situation, remain grateful. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn kan lè ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́, gbólóhùn kan náà lè tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: One sentence can mess up a discussion, and one sentence can make it better.
proverbs.wisdom: Words are powerful; use them with care. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọmọdé bá fẹ́ ṣe bí àgbà, ọjọ́ orí i rẹ̀ ò ní jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A youngster who wants to act matured, is quite often betrayed by his or her age (or narrow life experience).
proverbs.wisdom: Inexperience often distorts youngsters' views of what count as maturity; modesty to learn is crucial. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ẹkún kọ́ làpẹrẹ ìbànújẹ́; gbogbo ẹ̀rín sì kọ́ ló túmọ̀ sí ìdùnnú.
proverbs.translation: Not all tears signify sadness; not all laughters imply happiness.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You can only be certain of who you love, but you cannot tell who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n, á ran igba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed, it positively impacts two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success can be contagious. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ohun ọwọ́ mi ò tó, màá fi gọ̀ǹgọ̀ fàá, àbùkù ni í mú kan'ni.
proverbs.translation: To inordinately quest after what is evidently beyond one's reach is to court shame.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; live within your means; be wary of greed. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo tí kò bá fẹ́ fi ara gba iná, àti di gúgúrú rẹ̀, á nira.
proverbs.translation: Grains of corn that do not want to be exposed to heat would find their becoming pop corns difficult.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; be willing to pay the price. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Oore kéré, oore tóbi, oore loore yóò máa jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whether small or big, kindness received deserves to be recognised as such.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; never discount favours received. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ní tútù là ńká ẹja kò; ẹja gbígbẹ ò ṣeé ká.
proverbs.translation: Fish may be bent (and formed into shapes) only while fresh; dried fish cannot be bent.
proverbs.wisdom: Promptly resolve issues while still simple; once complicated, issues can be tough to resolve. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àrẹ̀mọ má jobì, má ròde ẹmu, kó lè dé ipò bàbá rẹ̀ ni.
proverbs.translation: That the royal heir should desist from rioutous living, it's so he can succeed his father (the king).
proverbs.wisdom: Be open and humble to take to good counsel. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ńsá nínú omi gbígbóná, tó bá sáa lọ́dàn ni, kò ní wọ omi gbígbóná
proverbs.translation: Had the frog been as fleet-footed in the fields as it is now inside hot water, it won't have found itself in the hot water
proverbs.wisdom: A stitch in time saves so much later; address issues promptly #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ikú ẹja ni í mú ẹja mọ ìlú.
proverbs.translation: The death of the fish is what enables it to know the city.
proverbs.wisdom: Adversity is, quite often, a stepping stone to greater heights; be positive, always; it's not over yet. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ ńbá àṣà ṣeré, ó rò pé ẹyẹ oko lásán ni.
proverbs.translation: The chick plays with the hawk, gullibly believing it to be an ordinary bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be costly; correctly assess risks; don't be presumptuous. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; there is always a price tag. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àìnísùúrù ìnàkí, ló sọọ́ di ará inú igbó.
proverbs.translation: Gorilla's impatience was what made it an inhabitant of the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; impatience can exact a heavy price. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ará oko tí yóò jẹ búrẹ́dì, á fi èsúrú ránṣẹ́ sílé.
proverbs.translation: A farm dweller who would like to eat bread (from those at home), would do well to send some aerial yams (from the farm to those at) home.
proverbs.wisdom: We easily receive when we are committed to giving: givers seldom lack. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́, kọ́ ni oògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; adopt radical measures with caution. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá gbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; ignore distractions; it's not all issues that should command one's attention. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n díẹ̀, òmùgọ̀ díẹ̀, l'ọba fi ńto ìlú.
proverbs.translation: Applying a little wisdom and a little stupidity is how a king administers his kingdom.
proverbs.wisdom: Sometimes, you have to act like a monkey to catch one; quite often, what appeared stupid may be a reflection of depths of wisdom. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; there's always a price tag. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í s'òótọ́ inú, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni má d'ayọ̀, báyé ẹni bá dojúrú ìwà èèyàn ló yẹ ká wò.
proverbs.translation: An honest life cannot but end well; if a life remains unpleasant, the person's character needs to be examined.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character quite often determines our experience; we reap what we sow

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tó gé ìyá a rẹ̀ lẹ́hìn jẹ, ṣòro ó gbà pọ̀n.
proverbs.translation: It's tough offering to back a child who bit his mother's back when backed by her.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive; don't expect anyone to treat you better than they are treating those close to them.
#òwe

proverbs.proverb: Láníntán kan kò lè ni ìwo ẹṣin.
proverbs.translation: No one can be so wealthy as to own the horn of a horse (since horses have no horns).
proverbs.wisdom: No one has it all made; we need one another. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ajá  kì í rorò títí, kó ṣọ́ ojú'lé méjì.
proverbs.translation: No matter how tough a dog is, it cannot watch over two separate houses.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a limit to what any one person can do; cooperate and collaborate more. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńwá ẹni tó jẹ bàbá rẹ̀ lówó, àfàìmọ̀, kó má pàdé ẹni tí bàbá rẹ̀ jẹ lówó.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is looking for his father's debtors, may well find his father's creditors.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; life can come with twists and turns. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àgbà ò sí ní ìdí ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́; ẹni tí yóò jẹ ẹran níláti ṣetán àti ṣe ọdẹ.
proverbs.translation: There should be no deferrence to seniority in sharing the squirrel's meat; whoever wants to partake must be prepared to hunt.
proverbs.wisdom: Lead by example; we musn't abuse our positions. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sí'nú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun without relenting, eventually, the shade will come (when the sun sets).
proverbs.wisdom: Tough times won't last forever; persistence pays: if we won't quit, we will win, eventually. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ilé tí a fi itọ́ mọ́, ìrì ni yóò wóo.
proverbs.translation: A house built with saliva will collapse under dew drops.
proverbs.wisdom: Integrity is it; fruits of deceit seldom last.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bérè lọ́wọ́ adélébọ̀ pé ní'bo ló ti rí oyún.
proverbs.translation: No one asks a married woman where she has got her pregnancy.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't ask obvious questions. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò dodo làgbàdo ńwọ ilẹ̀; tó bá jáde tán ló ńdi onígba aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The maize seed does go into the soil absolutely naked; it ends up with multiple peelings only after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Wọ́n ní kí olókùnrùn ṣe 'tó' ó lóun ò lè ṣe 'tó tò tó'.
proverbs.translation: A sick man who was asked to merely say 'to', profusely insisted he cannot say 'to to to'.
proverbs.wisdom: Be efficient; don't waste effort rejecting what would have taken far less to accept. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà, mọ̀sá, ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ.
proverbs.translation: Warriors must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to retreat would perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Know when to pursue, defer or quit. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ìgbà tí a dá aṣọ, tá ò rí ìgbà fi lòó.
