proverbs.translation: There is no time one buys clothes that one won't have opportunity to  wear them.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it.

proverbs.proverb: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kọ́ l'oníṣẹ́, à fi ẹni tó bá fi orí tì í d'ópin.
proverbs.translation: A good worker is not necessarily the one who starts something, but the one who finishes it.
proverbs.wisdom: To start any task is not as crucial as seeing it through to completion. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí kòkó ẹ̀ yè, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ọ́ ṣe ẹ̀, bíkòṣe Elédùà.
proverbs.translation: A farmer with a thriving cocoa farm owes this not just to his effort, but to God.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest; we owe everything to God. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tí sùúrù sè, tí kò jinná.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing 'cooked' by patience that won't get done.
proverbs.wisdom: Don’t give up; with patience, even complex issues get resolved. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ológùńná kan, kì í rìn létí odò.
proverbs.translation: A person with a single ember ought not to walk by the river bank.
proverbs.wisdom: Be cautious; avoid intolerably high risks or scenarios with zero way out. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa náwó, kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun, kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: Generosity does not necessarily make one poor nor does stinginess make one rich.
proverbs.wisdom: Generosity is it; kindness pays. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't pour away the water in the trough simply because the cloud rumbles.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; never count your chickens before they are hatched. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wàá ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; complex issues need to be patiently handled. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ńbáa lùú, áńbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ.
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow, had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his drum on a tree and walked away.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence is it; no complacency #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Adùn-ńṣe bí ohun tí Ọlọ́run lọ́wọ́ sí, aṣòroóṣe bí èyí tí Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: As easy to do as what God sanctions, and as difficult to achieve as what He opposes.
proverbs.wisdom: If God is in it, it will work out; keep hope alive. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Aláǹgbá tó jábọ́ lórí ìrókò, ó ní bí ẹnìkan ò yin òun, òun á yin ara òun.
proverbs.translation: The lizard that fell from a teak tree (unharmed), says if it receives no praise from anyone, it will praise itself.
proverbs.wisdom: It is okay to be your own cheerleader; celebrate your successes. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwò rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is turn by turn; a season goes, another comes; nothing lasts forever. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó jẹun yó tó fọ́ akèrègbè, ó ti gbàgbé pé ọjọ́ òǹgbẹ ṣì ńbọ̀.
proverbs.translation: The farmer who ate and broke the (water) gourd, forgot that days of thirst are ahead.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; maintain a view of the future; always. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín igbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun.
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver no longer carves calabashes, those already carved will still remain.
proverbs.wisdom: We are outlived by our legacy. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Igi tó tọ́ kì í pẹ́ n'ígbó.
proverbs.translation: Trees of value seldom remain in the forest for long.
proverbs.wisdom: What is of value is often in high demand; maintain a passion for excellence and leave a good legacy. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; answers may be so complete as to be overwhelming. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Òjò tó rọ̀ sí ewúro, náà ló rọ̀ sí ìrèkè.
proverbs.translation: The same rain that fell on the bitter leaf, fell on the sugarcane.
proverbs.wisdom: Bitter or vengeful responses are by choice; our reactions, regardless of situations, tell of who we really are deep down. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Oníjó tó bá jó mọ níwọ̀n, ló ńjó pẹ́; èyí tí kò bá jó mọ níwọ̀n, máa ńjó tẹ́ ni.
proverbs.translation: A dancer who dances moderately is the one who dances for long; the one who doesn't dance moderately courts shame.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó ya wèrè bí ẹṣin ò wọ́pọ̀: ẹṣin fi ọmọ rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ ó ńgbé ọmọ ọlọ́mọ kiri.
proverbs.translation: Not many animals are as stupid as the horse: it left its offspring unattended and carried those of others around.
proverbs.wisdom: Care for others, if you may, but don't neglect your own, either.

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n àgbọ́njù, ni í pa òdù ọ̀yà.
proverbs.translation: Unbridled craftiness is what kills the grown grasscutter.
proverbs.wisdom: Crafty people eventually self-destruct; pursue a win-win scenario rather. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Èéfín ni ìwà; kò ṣeé fi pamọ́.
proverbs.translation: Character is like smoke; it cannot be covered up.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot pretend to be who we are not for very long. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ l'oògùn ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Hardwork is the antidote against poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Hardwork always works; it's a surefire remedy for poverty. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Omi tí èyàn máa mu, kò ní ṣàn kọjá rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A stream from which one will drink will not flow beyond one's reach.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; never give up. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí yóò bá'ni kalẹ́, ki í ti àárọ̀ ṣe ipin.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that will serve one until old age will not be rheumy while one is young.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; whatever will stand the test of time shouldn't be having issues earlier on. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ kan a máa yí ìpinnu ogún ọdún padà.
proverbs.translation: A single sentence is well able to change a decision of twenty years.
proverbs.wisdom: Words are powerful; use them wisely; speak in wisdom #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọsàn bá dúdú, ó ńpadà bọ̀ wá pọ́n ni.
proverbs.translation: An unripe orange will most assuredly become ripe, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dá aró ní Ìṣokùn; àlà ni wọ́n ńlò níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No one engages in a cloth dyeing venture in Isokun Town; only whites (clothes) are worn there.
proverbs.wisdom: Supply should respond to demand; never supply or offer what is not required. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tí Ọlọ́run ò ṣe fún, à fi ẹni tó bá ni tòun ò tó.
proverbs.translation: There is no one God has not blessed, except those who believed they have not been blessed enough.
proverbs.wisdom: We all have reasons to be grateful; we have all being blessed, albeit in different ways. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó wọ bàtà nìkan ló mọ ibi tó ti ńta òun lẹ́sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Only the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant and empathetic; you never know for sure what anyone is going through.

proverbs.proverb: Dídùn ló dùn tá ńbá ọ̀rẹ́ jẹ̀kọ, ti ilé oge to óge é jẹ.
proverbs.translation: One eats with a friend because of the pleasure of friendship not because one lacks.
proverbs.wisdom: Treasure friendships; take no one for granted.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ dùn tó bá pọ́n, ṣùgbọ́n tó bá pọ́n láàpọ́njù, oúnjẹ ni fún ẹyẹ oko.
proverbs.translation: Banana is sweet when ripe, but it will become food for the birds, if it's overripe.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate, even in good things; immoderation, quite often, can be costly. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àì rìn jìnnà, làì rí abuké ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́; afọ́jú ẹyẹ ńbẹ lóko kárinkése
proverbs.translation: Not travelling far enough is why one may not have seen a squirrel with a hump; blind birds can be found deep in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of exposure often results in narrow-mindness; exposure broadens the mind

proverbs.proverb: Ìrèké ò níbùdó; ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: The sprouting of the sugarcane is not constrained to a specific place; every situation suits a hard worker just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays; the diligent person seldom whines. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: God's messenger never grows weary.
proverbs.wisdom: God cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a fẹ́ rí, la fẹ́ rí; kò sí ọjọ́ táa jí, táà rí èèyàn.
proverbs.translation: Our hearts yearn only for those we desire; there's no day we wake without people around us.
proverbs.wisdom: Love can be choosy; loneliness is not for want of people around. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kékeré gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, tí ìfẹ bá wà láàárín wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is sizable enough for twenty friends, if there is love in their midst .
proverbs.wisdom: Little is enough if love is in it; with love, a cottage may well pass for a castle. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ìfẹ́ fọ́jú; obìnrin tí a bá fẹ́ràn, kì í ní àléébù.
proverbs.translation: Love is blind; a woman one truly loves seldom has blemishes.
proverbs.wisdom:
With love, other concerns pale; if it's wrong, love won't see it. 

A kú ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ olólùfẹ́ o.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ gbé ọmọ sílẹ̀ ó gbé ọkọ pọ̀n, ó lọ́rọ̀ ọkọ bàǹtà banta ni.
proverbs.translation: The frog dropped its baby to back its mate, saying husbands are crucial.
proverbs.wisdom: Love is powerful; virtually nothing is impossible or irrational, where love exists. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú sí ẹni tí a kò rí.
proverbs.translation: Never be angry with someone you have not seen (or first heard out).
proverbs.wisdom: Never rush to judgment; there is always a chance you could be wrong; always give people the benefit of the doubt. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àyè kì í há adìyẹ kó má lè dé ìdí àba rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A hen is never too busy to brood over its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: We are always able to make time for what is crucial to us. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ àánú Olúwa kì í ṣú.
proverbs.translation: The sun of God's mercy never sets.
proverbs.wisdom: God's mercy never runs out; keep hope alive and trust Him. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ìpọ́njú là ńmọ ọ̀rẹ́; ọjọ́ tó bá burú la ńmọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: It is during times of deprivation that true friends are known; when things are tough is when we can know those who truly care.
proverbs.wisdom: Difficult times do point out those who truly care. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àjùmọ̀bí kò kan ti àánú, ẹni orí rán sí'ni ló ńṣe'ni lóore.
proverbs.translation: Kindness may not necessarily come from one's siblings but those divinely sent to one.
proverbs.wisdom: Help may not necessarily come from expected sources; keep an open-mind, always. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Adẹ́tẹ̀ ò lè fún wàrà, ṣùgbọ́n ó lè da wàrà nù.
proverbs.translation: A leper is unable to express milk, but can very well waste it.
proverbs.wisdom: Ignore or underestimate no one; those who cannot build, may be able to cause untold destruction. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó roko tí kò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró
proverbs.translation: A farmer ploughed his farm, but refused to plant any corn & claimed he's hurting the ground squirrel; he hasn't hurt the squirrel, but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Vindictive actions can be self-defeating

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò kì í gbóná kó má tutù.
proverbs.translation: The hearth does not get hot, without becoming cold eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is hot today, will one day become cold; tough times won't last forever; keep hope alive. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Kì í rẹ ológbò, kó má lè ṣe ọdẹ eku.
proverbs.translation: A cat cannot be so tired as to be unable to hunt mice.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast; be persistent; be resilient. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá ní tòún bàjẹ́, tó bá rí ti ẹlòmíì á yin Ọlọ́run lógo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever feels his case is deplorable will give glory to God on learning of another's (possibly worse case).
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment and attitude of gratitude are great virtues.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó sùn là ńjí, a kì í jí apirọrọ; táa bá jí apirọrọ kò ní dáhùn.
proverbs.translation: You can only wake someone who is truly asleep, not one pretending to be asleep; the person pretending to be asleep will not respond, if you wake him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Unsolicited help is seldom appreciated. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àjọjẹ ò dùn bí ẹnìkan ò bá ní; ọjọ́ a ní la ńṣe àjọjẹ.
proverbs.translation: Sharing can be hard going when one party lacks; we are usually happy to share, when we all can give.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to give to others, but better to empower them; it's better to teach people to fish than give them fish

proverbs.proverb: Pẹ̀lẹ́pẹ̀lẹ́ la ńpa àmúkùrù ẹpọ̀n.
proverbs.translation: It is with gentleness and caution that one kills the black ant lodged around the scrotum.
proverbs.wisdom: A delicate matter must be gently and carefully handled.

proverbs.proverb: Oko dùn ńro, l'agbẹdẹ ṣe ńrọ ọkọ́!
proverbs.translation: Farming is so great, which is why blacksmiths opt to make hoes (for others)!
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive to read between the lines; the proverb employs sarcasm to indicate that actions generally speak louder than words.

proverbs.proverb: Tí òjò bá kọ̀ tí kò rọ̀, ìyẹn ò ní ká sọ pé, kí omi òkun ya wọ ìlú.
proverbs.translation: That it has not rained for a while is no reason to wish the sea would flood the city.
proverbs.wisdom: Reactions should be commensurate; adopt extreme and radical measures with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lè ṣe bí aláàárù l'Óyìngbò, kò lè ṣe bí Adégbọrọ̀ l'Ọ́jà Ọba.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not willing to be a hired hand in a local market, cannot hope to become a wealthy merchant in a major one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be willing to start with what you have, right where you are. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Àìṣedédé ará ayé, ló ńmú’ni rántí ará ọ̀run.
proverbs.translation: The untoward behaviour of those alive is what makes us pine for those who had passed on.
proverbs.wisdom: Our deeds outlive us; let's leave good legacies. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Obìnrin kì í dàgbà jù lọ́wọ́ ọkọ rẹ̀; bí eyín bá ku méjì lẹ́nu ìyá, ọmọge ni lójú baba.
proverbs.translation: A woman is never too old to her husband; even if she's lost all her teeth, a maiden she remains to her man.
proverbs.wisdom: Love is it; with love, other concerns pale. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó lórí ò ní fìlà; ẹni tó ní fìlà ò lórí; ẹni tó lórí tó ní fìlà, kò rí òde dée lọ.
proverbs.translation: A man with a head has no cap; another with a cap has no head; and yet another who has both head and cap has no outing to go with the cap.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gèlè ò dùn bí i ká mọ̀ọ́ wé, ká mọ̀ọ́ wé, kò dà bí i kó yẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: The beauty of a woman's head-tie lies not just in knowing how to tie it, but in how well it fits when tied.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, end results not activities count. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá fara pamọ́, ló máa ńgbó.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that grows to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: It is good to fly under the radar sometimes; drawing undue attention to oneself isn't always beneficial.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í tojú oníka mẹ́ẹ̀sán kàá.
proverbs.translation: Never openly count the toes of someone with nine toes.
proverbs.wisdom: Be considerate, courteous, and tactful; never deliberately and pointlessly embarass anyone.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnití ò bá fẹ́ ṣe àṣedànù, kò lè ṣe àṣejèrè.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is unwilling to suffer losses, cannot experience gains.
proverbs.wisdom: Go for it; take carefully assessed and hedged risks; nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí kòkó ẹ̀ yéè, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ọ́ ṣe ẹ̀, bíkòṣe Elédùà.
proverbs.translation: A farmer with a thriving cocoa farm owes this not just to his or her effort, but to God.
proverbs.wisdom: Modesty is it; we owe everything to God. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Oníbàtà ló ńfojú di ẹ̀gún; ẹni táa bá fẹ́ ló ńfojú dini.
proverbs.translation: Someone who has shoes easily despises thorns; those we love are the ones who take us for granted.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Gbòngbò kan ṣoṣo kò gbọdọ̀ ré ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n lẹ́ẹ̀pa lẹ́ẹ̀mejì.
proverbs.translation: The same tree stump should not trip a learned person twice.
proverbs.wisdom: Discretion is a better part of valour; a wise fish seldom gets caught twice with the same net. #owe

proverbs.proverb: Olè tó gbé kàkàkí ọba, níbo ni yóò ti fun ún?
proverbs.translation: Where would the thief who stole the king's bugle blow it?
proverbs.wisdom: We ought to walk in wisdom; some actions are inherently unwise and ultimately self-defeating. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Agbọ́n tí géńdé rí tó ńsá, ni aláàmù ńṣà jẹ lẹ́ẹ̀gbẹ́ ògiri.
proverbs.translation: The same wasps that humans run from are what lizards, crawling on walls, easily snap up and eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what challenges someone may be well be an opportunity to another. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour; once satisfied, they easily lord it over their benefactors.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ lápa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè lápa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; be willing to pay the price. #owe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn
proverbs.translation: Whoever pleads (his case) with God, won't need to plead with man.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing is beyond God; He is not a man; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; excessive talk is how the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; exercise self-control, always #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Inú ilé ẹni la ti ńjẹ èkúté onídodo.
proverbs.translation: It's in the seclusion of one's home that one eats a rat with an outsized navel.
proverbs.wisdom: Some issues are better kept private.Proverb

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìtàkùn bá lè pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n á mú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants would unite (and collaborate), they would easily tie up an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Unity strengthens and empowers; pursue collaboration.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Handle anger with caution; avoid rash decisions.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a tó dé ibi tí à ńlọ, a lè kọ́kọ́ dé ibi tí a kò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Before getting to one's ultimate destination, one may have to get to where one would rather not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic: always look-ahead; be focused and undaunted.

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch darkness, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; it's not over yet; tough times are not forever.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ṣe'ni lóore, ọpẹ́ là ńdá; ẹni tí kò dúpẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀fà, bẹ́ igi dí ọ̀nà egbèje.
proverbs.translation: We ought to give thanks for every favour received; to be ungrateful for minor favours is to block the path to major ones.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness calls for gratitude & gratitude beckons more kindness

proverbs.proverb: Oò ṣá igi lọ́gbẹ́, oò ta ògùrọ̀ lọ́fà, o dé ìdí ọ̀pẹ, o ńgbẹ́'nu s'ókè, ṣé ọ̀fẹ́ ló máa ńro ni?
proverbs.translation: You neither cut an oil palm, nor punctured a raffia palm, yet you opened up your mouth under a palm for wine; does the wine drip freely?
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: If one won't give up trying, one's hustling will one day come to an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Persistence is it; if you won't quit, you will win, ultimately.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: We ought to focus on our destination, not where we had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; look ahead and keep moving; leave the past where it belongs: in the past.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Never carry out your duties using someone else's timepiece.
proverbs.wisdom: Do not compare yourself with anyone; stay in your lane; envy no one.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún'ni.
proverbs.translation: What is sweet, what is much and what endures are all from God.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, all blessings are from God; we ought to acknowledge and  be thankful to Him.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní sùúrù, ohun tí ò tó, ṣì ńbọ̀ wá ṣẹ́kù.
proverbs.translation: If we are patient, whatever is insufficient will be in excess soon enough.
proverbs.wisdom: With patience, virtually nothing is impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá kò pa, kó má a dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but was not struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: We must remain thankful in every situation; it could have been worse.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán owó tó sọnù; ìgbà wo ni níná ò ní kàn án tẹ́lẹ̀?
proverbs.translation: The sum of money that got lost is merely in haste; would it not be spent, eventually?
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; let things evolve at their time.

proverbs.proverb: Àkùkọ tí yóò kọ lágbà, àṣá ò ní gbée lóròmọ adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A cock that will crow when grown, will not be picked up by a hawk as a chick.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Igi ò lè gbé abẹ́ igi, kó rúwé.
proverbs.translation: A tree cannot remain shielded by another tree and sprout leaves.
proverbs.wisdom: To stay in our comfort zones is to limit ourselves; everyone must take responsibility for his or her life.

proverbs.proverb: Mú inú ṣe ìkà, mú òde ṣ’òótọ́, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ohun tí ńbi'ni kò ní ṣàì bi'ni.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long, whoever secretly indulges in evil but openly pretends to do good, will one day answer for his or her evil deeds.
proverbs.wisdom: Let's sow good seeds; ultimately, we'll reap whatever we sow.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó yẹni ló yẹni, okùn ọrùn ò yẹ adìyẹ; ó dẹ̀ yẹ adìyẹ, ẹni tó mú u dání lojú máa tì
proverbs.translation: There is what is proper; a leash does not suit the hen; even if the leash does, the shame is on the person holding it.
proverbs.wisdom: Some things are not proper and befitting; let's avoid them

proverbs.proverb: Eṣinṣin tí kò bá gbọ́ ikilọ ló ńbá ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ wọ ẹnu ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Only a disobedient housefly goes with (a bite of) banana into the monkey's mouth.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of self-control can be risky; we must moderate our appetite and tastes.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá pẹ́ lórí imí, eṣinkéṣin a máa bá’ni níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever takes unduly long in open defecation, may well play host to strange flies.
proverbs.wisdom: Undue tardiness often results in unexpected outcomes; make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Àkàbà tó bá fi ara ti ilẹ̀, tó bá fi ara ti ilé, kò lè yẹ̀ dànù.
proverbs.translation: A ladder that rests on both the ground and the wall, cannot easily fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Good support empowers and protects; seek to leverage on it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut fruit that wants to become palm oil must be prepared to have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is man’s adornment.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character traits are adorable and attractive; we ought to cultivate them.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àkàrà bá dé eyín akáyín, á di egungun ni.
proverbs.translation: To a toothless person, chewing mere àkàrà (fried bean cakes) is akin to chewing bones.
proverbs.wisdom: A simple task is complex to one who is unprepared for or unfamiliar with it.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò dá kainkain kó tóbi, àtapa ni ì bá máa ta èèyàn.
proverbs.translation: God did not create the ant big for a reason; it would have been stinging people to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Unpleasant manners, quite often, limit us; oppress no one with your privileges.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó rí òkú ìkà nílẹ̀ tó taá ní ìpá, ìkà ti di méjì.
proverbs.translation: Whoever came across the corpse of a wicked fellow and kicked it turned himself or herself into a wicked person, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Forgive and forget; we shouldn't always seek to get even.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ejò bá ti bùjẹ rí, bó bá rí ekòló, yóò họ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever had once been bitten by a snake, would flee at the sight of an earthworm.
proverbs.wisdom: Once beaten, twice shy; quite often, our past exerts pressure on our present.

proverbs.proverb: Àkókò kò dúró de ẹnìkan.
proverbs.translation: Time waits for no one.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; promptly exploit opportunities.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́ tí yóò gun igi ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀, èékánná rẹ̀ yóò mú ṣáṣá.
proverbs.translation: A squirrel that wants to climb the plantain tree must have sharp claw nails.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing good comes easy; lofty goals must be well prepared for.

proverbs.proverb: Ọsán tó já ló sọ ọrún di ọ̀pá.
proverbs.translation: The bowstring that got broken was what turned the bow into a mere baton.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a cause to every effect; a minor issue may produce a major consequence.

proverbs.proverb: Tí afọ́jú bá lóun yóò fọ́'ni lójú, ó yẹ ká fura; tí kò bá mú nǹkan lọ́wọ́, ó lè tẹ nǹkan mọ́'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Be wary of a blind man who threatens to make you blind; if he has nothing in his hands, he may have something under his feet.
proverbs.wisdom: Underestimate no one; don't be presumptuous.

proverbs.proverb: Ikú fẹ́ pa alápatà ó ńkígbe; ọmọ ẹranko tó ti dá lóró ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: Death stalks the butcher and he screams; what about the animals he's butchered?
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair and considerate; don't demand from anyone what you are unwilling to impose on yourself.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọ́mọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom: Prevention is better than cure; good to look for help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Stay focused; ignore distractions.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá dúpẹ́ oore àná, yóò rí òmíràn gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is thankful for yesterday's kindness, will be favored with another.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude makes for increase.

proverbs.proverb: Ogún ọmọdé kì í ṣeré gba ogún ọdún; ọgbọ̀n àgbà kì í ṣàṣàrò fún ọgbọ̀n oṣù.
proverbs.translation: Twenty youngsters cannot play together for twenty years as thirty elders cannot hold discussions for thirty months.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is inevitable; anticipate and prepare for it.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ikú ilé ò pa'ni, tòde ò leè pa'ni.
proverbs.translation: If there is no enemy within, the one outside can do us no harm.
proverbs.wisdom: Choose your friends wisely; worry less about the enemy without.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà, mọ̀sá, ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ
proverbs.translation: Warriors must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight, but not when to retreat will perish in battle
proverbs.wisdom: Timing is crucial; know when to pursue, defer or quit

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling will find rising difficult.
proverbs.wisdom: Be courageous; be bold; nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Ayé tí ẹṣin ò jẹ, tí ìrù ìdí rẹ̀ bá ní sùúrù, á jẹ jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
proverbs.translation: If the tail of a horse can be patient (to become a flywhisk), it will surpass the quality of life never enjoyed by the horse.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ìgbẹ́ kọ́ lọdẹ ti ńpa ọ̀yà; gbogbo ogun kọ́ lakíkanjú ti ńyege.
proverbs.translation: It's not from all forests that a hunter kills a grasscutter; it's not all battles that a warrior wins.
proverbs.wisdom: Win some, lose some; don't be deterred; rise up and try again; there'll always be another day.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó kọ̀ tí kò sin Ọlọ́run, òrìṣà kékèèké tí kò to Ọlọ́run ló máa sìn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever refuses to worship God will end up worshipping lesser gods.
proverbs.wisdom: To reject God is to accept the consequence of His absence.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan, bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time; be patient; don’t force issues before their time.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ ò lè fi apá kan fò.
proverbs.translation: A bird cannot fly with one wing.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another; together we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn kan lè ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́, gbólóhùn kan náà lè tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: One sentence can mess up a discussion and one sentence can make it better.
proverbs.wisdom: Words have consequences; use them wisely.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ojú ọwọ́ ṣiṣẹ́ tán, káa tún wá fi ẹ̀hìn ọwọ̀ dàánù.
proverbs.translation: Never destroy with your backhand what your open hand had accomplished.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid hasty and impulsive decisions; handle drastic decisions with caution.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá Ọlọ́run ṣòwò ká pàdánù.
proverbs.translation: No one trades with God and lose.
proverbs.wisdom: God is faithful; you can depend on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Lọ́jọ́ ti omi bá tán lẹ́hìn ẹja, ọwọ́ lásán ni wọ́n máa fi mú u.
proverbs.translation: The day water ceases to back the fish, it will simply be picked up (in the river) with mere hands.
proverbs.wisdom: Good support and network matter; absence of good support could make one vulnerable.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ṣe ohun tó dun'ni lóòní, lè ṣe ohun tí yóò dùn mọ́'ni lọ́la.
proverbs.translation: A person who hurts one today may still be a source of blessing tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; avoid overreaction and look ahead.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá gbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; it's not all issues that should command one's attention.

proverbs.proverb: Àbá làá kó dànù; ẹnìkan kì í kó aláàbá dànù.
proverbs.translation: Only ideas may be rejected; no one should reject the person who brought the idea.
proverbs.wisdom: A case against ad hominem; question and attack ideas not personalities.

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ mọ́, ọ̀lẹ pòṣé.
proverbs.translation: The day breaks and the indolent hissed.
proverbs.wisdom: Be diligent.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní máa fi ara yí ọlá, onítòhún á fi ara yí ẹ̀gbin, nítorí inú ẹ̀gbin lọlá ńgbé.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to be wealthy must be prepared to be inconvenienced, because wealth resides right inside of ‘filth’.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; answers may be so complete as to be overwhelming.

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kì í níyì lọ́ọ̀sán, ṣugbọ̀n a máa gbayì lọ́jọ́ alẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A lamp is typically of little value in the afternoon, but do get appreciated at night.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a right time and place for everything.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá ju abẹ̀bẹ̀ sí òkè nígbà igba, ibi pẹlẹbẹ náà ló máa fi lé lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Even if a hand-fan is thrown up two hundred times, it will consistently rest on one of its flat sides.
proverbs.wisdom: Stubbornness regardless of circumstances; be flexible and open-minded.

proverbs.proverb: À ti rán'mú gáńgan, ò ṣẹ̀hìn èékánná.
proverbs.translation: The nasal sound of the talking drum isn't without the knowledge (or cooperation) of the finger nails.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another; pursue cooperation and collaboration.

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ajá bá fi ogún ọdún sá, ìrin fàájì ni fún ẹṣin.
proverbs.translation: A race that takes dogs twenty years, is a mere leisurely walk to horses.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what proves a challenge to one, may well be a walkover to another.

proverbs.proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jìyà, bó bá dàgbà, á tó ọdẹ ẹ́ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Àì dúpẹ́ oore àná a máa mú oore sú'ni í ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Absence of appreciation for yesterday's kindness discourages future acts of kindness.
proverbs.wisdom: Show appreciation; it encourages further acts of kindness.

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í mọ iyì ohun tó ní, à fi tó bá sọọ́ nù.
proverbs.translation: We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose the thing.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ọ̀rẹ́ dà kó má ṣe bínú, ẹni abínibí ńda’ni.
proverbs.translation: Those betrayed by friends should not be offended; even siblings betray one another.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; forgive and forget; do not hold on to hurts.

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò lè já.
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they cannot fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ní tútù là ńká ẹja kò; ẹja gbígbẹ ò ṣeé ká.
proverbs.translation: Fish may be bent only while still fresh; dried fish cannot be bent.
proverbs.wisdom: Address issues promptly and before they get complicated; complex issues can be difficult to resolve.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí bíńtí ò tó, púpọ̀ yóò jìnnà sí i.
proverbs.translation: Abundance will be far from whoever is not contented with a little.
proverbs.wisdom: Be contented; contentment makes for increase.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; promptly take advantage of opportunities.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: No leaf drops off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing surprises God; nothing is beyond Him; lean on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa náwó kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: Generosity does not necessarily make one poor nor does stinginess make one rich.
proverbs.wisdom: Be generous.

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch darkness, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; it's not over yet.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó gbọ́n bí ajá kò sí; ajá mọ ọmọ tirẹ̀ ńfún lọ́mú, ó mọ ti òdù ọ̀yà ńkì mọ́'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No animal is as crafty as the dog; it knows how to suckle its offsprings and pounce on those of the grass-cutters.
proverbs.wisdom: Shun unbridled craftiness and self-centeredness.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í kán'jú lá'bẹ̀ gbígbóná, tí a bá kán'jú lá'bẹ̀ gbígbóná, á bó'ni l'ẹ́nu; tí ọbẹ̀ bá wá tutù tán, ẹnu wo la ó fi j'ata?
proverbs.translation: Never sip hot soup in haste, else you'll end up with a scalded mouth; and how'll you lick the soup when it cools?
proverbs.wisdom: Be calm with complex issues.

proverbs.proverb: Àìmọṣẹ́ ẹ́ kọ̀, ló ṣe orogùn, tó fi ki orí bọ omi gbígbóná.
proverbs.translation: Not knowing how to decline a request, is how the wooden stirrer gets dipped into hot water.
proverbs.wisdom: Learn to say, No; not all requests or offers are beneficial; some are traps in disguise.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànná yànná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹ̀rẹ̀ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that will not endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, cannot enjoy the glittering (beauty) of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìṣẹ́ ò bá jẹ́ ká ṣòdodo, àìṣòdodo ò ní jẹ́ ká bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: If fear of poverty makes us live dishonestly, dishonest living will keep us entrenched in poverty, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Honesty pays; dishonesty can be costly, at the end.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò kú ló ni igbó òkè ọ̀hún.
proverbs.translation: Only the person who is alive gets to own the farmland up yonder (eventually).
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up; with life, virtually nothing is impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán nínú ewé, táa se ọbẹ̀ nínú èpo ẹ̀pà, ẹní máa yó, á yó.
proverbs.translation: If we pound yam in a leaf and prepare the soup in a groundnut pod, those who will be full, will still be.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility; regardless of conditions, those who will thrive, will; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyẹ kò bá fín ẹyẹ ní'ràn, ojú ọrun tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì f'ara kan'ra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: Live and let live; always pursue a win-win scenario; no need to pull anyone down to rise.

proverbs.proverb: Ìṣẹ́ kì í ṣẹ́ ẹja kó má lè wẹ̀ nínú odò.
proverbs.translation: A fish cannot experience so much deprivation as to be unable to swim in the river.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep up hope; tough times will not be forever; there is a limit to any challenge.

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù, kì í pa ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A stone thrown at a bird in anger cannot kill the bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired goals; master your emotions.

proverbs.proverb: Nǹkan tí èyàn ò ní í jẹ, kì í fi run imú.
proverbs.translation: Don't sniff, what you won't eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won't finish; finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: Tẹ̀tẹ̀ tí kò bá fẹ́ tẹ́ láwùjọ ẹ̀fọ́, á yẹra fún àwọn ewé kéwé.
proverbs.translation: The spinach that wouldn't want to be put to shame in the midst of other vegetables should steer clear of strange leaves.
proverbs.wisdom: The company we keep matters; show me your friend and I'll tell you who you are.

proverbs.proverb: Bí afọ́jú bá lóun yóò fọ́ni lójú, ó yẹ ká fura, nítorí tí kò bá mú nǹkan lọ́wọ́, ó lè tẹ nǹkan mọ́lẹ̀
proverbs.translation: If a blind man threatens to make you blind, be wary; if he has nothing in his hands, he may have something under his feet.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; underestimate no one

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́ kọ́ ni oògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate; radical responses should be applied with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà bá ńgbáni ká máa rọ́jú, bó pẹ́ bó yà ìgbà ńbọ̀ wá gbani.
proverbs.translation: If a season is not so good, persevere; the good season would soon come.
proverbs.wisdom: Persevere and keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ aláṣetì; aláṣeyọrí là ńkí.
proverbs.translation: No one appreciates a person who abandons a task, but the one who completes it.
proverbs.wisdom: Endeavour to finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò á mọ ọpẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever can reason well will understand why he or she should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Always maintain an attitude of gratitude.

proverbs.proverb: Iná l'ọmọ aráyé lè pa; kò s'ẹ́ni tó lè pa èéfín.
proverbs.translation: Man can only put out fire, no one can put out smoke.
proverbs.wisdom: He or she may only be hindered, but no one can keep a good person down permanently; keep up hope.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ ló lésì, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ làá fèsì sí.
proverbs.translation: There is always an appropriate response to every statement, but it's not every statement that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused and prioritise; not all issues deserve attention.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ṣe ohun tó dun'ni lóòní le ṣe ohun tí yóò dùn mọ́'ni l'ọ́la.
proverbs.translation: Whoever hurts one today, may still be a source of blessing  to one, tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; write-off no one.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dé ejò mọ́ fìlà ká jayé ire.
proverbs.translation: One cannot put on a cap with a snake in it, and be at peace.
proverbs.wisdom: Crucial issues must be promptly addressed.

proverbs.proverb: Àdán tó sùn sí ìdí ọsàn, kò rí he, bèlèté odídẹrẹ́ tó lóun jí dé.
proverbs.translation: The bat that slept all night by the orange tree found no orange, not to mention the parrot that claimed it came early before dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Be prompt to exploit opportunities; don't be presumptuous.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í s'òótọ́ inú, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni má d'ayọ̀, báyé ẹni bá burú ìwà èèyàn ló yẹ ká wò.
proverbs.translation: A honest life cannot but end well; if a life remains unpleasant, the person's character need to be examined.
proverbs.wisdom: Character often determines experience.

proverbs.proverb: Mo gbọ́n tán, mo mọ̀ọ́ tán, lagbọ́n ò ṣe lóró bí oyin.
proverbs.translation: Wasps' claim to be the wisest and best is why they have less potent venom than bees.
proverbs.wisdom: Arrogance and pride do impose limitations.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would carefully dismember an ant would see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience can achieve the seemingly impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Tí irọ́ bá tan iná, kò lè so èso rere.
proverbs.translation: Even if a lie glows (and blooms), it can't yield good (and enduring) fruits.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is founded on deceit seldom lasts.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọ́mọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom: Prevention is better than cure; Good to look for help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence by seeking the cause.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà tí èèyàn tọ̀ tó ṣubú, bí èèyàn bá ní sùúrù, èyàn lè tọ̀ọ́ là.
proverbs.translation: A path that one treads and fails, with patience, one may well tread it to success.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no closed or impossible case; be patient and persistent.

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to glitter must pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ àánú Olúwa kì í ṣú.
proverbs.translation: God's mercy never runs out.
proverbs.wisdom: Never give up; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìbàjẹ́ ènìyàn, kò lè dá iṣẹ́ Olúwa dúró.
proverbs.translation: Man's wicked acts cannot nullify God's work (or purpose).
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; it is not over yet.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fura sí ẹni tí a ńbá rìn; ẹni tí a bá ńfura sí, a kì í bá irú wọn rìn.
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't be suspicious of those we associate with; those we are suspicious of should not be our close associates.
proverbs.wisdom: Build trust; don't be paranoid; be positive and forward-looking.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó torí òtútù fi ọmọ'rí odó yá iná, kò gbọdọ̀ máa retí ati jẹ iyán.
proverbs.translation: Whoever chose to burn the pestle to warm himself because of cold, should not be looking forward to eat any pounded yam.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions come with consequences; what goes around will eventually come around.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tó n'íbẹrẹ tí kò ní lópin.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing with a beginning that won't have an ending.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; no issue can remain intractable forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ò tó'ràwọ̀ ni kúrò lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, káyé ó rí mi.
proverbs.translation: Only a less than sparkling star strives for attention.
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure in who you are.

proverbs.proverb: Kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ tó bá ńsùn, kò lè rí ogbe àkùkọ já jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A sleeping fox won't get to eat a cock's comb.
proverbs.wisdom: Promptly take advantage of opportunities; no complacency.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot know God's name (or really know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is a present help, for those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kótópó gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, bí ìfẹ́ bá wà láàárín wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is good enough for 20 friends, if there is love among them.
proverbs.wisdom: With love, virtually nothing is impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Wọ́n ní kí olókùnrùn ṣe 'tó' ó lóun ò lè ṣe 'tó tò tó'.
proverbs.translation: A sick man who was asked to merely say 'to', profusely insisted he can't say 'to to to'.
proverbs.wisdom: Be efficient; don't waste time and energy rejecting what would have taken far less to accept.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá fi pẹ̀lẹ́ ṣe ilé aláre, àfàìmọ̀ kó má padà wá di ilé ẹlẹ́bi gbẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: If one is in the right and is not cautious enough, one may well end up being in the wrong.
proverbs.wisdom: Reactions should be commensurate to actions; radical responses are quite often counterproductive.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dámọ̀nràn àti tà'kìtì lágbàlá ọ̀bọ, nítorí ọ̀bọ fúnrara rẹ̀ ọba òkìtì ni.
proverbs.translation: Never toy with somersaults in the vicinity of a monkey; monkeys, themselves, are experts at somersaulting.
proverbs.wisdom: Remain modest and circumspect; make no public show of your weaknesses.

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wàá ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Complex issues need to be patiently handled; be patient.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sínú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun, eventually, the shade will come (when the sun sets).
proverbs.wisdom: Tough times never last; persistence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní sùúrù, ohun tí kò tó, ṣì ńbọ̀ wá ṣẹ́kù.
proverbs.translation: If we are patient, whatever is insufficient would be excessive, soon enough.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó fi irọ́ fẹ́ ìyàwó, kì í fẹ̀ ìyàwó ọ̀hún pẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever marries a woman based on false pretences won't keep the woman for long.
proverbs.wisdom: Personal integrity counts.

proverbs.proverb: Àgùtàn tó bá bá ajá rìn á jẹ ìgbẹ́, ajá tó bá bá ewúrẹ́ rìn á jẹ èpo iṣu.
proverbs.translation: A sheep that moves with dogs will eat faeces and a dog that moves with goats will eat yam peelings.
proverbs.wisdom: Show me your friends...; we reflect the company we keep.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ńbáa lùú, áḿbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow still had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his on a tree (branch) and sauntered away.
proverbs.wisdom: No complacency.

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ ló ṣeé dá ṣe; owó ò ṣeé dá ná.
proverbs.translation: Only work may be carried out alone; money cannot be spent alone.
proverbs.wisdom: Be generous, be willing to share.

proverbs.proverb: Olójú kan kì í mọ'yì Ọlọ́run, à fi tí nǹkan bá gbọ̀n sí i.
proverbs.translation: A person with only one good eye is seldom thankful to God, until a speck enters the eye.
proverbs.wisdom: Be ever grateful.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ìpọ́njú là ńm'ọ̀rẹ́; ọjọ́ tó bá burú la ńm'ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: True friends are known during times of deprivation; when things are really rough is when we'd know those who truly care.
proverbs.wisdom: Difficult times have one good use: they point out those who truly care.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìtàkùn bá lè pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n á mú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants could unite, they would tie up an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Unity is crucial; together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo èèyàn oníwà tùtù kọ́ lonínúure.
proverbs.translation: It is not everyone with quiet disposition who is kind-natured.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Àkìtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A refuse dump that's intolerant of filth won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; no one is perfect.

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tí Ọlọ́run ò ṣe fún, à fi ẹni tó bá ni tòun ò tó.
proverbs.translation: There is no one God has not blessed; except the person who insists his or her blessing is not enough.
proverbs.wisdom: We've all been blessed, albeit in different degrees; we all have reasons to be grateful.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó bá máa kan ará ilé, kan ará oko, ìwọ̀nba l’ẹni kan ńd’ojú kọ ọ́ mọ.
proverbs.translation: A matter that affects everybody should be cautiously confronted singlehandedly by one person.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't turn a general problem into a personal one.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńgun ẹṣin, kó sọ ìpàkọ́ mọ ní'wọ̀n, nítorí ìbẹ́kẹ́ṣẹ́ ẹṣin á máa la’ni mọ́’lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is on a horse should be moderate in flinging his or her head backward, as horses do very well throw their riders.
proverbs.wisdom: Those in priviledged positions should remain humble.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't pour away the water in the trough simply because the cloud rumbles.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; don't count your chickens before they are hatched.

proverbs.proverb: Dúrógbadé tó ńdẹ isà ejò, bí kò bá dúró gba adé, ọmọ mí ì yóò gbà á.
proverbs.translation: A royal heir who unconscionably places himself at risk hunting snakes may find his position taken by another.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid needless risks

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ẹni máa là, á rí ìyọnu.
proverbs.translation: Whoever desires to succeed would experience challenges.
proverbs.wisdom: Challenges are not unusual; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyé ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: The Creator hasn't forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀ kékeré létí àwo gbẹ̀gìrì, bó bá kúrò lójú, kô lè tán lọ́kàn.
proverbs.translation: A tiny turd on the edge of a plate of bean soup may be overlooked by the eyes, but certainly not by the heart.
proverbs.wisdom: Watch the indiscretions; they may be overlooked, but they are seldom forgotten.

proverbs.proverb: Ọrùn kúkurú la fi ńyá owó, ọrùn gígùn la fi ńsan án.
proverbs.translation: We borrow money with a short neck and repay with a long one.
proverbs.wisdom: It is usually quite convenient to borrow, but people become reluctant when it is time for repayment.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá ara ẹni tan kí á f'ara ẹni n'ítan ya.
proverbs.translation: To be a relation of someone is no excuse to become a liability to the person.
proverbs.wisdom: Do not abuse your privilege; there is a limit to everything.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó dá ẹnu, ti dá ohun tí kálukú máa fi sí i.
proverbs.translation: God who created the mouth had also created what we would all be putting into it.
proverbs.wisdom: Worry less; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Agídí inú ejò, ni kì í jẹ́ kí ejò rí ọmọ gbéjó.
proverbs.translation: Snake's stubborness is why it seldom enjoys the company of its offspring.
proverbs.wisdom: Broad-mindedness and flexibility are crucial; shun needless stubbornness.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ́ láàpa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè láàpa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Àdàbà ńpa ògèdè bí ẹni pé ẹyẹlé ò gbọ́, ẹyẹlé gbọ́, tí tiri ló ńtiri
proverbs.translation: The dove chants incantations believing that the pidgeon is oblivious of them; the pidgeon is quite aware, but simply ignores them.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; those with wicked intents ultimately self-destruct

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà àdó ló ńmú àdó mu ẹ̀jẹ̀; akèrègbè baba àdó, omi ni wọ́n fi ńpọ́n.
proverbs.translation: The tiny gourd is associated with bloodletting of its own volition; the fully grown (and far bigger) gourd is simply used for fetching water.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately our character, whether good or bad, is by choice

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsá fún iṣẹ́ tó lóun ò fẹ́ẹ́ ya akúùṣẹ́, tani ìṣẹ́ tọ́ sí bikòṣe ẹni tó ńsá fún iṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Someone, who avoids work, claims he or she does not want to be poor; who else deserves poverty, if not the one who avoids work.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà lẹ̀sìn; bí a bá ṣe mọ̀ọ́ hù ni í ṣeé gbe’ni.
proverbs.translation: Character is like religion; how good one's character is, that is how well it favours one.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character brings favour.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá bò, ló ńníyì.
proverbs.translation: What is covered up (or concealed) is what gets treated with honour.
proverbs.wisdom: What's always available loses value; familiarity breeds contempt.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ó bá pe abuké, kí a pe abuké, àbí èwo ni bọ̀ọ̀dá tẹ́hìn ńdùn.
proverbs.translation: Call someone a hunchback if you must, but why refer to him as 'the man with a backache'.
proverbs.wisdom: Call a spade a spade; no hypocrisy.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Be careful what you do when angry; avoid rash decisions

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi táa ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: We should focus on where we are going, not where we had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; be forward-looking; leave the past in the past.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló ńkán àrẹ̀mọ tó ńdé fìlà, tó bá gorí ìtẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀, yóò dé ohun tó ju àrán lọ
proverbs.translation: A royal heir who's wearing a cap is simply in haste; he'd get to put on far more than velvet caps when he ascends his father's throne.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; don’t force issues before their time

proverbs.proverb: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kọ́ l'oníṣẹ́, à fi ẹni tó bá fi orí tì í  d'ópin.
proverbs.translation: A good worker is not necessarily the one who starts something, but the one who finishes it.
proverbs.wisdom: To start anything is not as crucial as seeing it through to completion.

proverbs.proverb: Èéfín ni ìwà; kò ṣeé fi pamọ́.
proverbs.translation: Character is like smoke; it cannot be covered up.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can pretend  to be what he is not for very long.

proverbs.proverb: Bí báaṣe ò bá báa ṣe é, kíni báalá fẹ́ rí pọ́nlá?
proverbs.translation: If those who are to support do not provide needed support, what would those who are to join in the licking get to lick?
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give and take.

proverbs.proverb: Kíkéré l'abẹ́rẹ́ kéré, kì í ṣe mímì fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: Though a needle may be tiny, it’s not to be swallowed by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; underestimate no one.

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ tó ńṣu s’ínú íṣasún, sàréè rẹ̀ ló ńbàjẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A hen that is defecating inside a cooking pot is simply messing up its final resting place.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, we will reap whatever we sow.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yangan bàtà lójú ẹni tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Don't brag about shoes around someone who has no legs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be courteous, considerate and tactful.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tó máa gun ẹṣin, tí kò ní ju ìpàkọ́, tí kò bá fẹ́ẹ́ jùú, ẹṣin tó ńgùn a jẹ́ kó jùú
proverbs.translation: No one will ride a horse and not fling his head backward; even if he doesn't want to, the horse will make him do it
proverbs.wisdom: Our attitude is often influenced by our peculiar situation

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnu kìnìún lowó wà.
proverbs.translation: Money resides right in the lion's mouth.
proverbs.wisdom: Fortune favours the bold.

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ ńjẹ yangan, ó ńmu omi ó ńgbé ókúta mì, ó tún ńsunkún àìléyín; ṣé òbúkọ tó léyín ńjẹ irin ni?
proverbs.translation: Hens eat corns, drink water and swallow stones, yet lament lacking teeth; do goats eat pieces of iron with theirs?
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; shun greed.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbà ò sí ní ìdí ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́; ẹni tí yóò jẹran níláti ṣetán àti ṣe ọdẹ.
proverbs.translation: There is no seniority in sharing the squirrel's meat; whoever wants to share must be prepared to hunt.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no shortcut to reaping, beyond sowing; we must sow, in order to reap.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà ìpọ́njú là ńm'ọ̀rẹ́; ọjọ́ tó bá burú la ńm'ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: Times of deprivation show true friends; tough days reveal those who truly love us
proverbs.wisdom: Difficult times help identify those who truly care.

proverbs.proverb: Kàǹga tó jìn kì í pariwo.
proverbs.translation: A deep well is seldom noisy.
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure in who you are; empty vessels can be needlessly noisy.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ò re Ejìnrìn, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin town, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: No one (and nothing) is irreplaceable; there's always a way out; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Àjùmọ̀bí kò kan ti àánú, ẹni orí rán sí'ni ló ńṣe'ni lóore.
proverbs.translation: Kindness won't necessarily come from one's siblings, but those divinely sent to one.
proverbs.wisdom: Help, when it comes, may not necessarily be from expected sources; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks inordinately will misspeak; inordinate talk is how the king's mother referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate; self-discipline & self-control are sometimes needful

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá rí ẹni bá là, ọ̀là kì í yá.
proverbs.translation: If there is no one to toil with, efforts to build wealth can be stifled.
proverbs.wisdom: Good support and networks matter.

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò làgbàdo ńwọ ilẹ̀; tó bá jáde tán ló ńdi onígba aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The maize seed does go into the soil naked; it only ends up with multiple peelings after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà kan ńlọ, ìgbà kan ńbọ̀; ẹnìkan ò lo ilé ayé gbó.
proverbs.translation: One season goes another comes, no one can dominate forever.
proverbs.wisdom: Do or die mindset is needless; change is inevitable; nobody dominates forever.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot really be certain of who loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag to achieving any goal.

proverbs.proverb: Bíbíre kò ṣeé fi owó rà.
proverbs.translation: A good pedigree cannot be bought with money.
proverbs.wisdom: It's not everything that wealth can confer.

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwò rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom: A season goes, another comes; no condition is permanent.

proverbs.proverb: À pa àímú délé ni kò jẹ́ kí a mọ̀ pé ológbò ńse ọdẹ.
proverbs.translation: Its penchant for not bringing home its games, is why the cat is not known for hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; have a plan for the future.

proverbs.proverb: Àjànàkú kọjá a mo rí nkan fìrí, bí a bá rí erin ká wí.
proverbs.translation: The elephant is beyond what's said to be seen in a jiffy; it's presence is unmistakable.
proverbs.wisdom: Give honour to whom it is due.

proverbs.proverb: Àìtètè mú olè, olè á mú olóko.
proverbs.translation: A thief (in a farm), if not promptly apprehended, would (be emboldened to) apprehend the farm owner.
proverbs.wisdom: Tardiness can be costly; falsehoods not promptly challenged would pose as truths.

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù kí ojú kan tóbi tó, ojú méjì sàn ju ojú kan lọ.
proverbs.translation: No matter how big an eye is, two eyes are better than one.
proverbs.wisdom: Alone we can do so little, but together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is man’s adornment.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character is adorable and attractive.

proverbs.proverb: Oníbárà ńbá olè é bọ̀; a fún un lówó tán, ó tún ńyọjú wọlé.
proverbs.translation: The street beggar, still peeking into the house even after collecting his alms, is clearly beside himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó láṣọ tí ò léèyàn, ìhòhò ló wà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever has clothes, but has no one is naked.
proverbs.wisdom: Human relationships are crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Àǹfàní ò nírù, bó bẹ́ wọ igbó, kò sí ohun táà á fi fàá.
proverbs.translation: Opportunity has no tail, once it dashes into the forest, there's nothing with which to pull it out.
proverbs.wisdom: Exploit opportunities promptly; make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó kọ̀ tí ò sin Ọlọ́run, òrìṣà kékèèké tí ò to Ọlọ́run ló máa sìn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever refuses to worship God, will end up worshipping lesser gods.
proverbs.wisdom: To reject God is to accept the consequence of His absence.

proverbs.proverb: Ewúrẹ́ ò lóun ò ṣe ọmọ ìyá àgùtàn; àgùtàn ló ní ìyá òun kò bí dúdú.
proverbs.translation: The (black) goat did not object to being the sheep's sibling; it's the sheep that insisted its mother has no black offspring.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue cooperation and collaboration.

proverbs.proverb: Dídùn ló dùn tá ńbá ọ̀rẹ́ jẹ ẹ̀kọ; ti ilé oge to óge é jẹ.
proverbs.translation: We eat with a friend because of the pleasure of friendship not because we lack.
proverbs.wisdom: Foster friendships: people are more important than things.

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ tí ò fín igbá mọ, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun.
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver no longer carves calabashes, those already carved would remain.
proverbs.wisdom: We are outlived by our legacy.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo inú ìgò, ó di àwòmọ́jú fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The corns kept in a bottle are viewed with disdain by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: People are wont to belittle what is out of their reach.

proverbs.proverb: Igi tí a bá torí rẹ̀ gbodì nínú igbó, ó yẹ kó lè ṣe iná fún'ni yá.
proverbs.translation: A tree on whose behalf one was in contention in the forest, should  at least provide one with warmth at the fireplace.
proverbs.wisdom: One good turn deserves another.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànná yànná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹ̀rẹ̀ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, can't enjoy the glittering (beauty) of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run kì í ṣe nǹkan, kó má fi àyè ọpẹ́ sí i; tó bá pá baba lórí, a sì fi irùngbọ̀n rọ́po.
proverbs.translation: God never does anything, without leaving rooms for thanksgiving; if he makes a man bald, he'd give the beard in replacement.
proverbs.wisdom: We'd always have reasons to be thankful to God.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ̀ọ́ gún mọ̀ọ́ tẹ̀, kí iyán ewùrà má lọ́mọ.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be so adept at pounding and stirring water yam that it won't have lumps.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; tolerance is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyé ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God hasn't forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; never give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ikú fẹ́ pa alápatà ó ńkígbe; ọmọ ẹranko tó ti dá lóró ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: Death stalks the butcher and he screams; what about the animals he's butchered?
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair and considerate; don't demand from others what you are unwilling to impose on yourself.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọdé kọ́ ilé, wọ́n ní ìyá rẹ̀ ló ràn án lọ́wọ́; ṣe òun nìkan ló ní ìyá ni?
proverbs.translation: A young man built a house, but the support of his mother was adduced as the reason; is he the only one with a mother?
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure to give credit where credit is due.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Be careful what you do when angry; avoid rash decisions

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lè  jẹ ìyà tó kún ahá, kò lè gbádùn ọrọ̀ tó kún inú àmù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever cannot endure a cup-filled deprivation cannot enjoy a pot-filled wealth.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast; be patient; no pain no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Adùn-ńṣe bí ohun tí Ọlọ́run lọ́wọ́ sí, aṣòroóṣe bí ohun tí Ọlọ́run kò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: As easy to accomplish as what God sanctions, and as difficult to do as what He opposes.
proverbs.wisdom: If God is in it, it will work out.

proverbs.proverb: Omidan tó lóun yóò jẹ oyè abọ́bakú, òwe burúkù ló ńpa fún Olorì láàfin
proverbs.translation: A maiden, who insists she'd take up the title reserved for those to be buried with the king when he dies, is really sending a nasty message to the queen.
proverbs.wisdom: Not all positive gestures are noble; be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀kàn mọ̀kàn loyè ńkàn; oyè tó kan ará Ìwó, ó ńbọ̀ wá kan ará Ẹdẹ.
proverbs.translation: Chieftaincy titles are given, turn by turn; the title given to an Iwo indigene would eventually be given to someone from Ede.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is in phases; be patient.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We are inseparable from our character.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot pretend to be who we are not for very long; ultimately, our character will show through.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà, mọ̀sá, ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ.
proverbs.translation: It is crucial that warriors know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to retreat would perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Know when to pursue, defer or quit

proverbs.proverb: Òkú kì í fi ara pamọ́ fún ẹni tó máa sin ín; a kì í fi ara pamọ́  fún alámọ̀ràn ẹni.
proverbs.translation: Corpses never hide (their nudify)  from whoever would bury them; never keep (the details of) your issues away from whoever would advice you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be open & candid to those whose help you need.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá ńsọ òkò sí adìyẹ igba, òkò ló máa sọ tí ilẹ̀ á fi ṣú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is throwing stones at two hundred hens (to kill them simultaneously), would be at it until the evening.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't flock shoot.

proverbs.proverb: Òkèlè gbígbẹ pẹlu irọrun, ó sàn ju wàrà tó kún fún ìyọnu lọ.
proverbs.translation: Dry morsel with peace is better than milk that is full of stress.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue peace over wealth.

proverbs.proverb: Ìfẹ́ fọ́jú; obìnrin táa bá fẹ́ràn kì í ní àlébù.
proverbs.translation: Love is blind; a woman one really loves seldom has faults.
proverbs.wisdom: If it is wrong, love will not see it.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ aráyé ńpàtẹ́wọ́ fún yànmùyánmú, inú ẹ̀ ńdùn, kò mọ̀ pé òun ńfi ikú ṣeré ni.
proverbs.translation: The mosquito rejoices when people clap for it, oblivious that it is toying with death.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ńsá nínú omi gbígbóná, tó bá sáa lọ́dàn ni, kò ní wọ omi gbígbóná.
proverbs.translation: Had the frog been as fleet-footed in the fields as it is now inside hot water, it won't have found itself in the hot water.
proverbs.wisdom: A stitch in time saves nine.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ìyẹ́ adìyẹ nílẹ̀, kí a wá fi ìrù àkèekèé rin etí.
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't have the feather of a hen within reach and choose to scratch one's inner ear with a scorpion's stinger.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid needless exposure to high risks.

proverbs.proverb: Ewúrẹ́ tó lè kígbe jù, kọ́ lebi ńpa jù.
proverbs.translation: The goat that bleats the loudest, is not necessarily the most famished.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance isn't necessarily reality; noise or drama isn't necessarily substance.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí àtùpà ṣe lè lágbára tó, kò lè ríran rí ìdí ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No matter how strong a lamp is, it cannot light up it's base.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another; no one is completely self-sufficient.

proverbs.proverb: Dídákẹ́ lerin dákẹ́, àjànàkú ló lẹgàn.
proverbs.translation: The elephant is simply unpretentious; its lordship of the forest isn't in doubt.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't mistake meekness for stupìdity.

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa náwó kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: Generosity does not necessarily make one poor nor does stinginess make one rich.
proverbs.wisdom: Be generous.

proverbs.proverb: Pẹ́pẹ́yẹ ńlérí lásán ni, kò ní kọ.
proverbs.translation: The duck is simply being pretentious; it won't crow.
proverbs.wisdom: Be undaunted; most things we worry about never happen.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a difficult fellow, he will yet remain difficult.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; do your best and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn.
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes loving relationships endure.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; tolerance is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: An emaciated child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time; be patient.

proverbs.proverb: Ìpàdé ahọ́n àti ẹnu kò sẹ̀hìn Olódùmarè.
proverbs.translation: The meeting  of the tongue with the mouth is not beyond God's knowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: No sustainable success is beyond God.

proverbs.proverb: Òkété gbàgbé ìbòsí, ó dé igbá alátẹ ó ká'wọ́ lérí.
proverbs.translation: The rat, unmindful of the noise (of those stalking it), raised its paws in regret later, when offered for sale (dried and roasted).
proverbs.wisdom: A stitch in time saves nine; forewarned is forearmed.

proverbs.proverb: Ká bá olówó gbé kó máà fi owó mọ'ni, ó sàn ju ká bá òtòṣì gbé kó máa kó'ni l'ádìyẹ tà lọ.
proverbs.translation: It is better to live with a stingy rich man than with a poor man who swindles one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Bí iná bá ńjó ilé ẹrú, bí a kò bá paá, a máa padà wá jó ilé ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: If we do not put out the fire that engulfed the home of a slave, it would raze down that of the master's son soon enough.
proverbs.wisdom: If an issue is not promptly contained, it easily exacerbates.

proverbs.proverb: Àdáníkànrìn ejò ló ńjẹ ọmọ ejò níyà.
proverbs.translation: It's penchant for moving alone is what exposes the snake to life-threatening risks.
proverbs.wisdom: Isolation can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọ́mọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom: Prevention is better than cure; good to look for help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó pamọ́ lójù èyàn, kedere ló hàn sí Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is hidden to man, is glaringly clear to God.
proverbs.wisdom: God is all-seeing and all-knowing.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a tó dé ibi tí à ńlọ, a lè kọ́kọ́ dé ibi tí a kò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Before getting to our ultimate destination, we may have to get to where we'd rather not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic and focused.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tó ní tí òun bá dàgbà orí eyelé lòun máa máa jẹ, orí eyelé ọ̀hún ò ní jẹ́ kó dàgbà.
proverbs.translation: A child who says he would be eating pigeons' heads, once he's grown up, would find those same pigeons' heads won't let him grow up.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive and discreet.

proverbs.proverb: Àdán tó sùn sí ìdí ọsàn, kò rí he, bèlèté odídẹrẹ́ tó lóun jí dé.
proverbs.translation: The bat that slept by the orange tree found no orange, not minding the parrot that claimed it came early.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; be quick to exploit opportunities.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ òkèèrè, bí kò bá lé kan, yóò dín kan.
proverbs.translation: Words heard from afar, if they are not overstated, they will be understated.
proverbs.wisdom: Hearsays are quite often, unreliable.

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn kan lè ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́, gbólóhùn kan náà lè tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: One sentence can mess up a discussion, and one sentence can make it better.
proverbs.wisdom: Words are powerful; use them with care.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Any fish that sleeps would get eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom: No complacency; keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Màlúù tí kò ní ìrù, Ọlọ́run ni í lé eṣinṣin fún un.
proverbs.translation: It is God who invariably fends off flies for a cow that has no tail.
proverbs.wisdom: God helps those who can't help themselves.

proverbs.proverb: Gbẹ́ kòtò ọ̀tá à rẹ mọ ní'wọ̀n; kó má baà jẹ́ wípé ìwọ gan an ló máa jìn síbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Don't dig too deep a ditch for your enemies; you may well find yourself falling into it.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial; life can be full of twists and turns.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńwá ẹni tó jẹ bàbá ẹ̀ lówó, àfàìmọ̀, kó má pàdé ẹni tí bàbá ẹ̀ jẹ lówó.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is seeking his father's debtors, may well find his father's creditors.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial; life can be full of twists and turns.

proverbs.proverb: Àì fi’ni pe’ni, àì f’èèyàn p’èèyàn, ló ńmú ara oko sán bàǹtẹ́ wọ ìlú.
proverbs.translation: Sheer lack of civility is why a farm dweller would dare come to town in a loincloth.
proverbs.wisdom: Decries lack of decorum and courtesy.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Never carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Never compare your life with anyone's; stay in your lane and be focused.

proverbs.proverb: Ti imú yé imú, tí imú fi ńfọn.
proverbs.translation: The nose has its reasons for being noisy when blown.
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons; give them the benefit of the doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò gbọ́ ti ẹnu ẹ̀gà ló ńsọ pé ẹ̀gà ńpatótó, tẹnu ẹyẹ lẹyẹ kúkú ńsọ.
proverbs.translation: Only those who have not heard out the palmchat bird would deride it as needlessly noisy; it is simply making its point.
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons; give them the benefit of doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgba àkàṣù bàbà lábọ̀ ọjà, ni ìgba ẹ̀sun iṣu gbọọrọ lábọ̀ oko.
proverbs.translation: The receipt of a fat wrap (of corn meal) from the market commends the receipt of a long roasted yam from the farm.
proverbs.wisdom: No free lunch; give to get and sow to reap.

proverbs.proverb: Ará oko tí yóò jẹ búrẹ́dì, á fi èsúrú ránṣẹ́ sílé.
proverbs.translation: A farm dweller who desires to eat bread, need to send some aerial yams home.
proverbs.wisdom: No free lunch; give to get and sow to reap.

proverbs.proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jìyà, bó bá dàgbà, á tó ọdẹ ẹ́ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: À ti mọ ọ̀nà ẹ̀dá, kò ṣ'ẹ̀hìn Olódùmarè.
proverbs.translation: Man's quest to succeed is not without God's knowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Sustainable success need's God's support.

proverbs.proverb: Àlùya ni ìlù ọ̀fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A free drum gets beaten until it's bursted.
proverbs.wisdom: What's cheap gets easily abused.

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wàá ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; complex issues need to be patiently and carefully handled.

proverbs.proverb: Eku tó bá fi jùà jùà wọ isà, jùà jùà náà ló máa bá jáde.
proverbs.translation: A mouse that carelessly rushed into its burrow will carelessly rush out, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to handle issues with patience and care.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀ẹ̀kan latannimú, í tan’ni í mú, mọ.
proverbs.translation: Only once do those who deceive others to catch (or take advantage of) them, succeed.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, deception does not pay.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí àyè ìlẹ̀kẹ̀ ní ìdí adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: There are no rooms for (ornamental) beads on the waist of a hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Some things are simply inappropriate, even if desirable.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi gbogbo là ńdá'ná alẹ́; ọbẹ̀ ló kàn dùn ju'ra wọn lọ.
proverbs.translation: Supper is prepared in every home; some stews are simply tastier than others.
proverbs.wisdom: We are all endowed and blessed, albeit in different ways.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ńbáa lùú, áńbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ.
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow, had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his drum on a tree and walked away.
proverbs.wisdom: Be diligent; no complacency.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot know God's name (or really know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is a present help.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni táa fi jẹ baálẹ̀ tí kò ba ìlú jẹ́, kò ní pẹ́ dé adé ọba.
proverbs.translation: A village head who did not mess up the village, would soon find himself crowned a king.
proverbs.wisdom: Whoever is faithful in a minor responsibility would be offered a major one.
