proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ayé ńyọ lẹ́nu, sàn ju ẹni ayé gbàgbé lọ.
proverbs.translation: A person who is pestered and kept busy is better than one ignored or forgotten.
proverbs.wisdom: It is better to be kept busy than to be ignored.

proverbs.proverb: Kí èèmọ̀ wọlé, kí ajá máà gbó, gbogbo ajá kọ́ lara ẹ̀ lé gbàá.
proverbs.translation: Not all dogs can be silent and not bark in the face of a strange act.
proverbs.wisdom: Not everyone can tolerate an objectionable act.

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò leè já.
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they cannot fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún'ni.
proverbs.translation: What's sweet, what's much and what endures are all from God.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, all blessings are from God.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnu ẹyẹ ni ńpẹyẹ; ẹnu òrofó ní ńpa òrofó; òrofó bímọ mẹ́fà, ó ní ilé òun kún ṣọ́ṣọ́.
proverbs.translation: The boasts of birds are their undoing; so it is with the wild pidgeon that hatches just six chicks and brags that it's nest is completely filled up.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ dùn tó bá pọ́n, sùgbọ́n tó bá pọ́n láàpọ́njù, oúnjẹ ni fún ẹyẹ oko.
proverbs.translation: Banana is sweet when ripe, but it would become food for the birds, if it becomes overripe.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ igbó kì í mọ fífò ọ̀dàn.
proverbs.translation: Forest birds are seldom adept at flying on grasslands.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows it all; we are differently endowed.

proverbs.proverb: A ní kí ohun tó wun'ni wá, ohun tó dára ló yọjú; bó bá dára bí kò wun'ni ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: We beckon on what we desire, but the beautiful pops up; what if it's beautiful but it's not desired?
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever we desire is always what we prefer; beauty is in the eye of the beholder.

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ kọ̀rọ̀, ẹni kan kì í sáa nígbangba.
proverbs.translation: No one dries out in the open a clothing item that should be dried in the closet.
proverbs.wisdom: A confidential issue should be treated as such.

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ ńbá àṣá ṣeré, ó rò pé ẹyẹ oko lásán ni.
proverbs.translation: The chick gullibly plays with the hawk believing it to be an ordinary bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ ńbá àṣà ṣeré, ó rò pé ẹyẹ oko lásán ni.
proverbs.translation: The chick gullibly plays with the hawk believing it to be an ordinary bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Ìrèké ò níbùdó, ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: Sugarcane has no specific place of sprouting; every situation suits a hardworker just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; answers may be so complete as to be overwhelming.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks inordinately will misspeak; inordinate talk is how the king's mother referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate.

proverbs.proverb: Èlírí kì í ṣe ọmọ eku, bí ìran ẹ̀ ṣe mọ ni.
proverbs.translation: The tiny mouse isn't an offspring of the rat; its smallness is genetic.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a kò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot really be certain of who loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi táa ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: We should focus on where we are going, not where we had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Focus and be forward-looking; let go of past failures and hurts.

proverbs.proverb: Ìjẹ àná dùn mọ́ ehoro; ó di ọjọ́ kejì, ó mú ikún dání.
proverbs.translation: The last feast was quite satisfying to the rabbit; the next feast, it brought the squirrel along.
proverbs.wisdom: We easily repeat a good experience and refer others, as well.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ́ lápa láì lápá, béèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè lápa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A leaf cannot drop off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing takes God by surprise; nothing surprises God.

proverbs.proverb: Bó lé lógún ọdún táa ti fi adẹ́mun jọba kò ní yé ọrùn ọ̀pẹ wò.
proverbs.translation: Even after 20 years as a king, the palmwine tapper won't cease his nostalgic gaze at the palm tree.
proverbs.wisdom: Old habits die hard.

proverbs.proverb: Ó rọrùn fún ológbò mẹ́ẹ̀rin láti se ọdẹ eku kan; ìgbà tí wọ́n bá fẹ́  pín in, ni yóò di ìjà
proverbs.translation: Four cats may easily hunt a rat; to share it when caught is what would put them at loggerheads.
proverbs.wisdom: The more those who'd share a reward are, the less satisified they'd be.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó sùn là ńjí, a kì í jí apirọrọ; táa bá jí apirọrọ kò ní dáhùn.
proverbs.translation: One wakes the person who's truly asleep, not one pretending to be asleep; if woken, the person pretending won't respond.
proverbs.wisdom: An unnatural situation often results in unexpected outcomes.

proverbs.proverb: Tí irọ́ bá lọ lógún ọdún, ọjọ́ kan ṣoṣo ni òótọ́ yóò ba.
proverbs.translation: If a lie has gone for twenty years, the truth would catch up with it in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Truth will prevail, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Ìyànjú l'àgbẹ̀ ńgbìn, elédùà nìkan ló mọ b'íṣu ṣe ńta.
proverbs.translation: Farmers merely sow efforts; God alone knows how the yams are formed.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God  hasn't forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Olè tó gbé kàkàkí ọba, níbo ni yóò ti fun ún?
proverbs.translation: Where will the thief who stole the king's bugle blow it?
proverbs.wisdom: Some actions are self-limiting and ultimately self-defeating.

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kì í níyì lọ́ọ̀sán, ṣugbọ̀n a máa gbayì lọ́jọ́ alẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A lamp is seldom valued in the afternoon, but it is appreciated at night.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a right time for anything.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èkúté bá fara balẹ̀, á jẹ nínú owó ológbò.
proverbs.translation: If the rat can be reasonably calm (and patient), it would have a taste of the cat's wealth.
proverbs.wisdom: With patience, virtually nothing is impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá ní kí ọ̀rẹ́ òun má jọba, ni kò ní lọ́ọ̀rẹ́ ọba.
proverbs.translation: Whoever insists his friend won't become a king will not have a king as a friend.
proverbs.wisdom: Every choice comes with one or more consequences.

proverbs.proverb: Igi ò lè gbé abẹ́ igi, kó rúwé.
proverbs.translation: A tree shielded by another cannot sprout leaves.
proverbs.wisdom: Move forward; get off your comfort zone.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a ṣe lóore tí kò dúpẹ́, bí ìgbà tí ọlọ́ṣa kó ni lẹ́rù lọ ni.
proverbs.translation: A person who receives an act of kindness, but remains unthankful, is comparable to a robber.
proverbs.wisdom: Atittude of gratitude is crucial; be grateful, always.

proverbs.proverb: Gbàdàmọ́sí tó lóun yóò lu ìlù àkóbá, Aíbùkí tí yóò jo kì í ṣe ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: A fellow who insists on beating a drum implicatingly, ought to know that the person who's to dance to it, isn't stupid.
proverbs.wisdom: Take no one for a fool; respect everyone.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn ò bá rìn ní igbèrí irọ́, wọn kì í paá mọ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: If one is not within the vicinity of falsehoods, one cannot be falsely accused.
proverbs.wisdom: Personal integrity is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tó máa gun ẹṣin, tí kò ní ju ìpàkọ́; tí kò bá fẹ́ẹ́ jùú, ẹṣin tó ńgùn a jẹ́ kó jùú
proverbs.translation: No one will ride a horse and not fling his head backward; even if he doesn't want to, the horse will make him do it.
proverbs.wisdom: Quite often attitudes are imposed rather than deliberate

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he's appeased, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rash decisions.

proverbs.proverb: Wọ́n fi ẹ́ ṣe ẹẹ̀kẹrin ìlú, ò ńbínú, ṣé ẹ̀yin mẹ́rin lẹ̀ wà ní ìlú ni?
proverbs.translation: You were displeased when designated the fourth (to the throne) in a town; are there only four of you in the town?
proverbs.wisdom: Lack of contentment can be self-limiting

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọmọdé bá rí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tó ńgun ẹṣin lọ níwájú, ó yẹ kó wo ẹgbẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀ tó ńfi ẹsẹ̀ rìn bọ̀ lẹ́hìn.
proverbs.translation: A youngster who sees his or her peers riding horses ahead, would do well to look back to see his or her father's mates trudging behind.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò mọ bí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ ṣe là, á sá àsákú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever unduly bothers about his peers' successes, will hustle himself to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó làná, tó lòní, kò leè ni ọ̀la; Ọlọ́run nìkan ló lọjọ́ gbogbo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever called the shots yesterday and calls the shots today, cannot call the shots tomorrow; only God calls the shots at all times.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tí a máa fún lọ́kọ́, tí kò ní ro oko sí ọ̀dọ̀ ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: There is no one who's given a hoe, who would not first weed his own farm.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone would take advantage of a good opportunity.

proverbs.proverb: Àìdùn ọsàn lèyàn ò mu púpọ, bí ọsàn bá dùn a ó mu igba.
proverbs.translation: Only when oranges are not sweet does one eat a few; if they are sweet, everyone would devour lots of them.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone would take advantage of a good opportunity.

proverbs.proverb: Ìjọ oníìbínú kan kì í kún.
proverbs.translation: A gathering convened by an easily riled person seldom gets filled up.
proverbs.wisdom: Uncontrolled temper can be self-destructive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìbínú kì í pẹ́ sọ ilé olówó rẹ̀ dahoro.
proverbs.translation: Anger hardly takes long to render its bearer's home desolate.
proverbs.wisdom: Uncontrolled temper can be self-destructive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá fẹ́ jẹ iṣẹ́ ẹ̀ pẹ́, máa ńbínú mọ níwọ̀n ni.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to long enjoy the fruits of his labour ought to be moderate in his anger.
proverbs.wisdom: Uncontrolled temper can be self-destructive.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ọdún mẹ́ta, kò tó ẹni tí à ńgbára a lé, ọ̀tá oṣù mẹ́fà kò tó ẹni tí à ńsà à lóògùn
proverbs.translation: A friend of three years is not one to be completely trusted and an enemy of six months is not one to be grievously assaulted.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be impulsive; be moderate

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fura sí ẹni tí a ńbá rìn; ẹni tí a bá ńfura sí, a kì í bá irú wọn rìn.
proverbs.translation: Don't be suspicious of anyone you associate with; don't associate with anyone you'd be suspicious of.
proverbs.wisdom: Build trust.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú sí ẹni tí a kò rí.
proverbs.translation: Don't get mad at someone you have not seen (or heard out).
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant and fair; don't be impulsive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ọ̀rẹ́ dà kó má ṣe bínú; ẹni abínibí ńda'ni
proverbs.translation: Those betrayed by friends shouldn't be offended; even siblings do betray one another.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; forgive and forget. Don't hold on to hurts.

proverbs.proverb: Àjùmọ̀bí kò kan ti àánú, ẹni orí rán síni ló ńṣe ni lóore.
proverbs.translation: Kindness won't necessarily come from one's siblings but those divinely sent to one.
proverbs.wisdom: Help may not necessarily come from expected sources.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo èèyàn oníwà tùtù kọ́ lonínúure.
proverbs.translation: It is not everyone with a quiet disposition who is kind-natured.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo àwọn tó ńsun kọ́ ló ńhanrun.
proverbs.translation: It is not all those who are sleeping who snore.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lè ṣe bí aláàárù l'Óyìngbò, kò lè ṣe bí Adégbọrọ̀ l'Ọ́jà Ọba.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is unwilling to be a hired hand at a local market, can't hope to become a wealthy merchant at a major one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be willing to start with what you have, right where you are.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànnà yánná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹ̀rẹ̀ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire and the searing glare of the sun, can't hope to enjoy the glittering beauty of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: God's messenger never grows weary.
proverbs.wisdom: God cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni
proverbs.translation: Even if one pounds yam and prepares yam flour meal for a difficult fellow, he'd yet remain difficult.
proverbs.wisdom: Regardless of what you do or say, a difficult fellow would remain difficult; do your best and move on

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán nínú ewé, táa se ọbẹ̀ nínú èpo ẹpà, ẹni máa yó, á yó.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound yam in a leaf and prepare the soup in a groundnut pod, those who would be full, would be.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Agídí ọkàn ló ńṣíwájú ìṣubú.
proverbs.translation: Stubbornness of heart is what precedes a fall.
proverbs.wisdom: Be broad-minded and flexible.

proverbs.proverb: Òkìtì tí ọ̀bọ ta tí kò nílárí, ni eégún ta tó ńgba owó rẹpẹtẹ.
proverbs.translation: The same somersaulting that does not profit the monkey is the one that nets the masquerade lots of money.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what works for one may not necessarily work for another.

proverbs.proverb: Agbọ́n tí géńdé rí tó ńsá, ni aláàmù ńṣà jẹ lẹ́ẹ̀gbẹ̀ ògiri.
proverbs.translation: The same wasps that humans run from, are what lizards gladly feed on.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; what proves a challenge to one, may be an opportunity to another.

proverbs.proverb: Ìtàkùn tó ní kí erin má wọ odò, t'òun terin ní wọ́n máa jọ lọ.
proverbs.translation: A creeping plant that wants to obstruct the elephant would find itself in the river with the elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Be determined; nothing triumphs like determination.

proverbs.proverb: Àkísà tó bá ti dá gbére àtàn, igba abẹ́rẹ́ kò lè dáa dúró.
proverbs.translation: Two hundred needles cannot stop a piece of rag headed for the refuse dump.
proverbs.wisdom: Be determined; nothing triumphs like determination.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo tí kò bá fẹ́  fi ara gba iná, àti di gúgúrú rẹ́, á nira.
proverbs.translation: The grains of corn that refused to be exposed to heat would find their becoming pop corns difficult.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Kí ìkòkò ọbẹ̀ tó lè sọ̀rọ̀ síta, ìdí rẹ̀ á gbóná.
proverbs.translation: Before a pot of soup can make any sound, it's base will have to be heated up.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọmọdé bá ńgé igi ní inú igbó, àwọn àgbà ló mọ ibi tó máa ré sí.
proverbs.translation: When a youngster is cutting a tree in the forest, the elders are the ones who know where the tree would fall.
proverbs.wisdom: Understanding the ramifications of an action comes with maturity.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun ti owó bá pa tí kò kú, ọ̀nà ọ̀run ni kò mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whatever refused to die when fatally attacked by money must lack the direction to heaven.
proverbs.wisdom: Money

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí owó bá lù tí kò dún, kò lóhùn ni.
proverbs.translation: Whatever made no sound when beaten by money, must lack the capability to make sound.
proverbs.wisdom: Money

proverbs.proverb: Owó ní tí òun ò bá sí ní ilé, kí wọn má dámọ̀ràn nǹkànkan lẹ́hìn òun.
proverbs.translation: Money insists that no idea should be considered in its absence.
proverbs.wisdom: Money

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ebi ò pa ri, kì í mọ iyì ayo; ẹni tí ò jẹ ìyà rí, kì í mọ iyì ọrọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever has never suffered hunger seldom appreciates satiation; whoever has never suffered lack hardly appreciates wealth.
proverbs.wisdom: We value whatever we've lacked.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá ńwá owó lọ, tí a bá pàdé iyì lọ́nà, ńṣe ló yẹ ká padà, nítorí tí a bá rí owó ọ̀hún tán, iyì làá fi rà.
proverbs.translation: Once you obtain honour while on a quest for wealth, you should cease the quest, as the wealth ultimately will be used to procure honour.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá gbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; it's not all issues that should command one's attention.

proverbs.proverb: Olóore l'ore ńwọ́ tọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Kindness follows the kind-hearted.
proverbs.wisdom: Generosity pays.

proverbs.proverb: Òkè lọwọ́ afúnni ńgbé; ìsàlẹ̀ lọwọ́ ẹni tó ńgbàá ńwà.
proverbs.translation: A hand that gives is always at the top; the one that receives stays underneath.
proverbs.wisdom: Generosity pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ọdẹ tó bá ṣiyèméjì, òun lẹranko ńpa.
proverbs.translation: An indecisive hunter easily gets killed by an animal (in the forest).
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive; indecision is quite often costly.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó bá ṣiyèméjì lọdẹ ńpa.
proverbs.translation: An indecisive animal easily gets killed by the hunter.
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive; indecision is quite often costly.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run kì í ṣe nǹkan, kó má fi àyè ọpẹ́ sí i; tó bá pá baba lórí, a sì fi irùngbọ̀n rọ́po
proverbs.translation: God never does a thing, without the rationale for thanksgiving; if he makes a man bald, he would give the beard in replacement.
proverbs.wisdom: There'll always be reasons to be thankful to God.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ gbé ọmọ sílẹ̀ ó gbé ọkọ pọ̀n, ó lọ̀rọ̀ ọkọ bàǹtà banta ni.
proverbs.translation: The frog dropped its baby to back its mate. "Husbands are crucial", it said.
proverbs.wisdom: Love is powerful; love can rationalise what may seem irrational.

proverbs.proverb: Obìnrin kì í dàgbà jù lọ́wọ́ ọkọ rẹ̀; bí eyín bá ku méjì lẹ́nu ìyá, ọmọge ni lójú baba.
proverbs.translation: A woman is never too old to her husband; even if she's lost all her teeth, a maiden she remains to her man.
proverbs.wisdom: Love is it; with love, other concerns pale.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a kò bá rí ẹni fi ẹ̀hìn tì, bí ọ̀lẹ là ńrí.
proverbs.translation: With nobody to lean on, one would seem lazy and irresponsible.
proverbs.wisdom: Good support and networks matter.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá rí ẹni bá là, ọlà kì í yá.
proverbs.translation: Without good networks, the efforts to build wealth can be stifled.
proverbs.wisdom: Good support and networks matter.

proverbs.proverb: Alágbẹ̀dẹ tó ńlu irin lójú kan, ó lóhun tó fẹ́ fàyọ ńbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A blacksmith who kept hitting an iron at a single spot, very well has his reasons.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people have their reasons.

proverbs.proverb: Ó lóhun tí ojú rí, kó tó máa ṣoje.
proverbs.translation: The tearful eyes have their reasons for being tearful.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people have their reasons.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú  ló  pẹ́ sí, àgàn ṣì ńbọ̀ wá di ọlọ́mọ.
proverbs.translation: It merely seems delayed, the barren will one day put to bed.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient and keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ló pẹ́ sí, ìpàdé kì í jìnnà.
proverbs.translation: A meeting date is not far off, it merely appears so.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient and keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí òjò ò pa, tí òrùn ò pa, ebi ni yóò paá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not beaten by rain, and is not beaten by sun would get beaten by hunger.
proverbs.wisdom: Be diligent.

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ l'oògùn ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Work is the veritable cure for poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Dilligence pays

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: No one throws away the water in the trough simply because the cloud rumbles.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous.

proverbs.proverb: O gbọ́ ìró ìbọn, o ńfọ  ìṣasùn; o mọ̀ bọ́lọ́dẹ  pa  ẹran, tàbí  kò pa  ẹran?
proverbs.translation: You heard gun shots and hurriedly washed your cooking pot; do you know whether or not the hunter caught any game?
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous.

proverbs.proverb: Oníbàtà ló ńfojú di ẹ̀gún; ẹni táa bá fẹ́ ló ńfojú dini.
proverbs.translation: A man with shoes despises thorns; those we love are the ones who take us for granted.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò mọ bí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ ṣe là, á sá àsákú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever unduly frets about his peers' relative successes, will hustle himself or herself to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't compare yourself to anyone.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ tó fi ara rẹ̀ wé igún, ẹ̀yìn ààrò ni í ńsùn.
proverbs.translation: A bird that compares itself to vultures will end up (being roasted) at the fireplace.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't compare yourself to anyone.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Don't carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't compare yourself with anyone.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a ńbọ láti fi rú ẹbọ ìlú, là ńpè lọ́ba.
proverbs.translation: A person fed and pampered in order to be offered for sacrifice for (the good of the town) is the one called a king.
proverbs.wisdom: Positions of responsibilities can be demanding.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìlú bá ńdàrú, ààfin lórí ti máa ńfọ́ wọn.
proverbs.translation: When a town is in turmoil, the resulting headache is borne by those in the palace.
proverbs.wisdom: Positions of responsibilities can be demanding.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní gbé ọba mì kì í ní ìsinmi.
proverbs.translation: Whoever gets crowned a king cannot have rest.
proverbs.wisdom: Positions of responsibilities can be demanding.

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ rere ṣàgbà oyè.
proverbs.translation: A good name is superior to ranks or titled positions.
proverbs.wisdom: A good name is priceless.

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ rere, sàn ju wúrà àti fàdákà lọ.
proverbs.translation: A good name is better than gold and silver.
proverbs.wisdom: A good name is priceless.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńse ọbẹ̀, kò tí ì kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't lose hope; nothing is beyond God.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tí à ńjẹ tí kì í tán, à fi ọlá Ọlọrun.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing we are eating that won't eventually be exhausted, but the blessing of God.
proverbs.wisdom: Only the blessings from God endure.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹnìkan bá ní ogún èèyàn ò  lè mú  òun, bí wọ́n  ba fi  ogóojì  dán an wò, kó  léèwọ.
proverbs.translation: If someone brags that he cannot be apprehended by 20 men, if 40 men were tried on him, it is not out of place.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid grandstanding; don't brag.

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ńsá nínú omi gbígbóná, tó bá sáa lọ́dàn ni, kò ní wọ omi gbígbóná.
proverbs.translation: Had the frog been as fleet-footed in the fields as it is in the hot water pot, it won't have entered the pot.
proverbs.wisdom: A stitch in time saves nine.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní kí a dijú kí ẹni burúkú kọjá, a kò ní mọ ìgbà tí ẹni rere máa lọ.
proverbs.translation: If we were to close our eyes so as not to see a wicked person as he or she passes by, we may well miss a good person as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; be forward-looking.

proverbs.proverb: Èkù ò mọ̀ pé ara ńta àdá.
proverbs.translation: The handles hardly appreciate that cutlasses are stressed out.
proverbs.wisdom: Be careful to appreciate kind gestures received from others.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńkó ẹyin jẹ kò mọ̀ pé ìdí ńro adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: Those eating eggs seldom appreciate how tough egg-laying can be to the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Be careful to appreciate kind gestures received from others.

proverbs.proverb: Ọkùnrin tó rí ogun tó sá, tó rí iṣẹ tí kò ṣe, bí wọn bá kó ilé láàdúgbò, wọn a fura sí i.
proverbs.translation: A man who refuses to go to war and refuses to work would be suspected in a case of theft in the neighbourhood.
proverbs.wisdom: Be engaged; do what you can with what you have right where you are.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dé ejò mọ́ fìlà ká jayé ire.
proverbs.translation: One cannot put on a cap with a snake in it, and be at peace.
proverbs.wisdom: Be mindful of intolerably high risks.

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ tó lóun ò fi tàṣá se, ọ̀sán gangan làṣá yó gbe.
proverbs.translation: A chick that is unmindful of the the hawk would find itself being preyed upon in broad daylight.
proverbs.wisdom: Be mindful of intolerably high risks.

proverbs.proverb: Ijó tí kì í ṣe ijó ẹni, ìwọ̀n là ńkó gbẹ̀du ẹ̀ lójúde ọba.
proverbs.translation: One should be modest in a dance one is not adept at, in the presence of the king.
proverbs.wisdom: Remain modest; don’t make a show of your ignorance.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dámọ̀nràn àti tà'kìtì lágbàlá ọ̀bọ, nítorí ọ̀bọ fúnrara rẹ̀ ọba òkìtì ni.
proverbs.translation: Never toy with the idea of doing a somersault in the vicinity of a monkey, as monkeys themselves, are experts at somersaulting.
proverbs.wisdom: Remain modest; don’t make a show of your ignorance.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú, tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour; once satisfied, they easily lord it over their benefactors.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: Tí owó ò bá tí ì dé ọwọ̀ èyàn, ìwà oníwà ló máa máa hù.
proverbs.translation: You will never know who anyone really until he or she becomes wealthy.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; you never know who someone really is, until he or she no longer needs you.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó jẹ iṣu tán, tó tún jẹ èbù iṣu pẹ̀lú rẹ̀, kí ló máa jẹ láàmọ́dún?
proverbs.translation: What will a farmer who ate his yams along with the yam seeds, eat next year?
proverbs.wisdom: Always maintain a view of the future.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi dẹ́kun ẹ̀rin rínrín, tó bá ṣe igúnnugún, á wokoko mórí ẹyin ni.
proverbs.translation: If what took laughter away from the crow had befallen the vulture, it would have been stuck on its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people are uniquely  different.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lè jìyà tó kún ahá, ò lè gbádùn ọrọ̀ tó kúnnú àmù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever cannot endure a cup-filled deprivation cannot enjoy a pot-filled wealth.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no sweat, no sweet.

proverbs.proverb: Àìrìn jìnnà làìrí abuké ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́, bí a bá dé igbó tó tó igbó, àá rí èranko tó ńtiro.
proverbs.translation: Not going far enough (into the forest) is why one hasn't seen a humpy squirrel, if one could get deep into the forest, one would find an animal that tiptoes.
proverbs.wisdom: Exposure broadens the mind

proverbs.proverb: A kò lè tìtorí pé kí ẹgbẹ́ ó máà tú, kí ọmọde máa sọ àgbà ní ìkó kó dákẹ́.
proverbs.translation: The desire to keep a group intact is no reason to expect an elderly person to keep mute when assaulted by a youngster.
proverbs.wisdom: Decorum is it; there is a limit to everything.

proverbs.proverb: A kò lè tìtorí pé a fẹ́ kí ẹṣin kú iṣẹ́, ka wá ní k'órí adé rin'sẹ̀
proverbs.translation: We cannot ask the king to trek, simply because we want to appreciate the horse.
proverbs.wisdom: Decorum is it; there is a limit to everything.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá ńsọ òkò sí adìyẹ igba, òkò ló máa sọ tílẹ̀ á fi ṣú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is throwing stones at two hundred hens, would be at it until the evening.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't spread yourself thin.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn ò bá tọ̀ sójú kan, kì í hó.
proverbs.translation: If one does not urinate on a single spot, the urine won't foam.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't spread yourself thin.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A fish that sleeps would get eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep moving; inactivity can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a dé igbó kí a má fọ'hùn ló ńmú ẹyẹ oko ṣu síni lórí.
proverbs.translation: To remain silent in the forest is how bird droppings get to land on one's head.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep moving; inactivity can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Omi adágún a b'èérí lójú, èyí tó ńlọ tó nbọ ló ńmọ́.
proverbs.translation: Stagnant water is replete with dirt; it's the flowing stream that remains clean.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep moving; inactivity can be risky.

proverbs.proverb: Odò tó ńṣàn, kì í b'ojú w'ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: A flowing river never 'looks' back (or flows backward).
proverbs.wisdom: Be positive; be forward-looking.

proverbs.proverb: Sùúrù ni baba ìwà; àgbà tó ní sùúrù, ohun gbogbo ló ní.
proverbs.translation: Patience is the epitome of character; an elder who has patience, has everything.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá dúpẹ́ oore àná yóò rí òmíràn gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever gives thanks for past favours, will be granted another.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude commends increase.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi táa ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: We ought to focus on where we are going, not where we had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; be forward-looking; let go of past failures and hurts.

proverbs.proverb: Èrò làá rò, ká tó lè kọ́ ilé tó ga bí i dodo.
proverbs.translation: To build an exceedingly tall building requires prior proper planning.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; plan ahead.

proverbs.proverb: Adùn ńbẹ lẹ́hìn ewúro.
proverbs.translation: The bitter-leaf will end up sweet, ultimately.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; never give up.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ bá le títí, ó ńpadà bọ̀ wá rọ̀ ni.
proverbs.translation: Regardless of how long the plantain fruit has been hard, it would eventually become soft.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; never give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ayé tí ẹṣin kò jẹ, tí ìrù ìdí rẹ̀ bá ní sùúrù, á jẹ jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ (tó bá di ìrùkẹ̀rẹ̀).
proverbs.translation: What a horse never enjoyed in life, if it's tail can be patient, it will surpass it (as it becomes a flywhisk).
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò dodo làgbàdo ńwọ ilẹ̀, tó bá jáde tán ló ńdi onígba aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The maize seed does go into the soil absolutely naked; yet it ends up with multiple peelings after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá, akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: If we won't give up trying, our hustling will one day come to an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Be persistent; if you won't quit, you will win, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Tí akòko bá ńsọ igi láì jáwọ́, bó pẹ́ bó yá, á rí nǹkan gbà lọ́wọ́ igi.
proverbs.translation: If the woodpecker would persist in its ceaseless pecking of a tree, it would get something from the tree, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Persist; if you won't quit, you will win, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò á mọ ọpẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever can reason well will understand why he ought to be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain a heart of gratitude.

proverbs.proverb: Oloore l'ore ńwọ́ tọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Kindness follows the kind-hearted.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness pays.

proverbs.proverb: Orí ò mọ ibùsùn, ì bá tún ibẹ̀ ṣe láàárọ̀.
proverbs.translation: We do not know our future for certain, else we would have prepared for it, well ahead of time.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows the future, for certain.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọrùn àgbáǹréré ti gùn tó, kò lè rí ọjọ́ ọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: Despite how long the neck of a giraffe is, it cannot see into the next day.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows the future, for certain.

proverbs.proverb: Kò ṣe, kò jẹ́ kí Olúrè ṣe; ó gba ọkọ́ Olúrè; ó gba àdá Olúrè; kí ní kí Olúrè fi ṣiṣẹ́?
proverbs.translation: You won't do it, yet you won't let Olure; you grabbed Olure's cutlass; you seized Olure's hoe; with what will Olure work?
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive; no vacillation.

proverbs.proverb: A ní kí ẹ jẹẹ́, ẹ léegun lásán ni; a ní kí ẹ sọọ́ nù; ẹ lẹ́ran díẹ́ wà ńbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Asked to eat it, you complained it's just a mere bone; yet when asked to throw it away, you insisted it still has a little meat.
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive; no vacillation.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀bẹ kì í mú, kó gbẹ́ èkù ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A knife cannot be so sharp as to carve its handle.
proverbs.wisdom: We do need one another; no one is completely self-sufficient.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí àtùpà ṣe lè lágbára tó, kò lè ríran rí ìdí ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No matter how strong a lamp is, it cannot light up it's base.
proverbs.wisdom: We do need one another; no one is completely self-sufficient.

proverbs.proverb: Ká máa náwó, kò ní kí ówó ó tán; ká ya ahun, kò ní kí owó ó pọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: Generosity does not necessarily make one poor nor does stinginess make one rich.
proverbs.wisdom: Be generous; kindness pays.

proverbs.proverb: Oloore l'ore ńwọ́ tọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Kindness follows the kind-hearted.
proverbs.wisdom: Be generous; kindness pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ò tó'ràwọ̀ ni kúrò lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, káyé ó rí mi.
proverbs.translation: Only a less than sparkling star strives for attention.
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure in who you are; be less attention-seeking.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ojú bá fi ara balẹ̀ á rí imú.
proverbs.translation: If the eyes can be careful enough, they would see the nose.
proverbs.wisdom: Caution helps make difficult tasks achievable, ultimately.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would carefully dismember an ant would see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience can achieve the seemingly impossible.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a fi ijó gba Àwà; kí a fi ìwà gba Àwà; à ní ki a sá ti gba Àwà.
proverbs.translation: Whether we save Awa town through dancing exploits or through good behaviour, to save Awa town is what's crucial.
proverbs.wisdom: A focus on goals rather than methods.

proverbs.proverb: Ká lọ́ aṣọ mọ́ ìdí, ká lọ́ ìdí mọ́ aṣọ, kí ìdí ṣáà má ti gbófo.
proverbs.translation: Whether we tie a wrapper round the waist or tie the waist round a wrapper, to ensure the waist is not naked is what's crucial.
proverbs.wisdom: A focus on goals rather than methods.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí yóò ròhìn ogun, kò ní kú sí ogun.
proverbs.translation: A warrior who will tell war tales won't perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Àkùkọ tí yóò kọ lágbà, àṣá kò ní gbe lóròmọ adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A cock that would crow when grown, won't be picked up by a hawk as a chick.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Tèmi ò ṣòro, tí kì í jẹ kí ọmọ alágbẹ̀dẹ ní idà.
proverbs.translation: “Mine is not an issue.” believed by the blacksmith is why he ends up not owning a sword.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; no procrastination.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; no procrastination.

proverbs.proverb: À ńgba ọmọ ẹja lọ́wọ́ ikú, ó ní ekòló títóbi ẹnu ìwọ̀ yẹn gan an lòun fẹ́  jẹ.
proverbs.translation: We are trying to save a fishling from death, yet it is insisting that the big worm (used as a bait) on the fish hook is really what it would like to eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Crass naivety can be dangerous.

proverbs.proverb: Afọwọ́fọnná kì í mọ́wọ́ dúró.
proverbs.translation: No one packs live coals with his hands and maintain steady hands.
proverbs.wisdom: Stressful situations cannot be endured for long.

proverbs.proverb: Omi gbígbóná kì í pẹ́ lẹ́nu, nínú káa gbée mu tàbí káa tuú dànù, àá fọwọ́ mú'kan nínú u méjèjì.
proverbs.translation: Hot water cannot be long in the mouth; either it is swallowed or spat out, one has to be chosen.
proverbs.wisdom: Stressful situations cannot be endured for long.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńlé nǹkan níwájú, ńfi àwọn nǹkan míràn sẹ́hìn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is pursuing something ahead, is actually leaving some other things behind.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag...

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag...

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́ọ̀pá èwo ni tèpè? Amúni ńjẹ́ amúni; èwo ni pé "Oò ní bọ́ ńnú ẹ̀"?
proverbs.translation: Police officer, why the curse? Arrest if you must, but why rain a curse that "You won't escape this"?
proverbs.wisdom: Be independent; avoid conflict of interest situations.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ebi bá ńpa’ni ká wí, àbí èwo ni bóo bá kọlù mí, màá gba iṣu ọwọ́ ẹ jẹ.
proverbs.translation: If one is hungry one should say so or what's with if you bump into me I will collect your yams and eat.
proverbs.wisdom: No hidden agenda; say what you mean.

proverbs.proverb: Àgùtàn ò ní sùn láàrín ajá, kó má fi ara kó eégbọn.
proverbs.translation: A sheep won't lie in the midst of dogs and not get dog ticks on itself.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, we cannot but reflect the company we keep.

proverbs.proverb: Àgùtàn tó bá bá ajá rìn á jẹ ìgbẹ́, ajá tó bá bá ewúrẹ́ rìn á jẹ èpo iṣu.
proverbs.translation: A sheep that moves with dogs will eat faeces and a dog that moves with goats will eat yam peelings.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, we will reflect the company we keep.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá máa kọ oúnjẹ, tẹran tẹran lèyàn ńkọ̀ ọ́.
proverbs.translation: If one would refuse a meal, one would refuse it along with the pieces of meat on it, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: No half measures.

proverbs.proverb: Pátá pátá là ńfọ́jú, kùnà kuna là ńdẹtẹ, ojú àfọìfọtán ìjà ló ńmú wá.
proverbs.translation: Affliction of blindness and leprosy should be total; partial blindness does give rise to contention.
proverbs.wisdom: No half measures.

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù kéèyàn lówó tó, kò lè ra ilé ayé tán.
proverbs.translation: No matter how wealthy anyone is, he or she cannot buy up the whole world.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no need to pull anyone down to rise; the world is big and endowed enough for all.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹyẹ kò bá fín ẹyẹ níràn, ojú ọrun tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì fara kanra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no need to pull anyone down to rise; the world is big and endowed enough for all.

proverbs.proverb: Báà fi ọ̀pá bọ ìlù, a à ní mọ̀ pé ìlù lóhùn tó dùn.
proverbs.translation: Had we not beaten the drum with the stick, we won't have known that the drum has a sweet 'voice'.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep up hope; an adverse event may well be a stepping stone.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá dúpẹ́ oore àná yóò rí òmíràn gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is thankful for past favours, will be granted another.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain an attitude of gratitude.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni táa fún lóbì tí ò ṣọpẹ́, báa fun lọ́mọ kò ní ṣàna.
proverbs.translation: A person who isn't thankful when given kolanut won't pay his dues if given a bride.
proverbs.wisdom: Whoever is not thankful for small favours won't be grateful for major ones.

proverbs.proverb: Àìṣedédé ará ayé, ló ńmú’ni rántí ará ọ̀run.
proverbs.translation: The untoward behaviour of those alive is what makes one pines for those who had gone.
proverbs.wisdom: Leave a good legacy.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í kán'jú lá ọbẹ̀ gbígbóná, tí a bá kán'jú lá'bẹ̀ gbígbóná, á bó ni l'ẹnu, tí ọbẹ̀ bá wá tutù tán, ẹnu wo la ó fi j'ata.
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't sip hot soup in haste, else it will hurt one's mouth. And with what mouth will one eat when the soup cools?
proverbs.wisdom: Patience is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Ti iná ba ńjó lóko, màjàlá a ṣe òfófó.
proverbs.translation: When a farm goes aflame, the cinders fly home to bear the tale.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing can be permanently covered up.

proverbs.proverb: Àdàbà ò náání àńkùn'gbẹ́, pápá ńjó ẹyẹ oko fò lọ.
proverbs.translation: The dove has no regard for the bush being set on fire; once the bush is aflame, the bird would simply fly away.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; always have a plan B.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó gbọ́n bí ajá kò sí; ajá mọ ọmọ tirẹ̀ ńfún lọ́mú, ó mọ ti òdù ọ̀yà ńkì mọ́'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No animal is as crafty as the dog; it knows how to breastfeed its offsprings and pounce on those of the grass-cutters.
proverbs.wisdom: Shun unbridled craftiness and self-centeredness.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó ya wèrè bí ẹṣin ò wọ́pọ̀; ẹṣin fi ọmọ rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ ó ńgbé ọmọ ọlọ́mọ kiri.
proverbs.translation: No other animal is as stupid as the horse; it left its offspring unattended and carried those of others around.
proverbs.wisdom: Mind your affairs.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó roko tí kò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró
proverbs.translation: A farmer ploughed his farm, but refused to plant any corn & claimed he's hurting the ground squirrel; he hasn't hurt the squirrel, but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Vindictive actions can be self-defeating

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that wants to become palm oil would have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always price tag.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; answers may be so complete as to be overwhelming.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ńbáa lùú, áńbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow still had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his on a tree (branch) & walked away.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines

proverbs.proverb: Àdán tó sùn sí ìdí ọsàn, kò rí he, bèlèté odídẹrẹ́ tó lóun jí dé.
proverbs.translation: The bat that slept overnight by the orange tree found no orange, not to mention the parrot that claimed it came early (in the morning).
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin town, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is indispensable.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a tó bímọ ẹnikan là ńbá ṣeré.
proverbs.translation: Before one had a child, one must have been playing with someone.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is indispensable.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó sọ̀rọ̀ tó dá'ràn, ọ̀rọ̀ náà ló máa sọ tó máa fi yọ ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got into trouble through spoken words would also get out of it though spoken words, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Use words wisely; they can be effective.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ rírọ̀ ni í yọ obì lápò, ọ̀rọ̀ líle nií yọ ọfà lápó.
proverbs.translation: Soft words can pull kolanuts from a pouch, as strong words do pull arrows from a quiver.
proverbs.wisdom: Use words wisely; they can be effective.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ọdún mẹ́ta, kò tó ẹni tí à ńgbára á lé, ọ̀tá oṣù mẹ́fà kò tó ẹni tí à ńsà à lóògùn
proverbs.translation: A friend of three years is not one to be completely relied upon and an enemy of six months is not one to be attacked with charms (or completely distrusted).
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rash decisions.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he's pacified, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rash decisions.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni máa fi ara yí ọlá, onítòhún á fi ara yí ẹ̀gbin; inú ẹ̀gbin lọlá ńgbé.
proverbs.translation: Whoever desires to be wealthy must be prepared to be inconvenienced, as wealth resides right inside of ‘filth’.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; no free lunch.

proverbs.proverb: Oò ṣá igi lọ́gbẹ́, oò ta ògùrọ̀ lọ́fà, o dé ìdí ọ̀pẹ, o ńgbẹ́nu s'ókè, ṣé ọ̀fẹ́ ló máa ńro ni?
proverbs.translation: You neither cut an oil palm, nor pierced a raffia, yet you opened your mouth under a palm for wine; does it drip freely?
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; no free lunch.

proverbs.proverb: Erin kì í fọn kí ọmọ rẹ́ fọn; ọmọ erin tó bá tó ó fọn á wá ìgbẹ́ tirẹ̀ lọ ni.
proverbs.translation: An elephant cannot trumpet and its baby would trumpet as well; a baby elephant that wants to trumpet ought to seek his own forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Humility is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Ilá kì í ga ju onírè lọ; èyí tó bá ga ju onírè lọ, a sì tẹ́ẹ ká.
proverbs.translation: An okro plant shouldn't outgrow the farmer; whichever does will be bent low to be plucked.
proverbs.wisdom: Humility is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Etí mẹta ò yẹ orí; èèyàn mẹ́ta ò lè dúró ní méjì-méjì.
proverbs.translation: Three ears do not suit the head; three people cannot stand in groups of twos.
proverbs.wisdom: Do things properly and in order.

proverbs.proverb: Etí kan ò yẹ orí, bàtà kan ò yẹ ẹsẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A single ear does not suit the head; a single shoe does not suit the feet.
proverbs.wisdom: Do things properly and in order.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó wọ bàtà nìkan ló mọ ibi tó ti ńta òun lẹ́sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Only the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.
proverbs.wisdom: Only those in the thick of an issue, can truly say how it feels.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ Ọ̀yọ́ ju ọlọ́yọ̀ọ́ lọ.
proverbs.translation: One cannot claim to be more proficient at Oyo dialect than an Oyo indigene.
proverbs.wisdom: Only those in the thick of an issue, can truly say how it feels.

proverbs.proverb: Ọdẹ tó ńbọ́ ṣòkòtò l'ẹ́ẹ̀bá ọ̀nà, ẹ má bawí, ọmọ ìjàlọ ni kí ẹ bi.
proverbs.translation: Don't blame the hunter for pulling his pants in public, but the soldier ants (in the pants).
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people have their reasons.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tó máa gun ẹṣin tí kò ní ju ìpàkọ́, tí kò bá fẹ́ẹ́ jùú, ẹṣin tó ńgùn a jẹ́ kó jùú
proverbs.translation: No one will ride a horse & not fling his head backward; even if he doesn't want to, the horse will make him do it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; we are often influenced by our peculiar situation

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí wọ́n fi jọba tó ńṣe àwúre, ṣé o fẹ́ di Olódùmarè ni?
proverbs.translation: Does a king who is still seeking good luck charms want to become God?
proverbs.wisdom: Be contented; be grateful.

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ ńjẹ yangan, ó ńmu omi ó ńgbé ókúta mì, ó tún ńsunkún àìléyín; ṣé òbúkọ tó léyín ńjẹ irin ni?
proverbs.translation: Hens eat corns, drink water and swallow stones, yet lament lacking teeth; do goats that have teeth eat pieces of iron with theirs?
proverbs.wisdom: Be contented; be grateful.

proverbs.proverb: Asúramú kò tẹ́ bọ̀rọ̀ bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: The diligent seldom falls into disrepute
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ ọ̀lẹ làyè ò lè gbà, ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: Only a lazy person has issues coping, every situation suits a hardworker, just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays

proverbs.proverb: Ogun àsọtẹ́lẹ̀, kì í pa arọ, tí arọ ọ̀hún bá gbọ́n.
proverbs.translation: A war announced well in advance won't kill a lame, if the lame is wise enough.
proverbs.wisdom: To be forewarned is to be forearmed.

proverbs.proverb: A ki ẹsẹ̀ kan bọ odò, ọ̀nì fàá, tí a bá fi ẹsẹ̀ méjèjì s'ódò kí la mọ̀ pó fẹ́ ṣẹ'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: One dipped a leg into the river and the crocodile snapped at it; who knows what would have happened had the two legs been dipped.
proverbs.wisdom: To be forewarned is to be forearmed.

proverbs.proverb: Bó lé lógún ọdún táa ti fi adẹ́mun jọba, kò ní yé ọrùn ọ̀pẹ ẹ́ wò.
proverbs.translation: Even after twenty years as a king, the palmwine tapper won't cease gazing at the palm tree, with nostalgia.
proverbs.wisdom: Old habits die hard.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a gún ata nínú odó, báa lọ̀ọ́ lórí ọlọ, iwa ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whether pounded in a mortar or ground on a grinding stone, pepper will remain inseparable from its character.
proverbs.wisdom: Old habits die hard.

proverbs.proverb: Ará oko tí yóò jẹ búrẹ́dì á fi èsúrú ránṣẹ́ sí ilé.
proverbs.translation: A farm dweller who wants to eat bread (from home), ought to send some aerial yams back home.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give and take; to reap, we should sow.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá da omi síwájú, á tẹ ilẹ̀ tútù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever waters the ground ahead of him, will get to step on a wet ground.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give and take; to reap, we must sow.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a re odò ká sùn, kí lará ilé yóò mu?
proverbs.translation: If we tarry long at the river, what would those at home drink?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Ìbínú kì í pẹ́ sọ ilé olówó rẹ̀ dahoro.
proverbs.translation: Anger hardly takes long to make the home of its bearer desolate.
proverbs.wisdom: Anger can be self-limitting.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá pẹ́ láyé, àá jẹ ẹran tó ju erin lọ.
proverbs.translation: With long life, we would eat far more meat larger in size than an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa tí àrá kó pa kó máa dúpẹ́
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain, but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò á mọ ọpẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever can reason well will understand why he ought to be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain a heart of gratitude.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá gba kádàrá, yóò gba kodoro.
proverbs.translation: Whoever won't accept his destined lot per time would end up with nothing.
proverbs.wisdom: Live in contentment.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá gba èyí tó mi, èyí tẹ́ mi ló máa gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever won’t accept contentment, has accepted dishonour.
proverbs.wisdom: Live in contentment.

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ ti ọmọdé nàró kọ́ nií rìn.
proverbs.translation: The day a baby stands up for the first time is not the same day he or she walks.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: An emaciated child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time; be patient.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó kọjú sẹ́nìkan, ẹ̀hìn ló kọ sẹ́lòmíràn, bí ìlù gángan
proverbs.translation: What faces someone backs another, like the talking drum.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes...

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ẹnikan ńpè ní ìyá, ìyàwó ló jẹ́ fún ẹlòmíràn
proverbs.translation: A woman referred to as a mother by someone is a wife to another.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes...

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Any fish that sleeps would get eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom: No complacency.

proverbs.proverb: Kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ tó bá ńsùn ò lè rí ogbe àkùkọ jájẹ.
proverbs.translation: A sleeping fox can't get to eat a cock's comb.
proverbs.wisdom: No complacency.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá fi àbòsí kó jọ, kì í pẹ́ túká.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is gathered through hypocrisy, hardly takes long to scatter.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ l'oògùn ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Work is the antidote of poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Dilligence pays

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tó rí ibi tí kò fọ́, ire ló ńdúró de
proverbs.translation: The eyes that didn't go blind upon seeing evil, are waiting to see good.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Ìyànjú l'àgbẹ̀ ńgbìn; elédùà nìkan ló mọ b'íṣu ṣe ńta
proverbs.translation: Farmers merely sow efforts; God alone knows how the yams are formed.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes...

proverbs.proverb: Nínú oore loore wà.
proverbs.translation: Kindness begets kindness.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness pays.

proverbs.proverb: Oloore l'ore ńwọ́ tọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Kindness follows the kind-hearted.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness pays.

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá fara pamọ́, ló máa ńgbó.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that grows to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest.

proverbs.proverb: Tí iṣu ẹni bá funfun, a máa ńfọwọ́ bòó jẹ ni.
proverbs.translation: If one is blessed with fine (harvested) yams, one ought to eat them under wraps.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ejò sí orí òrùlé sùn.
proverbs.translation: No one goes to sleep with a snake inside the roof of his house.
proverbs.wisdom: Attend to a serious issue promptly.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi iná sí orí òrùlé sùn.
proverbs.translation: No one goes to sleep with the roof of his house on fire.
proverbs.wisdom: Attend to a serious issue promptly.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ ò lè fi apá kan fò.
proverbs.translation: Birds cannot fly with one wing.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another; together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìtàkùn bá lè pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n á mú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants could unite, they'd easily tie up an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more

proverbs.proverb: Bíńtín lèkùrọ́, ṣùgbọ́n apá ọ̀bẹ ò ka.
proverbs.translation: The palm kernel is truly small, but it is beyond what the knife can handle.
proverbs.wisdom: Underestimate no one.

proverbs.translation: 2 The soldier ants are truly tiny (compared to a giant), but they may well compel anyone who ignores them to disrobe
proverbs.wisdom: Underestimate no one

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling, would find it difficult to rise.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain; no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Ìkòkò tó máa jẹ ata ìdí rẹ̀ á gbóná.
proverbs.translation: A pot that wants to consume pepper must expect its base to be heated up.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain; no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Èéfín ni ìwà; kò ṣeé fi pamọ́.
proverbs.translation: Character is like smoke: it cannot be covered up.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot pretend to be who we are not for very long.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A person and his or her character are inseparable.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot pretend to be who we are not for very long.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ti kò lágbà lẹ́hìn kìí sàyà gbàǹgbà níta gbangba
proverbs.translation: Anyone who lacks good backing shouldn't be unduly obtrusive in the public.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest

proverbs.translation: 2. A royal heir who unconscionably places himself at risk hunting snakes may find his position taken by another.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid needless risks.

proverbs.proverb: A kìí mọ̀ọ́ rìn mọ̀ọ́ yan kí orí má mì l'ọ́rùn
proverbs.translation: No one can be so good at walking & strutting that the head won't shake.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect

proverbs.proverb: A kìí mọ̀ọ́ sun mọ̀ọ́ sè kí etí eku máà jóná
proverbs.translation: No one can be so good at roasting & cooking rat that its ears won't be burnt.
proverbs.wisdom: No one's perfect

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ̀ọ́ gún mọ̀ọ́ tẹ̀ kí iyán ewùrà má lọ́mọ.
proverbs.translation: No one can be so good at pounding water yam and not have it lumpy.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà tí ijó bá yẹ'ni lá ńkúrò lójú agbo.
proverbs.translation: One should quit the dance floor when the ovation is loudest.
proverbs.wisdom: Know when to quit; be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹṣin bá dáni, a máa ńtun gùn ni
proverbs.translation: If one is thrown by a horse, one ought to remount the horse again.
proverbs.wisdom: Be persistent; try again, and again

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is man’s adornment.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character is adorable and attractive.

proverbs.proverb: Eré tí ajá bá fi ogún ọdún sá, ìrin fàájì ni fún ẹṣin
proverbs.translation: A race that takes dogs 20 years, is a leisurely walk to horses.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes...

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí ajá rí tó ńgbó, kò tó èyí tí ágùntàn fi ńṣe ìran wò.
proverbs.translation: What makes dogs bark, is nothing to what sheep ignore.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes...

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá gbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn
proverbs.translation: It's not all dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one attends to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused.

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ ńlá kọ́  lèyàn ńlá.
proverbs.translation: Clothes do not make a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A leaf won't drop off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing surprises God.

proverbs.proverb: Òní la rí, kò sí ẹni tó mọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: We are only certain of today; no one knows tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one; it is not over.

proverbs.proverb: Nínú ìkòkò dúdú, ni ẹ̀kọ funfun ti ńjáde.
proverbs.translation: Out of the black pot nonetheless comes the white pap (corn meal).
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one.

proverbs.proverb: Ó lóhun tí àgùntàn rí, kó tó dákẹ́ jẹ́jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: The sheep has its reasons for being noticeably quiet.
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons; be tolerant.

proverbs.proverb: Ti imú yé imú tí imú fi ńfọn.
proverbs.translation: The nose has its reasons for being noisy (when blown).
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons; be tolerant.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yangan bàtà lójú ẹni tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀
proverbs.translation: Don't brag about shoes around someone who has no legs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be considerate; be courteous; be tactful.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í tojú oníka mẹ́ẹ̀sán kàá.
proverbs.translation: Don't count the toes of someone with nine toes in his presence.
proverbs.wisdom: Be considerate; be courteous; be tactful.

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, akólòlò á pe 'baba'.
proverbs.translation: It may take long, but a stammerer would eventually pronounce 'father'.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.translation: 2. Let's be thankful to the neck for bearing the head; there are tissues around the head that do nothing.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain a heart of gratitude.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí èyàn ò bá ní í rà, kì í yọ owó rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't be haggling the price of what one won't buy.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won’t finish

proverbs.proverb: Nǹkan tí èyàn ò ní í jẹ, kì í fi run imú.
proverbs.translation: No one sniffs, what he or she won't eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won't finish.

proverbs.proverb: Kòkòrò tó ńjó lẹ́ẹ̀bá ọ̀nà, onílù rẹ̀ ńbẹ nínú igbó.
proverbs.translation: The insect dancing by the bush path has its drummer right in the bush.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: Àwòdì òkè kò mọ pé ará ilẹ ńwo òun.
proverbs.translation: The hawk hovering above is unaware that the people on the ground are watching it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá pẹ́ nígbó á rí ìríkúùrí.
proverbs.translation: Whoever tarries long in the forest, would have strange experiences.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid tardiness.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a kò bá fẹ́ nilé rẹ̀ ńjìnnà.
proverbs.translation: Only those we are not keen on visiting live afar off.
proverbs.wisdom: We always make time for what's crucial to us.

proverbs.proverb: Aláṣejù ajá ni í lépa ẹkùn.
proverbs.translation: Only an intemperate dog stalks the leopard.
proverbs.wisdom: Know yourself and be moderate; operate within your limits.

proverbs.proverb: Àìnísùúrù ìnàkí ló sọọ́ di ará inú igbó
proverbs.translation: Gorilla's impatience is what made it an inhabitant of the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; impatience is risky

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no end to learning.

proverbs.proverb: Òkèlè gbígbẹ pẹ́lù ìrọ̀rùn sàn ju wàrà tó kún fún ìyọnu lọ
proverbs.translation: Dry morsel with peace is better than milk that is full of stress.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue peace

proverbs.proverb: Ìfẹ́ fọ́jú; obìnrin táa bá fẹ́ràn kì í ní àlébù
proverbs.translation: Love is blind; a woman one really loves seldom has faults.
proverbs.wisdom: With love, other concerns pale

proverbs.proverb: Láníntán kan kò ní ni ìwo ẹṣin
proverbs.translation: No one can be so wealthy as to own the horn of a horse (since horses have no horns).
proverbs.wisdom: No one has it all made

proverbs.proverb: Pẹ́pẹ́yẹ ńlérí lásán ni, kò ní kọ.
proverbs.translation: The duck is simply pretentious, it won't crow.
proverbs.wisdom: Be undaunted; most things we worry about never happen.

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò lè já.
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they cannot fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that wants to become palm oil would have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó dá ẹnu, ti dá ohun tí kálukú máa fi síi
proverbs.translation: God who created the mouth had also created what we'd all be feeding it with.
proverbs.wisdom: Worry less

proverbs.proverb: Ajá ìsìnyì, ló mọ ehoro ìsìnyì ńlé.
proverbs.translation: Only the modern day dogs can chase the modern day rabbits.
proverbs.wisdom: Be current; update yourself constantly.

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́, kọ́ ni oògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Adopt radical solutions with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Onísùúrù ló ńfún wàrà kìnìún.

proverbs.wisdom: With patience, tough tasks often become achievable.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú ṣe lè bí àjànàkú, ló ṣe lè bí èèrà.

proverbs.wisdom: What's good for one, should be good for another

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá rí ẹni bá là, ọ̀là kì í yá
proverbs.translation: If we lack good network, the efforts to build wealth can be stifled.
proverbs.wisdom: Good support & networks matter

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wàá ruru.
proverbs.translation: Do not paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; complex issues need to be patiently handled.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni gbé ọkàn lé Olúwa kò ní jogún òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever places his hope on God won't hope in vain.
proverbs.wisdom: God never fails.

proverbs.translation: 2 People will present a facade of humility when seeking favour; once satisfied, they easily lord it over their benefactors
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin town, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is irreplaceable.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold is seldom appreciated until it gets lost.
proverbs.wisdom: The available is easily taken for granted.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yàgò fún ẹlẹ́ṣin àná.
proverbs.translation: No one gives way (or defer) to someone who used to own a horse.
proverbs.wisdom: The past is not as crucial as the future.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would patiently dismember an ant would see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ò tó'ràwọ̀ ni kúrò lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, káyé ó rí mi.
proverbs.translation: Only a less than sparkling star strives for attention.
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure in who you are.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ò kú, ìṣe ò tán.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is no end to what one can achieve.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í rẹ ológbò, kó má lè ṣe ọdẹ eku.
proverbs.translation: A cat cannot be so tired, that it won't be able to hunt for mice.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast; be persistent.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tí sùúrù sè, tí kò jinná.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing 'cooked' by patience that won't get done.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó láṣọ tí ò léèyàn, ìhòhò ló wà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever has clothes but lacks human relationships, is naked.
proverbs.wisdom: Human networks are crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnití kò bá fẹ́ ṣe àṣedànù kò lè ṣe àṣejèrè.

proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You can only be certain of who you love, but you cannot tell who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.translation: To concede to Raji at home fosters the concessions to Gbada in the farm.
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give & take

proverbs.translation: We need to focus on where we are going, not where we'd fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; be forward-looking

proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Stay focused.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí bíńtí ò tó, púpọ̀ yóò jìnnà sí i.
proverbs.translation: Abundance would be far from whoever is not contented with a little.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni máa jẹ oyin inú àpáta, kì í wo ẹnu àáke.

proverbs.translation: 2. Whoever wants to be wealthy must be prepared to be inconvenienced; wealth comes loaded with inconveniences.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èkòlò bá júbà ilẹ̀, ilẹ̀ á lanu.

proverbs.translation: Whoever pleads (his case) with God, won't need to beg any man.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, agogo tó lu méjìlá, ńbọ̀ wá lù kan.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í pẹ̀lú ọ̀bọ já'ko.
proverbs.translation: Don't join a monkey to roam the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't stoop low, aim high; don't descend low to do despicable things.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that wants to become palm oil would have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag...

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayer works.

proverbs.translation: 2 If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he's appeased the ants may not be
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rashness

proverbs.translation: What's sweet, what's much & what endures are all from God.

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ kan a máa yí ìpinnu ogún ọdún padà.

proverbs.translation: Only an indecisive animal gets killed by the hunter.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú ẹní máa là, á rí ìyọnu.

proverbs.proverb: Omi tó tán lẹ́hìn ẹja ló sọọ́ di èrò ìṣasùn
proverbs.translation: Absence of water's backing is what made the fish an item in a cooking pot.

proverbs.translation: Things can't be so bad for a hunter that he'd pull his gun on a cat.

proverbs.translation: Anger hardly takes long to render its bearer's home desolate.

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.

proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no sweat, no sweet.

proverbs.proverb: Kòkòrò tó ńjó lẹ́ẹ̀bá ọ̀nà, onílù rẹ̀ ńbẹ nínú igbó
proverbs.translation: The insect dancing by the bush path has its drummer in the bush
proverbs.wisdom: Look beyond the obvious

proverbs.translation: 2. A wicked man with up to six different ways to hurt others, will invariably hurt himself with one or two.
proverbs.wisdom: What goes around comes around

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí òjò ò pa, tí òrùn ò pa, ebi ni yóò paá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not beaten by rain nor the sun will be beaten by hunger.
proverbs.wisdom: Be diligent.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà ò ní jìn kó má lóòpin.
proverbs.translation: No matter how far a road is, it will undoubtedly have an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Àlùya ni ìlù ọ̀fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A free drum gets beaten until it is burst.
proverbs.wisdom: What is free or cheap is easily abused.

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ kì í pẹ́ ní isà àkeekè.
proverbs.translation: A hand cannot be kept in a scorpion's burrow, for long.
proverbs.wisdom: High risks situations must be speedily addressed.

proverbs.proverb: Èyí ó wù á wí, t'Olúwa làṣẹ.
proverbs.translation: We may say what we please, it's God's will that will get done.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes.

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kékeré gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A little room is sizable enough for twenty friends.
proverbs.wisdom: Little is enough if love is present.

proverbs.proverb: Ewúrẹ́ tó lè kígbe jù, kọ́ lebi ńpa jù.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí kòkó ẹ̀ẹ́ yè, layé ló mọ̀ọ́ ṣe
proverbs.translation: Only the farmer with a thriving cocoa farm, is considered successful by the world.
proverbs.wisdom: Results matter.

proverbs.proverb: Nínú òròmọ adìyẹ àti ẹyin rẹ̀, ọ̀kan lèyàn máa fọwọ́ mú.
proverbs.translation: One must choose between the chick and the egg.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't eat your cake & have it

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold is seldom appreciated until it gets lost.
proverbs.wisdom: The available is easily taken for granted.

proverbs.proverb: Jẹ́ kí nfi ìdí hẹẹ́, lálejò fi ńti onílé sóde.
proverbs.translation: Let me just hang in here is how a guest takes over the house.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò, á mọ ọpẹ́ ẹ́ dá
proverbs.translation: Whoever can reason well will appreciate why he ought to be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Be ever grateful

proverbs.proverb: Ìwákúùwá nií mú'ni rí ìríkúùrí
proverbs.translation: Unconscionable quest exposes one to undesirable (or strange) outcomes.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate; tame inordinate desires

proverbs.proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: God's messenger never grows weary.
proverbs.wisdom: Lean on God; He cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs.

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn.
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes loving relationships endure.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; be tolerant.

proverbs.proverb: Kékeré ata kò ṣeé fi b'ọ́jú.
proverbs.translation: Even a little quantity of pepper cannot be used to wash the face.
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìtàkùn bá lè pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n á mú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants could unite, they would tie up an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Tí èyàn kò bá tí ì dé ibi tó ńlọ, kì í dúró.
proverbs.translation: If one has not reached one’s destination, one should not stop.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep moving; be persistent.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: Any palm nut that wants to become palm oil would have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: Success comes with a price tag

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ tó ńṣu sínú ìṣasùn, sàréè ẹ̀ ló ńbàjẹ
proverbs.translation: A hen that's defecating into a soup pot is desecrating its grave.
proverbs.wisdom: What goes around comes around

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú
proverbs.translation: We ought to focus on where we are going, not where we'd fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Focus; be forward-looking.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Stay focused.

proverbs.proverb: Olè tó gbé kàkàkí ọba, níbo ni yóò ti fun ún?

proverbs.translation: Whoever gives thanks for past favours would be favoured with more.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá fi àbòsí kó jọ, kì í pẹ́ túká.

proverbs.translation: 2. ...and when to run; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to run would perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Know when to pursue, defer or quit.

proverbs.translation: Knowing when to fight & when to run helps a warrior to live long.
proverbs.wisdom: Know when to pursue, defer or quit

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í dára, kó má kù síbì kan.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní sùúrù, ohun tí ò tó, ṣì ńbọ̀ wá ṣẹ́kù
proverbs.translation: If we are patient, what is not sufficient would be in excess soon enough.

proverbs.translation: 2. Whoever erred out of real or feigned ignorance ought to be gently but firmly corrected.
proverbs.wisdom: Correct gently but firmly.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo àlùwàlá ológbò, kò kọjá à ti kẹ́ran jẹ
proverbs.translation: All the ablutions of the cat are mere ploys to steal some meat

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ tó ńṣu s'ínú íṣasún, sàréè rẹ̀  ló ńbàjẹ́.

proverbs.wisdom: We reap whatever we sow.

proverbs.proverb: A jókòó a fi àpò kọ́, a dìde ọwọ́ ò tó àpò mọ́.
proverbs.translation: We sat and hung a bag; we stood up and the bag was out of reach.
proverbs.wisdom: A perplexing scenario.

proverbs.translation: 2 There's always a right response to every statement, but it's not every statement that one responds to.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá dúpẹ́ oore àná, yóò rí òmíràn gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever gives thanks for past favours would be favoured with more.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it.

proverbs.proverb: Àkùrọ̀ ti lómi tẹ́lẹ̀, kí òjò tó rọ̀ si.
proverbs.translation: The river bank was damp with water, even before the rain fell on it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be humble.

proverbs.translation: A chick that would crow when grown as a cock won't be picked up by a hawk.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá fi àbòsí kó jọ, kì í pẹ́ túká.

proverbs.translation: If man knows his destined path to success for sure, he'll hustle less

proverbs.translation: Farmers merely sow efforts; God alone knows how the yams get formed.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes...
Make hay while the sun shines; not wise to change career too late in life.

proverbs.translation: 2 No matter how bright the day, night will fall, and no matter how dark the night, it will yet become dawn.

proverbs.proverb: Abẹ́ igi tí àá sinmi sí, a kì í gé ẹ̀ka rẹ̀
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't cut off the branches of a tree,  in whose shade one'd rest.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá pẹ́ nígbó, á rí ìríkúùrí.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fẹsẹ̀ kọ
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.

proverbs.translation: 2. If the woodpecker would ceaselessly peck a tree, it would get something from the tree, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ńbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.

proverbs.translation: 2. If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom: Live and let live.

proverbs.translation: The sweetness of meat is felt only within the mouth; it doesn't get to the stomach.

proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more.

proverbs.translation: 2. A king who ushered in peace won't be forgotten; the one who brought desolation won't be forgotten as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever we do outlives us.

proverbs.proverb: Bí òrónró ṣe sún mọ́ ẹran tó ló ṣe ńba ẹran jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: As the gall bladder is close to meat parts, so it messes them up.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive.

proverbs.translation: 2. A tree for which one went into untold trouble in the forest, should at least provide one with warmth.
proverbs.wisdom: One good deserves another.

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n àgbọ́njù ni í pa òdù ọ̀yà.
proverbs.translation: Unbridled craftiness is what kills the grasscutter.
proverbs.wisdom: Crafty fellows eventually self-destruct

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ńbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep keeping on.

proverbs.proverb: Àìnísùúrù ìnàkí ló sọọ́ di ará inú igbó.
proverbs.translation: Gorilla's impatience is what made it an inhabitant of the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Impatience can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ẹran tó bá dé inú ọbẹ̀ ló ńṣakọ.
proverbs.translation: All meat parts, once in a pot of soup, are haughty.
proverbs.wisdom: Environment quite often affects attitude

proverbs.proverb: A kì í láhun ká níyì.
proverbs.translation: You can't be stingy and be honoured.
proverbs.wisdom: No honour for a stingy person; choose to be generous

proverbs.proverb: Náwó náwó kì í ṣ'àpà, ó ńfi owó ra iyì ni
proverbs.translation: The generous person is not wasteful; he is simply buying honour for himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Good to be generous

proverbs.proverb: Ìbàjẹ́ ènìyàn ò lè dá'ṣẹ́ Olúwa dúró.
proverbs.translation: The wickedness of man cannot stop the work (or plan) of God.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep moving, undeterred...

proverbs.proverb: Iná l'ọmọ aráyé lè pa, kò s'ẹ́ni tó lè pa èéfín.
proverbs.translation: It's fire that man can put out, no one can put out smoke.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú ẹ̀
proverbs.translation: If one carefully dismembers an ant one would see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience can achieve the impossible

proverbs.proverb: Àkùkọ tí yóò kọ lágbà, àṣá ò ní gbe lóròmọ adìyẹ
proverbs.translation: A cock that would crow when grown won't be picked up by a hawk as a chick
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ kan a máa yí ìpinnu ogún ọdún padà
proverbs.translation: A single statement is well able to turn-around a decision of 20 years.
proverbs.wisdom: Speak in wisdom

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pleads with God, won't need to plead with any man.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing is beyond Him; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: A kìí mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One can't know God's name (or really know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is a present help.

proverbs.proverb: Ìrọ̀rùn igi ni ìrọ̀rùn ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The comfort of the tree is what assures the comfort of the bird (on it).
