proverbs.wisdom: Pursue the common good, always

proverbs.proverb: Àṣegbé kànkan ò sí, àṣepamọ́ ló wà
proverbs.translation: Actions may be covered up but can't be carried out with impunity.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing can be permanently covered up

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi iná sí orí òrùlé sùn.
proverbs.translation: No one goes to sleep with the roof of his house on fire.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious issue requires prompt attention

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù kìí pẹyẹ
proverbs.translation: A stone thrown at a bird in anger can't kill the bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results

proverbs.proverb: Àdáníkànrìn ejò ló ńjẹ ọmọ ejò níyà
proverbs.translation: It's penchant for moving alone is what exposes the snake to life-threatening risks.
proverbs.wisdom: Isolation is risky

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A fish that sleeps will get eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom: No complacency

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọsàn bá dúdú, ó ńpadà bọ̀ wá pọ́n ni
proverbs.translation: An unripe orange will certainly become ripe, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come

proverbs.proverb: Àt'oore àt'ìkà, ìkan kì í gbé.
proverbs.translation: Neither acts of kindness nor those of wickedness shall be lost.
proverbs.wisdom: We reap whatever we sow

proverbs.proverb: Òde ò ní dùn kí onílé má re'lé.
proverbs.translation: An outing can't be so nice that one won't return home.
proverbs.wisdom: No matter where it is, home is the best place to be

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá fara pamọ́ ló máa ńgbó.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that grows to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest; avoid ostentation

proverbs.proverb: Àlùya ni ìlù ọ̀fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A free drum gets beaten until it's bursted.
proverbs.wisdom: What's cheap, is seldom appreciated but easily abused.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Igúnnugún ò torí abẹ párí.
proverbs.translation: The vulture did not go bald for fear of the blade.
proverbs.wisdom: Certain events are mere coincidences and not imposed.

proverbs.proverb: Idà tó bá ba àkọ̀ jẹ́, yóò sun ìta.
proverbs.translation: A sword that destroyed its sheath will have to do without covering.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't mess with your source

proverbs.proverb: Bí ewé ṣe tóbi tó, kọ́ ló ṣe wúlò tó.
proverbs.translation: How big a leaf is, is not necessarily how useful it is.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá bò ló ńníyì.
proverbs.translation: What's covered up (or made scarce) is what gets treated with honour.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt

proverbs.proverb: Táa bá ní káa tìí kó dúró, táa bá tìí tó ṣubú, ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: If we plan to push it to stand, what if we push it and it falls?
proverbs.wisdom: Think before acting

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love; but you can't be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Good to be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling, would find it difficult to rise.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Ilé ò ní gba eku kó tún gba ejò
proverbs.translation: A house can't harbour rats and harbour snakes (snakes prey on rats).
proverbs.wisdom: You can't eat your cake and have it

proverbs.proverb: Ilé ò ní gba eku kó tún gba ejò
proverbs.translation: A house can't harbour rats and harbour snakes (snakes prey on rats).
proverbs.wisdom: You can't eat your cakes and have it

proverbs.proverb: Ilé tí a fi itọ́ mọ́, ìrì ló máa wóo.
proverbs.translation: A house built with saliva will collapse under dew drops.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is based on deceit seldom lasts

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch-dark night, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò làgbàdo ńwọlẹ̀, tó bá jáde tán ló ndonígba aṣọ
proverbs.translation: Maize goes naked into the soil, but has multiple peelings after sprouting
proverbs.wisdom: Dare to hope

proverbs.proverb: Onísùúrù ló ńfún wàrà kìnìún.
proverbs.translation: Only a patient person can get to milk a lioness.
proverbs.wisdom: With patience, exceptional outcome is achievable

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí èyàn ṣe lè kúrú tó, kò lè nàgà wo sánmà
proverbs.translation: No matter how short anyone is, one needn't stretch to see the sky.
proverbs.wisdom: Tough times have limits

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni à ńgbé ìyàwó bọ̀ wá bá kì í ga'rùn.
proverbs.translation: A groom shouldn't be craning his neck to peek at his bride.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; avoid undue haste

proverbs.proverb: Ajá ò ní gbó kí eyín rẹẹ̀ yọ.
proverbs.translation: A dog won't lose its teeth as a result of barking.
proverbs.wisdom: Tough times won't last.

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́ làá wà, tí a rí èyí tó tọ́
proverbs.translation: It's while on a crooked tree that one will discover the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't despise where you are

proverbs.proverb: Ajá  kì í rorò títí kí ó ṣọ́ ojú'lé méjì.
proverbs.translation: A dog can't be so vicious as to be able to watch over two houses.
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ àtàtà kìí gbayì nínú àpò
proverbs.translation: A beautiful clothe kept in a bag, can't be appreciated.
proverbs.wisdom: Let your light shine; don't cover up your gift

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní sùúrù, ohun tí ò tó, ṣì ńbọ̀ wá ṣẹ́kù.
proverbs.translation: If we are patient, what is not sufficient will be in excess soon enough.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed will be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayer works

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Don't carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't compare yourself with anyone

proverbs.proverb: Tí kò bá sí, a kì í dédé rí ẹja lókè odò.
proverbs.translation: If there are no reasons, fish can't be found on the bank of a river.
proverbs.wisdom: Unusual events are caused

proverbs.proverb: Nǹkan tí èyàn ò ní jẹ, kì í fi run imú.
proverbs.translation: Don't sniff, what you won't eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you can't finish; finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: Nítorí ọ̀dá la ṣe ńlóko lákùrọ̀.
proverbs.translation: It's because of the time of drought that one maintains a farm close to a river.
proverbs.wisdom: Plan for the future

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ò tó'ràwọ̀ ni kúrò lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, káyé ó rí mi
proverbs.translation: Only a less than sparkling star seeks attention.
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure in who you are.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo àwọn tó ńsun kọ́ ló ńhanrun.
proverbs.translation: It's not everyone who is sleeping who snores.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: A kìí kóòríra ọ̀fọ́ọ̀n kí a fi'ná bọ ahéré.
proverbs.translation: One cannot so detest the mouse as to set the farm-house ablaze.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ tó bá dilẹ̀ ni wọ́n fi ńlẹ́rán.
proverbs.translation: It is an idle hand that gets placed on the cheek.
proverbs.wisdom: Idleness exposes one inappropriately.

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ ti ọmọdé nàró kọ́ ni í rìn.
proverbs.translation: It's not the day a baby stands up for the first time that he (or she) walks.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín (a town), ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternatives always exist

proverbs.proverb: Bí orí bá ti mọ, là ńdá fìlà fún un.
proverbs.translation: As a head is (in size), so caps are made for it.
proverbs.wisdom: Cut your clothes according to your size

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò fẹ́ wọ àkísà, kìí bá ajá ṣe eré e géle
proverbs.translation: If you don't want to end up in tatters, don't play rough with a dog.
proverbs.wisdom: Look before you leap

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ti ńṣe níbì kan èèwọ ibòmíràn ni
proverbs.translation: What is acceptable in one place is an abomination in another.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbọ́n ṣe lóró tó, oúnjẹ ni fún aláǹgbá
proverbs.translation: Despite how venomous the wasp is, it is food for the lizard.
proverbs.wisdom: One man's meat is another's poison

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is what adorns a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character is adorable.

proverbs.proverb: Àparò kan ò ga jù kan lọ, à fi èyí tó bá gun orí ebè
proverbs.translation: One patridge isn't taller than another except the one on a mound.
proverbs.wisdom: We are more alike...

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá fẹ́ fò gbọ́dọ̀ kọ́kọ́ sáré.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to fly, must first run.
proverbs.wisdom: Success don't just happen, it has to be prepared for.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan là ńyọ ẹsẹ̀ lábàtà
proverbs.translation: The feet are pulled out of mud, one at a time
proverbs.wisdom: Multiple complicated issues should be resolved one at a time

proverbs.proverb: Ìbàjẹ́ ọjọ́ kan kìí tán lógún ọdún.
proverbs.translation: An indiscretion of one day, is not forgotten in twenty years.
proverbs.wisdom: A little indiscretion can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ rere ṣàgbà oyè.
proverbs.translation: A good name is superior to ranks or titled positions.
proverbs.wisdom: A good name shouldn't be compromised

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí ò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, ò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀
proverbs.translation: A dunghill that's intolerant of filth won't be filled up easily
proverbs.wisdom: Intolerance imposes limitations

proverbs.proverb: Àjàdijú ló ńpa àdá.
proverbs.translation: Unconscionable (or senseless) 'fighting' is what makes the cutlass blunt.
proverbs.wisdom: Wisdom is crucial

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọmọdé ò tó pẹpẹ, tàgbàlagbà ò wọ akèrègbè
proverbs.translation: A child's hand can't reach the shelf as an elder's can't enter a gourd.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò lè já.
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they cannot fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀mí bá wà, ìrètí ńbẹ.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is hope.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep keeping on.

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, ogún ọdún ńbọ̀ wá k'ọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long, twenty years time will one day be referred to as 'tomorrow'.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't lose hope

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńsebẹ̀, ò kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; Never give up!

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó dá ẹnu, ti dá ohun tí kálukú máa fi síi
proverbs.translation: God who made the mouth had also created what we'd be putting into it.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Àdánìkànrìn ejò ló ńjẹ ọmọ ejò níyà.
proverbs.translation: Its penchant for moving alone is what exposes the snake to life-threatening risks.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid isolation

proverbs.proverb: Èrò làá rò, ká tó lè kọ́lé tó ga bí i dodo
proverbs.translation: Prior proper planning is what is required to build an exceedingly tall building
proverbs.wisdom: Planning is it

proverbs.proverb: Rírò lọbẹ̀ gbẹ̀gìrì, táà bá ròó a máa díkókó
proverbs.translation: The bean soup needs to be well stirred, else it will become lumpy
proverbs.wisdom: Proper planning is crucial

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed will be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayer works.

proverbs.proverb: Nínú oore loore wà.
proverbs.translation: Kindness begets kindness.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness follows the kind-hearted

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One can't know God's name (or really know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is a present help.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹran tó mú erèé jẹ ló mú kí gbẹ̀gìrì ṣàn
proverbs.translation: The goat that ate the beans is the one that made the bean soup watery.
proverbs.wisdom: One thing leads to another

proverbs.proverb: Èyíówù áwí, t'Olúwa làṣẹ.
proverbs.translation: We may say what we please, it is God's will that will get done.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìtàkùn bá pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n a mú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants could unite, they'd easily tie up an elephant
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Àìmọṣẹ́ kọ̀ ló ńmú kí ẹṣin kú sí ogun
proverbs.translation: Not knowing how to say 'No' is what makes the horse perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Not every offer one accedes to

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ránni níṣẹ́ ẹrú, a sì fi jẹ́ ti ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: If one is sent on a questionable errand, one should handle it with wisdom.
proverbs.wisdom: Walk in wisdom

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ l'oògùn ìṣẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Work is the antidote of poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Hardwork pays

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù.
proverbs.translation: Gold is seldom appreciated until it gets lost.
proverbs.wisdom: Let's be grateful for what we have and where we are

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá kó pa kó má a dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Be ever grateful.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ojú bá f'ara balẹ̀ á r'imú
proverbs.translation: If the eyes can be patient enough, they will see the nose.
proverbs.wisdom: With patience, there's virtually no impossibility

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí bíńtí ò tó, púpọ̀ yóò jìnnà sí i.
proverbs.translation: Much will be far from whoever is not contented with a little.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is crucial

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí ojú rí mọ, òun lòpin ìrìn àjò
proverbs.translation: It's how far the eyes see that marks the end of a journey.
proverbs.wisdom: Depth of vision determines destination

proverbs.proverb: Ayé kìí fọn fèrè tó fi ńkọjá lara ẹni
proverbs.translation: The world won't blow the siren as it leaves one behind.
proverbs.wisdom: Promptly exploit opportunities; make hay...

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí ajá rí tó ńgbó, kò tó èyí tí ágùntàn fi ńṣe ìran wò
proverbs.translation: What makes the dog barks pales to what the sheep ignores.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes...

proverbs.proverb: Tí apá ò bá ṣe ṣán, a ńma a ka lórí ni
proverbs.translation: If the arms can't be swung, they are folded on the head.
proverbs.wisdom: If plan A is impossible, pursue plan B

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà ò ní jìn kó má lóòpin.
proverbs.translation: No matter how far a road is, it will undoubtedly have an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà kan ńlọ ìgbà kan ńbọ̀; ẹnìkan ò lo ilé ayé gbó.
proverbs.translation: One season goes and another comes; no one can dominate forever.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is inevitable

proverbs.proverb: A kì í f'ọmọ àparò s'ábẹ́ j'ọkà.
proverbs.translation: No one eats corn while a patridge is within his vicinity.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't expose your assets to needless risks

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́ làá wà táà rí èyí tó tọ́
proverbs.translation: It's while on the crooked tree that one will find the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Make the best of where you are

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù kí ojú kan tóbi tó, ojú méjì sàn ju ojú kan lọ
proverbs.translation: No matter how big an eye is, two eyes are better than one
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more

proverbs.proverb: Omi tí èyàn máa mu ò ní ṣàn kọjá rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A stream from which one will drink won't flow beyond one's reach.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ ti ọmọdé nàró kọ́ nií rìn.
proverbs.translation: It's not the day a baby stands up for the first time that he walks.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; good things take time.

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, agogo tó lu méjìlá, ńbọ̀ wá lù'kan.
proverbs.translation: Eventually, a clock that struck 12 O'clock would strike 1 O'clock.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Rírò ntènìyàn, ṣíṣe ni t'Olúwa.
proverbs.translation: Man proposes, God disposes.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows tomorrow; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í rẹ ológbò kó má lè ṣe ọdẹ eku.
proverbs.translation: A cat can't be so tired that it won't be able to hunt the mouse.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility

proverbs.proverb: Timú yé'mú tímú fi ńfọn.
proverbs.translation: The nose has its reasons for being noisy when blown.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it; people have their reasons.

proverbs.proverb: Bí iná ò bá tán l'áṣọ, ẹ̀jẹ̀ kìí tan léèkánná
proverbs.translation: As long as lice remain on one's clothes, blood can't cease from the finger nails.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't quit

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kìí wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú
proverbs.translation: We should focus on where we are going, not where we had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Focus; let go of the past

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá
proverbs.translation: God hasn't forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what worries us.
proverbs.wisdom: Be hopeful

proverbs.proverb: A kìí mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù.
proverbs.translation: Gold is seldom appreciated until it gets lost.
proverbs.wisdom: The available is easily taken for granted

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo inú ìgò, ó di àwòmọ́jú fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: The corns kept in a bottle are viewed with disdain by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: We do belittle what we can' t have

proverbs.proverb: Aláṣejù ajá ní ńlépa ẹkùn.
proverbs.translation: Only an intemperate dog stalks the leopard.
proverbs.wisdom: Know yourself and be moderate

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A dunghill that won't tolerate filth, won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it

proverbs.proverb: A kìí yangan bàtà lójú ẹni tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Don't brag about shoes around someone with no legs.
proverbs.wisdom: Tact, courtesy, and consideration are crucial

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan
proverbs.translation: If we won't give up, our hustling will one day end.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't quit!

proverbs.proverb: Rí'rú omi òkun kò ní k'ẹ́ja má sùn, kó má han'run.
proverbs.translation: The storms of the sea won't stop the fish from sleeping and snoring.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed will be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work

proverbs.proverb: Nínú ìkòkò dúdú ni ẹ̀kọ funfun ti ńjáde.
proverbs.translation: The pot may be black, yet out of it comes the white corn meal.
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà ò ní jìn kó má lóòpin.
proverbs.translation: A road cannot be so far and not have an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must be passed through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: No pains, no gains; don't give up!

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed, it will positively impact two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success is contagious

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó máa di akàn, bí ẹja nií kọ́kọ́ ńrí
proverbs.translation: What will turn out well, may start out negatively.
proverbs.wisdom: It's not over yet; don't give up

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńsebẹ̀, ò kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; Never give up!

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá máa kọ oúnjẹ, tẹran tẹran lèyàn ńkọ̀ọ́.
proverbs.translation: If one would refuse a meal, the refusal will include the meat in it.
proverbs.wisdom: No half measure

proverbs.proverb: Omi kì í korò lẹ́nu láì ní ìdí.
proverbs.translation: Water does not taste bitter in the mouth without a reason.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a reason for every seeming anomaly

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n ju agbára lọ.
proverbs.translation: Wisdom is better than strength.
proverbs.wisdom: Wisdom should be pursued #Owe

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù kìí pẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A stone thrown at a bird in anger can't kill the bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọlọ́wọ́ ò lè yó ẹnu ẹlẹ́nu
proverbs.translation: No one can be fed to satisfaction by the hands of another.
proverbs.wisdom: It's what you achieve by yourself that endures

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò, á mọ ọpẹ́ ẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever can think well, will know how to be ever grateful.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintaining a heart of gratitude...

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi gbèsè sọ́rùn ṣe ọ̀ṣọ́.
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't indulge in an extravagant lifestyle while in debt.
proverbs.wisdom: We should set our priorities right.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child can't be fattened in one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time; be patient

proverbs.proverb: Ẹran táà bá ní jẹ, a kìí fi eyín dan wò
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't be nipping at a piece of meat that one won't eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won't finish

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà ròde ìyàwò rí
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on a refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom: A season goes, another comes

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo èèyàn oníwà tùtù kọ́ lonínúure.
proverbs.translation: It's not everyone with a gentle disposition who is kind-natured.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Don't carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; avoid needless comparisons

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever places his hopes on God, won't need to look up to a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni fi irọ́ fẹ́ ìyàwó, kìí fẹ̀ ìyàwó ọ̀hún pẹ́
proverbs.translation: Whoever marries a woman based on false pretences won't keep the woman for long.
proverbs.wisdom: Be honest

proverbs.proverb: Bí òfé ti ńfò la ti ńmọ̀ọ́ lákọ ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: By its prowess in flying is how a parrot is adjudged a top-notch bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Think big; go for excellence

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you can't really be certain of who loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: Omi kìí korò lẹ́nu láì níìdí
proverbs.translation: Water never tastes bitter in the mouth without a reason.
proverbs.wisdom: No smoke without fire;unusual occurrences are caused

proverbs.proverb: Àyè kìí há adìyẹ kó mà lè dé ìdí àba rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A hen can't be too busy to brood over its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: We make time for what's crucial to us.

proverbs.proverb: Àdánìkànrìn ejò ló ńjẹ ọmọ ejò níyà
proverbs.translation: It's penchant for moving alone is what exposes the snake to life-threatening risks.
proverbs.wisdom: Isolation is risky

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá da omi síwájú, á tẹ ilẹ̀ tútù
proverbs.translation: Whoever pours water on the ground ahead of him, will get to step on wet ground
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give and take

proverbs.proverb: Kàǹga tó jìn kì í pariwo.
proverbs.translation: A deep well never makes noise.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't grandstand #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àkùkọ tí yóò kọ lágbà àṣá ò ní gbe lóròmọ adìyẹ
proverbs.translation: A cock that would crow when grown won't be picked up by a hawk as a chick.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ọbẹ̀ tí ò pọ̀ kì í kan.
proverbs.translation: A soup that is not much in quantity never goes sour.
proverbs.wisdom: What's not readily available won't suffer negect.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú sí ẹni tí a kò rí
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't be annoyed preemptively with someone we haven't seen (or heard out).
proverbs.wisdom: Don't rush to judgment.

proverbs.proverb: Yinni yinni kí ẹni ṣè'mí ì.
proverbs.translation: Praise a good person so he can do more.
proverbs.wisdom: Praise inspires; it's good to appreciate others

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọsàn bá dúdú, ó ńpadà bọ̀ wá pọ́n ni.
proverbs.translation: An unripe orange will one day become ripe.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come

proverbs.proverb: Onírúurú ọ̀bẹ làá rí ní'jọ́ ikú erin.
proverbs.translation: Upon the death of the elephant, various types of knives show up.
proverbs.wisdom: A major setback can be humbling

proverbs.proverb: Nínú òròmọ adìyẹ àti ẹyin rẹ̀, ọ̀kan lèyàn máa fọwọ́ mú.
proverbs.translation: One must choose between the chick and the egg.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't eat your cake & have it

proverbs.proverb: Tí ayé bá wà lẹhìn aáyán, yóò pa adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: If the world would back the cockroach, it woud kill the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Good backing empowers

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá kó pa kó má a dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Be ever grateful

proverbs.proverb: Òde ò ní dùn kí onílé má re'lé.
proverbs.translation: An outing can't be so nice that one won't return home.
proverbs.wisdom: No matter where it is, home is the best place to be

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ò tó'ràwọ̀ ni kúrò lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, káyé ó rí mi
proverbs.translation: Only a less than sparkling star strives for attention.
proverbs.wisdom: Be secure in who you are.

proverbs.proverb: Sáà làá ńni ẹnìkan kìí nilé ayé
proverbs.translation: Seasons (or dispensations) are what we can own, no one can own the world.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is constant & inevitable

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed will be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work

proverbs.proverb: Tí èyàn kò bá ṣubú kì í mọ ẹrù ńdì
proverbs.translation: If one hasn't tripped (or failed), one won't know how to properly pack one's loads.
proverbs.wisdom: Failure does teach.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò fẹ́ wọ àkísà, kìí bá ajá ṣe eré e géle
proverbs.translation: If you don't want to end up in tatters, don't play rough with a dog.
proverbs.wisdom: Think before you act

proverbs.proverb: Sùúrù la fi ńyọ òróǹró kúrò lára ẹran.
proverbs.translation: Patience is what helps to separate gallbladder from meat parts.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience resolves complexities

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò si nílé lewúrẹ́ rẹ̀ ńbí kan
proverbs.translation: The goat of an absentee owner is the one that births only one kid.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever's neglected underperforms

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá dúpẹ́ oore àná yóò rí òmíràn gbà
proverbs.translation: Whoever gives thanks for past favours, will be granted another.
proverbs.wisdom: An attitude of gratitude is it

proverbs.proverb: Ojú éni máa là, á rí ìyọnu
proverbs.translation: Whoever desires success will experience challenges.
proverbs.wisdom: Challenges aren't unusual, don't give up #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Okùn ò lè gùn gùn kí ó máa ní'bi tí a ti fàá wá.
proverbs.translation: A rope can't be so long that it won't have a source.
proverbs.wisdom: Every effect has a cause.

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ lẹran dùn mọ; kò dénú.
proverbs.translation: Meat's sweetness is felt only within the cheeks; it's not felt in the stomach.
proverbs.wisdom: Some things are trivial

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes loving relationships endure.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; tolerance is crucial

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: No age limit to learning

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá ṣe lónìí, ọ̀rọ̀ ìtàn ni bó d'òla.
proverbs.translation: Whatever we do today, will become history tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: Let's be mindful of our legacy.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹníkan kìí jẹ, kí ìlú fẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: One person's well-being won't result in the expansion of the town.
proverbs.wisdom: The 'good' of one isn't the 'good' of all.

proverbs.proverb: A kìí fi ojú ọwọ́ ṣiṣẹ́ tán, ká wá fẹ̀hìn ọwọ̀ dàánù
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't discard with our backhand what our open hand had achieved
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rashness

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines

proverbs.proverb: Pípẹ́ ni yóò pẹ́, akólòlò á pe "Baba".
proverbs.translation: It may be long, but the stammerer will  eventually call "Father".
proverbs.wisdom: Be persistent; don't let go.

proverbs.proverb: Nǹkan tí èyàn ò ní jẹ, kì í fi run imú.
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't be sniffing, what one won't eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you can't finish

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí àtùpà ṣe lè lágbára tó, kò lè ríran rí ìdí ara ẹ̀
proverbs.translation: No matter how strong a lamp is, it can't light up it's base
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is what adorns a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character ought to be cultivated #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀gàn ò ní kóyin má dùn; ọ̀tẹ̀ ò ní kóyin ó kan
proverbs.translation: Derision won't kill honey's sweetness; rebellion won't make honey go sour.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fẹsẹ̀ kọ
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid distractions

proverbs.proverb: Jẹ́ kí ńfìdí hẹẹ́, làlejò fi ńti onílé sóde
proverbs.translation: Let me just hang in here, is how a guest takes over the house
proverbs.wisdom: Give an inch and lose a mile...

proverbs.proverb: Ilé tí a fi itọ́ mọ, ìrì ló máa wóo.
proverbs.translation: A house built with saliva would collapse under dew drops.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is based on deceit won't last

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó jìn sí kòtò kọ́ ará ìyókù lọ́gbọ́n
proverbs.translation: Whoever falls into a ditch, serves as a lesson to others.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to learn from others.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni gbọ́kàn l'Ólúwa ò ní jogún òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever places his hope in God won't hope in vain.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò dúpẹ́ ẹgbẹfà, bẹ́'gi dí'nà egbèje.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not thankful for 1,200 (units of money) has blocked the path to 1,400.
proverbs.wisdom: Be thankful

proverbs.proverb: Kó sí kekere akàn tí kò nílé lórí
proverbs.translation: You'll never find a diminutive crab without a home of its own.
proverbs.wisdom: Underscoring importance of home ownership

proverbs.proverb: Ìyàwó táa fijó fẹ́, ìran ló máa wò lọ
proverbs.translation: A wife married through dancing exploits, would soon elope with a better dancer.
proverbs.wisdom: Choose wisely

proverbs.proverb: Orí tó máa j'ọba, kò ní ṣàì jẹẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A head destined to be king, can't but be crowned.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọdé ò lè mọ ẹ̀kọ jẹ, kó má ráa lọ́wọ́
proverbs.translation: A child can't be good at eating corn meal and not soil his hands with it.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is above mistake

proverbs.proverb: Olè tó gbé kàkàkí ọba, níbo ni yóò ti fun ún?
proverbs.translation: Where will the thief who stole the king's bugle blow it?
proverbs.wisdom: Some actions are self-limiting

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún ni.
proverbs.translation: What's sweet, what's much & what endure are all from God.
proverbs.wisdom: Only God's blessing endures

proverbs.proverb: Ajá kìí rorò títí kó ṣọ́ ojúlé méjì
proverbs.translation: No matter how vicious a dog is, it can't  watch over two houses.
proverbs.wisdom: There's a limit to what anyone can do

proverbs.proverb: Igba eṣinṣin kì í dè'nà de ọwọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Two hundred flies cannot waylay the broom.
proverbs.wisdom: Refers to an impossible scenario

proverbs.proverb: Ìbàjẹ́ ènìyàn, kò lè dá iṣẹ́ Olúwa dúró.
proverbs.translation: Man's wickedness can't deter God's plan.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; only God has the final say

proverbs.proverb: Gbòngbò kan ṣoṣo kò gbọdọ̀ ré ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n lẹ́ẹ̀pa lẹ́ẹ̀mejì
proverbs.translation: The same tree stump shouldn't trip a wise person twice.
proverbs.wisdom: Once beaten, twice shy

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá lé eku méjì, á p'òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pursues after two rats simultaneously, will catch none.
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive; be focused

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kìí hó ruru kí á wàá ruru.
proverbs.translation: Don't paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; complex issues should be  handled with patience

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ àtàtà kìí gbayì nínú àpò
proverbs.translation: A beautiful apparel isn't appreciated when packed in a bag.
proverbs.wisdom: Let your gift

proverbs.proverb: Òní la rí kò sẹ́ni tó mọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: It is today (the present) we all see, no one knows tomorrow (the future).
proverbs.wisdom: Write off no one

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọlọ́wọ́ ò lè yó ẹnu ẹlẹ́nu.
proverbs.translation: One can't be fed to satisfaction with the hands of someone else.
proverbs.wisdom: Be diligent; depend less on others

proverbs.proverb: Kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ tó bá ńsùn, ò lè rí ogbe àkùkọ jájẹ.
proverbs.translation: A sleeping fox can't get to eat a cock's comb.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò lè já
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they can't fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive, no matter how tough it seems

proverbs.proverb: A kìí mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One can't know God's name (or really know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is a present help.

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá fara pamọ́ ló máa ńgbó.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that grows to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest

proverbs.proverb: Iná l'ọmọ aráyé lè pa, kò s'ẹ́ni tó lè pa èéfín.
proverbs.translation: It's fire that man can put out, no one can put out smoke.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a kò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love; but you can't be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: A kìí mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold (ornament) is seldom appreciated until it's lost.
proverbs.wisdom: The available is often taken for granted

proverbs.proverb: Kìí ṣe gbogbo ajá tó ba ńgbó'ni lọ́jà la ńdá lóhùn
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one in the market that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused

proverbs.proverb: Kíkéré l'abẹ́rẹ́ kéré, kìí ṣe mímì f'ádìyẹ
proverbs.translation: Though the needle may be tiny, it can't be swallowed by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: If a fish sleeps, it will be eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom: Complacency can be risky; be diligent.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú éni máa là, á rí ìyọnu.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to succeed will experience challenges.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; challenges are not unusual

proverbs.proverb: Odò tó ńṣàn kì í b'ojú w'ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: A flowing stream never looks back (or flows backward).
proverbs.wisdom: Be  forward-looking

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not hot, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ṣe'ni lóore, ọpẹ́ là ńdá.
proverbs.translation: If one has been favoured with kindness, one ought to give thanks.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain an attitude of gratitude

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ọ̀rẹ́ dà kó má ṣe bínú; ẹni abínibí ńdani
proverbs.translation: Those betrayed by friends shouldn't be offended; siblings betray one another.
proverbs.wisdom: Be gracious

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í mọ iyì ohun tó ní, à fi tó bá sọọ́ nù
proverbs.translation: We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose the thing.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt

proverbs.proverb: Àt'oore àt'ìkà, ìkan kìí gbé.
proverbs.translation: Neither acts of kindness nor those of wickedness shall be lost.
proverbs.wisdom: We will reap whatever we sow

proverbs.proverb: Àṣìṣe ò kan ọgbọ́n.
proverbs.translation: Possession of wisdom excludes no one from mistakes.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is above mistakes; tolerance is crucial

proverbs.proverb: Bí orí bá ti rù, ó di dandan kí ẹnu ó jẹ
proverbs.translation: Once the head has carried, the mouth must need eat.
proverbs.wisdom: Reaping follows sowing Happy Workers Day!

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo inú ìgò, di àwòmọ́jú fún adìyẹ
proverbs.translation: The corns kept in a bottle are viewed with disdain by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: What's out of reach is often despised

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A person is inseparable from his character.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can hide his character for long.

proverbs.proverb: Tí igi bá ga lágajù, wíwó ni í wó.
proverbs.translation: If a tree becomes unduly tall, it will end up collapsing.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial in all things

proverbs.proverb: Asúramú kò tẹ́ bọ̀rọ̀ bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: The diligent seldom falls into disgrace.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed will be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayer works

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed, it will positively impact two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success can be contagious

proverbs.proverb: Àlùya ni ìlù ọ̀fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A free drum gets beaten until it's bursted.
proverbs.wisdom: What's cheap, quite often isn't appreciated but gets abused.

proverbs.proverb: Bíbíre kò ṣeé fi owó rà
proverbs.translation: A good pedigree can't be acquired with money.
proverbs.wisdom: Money isn't everything; it's not everything that wealth can confer

proverbs.proverb: Afọgbọ́nọlọ́gbọ́n ṣọgbọ́n kì í ṣìṣe.
proverbs.translation: Those who adopt the wisdom of others seldom trip.
proverbs.wisdom: Be open and quick to learn from others

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tí sùúrù sè tí kò jinná.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing 'cooked' by patience that won't get done.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di eepo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that wants to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo aṣọ kọ́ là nsá lóòrùn.
proverbs.translation: It is not all clothes that one dries in the sun.
proverbs.wisdom: Different situations call for different approaches

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò tíì kúrò láyé kò lè mọ irú ẹni tí òun yó dà
proverbs.translation: Whoever still has life, can't know for sure who he'll become.
proverbs.wisdom: With life there's hope.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńṣe rere, ìwọ̀n ló ńrin àrìnfura mọ
proverbs.translation: A good-hearted person seldom needs to be suspicious of others.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain a clear conscience.

proverbs.proverb: Labalábá tó fi ara rẹ̀ wẹ́yẹ kò lè ṣe ìṣe ẹyẹ
proverbs.translation: A butterfly that likens itself to a bird can't act like one.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can take another's place

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbìyànjú la fií mọ akínkanjú
proverbs.translation: Willingness to make the needed effort is how a brave person is known.
proverbs.wisdom: Give it a shot; make effort to start

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò kú ló ni igbó òkè ọ̀hún
proverbs.translation: The person who is alive gets to own the farmland up yonder (eventually).
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up; it's not over yet

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ tí ò kú ṣì máa jẹ àgbàdo.
proverbs.translation: The hen that did not die would eventually get to eat corn.
proverbs.wisdom: Once there is life, there's hope

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò làgbàdo ńwọlẹ̀, tó bá jáde tán ló ńdonígba aṣọ
proverbs.translation: Maize does go into the soil naked, but has multiple peelings after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom: Hope!

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ rere ṣàgbà oyè.
proverbs.translation: A good name is superior to titled positions (or achievements).
proverbs.wisdom: A good name shouldn't be compromised

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tó bá mọwọ́ wẹ̀, á bágbà jẹun
proverbs.translation: A child that knows how to wash his hands will eat with the elders.
proverbs.wisdom: Learn to relate well with those ahead

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever carefully dismembers an ant will see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience can achieve the impossible

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù kí ojú kan tóbi tó, ojú méjì sàn ju ojú kan lọ
proverbs.translation: No matter how big an eye is, two eyes are better than one.
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù ká fa igi èsúrú tó, èsúrú yóò ta.
proverbs.translation: No matter how the aerial yam plant is pulled, it will still grow to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: Be determined

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, ogún ọdún ńbọ̀ wá k'ọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long, twenty years time will one day be referred to as 'tomorrow'.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't lose hope

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ kìí pẹ́ kó máà dé, à fi àìmọ̀ọ́kà
proverbs.translation: A set date can't be so far off and not come to pass, except it's improperly assessed.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọsàn bá dúdú, ó ńpadà bọ̀ wá pọ́n ni
proverbs.translation: An unripe orange will most assuredly one day become ripe.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Àt'oore àt'ìka, ìkan kì í gbé.
proverbs.translation: Neither acts of kindness nor those of wickedness shall be lost.
proverbs.wisdom: We shall certainly reap whatever we sow.

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò tó bá tutù ladìyẹ ńyé sí.
proverbs.translation: It's only in a cold hearth that a hen can dare lay its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: We experience whatever we make room for

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò tó bá tutù ladìyẹ ńyé sí.
proverbs.translation: It's only in a cold hearth that a hen can dare lay its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: We expereience whatever we make room for

proverbs.proverb: Ìka tó bá ńfún'ni lóúnjẹ, a kì í gée jẹ.
proverbs.translation: We ought not to bite the fingers that feed us.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't repay good with evil. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá gun àkàbà dé òkè máa ńṣe pẹ̀lẹ̀ ni
proverbs.translation: Whoever climbs to the top of a ladder, ought to tread gently.
proverbs.wisdom: Those at the top must tread softly

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch darkness, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive...

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùkù biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch darkness, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive...

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọrùn àgbáǹréré ti gùn tó, kò lè rí ọjọ́ ọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: Despite how long the neck of a giraffe is, it can't see the future.
proverbs.wisdom: No one knows tomorrow

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines

proverbs.proverb: Kí a r'odò ká sùn, kí l'ará ilé yóò mu?
proverbs.translation: If we tarry long at the river, what will those at home drink?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kìí wo ibi táa ti ṣubú
proverbs.translation: One ought to focus on where one is going, not where one had fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Look beyond past failures

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí yóò ròhìn ogun ò ní kú sógun.
proverbs.translation: A warrior who will tell war tales won't perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tó rí ibi tí ò fọ́, ire ló ńdúró dè.
proverbs.translation: The eyes that saw evil and did not go blind, are waiting to see good.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá gbé ayé jẹ́jẹ́ ni í gbé ayé pẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is patient in life is the one who lives long.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient

proverbs.proverb: Pípẹ́ ni yóò pẹ́, akólòlò á pe "Baba"
proverbs.translation: It may be long but the stammerer will say "Father", eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: If we won't quit, we'll win.

proverbs.proverb: Ayé ò ṣeé dá gbé.
proverbs.translation: The world is not to be lived in or enjoyed alone.
proverbs.wisdom: One ought not to eat it alone; reach out to others #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Labalábá tó fi ara ẹ̀ wé ẹyẹ kò lè ṣe ìṣe ẹyẹ
proverbs.translation: A butterfly that likens itself to a bird can't act like one.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can take another's place

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ìgbà tí a d'áṣọ tá ò rí'gbà fi lò
proverbs.translation: There is no time one buys clothes that one won't have opportunity to  wear them.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tí sùúrù sè tí kò jinná
proverbs.translation: There is nothing 'cooked' by patience that won't get done
proverbs.wisdom: With patience complex issues get simplified

proverbs.proverb: Oúnjẹ tí èyàn á jẹ pẹ́, kìí fi ọwọ́ mẹ́wẹ̀ẹ̀wá jẹẹ́.
proverbs.translation: One ought not to eat with the ten fingers, the food one will eat for long.
proverbs.wisdom: Be prudent

proverbs.proverb: Ìràwọ̀ ò tó'ràwọ̀ ni kúrò lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, káyé ó rí mi
proverbs.translation: Only a less than sparkling star strives for attention.
proverbs.wisdom: Decrying grandstanding...

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ àánú Olúwa kì í ṣú
proverbs.translation: God's land of mercy never goes dark.
proverbs.wisdom: God's mercy never runs out; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà ò ní jìn kó má lóòpin
proverbs.translation: A road (or route) cannot be so far and not have an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kò sẹ́ni tó lè dá gbọ́n odò tó ńṣàn
proverbs.translation: No one person can completely scoop out a flowing stream.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ ò lè fi apá kan fò.
proverbs.translation: Birds cannot fly with one wing.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another; together we can do more #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Inú ò ní rorò kí ìdodo má ba gbé.
proverbs.translation: The belly cannot be so fearsome that it won't cohabit with the navel.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursuing peace...

proverbs.proverb: Bí igi bá rorò, ó níláti bá igbó gbé.
proverbs.translation: Even if a tree is fearsome, it must still cohabit with the others in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Peace is crucial

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí èyàn ò bá ní ló ńjọọ́ lójú.
proverbs.translation: We place value on what we lack (or what's inaccessible to us).
proverbs.wisdom: Demand increases as supply reduces

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọmọdé ò tó pẹpẹ, tàgbàlagbà ò wọ akèrègbè
proverbs.translation: A child's hand can't reach the shelf as an elder's can't enter a gourd.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone is crucial

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í mọ iyì ohun tó ní, à fi tó bá sọọ́ nù.
proverbs.translation: We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose the thing.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt.

proverbs.proverb: Nínú òròmọ adìyẹ àti ẹyin rẹ̀, ọ̀kan lèyàn máa fọwọ́ mú
proverbs.translation: One must choose between the chick and the egg.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't eat your cake & have it

proverbs.proverb: Bí oko bá tilẹ̀ dára bí ilé, ibi kan lèyàn ńfọwọ́ mú.
proverbs.translation: Even if the farm is as nice as the home, one ought to stick with one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive

proverbs.proverb: Bí ó bá ku ọwọ́ kan àdán, yóò fi rọ igi
proverbs.translation: Even if left with just one paw, the bat will still hang unto a tree branch.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up

proverbs.proverb: Kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ tó bá ńsùn, ò lè rí ogbe àkùkọ jájẹ.
proverbs.translation: A sleeping fox can't get to eat a cock's comb.
proverbs.wisdom: Persistent effort must precede results

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni máa jẹ oyin inú àpáta, kìí wo ẹnu àáke.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to eat the honey embedded in a mountain won't fret about the axe.
proverbs.wisdom: Persist!

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that wants to shine must be passed through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: No pains, no gains; don't give up!

proverbs.proverb: Bí èèyàn ò bá tọ̀ sójú kan, kìí hó.
proverbs.translation: If one does not urinate on a single spot, the urine won't foam.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't spread yourself thin

proverbs.proverb: Òní la rí kò sẹ́ni tó mọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: It's today we all see; no one knows tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can predict the future for sure; don't give up hope.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹda ò l'àròpin.
proverbs.translation: No one can be written off.
proverbs.wisdom: Never underestimate yourself or anyone; you have no idea what you or anyone is capable of

proverbs.proverb: Orí ẹni ni í fini í jọba, ìwà èyàn ni í yọ èyàn lóyè.
proverbs.translation: Fate may enthrone one a king, but it's character that dethrones.
proverbs.wisdom: Character limits

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà lọba àwúre.
proverbs.translation: Good character is superior to any goodluck charm.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character promotes

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is what adorns a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character ought to be cultivated #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àkàṣọ̀ tó bá fara tilẹ̀ tó bá fara tilé kò lè yẹ̀ dànù.
proverbs.translation: A ladder that rests on both the ground & the wall can't fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid isolation

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí àtùpà ṣe lè lágbára tó, kò lè ríran rí ìdí ara rẹ̀
proverbs.translation: No matter how strong a lamp is, it cannot see it's base.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀bẹ kì í mú kó gbẹ́ èkù ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A knife cannot be so sharp as to carve its handle.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another; no man is an island.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ewu l'óko, à fi gìrìgìrì àparò
proverbs.translation: There is no danger at the farm except the sound of the patridge's movement.
proverbs.wisdom: A situation with no fear

proverbs.proverb: Àlùya ni ìlù ọ̀fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: A free drum gets beaten until it's bursted.
proverbs.wisdom: What is cheap, gets abused (or treated with disrespect).

proverbs.proverb: Ìrìn a rìn, làá ko'ni.
proverbs.translation: As we walk, so we meet people.
proverbs.wisdom: Our 'appearance' determines our association

proverbs.proverb: Èlírí kì í ṣe ọmọ eku, bí ìran ẹ̀ ṣe mọ ni
proverbs.translation: The tiny mouse isn't an offspring of the rat; its smallness is genetic.
proverbs.wisdom: Look beyond the obvious

proverbs.proverb: Ìjọ oníìbínú kan kì í kún.
proverbs.translation: A gathering convened by an intolerant person, seldom gets filled up.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is crucial #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìbínú kì í pẹ́ sọ ilé olówó rẹ̀ dahoro.
proverbs.translation: Anger hardly takes long to make the home of its bearer desolate.
proverbs.wisdom: Uncontrolled anger can be costly

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ka.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed will be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work, amazingly!

proverbs.proverb: Yóó ṣẹ, kò ṣẹ, àdúrà yá ju èpè.
proverbs.translation: Regardless of whether or not they will be answered, prayers are better than curses.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers are crucial

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹrù bá pọ̀ lórí ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀, ó ńpa ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ lara ni
proverbs.translation: If a plantain plant bears excessive burden, it will be detrimental to it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate

proverbs.proverb: Tí èyàn kò bá tí ì dé ibi tó ńlọ, kì í dúró.
proverbs.translation: If one has not reached one's destination, one ought not to stop.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up; keep moving

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà kan ò wọ ọjà.
proverbs.translation: There's more than one route to the market.
proverbs.wisdom: There are several possible ways of achieving something.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí yóò bá di akàn, bí ẹja nií kọ́kọ́ maá ńrí
proverbs.translation: What will turn out favourable often do start out less than favourable.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive!

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọlọ́wọ́ ò lè yó ẹnu ẹlẹ́nu
proverbs.translation: One can't be fed to satisfaction with the hands of someone else.
proverbs.wisdom: Be diligent; don't always depend on others

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹja bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A fish that sleeps will get eaten up by another fish.
proverbs.wisdom: Be diligent; avoid complacency #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Iṣẹ́ l'oògùn ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Work is the antidote for poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Get busy; diligence is a sure way to address poverty #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni lẹ́ni lẹ́hìn kì í ṣẹ̀sín ilu.
proverbs.translation: A person with good backing won't be easily exposed to shame.
proverbs.wisdom: Human networks provide good cover

proverbs.proverb: Tí ò bá sígi lẹ́hìn ọgbà, wíwó nií wó
proverbs.translation: A make-shift fence without the backing of a tree collapses, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Good networks are supportive

proverbs.proverb: Owó tóbi, ṣùgbọ́n kò tó èèyàn
proverbs.translation: Money (or wealth) is crucial, but it's nothing like human relationships.
proverbs.wisdom: Networks are superior to wealth

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni òjò pa, tí àrá ò pa kó máa dúpẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got beaten by rain but wasn't struck by lightning should be thankful.
proverbs.wisdom: Be ever grateful

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá mọ inú rò, á mọ ọpẹ́ ẹ́ dá.
proverbs.translation: Whoever can think well, will know how to be ever grateful.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain a heart of gratitude, always

proverbs.proverb: Ìfẹ́ fọ́jú; obìnrin táa bá fẹ́ràn kìí ní àlébù
proverbs.translation: Love is blind; a woman one loves seldom has faults.
proverbs.wisdom: If there's a blemish, love won't see it

proverbs.proverb: Náwó náwó kìí ṣ'àpà, ó ńfi owó ra iyì ni.
proverbs.translation: The generous person is not wasteful, he is actually buying honour for himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Generosity pays

proverbs.proverb: A kì í láhun ká níyì.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be stingy and be respected.
proverbs.wisdom: Choose to be a giver; it's honourable. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Rí'rú omi òkun kò ní k'ẹ́ja má sùn, kó má han'run.
proverbs.translation: The storms of the sea won't stop the fish from sleeping and snoring.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ò kàn ńṣe ọmọ olóòkú bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, a ò ní sin ín pẹ̀lú òkú rẹ̀
proverbs.translation: The bereaved is simply hurting, he won't go with the deceased.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò lè já.
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they can't fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Dare to hope; no matter how tough it seems

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùkù biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch-dark night, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùkù biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After pitch-dark night, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò bá gba kádàrá, yóò gba kodoro.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is unwilling to accept his lot will end up with nothing.
proverbs.wisdom: Be contented

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí bíńtí ò tó, púpọ̀ yóò jìnnà si.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not contented with a little, much will be far from him.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment makes for increase

proverbs.proverb: Àjùlọ ò lóòpin.
proverbs.translation: Seniority knows no end.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest; there will always be someone ahead, just as there are many behind #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ò kú, ìṣe ò tán
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is no limit to what can be achieved.
proverbs.wisdom: Endure; as long as there is life, there is hope

proverbs.proverb: Hùnrùnhunrun ni yóò pọ̀, ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ á dé Ọ̀yọ́.
proverbs.translation: Its grunting may be endless but the pig would get to Oyo town, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep up hope

proverbs.proverb: Ìrírí ayé ò ní ti'ni títí kó ti'ni pa; ọgbọ́n ló fi ńkọ́'ni
proverbs.translation: Life's challenges quite often do not kill; they simply make one wiser.
proverbs.wisdom: Endure!

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bópẹ́ bóyá akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan
proverbs.translation: If one won't stop trying, one's hustling will end, one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Persist!

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ibi ṣú olóore.
proverbs.translation: A benefactor should not be repaid with wickedness.
proverbs.wisdom: Be grateful; honour your benefactor #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Nínú oore loore wà.
proverbs.translation: Kindness begets kindness.
proverbs.wisdom: Give kindness, and you'll get it in return #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àìnísùúrù ìnàkí ló sọọ́ di ará inú igbó.
proverbs.translation: Gorilla's impatience is what made it an inhabitant of the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Impatience can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kìí hó ruru kí á wàá ruru.
proverbs.translation: One ought not to paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Complex issues should be patiently handled

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá ṣe lónìí, ọ̀rọ̀ ìtàn ni bó d'òla.
proverbs.translation: Whatever we do today, will become history, tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: Be mindful of your legacy

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù kìí pẹyẹ
proverbs.translation: A stone thrown at a bird in anger can't kill the bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results

proverbs.proverb: Afọgbọ́nọlọ́gbọ́n ṣọgbọ́n kìí tẹ́ bọ̀rọ̀
proverbs.translation: Those who are smart to adopt the wisdom of others seldom get shamed
proverbs.wisdom: Be open to learn from others

proverbs.proverb: Àṣìṣe ò kan ọgbọ́n.
proverbs.translation: Wisdom does not exclude anyone from mistakes.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is infallible #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: T'ẹni bẹ́'gi lójù; igi á rú'wé.
proverbs.translation: The shame is on the person who cuts a tree; it will sprout leaves again.
proverbs.wisdom: Persist. Be undaunted.

proverbs.proverb: Wúrà tó máa dán, á la iná kọjá.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold that desires to shine must need pass through fire.
proverbs.wisdom: No pains, no gains; don't give up!

proverbs.proverb: Kò s'óhun tó pọ̀ tí kìí tán, à fọlá Ọlọ́run
proverbs.translation: There's nothing much that won't get exhausted except God's grace
proverbs.wisdom: God's blessing never runs out

proverbs.proverb: Kó dùn, kó pọ̀, kó pẹ́, Ọlọ́run ló ńfún ni.
proverbs.translation: What's sweet, what's much and what endures are all from God.
proverbs.wisdom: Only God's blessing endures

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni kan kì í gbọ́n tán.
proverbs.translation: No one knows it all (or possesses all wisdom).
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain a teachable mindset #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Omi tí èyàn máa mu ò ní ṣàn kọjá rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A stream from which one will drink won't flow beyond one's reach.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá bò ló ńníyì.
proverbs.translation: What's covered up (or concealed) is what gets treated with honour.
proverbs.wisdom: Undue familiarity does breed contempt

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love, but you can't be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnití ò bá fẹ́ ṣe àṣedànù, kò lè ṣe àṣejèrè
proverbs.translation: Whoever is unwilling to suffer loss, can't experience gains.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnu kìnìún lowó wà
proverbs.translation: Money (wealth) resides right in the lion's mouth.
proverbs.wisdom: Willingness to take risks is crucial to success #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo èèyàn oníwà tùtù kọ́ lonínúure.
proverbs.translation: It's not everyone with quiet disposition that is kind-natured.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá pẹ́ ní ààtán a máa rí abuké eṣinṣin
proverbs.translation: If one tarries at the dunghill one will find a housefly with a hump.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; be steadfast

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ ńlá kọ́ l'èyàn ńlá.
proverbs.translation: Being expensively attired does not connote wealth or importance.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance quite often can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí ò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, ò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀
proverbs.translation: A dunghill that will not tolerate filth won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no sweat, no sweet

proverbs.proverb: Ilé ọba tó jó ẹwà ló bù si
proverbs.translation: A palace that got burnt is preparing for better aesthetics.
proverbs.wisdom: A disappointment may well be a blessing in disguise

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í dára kó má kù síbì kan.
proverbs.translation: No one can be so good and not have a flaw.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; we all need to be tolerant

proverbs.proverb: Ìwákúùwá nií mú'ni rí ìríkúùrí
proverbs.translation: Unconscionable quest exposes one to undesirable (or strange) outcomes.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate; tame inordinate greed

proverbs.proverb: A kìí gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't pour away the water in the trough just because the cloud rumbles.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous

proverbs.proverb: Ilé tí a fi itọ́ mọ, ìrì ló máa wóo.
proverbs.translation: A house built with saliva will collapse under dew drops.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is founded on deceit won't endure

proverbs.proverb: Àt'oore àt'ìkà, ìkan kìí gbé.
proverbs.translation: Neither acts of kindness nor those of wickedness shall be lost.
proverbs.wisdom: We reap what we sow

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi gbèsè sọ́rùn ṣe ọ̀ṣọ́.
proverbs.translation: One ought not to live an extravagant lifestyle while in debt.
proverbs.wisdom: Decrying indebtedness... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ṣebíotimọ kì í tẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Those who operate within their means, seldom get disgraced.
proverbs.wisdom: Live within your means. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà jọ̀wà nií jẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́ jọ̀rẹ́
proverbs.translation: It's the sharing  of common character traits that makes for friendly relationships.
proverbs.wisdom: Show me your friends...

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tó ti rí òkun, ò lè bẹ̀rù ọ̀sà mọ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever had experienced the seas would no longer be moved by the lagoons.
proverbs.wisdom: Challenges do empower

proverbs.proverb: Bí oore bá pọ̀ lápọ̀jù, ibi laráyé fi í sú'ni í san
proverbs.translation: Uncontrolled kindness is often reciprocated with wickedness.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo àlùwàlá ológbò ò kọjá à ti kẹ́ran jẹ
proverbs.translation: All the ablutions of the cat were mere ploys to steal some beef.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Amọ̀nà èṣí kì í ṣe amọ̀nà ọdún yìí.
proverbs.translation: A person who knew the way last year will not necessarily know the way this year.
proverbs.wisdom: Learn constantly

proverbs.proverb: Ìka ò dọ́gba.
proverbs.translation: All fingers are not equal.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't compare yourself to anyone; you are unique, in your own way. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fẹsẹ̀ kọ
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid distractions; be focused

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kìí wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: We should be focused on where we are going, not where we have fallen.
proverbs.wisdom: Let go of the past

proverbs.proverb: Ẹrù ìyẹ́ kì í pa adìyẹ
proverbs.translation: A hen is never burdened by the weight of its feathers.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up; your challenges are within your capabilities

proverbs.proverb: Ẹrù ìyẹ́ kì í pa adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A hen is never burdened by the weight of its feathers.
proverbs.wisdom: One's responsibilities shouldn't be too onerous for one

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: No age limit to learning

proverbs.proverb: Gbòngbò kan ṣoṣo ò gbọdọ̀ ré ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n lẹ́pa lẹ́ẹ̀mejì
proverbs.translation: The same tree stump shouldn't trip a wise person twice.
proverbs.wisdom: Learn from past mistakes

proverbs.proverb: Ọbẹ̀ tó dùn owó ló paá.
proverbs.translation: A tasty soup costs money.
proverbs.wisdom: No free lunch... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kí a fi gègé gún ara ẹni wò, kí a tó fi gún ọmọ ẹyẹ
proverbs.translation: We should prick ourselves with the penpoint first, before using it on a bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀mọ̀ràn ní ńmọ oyún ìgbín
proverbs.translation: Only a person of knowledge will know when a snail is pregnant.
proverbs.wisdom: Seek knowledge; it confers privileges and power

proverbs.proverb: Okùn kì í gùn títí kó má ní ibi tí a ti fàá wá.
proverbs.translation: A rope can't be so long and not have a beginning or a source.
proverbs.wisdom: Every effect has a cause

proverbs.proverb: Èlùbọ́ ṣe ègbodò rí; arúgbó ṣe omidan rí
proverbs.translation: Yam flour was once fresh yams; the old grey-haired woman was once a maiden
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́ kọ́ ni oògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Be moderate; adopt radical solutions with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀bẹ kì í mú kó gbẹ́ èkù ara rẹ
proverbs.translation: A knife cannot be so sharp as to carve its handle.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ará oko tí yóò jẹ búrẹ́dì á fèsúrú ránṣẹ́ sílé
proverbs.translation: A farm dweller who wants to eat bread need to send some aerial yams home
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give & take

proverbs.proverb: Ará oko tí yóò jẹ búrẹ́dì á fèsúrú ránṣẹ́ sílé
proverbs.translation: A farm dweller that wants some bread need to send some aerial yams home
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give & take

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ là ńtẹ ẹrẹ̀; ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ là ńtẹ eruku.
proverbs.translation: Muds and sands are stepped on differently.
proverbs.wisdom: One size does not fit all.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá dúpẹ́ oore àná yóò rí òmíràn gbà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever gives thanks for past favours, will be granted another.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to be thankful.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá lé eku méjì á p'òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pursues two rats simultaneously, will lose both.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't spread yourself too thin

proverbs.proverb: Alágbẹ̀dẹ tó ńlu irin lójú kan ó lóhun tó fẹ́ fàyọ ńbẹ̀
proverbs.translation: A blacksmith who kept hitting an iron at a spot has his reasons.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹṣin bá dáni a máa ńtún un gùn ni.
proverbs.translation: If one is thrown by a horse, one ought to persist in remounting it.
proverbs.wisdom: Persist! Try again, and again,

proverbs.proverb: Tí ojú bá f'ara balẹ̀ á r'imú.
proverbs.translation: If the eyes are patient enough, they can get to see the nose.
proverbs.wisdom: Patience is crucialProverbs

proverbs.proverb: A kìí gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't throw away the water in the trough upon the rumbling of the cloud
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed, it will positively impact two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success is contagious

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kìí tan'ni jẹ
proverbs.translation: The output of one's palm (the results of one's effort) can't deceive one
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid excessive dependence on others

proverbs.proverb: Orí igi tó wọ́ làá wà táà rí èyí tó tọ́
proverbs.translation: It's while on the crooked tree that one will find the proper one.
proverbs.wisdom: Make the best of opportunities

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàdo inú ìgò, ó di àwòmọ́jú fún adìyẹ
proverbs.translation: The corns kept in a bottle are viewed with disdain by the hen
proverbs.wisdom: People despise what they can' t have

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìtàkùn bá pa ẹnu pọ̀, wọ́n a mú erin so.
proverbs.translation: If creeping plants could unite, they'll easily tie up an elephant.
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Agbójúlógún fi ara ẹ̀ fún òṣì ta.
proverbs.translation: Whoever trusts on hoped-for inheritance, exposes himself to poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Take responsibility for your life

proverbs.proverb: Igi ò lè gbé abẹ́ igi, kó rúwé
proverbs.translation: A tree cannot be shielded by another tree and consistently sprout leaves.
proverbs.wisdom: Get off your comfort zone.

proverbs.proverb: Ìrèké ò ní'bùdó; ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára
proverbs.translation: Sugarcane has no place of refuge; every situation suits a hardworker just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńsebẹ̀, ò kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't lose hope; nothing is beyond God

proverbs.proverb: Bí túlàsì bá di méjì, ọ̀kan là ńmú.
proverbs.translation: If there are two (competing) obligations, one ought to simply pick one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive and focused

proverbs.proverb: Òde ò ní dùn kí onílé má re'lé.
proverbs.translation: An outing can't be so nice that one won't return home.
proverbs.wisdom: No matter where it is, home is the best place to be

proverbs.proverb: Bíbíre kò ṣeé fi owó rà.
proverbs.translation: A good pedigree cannot be bought with money.
proverbs.wisdom: It's not everything that wealth can confer #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìyànjú l'àgbẹ̀ ńgbìn; elédùà nìkan ló mọ b'íṣu ṣe ńta
proverbs.translation: Farmers merely sow efforts; God alone knows how the yams get formed.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes...

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tó n'íbẹ̀rẹ̀ tí kò ní lópin
proverbs.translation: There is nothing with a beginning that won't have an ending.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò lè já
proverbs.translation: The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they can't fall off.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up, no matter how tough it seems.

proverbs.proverb: Nínú ìkòkò dúdú ni ẹ̀kọ funfun ti ńjáde.
proverbs.translation: The pot may be black, yet out of it comes the white corn meal.
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one

proverbs.proverb: Tí omi bá pọ̀ jokà lọ, ọkà a máa dí kókó
proverbs.translation: Excessive water makes the yam flour meal lumpy.
proverbs.wisdom: Too much of even a good thing can be detrimental

proverbs.proverb: Tí èyàn bá ní sùúrù, ohun tí ò tó, ṣì ńbọ̀ wá ṣẹ́kù
proverbs.translation: If one is patient, what is insufficient will be in excess soon enough
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive

proverbs.proverb: Tí èyàn bá pẹ́ láyé á jẹran tó ju erin lọ
proverbs.translation: If one lives long enough, one would eat far more quantity of meat than an elephant
proverbs.wisdom: Don't give up

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: One ought not to carry out one's duties using someone else's time piece
proverbs.wisdom: Don't evaluate your life by another's

proverbs.proverb: Àkókò kò dúró de ẹnìkan.
proverbs.translation: Time waits for no one.
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ rere sàn ju wúrà àti fàdákà lọ.
proverbs.translation: A good name is better than gold and silver.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue a good name; it is priceless. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kìí yangan bàtà lójú ẹni tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀
proverbs.translation: One shouldn't brag about shoes in the presence of a person who has no legs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be courteous & tactful

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnití ò bá fẹ́ ṣe àṣedànù kò lè ṣe àṣejèrè
proverbs.translation: Those who are unwilling to suffer loss can't experience gains.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣánpá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí èyàn ò bá rí, kì í  rí èyàn lára.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be repulsed by what one cannot see.
proverbs.wisdom: One cannot react to what cannot perceive

proverbs.proverb: Àt'oore àt'ìkà, ìkan kì í gbé.
proverbs.translation: Neither acts of kindness nor those of wickedness shall be lost.
proverbs.wisdom: We will reap whatever we sow

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: I am hungry is not to be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious matter shouldn't be treated with levity

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀kùn tí ò bá ní alùgbàgbà, kó yára dẹ́kun àpárá dí dá
proverbs.translation: A door that has no frame, had better cease all pranks.
proverbs.wisdom: Operate within your means

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kìí fi oníwà sílẹ̀
proverbs.translation: A person's character sticks to him
proverbs.wisdom: Character can't be counterfeited; One can't feign to be who one isn't for long

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá fara pamọ́ ló máa ńgbó.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that grows to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Obì tó bá fara pamọ́ ló máa ńgbo.
proverbs.translation: The kolanut fruit that hides itself is the one that grows to maturity.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Méèló ni èèrà tó wípé aràn ńyọ òun l'ẹ́nu?
proverbs.translation: How big is the ant that claimed that it's being ailed by worms?
proverbs.wisdom: Decrying inordinate arrogance

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọmọdé ò tó pẹpẹ, tàgbàlagbà ò wọ akèrègbè
proverbs.translation: A child's hand can't reach the shelf as an elder's can't enter a gourd.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another

proverbs.proverb: Ọbẹ̀ tí ò pọ̀ kì í kan.
proverbs.translation: A soup that is moderate in size soup can't get (so neglected as to go) sour.
proverbs.wisdom: What's not common can't lose value

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò rí nǹkan wò, ló ńwo ti ẹniẹlẹ́ni
proverbs.translation: It's a person with no issue to attend to, who meddles in those of others.
proverbs.wisdom: Mind your ọwn business

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín (a town), ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternatives exist

proverbs.proverb: Á ka owó tì lálẹ́, oníbárà tó ńṣe ẹ̀ẹ́kẹ́ èébú.
proverbs.translation: A quarrelsome beggar would find few alms to count at the end of the day.
proverbs.wisdom: Be courteous

proverbs.proverb: Kìí ṣe gbogbo ajá tó ńgbóni lọ́jà la ńdá lóhùn
proverbs.translation: Not all dogs that bark at one in the market that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Focus; avoid distractions

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ohun tó ńdán kọ́ ni wúrà.
proverbs.translation: Not all that glitters is gold.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs.proverb: Ìbàjẹ́ ọjọ́ kan kì í tán lógún ọdún.
proverbs.translation: An indiscretion of one day, does not get forgotten in twenty years.
proverbs.wisdom: Maintain a good reputation

proverbs.proverb: Àdánìkànrìn ejò ló ńjẹ ọmọ ejò níyà
proverbs.translation: It's penchant for moving alone is what exposes the snake to life-threatening risks
proverbs.wisdom: Isolation is unwise

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di eepo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that wants to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain

proverbs.proverb: Yíyọ́ ẹkùn, kì í ṣe tojo
proverbs.translation: The stealthy movement of the leopard isn't out of cowardice.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't mistake gentleness for stupidity or cowardice

proverbs.proverb: Ọjọ́ kìí pẹ́ kó máà dé, à fi àìmọ̀ọ́kà.
proverbs.translation: A set date can't be so far off & not come to pass, except it's incorrectly counted.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast
