proverbs.translation: Whoever is singing a lousy song, very well hears it, as well
proverbs.wisdom: The obvious needs no emphasis

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tó tọ́ lèyàn ńtọ̀ sí.
proverbs.translation: One ought to urinate in a proper place.
proverbs.wisdom: Things should be done in order #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: No age limit to learning #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, ogún ọdún ńbọ̀ wá k'ọ̀la.
proverbs.translation: Eventually, twenty years time will be referred to as, tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ohun tó n'íbẹ̀rẹ̀ tí kò ní lópin.
proverbs.translation: There is nothing with a beginning that will not have an ending.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kékeré ata kò ṣeé fi b'ọ́jú.
proverbs.translation: Even a little quantity of pepper can't be used to wash the face.
proverbs.wisdom: Under-estimate no one #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Nítorí kí a má jìyà, la ṣe yá Májìyà lọ́fà.
proverbs.translation: We lent out our arrow to Majiya, so that we would not suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: Being proactive...

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time; be patient #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Etí tó bá tọrọ ọ̀rọ̀ dandan ni kó gbọ́ọ.
proverbs.translation: The ears that asked for words would surely hear them.
proverbs.wisdom: Effects definitely result from causes

proverbs.proverb: Kí á rí ogun, kí á máà sá, ni iyì ọkùnrin
proverbs.translation: To face war and not flee is the honour of a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't shirk responsibilities #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lọ kì í dé.
proverbs.translation: One who has not gone, cannot be arriving.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't reap, if you have not sown #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í pẹ̀lú ọ̀bọ já'ko.
proverbs.translation: No one joins a monkey to roam the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't descend to join anyone do despicable things #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tútù ní ńtẹnu ẹja wá.
proverbs.translation: It's cold things that come out of the mouth of a fish.
proverbs.wisdom: One's words should be comely... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed, it positively impacts two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success is contagious #yoruba#proverb

proverbs.proverb: Tí kò bá sí, a kìí dédé rẹ́ja lókè odò
proverbs.translation: If there are no reasons, a fish can't be found on the bank of the river
proverbs.wisdom: Unusual events have causes

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi orí adé sán gbàǹgede.
proverbs.translation: One ought not to bring the king into disrepute.
proverbs.wisdom: Give honour to whom it is due #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí a fi í ríran a kì í fi tẹ ilẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: One ought not to step the ground with the eyes with which one sees.
proverbs.wisdom: Give honour to whom it is due

proverbs.proverb: Tí apá kò bá ṣe ṣán, a ńma a ka lórí ni.
proverbs.translation: If the arms cannot be swung, they are simply folded on the head.
proverbs.wisdom: There is always a way out!

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹṣin bá dá'ni a máa ńtun gùn ni.
proverbs.translation: If one is thrown by a horse, one ought to re-mount it again.
proverbs.wisdom: Never give up! #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àlejò oṣù mẹ́ẹ̀sán kì í bá'ni lójijì
proverbs.translation: The visit of a guest expected for 9 months (birth of a baby) cannot be sudden to one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be proactive

proverbs.proverb: Ọbẹ̀ tí kò pọ̀ kì í kan.
proverbs.translation: A moderately-sized soup does not go sour.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is critical in all things. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kìí tan'ni jẹ
proverbs.translation: One's palm cannot deceive one
proverbs.wisdom: The results of one's efforts are what most assuredly won't come with deception

proverbs.proverb: Tí ayé bá wà lẹyìn aáyán, yóò pa adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: If the world backs the cockroach, it will kill the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: With good backing nothing is impossible

proverbs.proverb: Èèyàn boni lára ju aṣọ lọ.
proverbs.translation: People provide better cover than clothes.
proverbs.wisdom: Relationships are critical #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìtẹ́lẹ̀dí ẹni kì í ríni tì
proverbs.translation: One's undergarments are not unfamiliar with one's nudity
proverbs.wisdom: Those close to one, know one deeply #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí yóò ti dára, lọ́wọ́ Elédùmarè ló wà.
proverbs.translation: How things will get better is in God's hands.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ibi pẹlẹbẹ la ti ńmú ọ̀ọ̀lẹ̀ jẹ
proverbs.translation: Bean meals are first eaten from the flattened edges
proverbs.wisdom: Address simple issues first, before the complex ones

proverbs.proverb: Nínú oore loore wà.
proverbs.translation: Kindness begets kindness.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness follows the kind-hearted #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A person's character sticks to him.
proverbs.wisdom: Character cannot be counterfeited or feigned for long #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Adìyẹ tí ò kú ṣì máa jẹ àgbàdo.
proverbs.translation: The hen that did not die will eventually get to eat corn.
proverbs.wisdom: Once there is life, nothing is impossible

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ò ní pa igún títí, kó wá jẹ àgbàdo.
proverbs.translation: The vulture cannot be so hungry as to eat maize.
proverbs.wisdom: There's a limit to how low anyone will stoop

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: I am hungry is not to be announced by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious matter should not be treated with levity

proverbs.proverb: Ogun àsọtélè kì í pa arọ.
proverbs.translation: A war announced well in advance never kills the lame.
proverbs.wisdom: Be proactive #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ojú àwo làwo fi ńgb'ọbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Eating plates receive stews on their 'faces'.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone bears his responsibilities... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo aṣọ kọ́ là ńsá lóòrùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all clothes that are dried in the sun.
proverbs.wisdom: Different situations call for different approaches

proverbs.proverb: A kìí bérè lọ́wọ́ adélébọ̀ pé ńbo ló ti róyún
proverbs.translation: No one asks a married woman where she's got her pregnancy
proverbs.wisdom: Some questions have obvious answers

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá da omi síwájú á tẹ'lẹ tútù.
proverbs.translation: Whoever pours water ahead of him, will step on a wet ground.
proverbs.wisdom: Sow, if you desire to reap

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ eré dìjà ní ńjẹ̀bi ẹjọ́.
proverbs.translation: Whoever turns a prank into a quarrel is the one at fault.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be too serious #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ní kàǹga ò lè mọ iyì òǹgbẹ
proverbs.translation: A person who has a water well can't appreciate what thirst is all about
proverbs.wisdom: Insensitivity to the unfamiliar

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not hot, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: No pains, no gains. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí aboyún bá bímọ tán ara á tùú.
proverbs.translation: Once a pregnant woman delivers (her baby), she will be at ease.
proverbs.wisdom: After the storm, comes the calm

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹrú bá pẹ́ n'ílé á bú alájọbí.
proverbs.translation: If a slave dwells long with one, he will insult one's forebears.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt

proverbs.proverb: Tí apá ò bá ṣeé ṣán, a máa ka lórí ni.
proverbs.translation: If the arms cannot be swung, they are simply folded on the head.
proverbs.wisdom: An alternative way out exists

proverbs.proverb: Ẹníkan kì í jẹ, kí ìlú fẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: One person can't eat and the town will expand.
proverbs.wisdom: The progress of one is not progress of all #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ayé kò ṣeé dá gbé.
proverbs.translation: The world is not to a place to live in, alone.
proverbs.wisdom: We need one another... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹṣin iwájú ni ti ẹ̀yìn ńwò sáré.
proverbs.translation: It's the lead of the horse in front that those behind follow.
proverbs.wisdom: A group is defined by its leader

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó bá kan ojú lojú ma ńṣẹ́ sí
proverbs.translation: It is what concerns the eyes that they blink on.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid meddling #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kìí ṣòwò méjì kẹ́ran má jẹ ọ̀kan.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be engaged in two trades and goat will not eat up one of them.
proverbs.wisdom: Be single-focused

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ńsọ̀kò sádìyẹ igba, òkò ló máa sọ tílẹ̀ á fi ṣú
proverbs.translation: Whoever is throwing stones at 200 hens, will throw them until the evening
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní gbé ọba mì kì í ní ìsinmi.
proverbs.translation: Whoever swallows (gets crowned) a king can't have rest.
proverbs.wisdom: Positions of responsibility can be stressful

proverbs.proverb: Àìsí olójú, ẹnìkan kì í tìí.
proverbs.translation: An eye cannot be closed in the absence of the owner.
proverbs.wisdom: Help cannot be rendered to an unwilling recipient

proverbs.proverb: Ìka ò dọ́gba.
proverbs.translation: All fingers are not equal.
proverbs.wisdom: We are all unique, but different. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Fúnrara abẹ́rẹ́ ló ńf'ẹnu ara rẹ̀ d'áṣọ lu.
proverbs.translation: The needle by itself pierces cloths with its pointed end.
proverbs.wisdom: Your progress is up to you

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀mọ̀ràn ní ńmọ oyún ìgbín.
proverbs.translation: Only a person of knowledge will know, when a snail is pregnant.
proverbs.wisdom: Knowledge confers privileges & power

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be too old for (or to learn) what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no end to learning

proverbs.proverb: Amọ̀nà èṣí kì í ṣe amọ̀nà ọdún yìí.
proverbs.translation: A person who knew the way last year will not necessarily know the way this year.
proverbs.wisdom: Learn constantly

proverbs.proverb: Nǹkan tí èyàn ò ní jẹ, kì í fi run imú.
proverbs.translation: What one will not eat, one ought not to sniff
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won't finish #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Epo bíntín ló ńba ojú omi jẹ́.
proverbs.translation: It's a little quantity of oil that mars the surface of water.
proverbs.wisdom: A little indiscretion is destructive enough

proverbs.proverb: Ò ńlọ si Ọ̀yọ́ ò ńkánjú, Aláàfin ò re ibi kan
proverbs.translation: You are going to Ọ̀yo town and you are in haste; the king is going nowhere
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be in haste

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ 'Lùú!' lẹ́nu àgbà
proverbs.translation: We shouldn't hear ''Beat him up!' from an elderly person
proverbs.wisdom: Matured minds resolve rather than compound issues

proverbs.proverb: Ìríkúrìí kì í fọ́ ojú
proverbs.translation: To see unusual things, does not necessarily make one blind.
proverbs.wisdom: You can do more than you think #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ pọ̀ nínú ìwé kọ́bọ̀.
proverbs.translation: There are exceeding details from a book (insignificantly) priced at 1 kobo.
proverbs.wisdom: Much ado about nothing

proverbs.proverb: Ibi gbogbo nií rọ àdàbà lọ́rùn.
proverbs.translation: Everywhere suits the dove just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Ability to cope with different situations. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí ajá ò bá rí, kì í gbó.
proverbs.translation: Dogs do not just bark for no reason.
proverbs.wisdom: Every effect has an associated cause. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ra ẹ̀kọ ní ibi agbọ̀n ti ga.
proverbs.translation: One does not buy the corn meal, where the basket is high.
proverbs.wisdom: Live within your means #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ ńlá kọ́ l'èyàn ńlá.
proverbs.translation: To be expensively attired does not connote wealth or importance.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Erin kì í jẹ koríko abẹ́ rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: The elephant does not eat the grass underneath it.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid situations with conflict of interests

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọ̀nà odò han ikún.
proverbs.translation: The ground squirrel need not be shown the way to the river.
proverbs.wisdom: An expert in a field need not be tutored on it

proverbs.proverb: Ilé l'adìyẹ ò ti níyì.
proverbs.translation: It is at home that a hen has no honour.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní dádé ti kúrò lọ́mọdé
proverbs.translation: Whoever is crowned king, is no longer a youngster.
proverbs.wisdom: Responsibility may redefine one's status  #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tó bá tọ́ sí, lèyàn ńtọ̀ sí
proverbs.translation: One ought to urinate in a proper place
proverbs.wisdom: A play on the word 'tọ' to mean that things should be properly done

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá lé eku méjì á p'òfo.
proverbs.translation: Whoever chases two rats, will will catch none.
proverbs.wisdom: Being focused... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If a bus won't go to Ejinrin town, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is irreplaceable

proverbs.proverb: Aṣọ funfun òun àbàwọ́n kì í rẹ́.
proverbs.translation: White clothes and stains are no friends.
proverbs.wisdom: Persons with deeply contrasting values are seldom close

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnú dùn ńròfọ́; agada ọwọ́ dùn ńṣánko.
proverbs.translation: The mouth may easily cook vegetable soup  as the hand may cut grasses.
proverbs.wisdom: Easier to brag...

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ẹnu kọ́ la fi ńpe ọmọ alákàrà
proverbs.translation: To beckon on the bean cake seller need not be with much noise
proverbs.wisdom: Not all issues need maximum attention

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá tíì jókòó a kìí na ẹsẹ̀
proverbs.translation: If one is not properly seated, one cannot stretch one's legs
proverbs.wisdom: Don't relent until you achieve your goals

proverbs.proverb: Ẹran tó mú erèé jẹ, ló mú kí gbẹ̀gìrì ó ṣàn
proverbs.translation: The goat that ate up the beans made the bean soup watery.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a cause for every effect

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni à ńbá nájà là ńwò, a kìí wo ariwo ọjà
proverbs.translation: We should face who we are trading with & ignore the noise in the market
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused on your goals

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà fún oun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: No end to learning #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yangan bàtà lójú ẹni tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: One ought not to brag about shoes in the presence of one with no legs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tactful

proverbs.proverb: Ayé ńlọ, a ńtọ̀ọ́.
proverbs.translation: The world is moving and we are following it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be responsive to change as the world changes #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ajá kì í rorò títí kó ṣọ́ ojú'lé méjì.
proverbs.translation: A dog cannot be so ferocious as to watch over two houses.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a limit to what anyone can do

proverbs.proverb: Abẹ́rẹ́ tó bá lókùn n'ìdí kì í sọnù
proverbs.translation: A needle affixed with a thread never gets lost
proverbs.wisdom: Those under authority (God or man) seldom go astray

proverbs.proverb: Alágbára má mèrò baba ọ̀lẹ
proverbs.translation: Strength devoid of wisdom is the epitome of indolence
proverbs.wisdom: Strengths yield more when steered & controlled in wisdom

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀bìtì ẹnu ò tàsé.
proverbs.translation: The trap set by the mouth (for food) never misses.
proverbs.wisdom: Competence with determination never misses #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbín kìí tẹnu mọ́gi kó má gùn ún
proverbs.translation: The snail never embarks on climbing a tree & fails to climb it
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused to finish whatever you start

proverbs.proverb: Ajá ìsìnyì ló mọ ehoro ìsìnyì ńlé
proverbs.translation: It is the modern day dogs that can chase the modern day rabbits
proverbs.wisdom: New challenges calls for new approaches

proverbs.proverb: Okùn ò lè gùn gùn kí ó máa ní'bi tí a ti fàá wá.
proverbs.translation: A rope cannot be so long that it won't have a source.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a cause for every effect

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìgbín bá fà ìkarahun á tẹ̀ le.
proverbs.translation: If the snail crawls, its shell will follow along.
proverbs.wisdom: Refers to soul mates or cause & effect relationship

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn mẹ́ta ò lé dùró ni méjì méjì
proverbs.translation: Three persons cannot stand (or be grouped) two-by-two.
proverbs.wisdom: Refers to an impossible scenario #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àjà ló lẹrù, irọ́ ni pẹpẹ ńpa
proverbs.translation: The attic 'owns' luggages, the shelf is merely bluffing.
proverbs.wisdom: Pretences to own another's assets #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àbá ni ikán ńdá; ikán ò lè mu òkúta.
proverbs.translation: The termite is merely wishful, it cannot sting the stone.
proverbs.wisdom: Refers to empty threats #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọbẹ̀ tó dùn owó ló paá.
proverbs.translation: A tasty soup costs money.
proverbs.wisdom: No free lunch... #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kójú má ríbi ẹsẹ̀ loògùn rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If the eyes will not see evil, the legs are the antidote.
proverbs.wisdom: Quickly distance yourself from intolerable risks

proverbs.proverb: Mélò lọ̀kánjúwà fẹ́ lá ńnú ọ́pọ́ iyọ́?
proverbs.translation: How much really can a greedy person lick out of a large amount of salt?
proverbs.wisdom: Greed is needlessly wasteful

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ara lasẹ́ fi ńjomi.
proverbs.translation: Sieves leak water through all of their holes.
proverbs.wisdom: Being extra-vigilant #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tojú tìyẹ́ l'àparò fi ńríran.
proverbs.translation: It is with both its eyes and feathers that a patridge, sees.
proverbs.wisdom: Be extra-vigilant #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àt'oore àt'ìkà, ìkan kì í gbé.
proverbs.translation: Neither acts of kindness nor those of wickedness shall be lost.
proverbs.wisdom: We reap what we sow #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó pa kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́ yó ru ẹrù rẹ̀
proverbs.translation: Whoever kills the donkey, will have to carry his load.
proverbs.wisdom: An action may produce unwanted consequences

proverbs.proverb: Ẹkọ gbígbóná ńfẹ́ sùúrù.
proverbs.translation: Patience is needed to drink hot pap.
proverbs.wisdom: Crucial issues must be patiently handled #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kìí kóòríra ọ̀fọ́ọ̀n kí a fi'ná bọ ahéré
proverbs.translation: One cannot so detest the mouse as to set the farm-house ablaze
proverbs.wisdom: Don't overreact #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òṣùṣù ọwọ̀ la fi ńgbálẹ̀ ti ilẹ̀ fi ńmọ́.
proverbs.translation: It is a bunch of broomsticks that is used to sweep the floor, clean.
proverbs.wisdom: Together, we can do more.

proverbs.proverb: Ọrun ńwó bọ kì í ṣe ọrọ ẹni kan.
proverbs.translation: The heaven is collapsing is not a problem of one person.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't make a general problem a personal one.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tí ayé bí láyé ńpọ̀n.
proverbs.translation: The world must back its offsprings.
proverbs.wisdom: You bear the consequences of your choices. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹrú kan nií múni búgba ẹrú
proverbs.translation: It's one slave that will cause two hundred others to be insulted
proverbs.wisdom: An indiscretion of one, invariably smears all

proverbs.proverb: Orí ẹni nií fini jọba, ìwà èyàn nií yọ èyàn lóyè
proverbs.translation: It is fate that enthrones one a king, but character dethrones
proverbs.wisdom: Character may limit one

proverbs.proverb: Àṣìṣe kò kan ọgbọ́n.
proverbs.translation: Possession of wisdom does not exclude anyone from mistakes.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is above mistake #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọdé gbọ́n àgbà gbọ́n la fi dá ilẹ̀ Ifẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: The wisdom of both the youth and elders were used to redeem Ife town.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone is needed

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀tún wẹ òsì, òsì wẹ ọ̀tun, ni ọwọ́ fií mọ́
proverbs.translation: The hands are clean when the right and the left hands washes each other.
proverbs.wisdom: Together we do more

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ àánú Olúwa kì í ṣú
proverbs.translation: God's land of mercy never grows dark.
proverbs.wisdom: God is infinitely merciful; no impossible case with Him #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo aṣọ kọ́ là nsá lóòrùn.
proverbs.translation: It is not all clothes that one dries in the sun.
proverbs.wisdom: Different situations call for different approaches

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó bá ṣiyèméjì lọdẹ ńpa.
proverbs.translation: It is an animal that is hesitant (or indecisive) that gets killed by the hunter.
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyẹ igbó kìí mọ fífò ọ̀dàn
proverbs.translation: Forest birds don't have the flying know-how of grasslands
proverbs.wisdom: An expert in one field often is a novice in another

proverbs.proverb: Eṣinṣin tó ńbọ́dẹ rìn ló ǹmu ẹ̀jẹ̀ àmuyó
proverbs.translation: A fly that moves with the hunter gets to drink blood satisfyingly
proverbs.wisdom: Connect duly to meet your goals

proverbs.proverb: Eré orí igi, àṣekù ọmọ ẹdun ni
proverbs.translation: Pranks on tree-tops are pastimes to monkeys
proverbs.wisdom: Refers to an issue one is very familiar with #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí yóò sọ irọ́ di òtítọ́ yóò ja'gun ẹnu
proverbs.translation: Whoever will convert lies to truths will have to fight with his mouth
proverbs.wisdom: Falsehood is stressful

proverbs.proverb: Àṣá kì í rà kádìyẹ gbé kòkòrò dání
proverbs.translation: A kite can't hover and the chicken will hang on to an insect.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't focus on trifles while danger looms

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fọmọ àparò sábẹ́ j'ọkà
proverbs.translation: One should not be eating corn with a patridge within one's vicinity
proverbs.wisdom: Protect your assets from obvious risks

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a sọ mọ́'pẹ òun ni ọ̀pẹ ńsọ mọ́ eyan.
proverbs.translation: The stone thrown at the palm gets thrown back at one by the palm
proverbs.wisdom: You get what you give

proverbs.proverb: Olúkálùkù ló mọ bó ṣe ńrìn tí ilẹ̀ fi ńṣúu
proverbs.translation: Each person knows how he moves until night falls on him
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks

proverbs.proverb: Èrò lọbẹ̀ gbẹ̀gìrì tí a kò bá ròó á díkókó.
proverbs.translation: The bean soup must be well stirred else it will be lumpy.
proverbs.wisdom: A matter requiring deep reflection

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó tó gbani làá ńsá tọ̀
proverbs.translation: One seeks for refuge from one who is able to save one.
proverbs.wisdom: Solution should be sought from where it can be found

proverbs.proverb: Èyíówù áwí, t'Olúwa làṣẹ.
proverbs.translation: We may say what we please, it is God's will that will get done.
proverbs.wisdom: Man proposes, God disposes #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ó ti wù kí ojú ọ̀run funfun tó, sánmà dúdú yó wà
proverbs.translation: No matter how bright the sky, some dark clouds will exist.
proverbs.wisdom: Challenges are not unusual

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́
proverbs.translation: One should not do one's work with another person's time piece
proverbs.wisdom: Don't run your life in line with others' agenda

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tanni jẹ
proverbs.translation: One's palm does not deceive one
proverbs.wisdom: The result of your effort (not another's) is yours to keep #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Díẹ̀ tó nínú nkan onínǹkan.
proverbs.translation: A little out of someone else's possession should be enough.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be greedy. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Abẹ́rẹ́ tó nínú ogún ológún.
proverbs.translation: A needle (if shared with one) is enough out of someone else's inheritance.
proverbs.wisdom: Be content with what you have

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn óò bá jẹ ọ̀pọ̀lọ́, á jèyí tó lẹ́yin
proverbs.translation: If one must eat toad, it should be one with eggs
proverbs.wisdom: If one must stoop, the cause should be noble

proverbs.proverb: Tí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed it positively impacts two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success is infectious #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Òdú ni; kì í ṣe àìmọ̀ olóko.
proverbs.translation: It is 'odu' (a vegetable); it is not strange to the farmer.
proverbs.wisdom: Refers to a familiar matter #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Igúnnugún kò torí abẹ párí.
proverbs.translation: The vulture did not go bald for fear of the blade.
proverbs.wisdom: Certain events may be mere coincidence. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Omi tí èyàn máa mu kò ní ṣàn kọjá rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A stream from which one will drink will not flow beyond one's reach.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient! #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà kan kò wọ ọjà.
proverbs.translation: It is not just one route that leads to the market.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternative approaches exist. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí igi bá ré lugi tòkè rẹ̀ là ńkọ́kọ́ gbé
proverbs.translation: If trees fall in a pile, the top ones are removed first
proverbs.wisdom: Clear issues, from simple to complex

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni gbá àyà ẹni ò ní kírú ẹni má rà
proverbs.translation: Whoever slaps one's chest, can't stop one's locust beans from fermenting
proverbs.wisdom: Assault cannot deter success

proverbs.proverb: Èébú ò so.
proverbs.translation: Abusive or deriding words do not grow on one.
proverbs.wisdom: Ignore undermining or critical words. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀gàn kò ní kí oyin má dùn.
proverbs.translation: Derision does not deter honey from sweetness.
proverbs.wisdom: External forces cannot stop internally-driven success

proverbs.proverb: Ìdẹra ò kan àgbà.
proverbs.translation: Comfort has nothing to do with age.
proverbs.wisdom: Peace and comfort appeal to all. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Abẹ́rẹ́ á lọ kí ọ̀nà okùn tó dí.
proverbs.translation: The needle will go through before the path of the thread gets blocked.
proverbs.wisdom: Sharp focus secures progress.

proverbs.proverb: Tí èyàn kò bá tí ì dé ibi tó ńlọ, kì í dúró.
proverbs.translation: If one's destination has not been reached, one does not stop.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep moving! #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá pẹ́ nígbó á rí ìríkúùrí
proverbs.translation: Whoever tarries long in the forest, will see strange things
proverbs.wisdom: Undue delaying may lead to unexpected results

proverbs.proverb: Ti iná ba ńjó lóko, màjàlá a ṣe òfófó
proverbs.translation: When a farm goes aflame, the flakes fly home to bear the tale
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing can be permanently covered up

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńkọrin tí ò dùn, ó ńfi etí ara rẹ̀ gbọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is singing a lousy song, very well knows as well.
proverbs.wisdom: The obvious needs no emphasis

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé sọ
proverbs.translation: Hunger should not be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A crucial matter should not be casually handled #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà ló jìn ẹrú ní baba
proverbs.translation: The slave came from a home as well, he is simply far from it
proverbs.wisdom: The disadvantaged is human, as well #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a kò bá fẹ́ nilé rẹ̀ ńjìnnà
proverbs.translation: It is the person we don't want to visit who lives afar off
proverbs.wisdom: Excuses exist for what we lack interest in

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ tó bá dilẹ̀ ni wọ́n fi ńlẹ́rán.
proverbs.translation: It is an idle hand that gets placed on the cheek.
proverbs.wisdom: The idle person gets assigned mundane tasks

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbín kì í tẹnu mọ́gi kó má gùn ún
proverbs.translation: The snail never embarked on climbing a tree and failed to climb it.
proverbs.wisdom: Dogged determination is critical

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ̀sọ̀ ẹ̀sọ̀ ni ìgbín fi ńgun igi
proverbs.translation: Slowly and steadily is how snails climb trees
proverbs.wisdom: Patience and persistence lead to success #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbálẹ̀ ni ilẹ̀ ńmọ́ fún.
proverbs.translation: It is whoever sweeps the floor that experiences a clean floor.
proverbs.wisdom: We reap what we sow.

proverbs.proverb: Omi gbígbóná kì í pẹ́ lẹ́nu.
proverbs.translation: Hot water cannot be long in the mouth.
proverbs.wisdom: Stressful

proverbs.proverb: Ibi gbogbo nilẹ̀ ọ̀wọ̀.
proverbs.translation: Courteous and civil behaviour applies everwhere.
proverbs.wisdom: Be courteous, always and everywhere. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: A kìí mọ̀ọ́ rìn mọ̀ọ́ yan kórí má mì lọ́rùn
proverbs.translation: One can't be good at walking that the head wont shake on the neck.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is above mistakes

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọdé kò lè mọ ẹ̀kọ jẹ kó má ráa lọ́wọ́
proverbs.translation: A child cannot be so good at corn meal and not soil his hands.
proverbs.wisdom: Youngsters are not beyond mistakes

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ tí ayé bí ni ayé ńpọ́n.
proverbs.translation: The world backs its offsprings.
proverbs.wisdom: We bear the consequences of our choices. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Omi ńṣàn ní ìdí ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀, ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ ńsunkún omi.
proverbs.translation: Water flows at the base of plantain plant, yet it weeps for water.
proverbs.wisdom: Lack amidst plenty

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan là ńyọ ẹsẹ̀ lábàtà.
proverbs.translation: It is one at a time that legs are pulled out of mud.
proverbs.wisdom: Complex issues need be resolved one at a time

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kìí rí ìdí ara rẹ̀ à fi ti ẹni ẹlẹ́ni
proverbs.translation: A lamp never sees its own base, but those of others
proverbs.wisdom: Others help may be needed for one's issues

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀bẹ kì í mú kó gbẹ́ èkù ara rẹ
proverbs.translation: A knife cannot be so sharp as to cut its handle.
proverbs.wisdom: Others' help are often needed to sort out one's issues

proverbs.proverb: Àgbà wá búra bèwe ò bá ṣe ọ rí
proverbs.translation: Let the elder come & swear if he has not been  childishly before.
proverbs.wisdom: Youthfulness comes with certain traits

proverbs.proverb: Orí tí a fi ṣe èwe, ṣì ńbẹ lọ́rùn
proverbs.translation: The head that one has as a youngster, is still on one's neck.
proverbs.wisdom: Some traits persist until old age.

proverbs.proverb: Tí òkété bá dàgbà ọmú ọmọ rẹ̀ ló máa mu
proverbs.translation: When old the bush rat is suckled by its offspring
proverbs.wisdom: Eventually elders depend on those they've raised

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí ò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, ò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀
proverbs.translation: A refuse dump that's intolerant of filth wont be filled up easily
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; no one is perfect

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù kì í pẹyẹ
proverbs.translation: A bird does not get killed with a stone thrown in anger
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired goals

proverbs.proverb: Odò tó ńṣàn kì í b'ojú wẹ̀yìn.
proverbs.translation: A flowing stream never looks (or flows) backward.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àfòmọ́ ò légbò gbogbo igi nií bá tan
proverbs.translation: The parasitic plant has no root; it lives off all trees.
proverbs.wisdom: Those who sponge off others are seldom loyal

proverbs.proverb: Ará oko tí yóò jẹ búrẹ́dì á fèsúrú ránṣẹ́ sílé
proverbs.translation: A farm dweller that desires bread ought to send some 'esuru' yam home
proverbs.wisdom: Life is give & take.

proverbs.proverb: Apọnle kó sì fún ọba tí kò ní àrólé.
proverbs.translation: There is no honour for a king with no heir.
proverbs.wisdom: Succession planning is critical to leadership

proverbs.proverb: Ti imú yé'mú tí imú fi ńfọn.
proverbs.translation: The nose very well knows why it is noisy when blown.
proverbs.wisdom: Do not despise what you cannot see or understand.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní gbé òkú àparò gbé aápọn.
proverbs.translation: Whoever picked up a dead patridge, picked up hassles.
proverbs.wisdom: Some opportunities are liabilities in disguise.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí yóò dáṣọ ẹtù, inú rẹ̀ ni í gbé.
proverbs.translation: Whoever wants to buy an expensive clothe will keep it to himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Do not boast! #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ò kú, ìṣe ò tán.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is no end to accomplishments.
proverbs.wisdom: Belittle no one! #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Nínú ìkòkò dúdú ni ẹ̀kọ funfun ti ńjáde.
proverbs.translation: Out of the black pot, comes the white pap.
proverbs.wisdom: Underestimate no one! #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ là ńtẹ ẹrẹ̀; ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ là ńtẹ eruku.
proverbs.translation: Muds & sands are stepped on differently
proverbs.wisdom: Varied situations must be treated as such

proverbs.proverb: Dídùn dídùn là ńbá ilé olóyin.
proverbs.translation: Honeycombs are always found in a sweet state.
proverbs.wisdom: You will not lack what you give to others. #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọn ọgbọ́n, ẹ̀sọ̀ ẹ̀sọ̀, làgbà fi ńsá fún màlúù
proverbs.translation: It is with wisdom & patience that an elder runs from a cow
proverbs.wisdom: Patience unties knotty issues

proverbs.proverb: Fálànà, gbọ́ tì ẹ; ti ara ẹni là ńgbọ́
proverbs.translation: Falana, attend to your affairs; one ought to attend to one's issues
proverbs.wisdom: Don't meddle! #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó bá kan ojú lojú ma ńṣẹ́ sí
proverbs.translation: It is what concerns the eyes that the eyes blink on.
proverbs.wisdom: Mind your affairs, not others' #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ
proverbs.translation: If one bus declined going to Ejinrin town, thousands others will go
proverbs.wisdom: No one is indispensable

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ burúkú lọ́jọ́ ti rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: A lousy fellow has his day (when he will be sorely needed).
proverbs.wisdom: No one is utterly useless.

proverbs.proverb: Igi kan kì í le títí kí akòko máà lè sọọ́.
proverbs.translation: A tree cannot be so hard that the woodpecker will be unable to peck it.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility!

proverbs.proverb: Pípẹ́ ni yóò pẹ́, akólòlò á pe "Baba".
proverbs.translation: It may be long; the stammerer will call "Father", eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Persistence leads to success

proverbs.proverb: Tí ojú bá fara balẹ á rímú.
proverbs.translation: If the eyes are patient enough, they will see the nose.
proverbs.wisdom: With patience, the extraordinary is achievable.

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no sweat, no sweet

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbà tí ijó bá yẹ'ni lá ńkúrò lójú agbo
proverbs.translation: One ought to leave the dance floor, when the ovation is loudest.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a right time for things

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní gbé ọba mì kì í ní ìsinmi.
proverbs.translation: Whoever who gets crowned a king cannot have rest.
proverbs.wisdom: Positions of responsibilities can be stressful

proverbs.proverb: Ẹ kó ilà kúrò lẹ́kọ, ẹ̀kọ ò kọlà.
proverbs.translation: Get the marks off the corn meal, the corn meal has no tribal marks.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't pull the wool over our eyes!

proverbs.proverb: Eré orí igi, àṣekù ọmọ ẹdun ni
proverbs.translation: Pranks on tree-tops are pastimes to monkeys
proverbs.wisdom: Refers to an issue one is very familiar with #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní gbé ọba mì kì í ní ìsinmi.
proverbs.translation: Whoever gets crowned a king cannot have rest.
proverbs.wisdom: Positions of responsibilities can be demanding.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá ja'lè lẹ́ẹ̀kan, tó bá daṣọ àrán bo orí, aṣọ olè ló dà bo'ra
proverbs.translation: Whoever steals, even just once, if covered with velvet, remains a thief, still.
proverbs.wisdom: Dishonesty permanently stains; looting, in whatever form or guise, is stealing and #LootersAreThieves #MoralRevival

proverbs.proverb: Àdàbà ńpa ògèdè bí ẹni pé ẹyẹlé ò gbọ́, ẹyẹlé gbọ́, tí tiri ló ńtiri
proverbs.translation: The dove chants incantations believing that the pidgeon is oblivious of them; the pidgeon is quite aware, but simply ignores them.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; those with wicked intents ultimately self-destruct

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò gbọ́ ti ẹnu ẹ̀gà ló ńsọ pé ẹ̀gà ńpatótó, tẹnu ẹyẹ lẹyẹ kúkú ńsọ.
proverbs.translation: Only those who have not heard out the palmchat bird would deride it as needlessly noisy; it is simply making its point.
proverbs.wisdom: People have their reasons; give them the benefit of doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá ní kí ọ̀rẹ́ òun má jọba ni kò ní lọ̀rẹ́ ọba.
proverbs.translation: Whoever blocks his friend from becoming a king won't have a king as a friend.
proverbs.wisdom:
Foster goodness: those plotting evil for others often share in the evil results; we reap whatever we sow.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Tí iná ò bá tán l'áṣọ, ẹ̀jẹ̀ kì í tan léèkánná.
proverbs.translation: If the lice won't cease to be on clothes, blood (from efforts to remove them) can't cease from the finger nails.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be steadfast and persistent: until an issue is resolved, efforts to address it must not abate.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi abẹ fá orí igún, ká fi fá orí àkàlàmàgbò kó wá di orí àtíòro, ká wá ní abẹ kú.
proverbs.translation: You cannot use a blade to scrape the vulture's head, use it to scrape the crow's head, but claim that the blade is blunt, when it comes to the  tassel's turn.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; no hypocrisy.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà, mọ̀sá, ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ
proverbs.translation: A good warrior must know when to fight and when to run; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to run will perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Timing is crucial; know when to pursue, defer or quit

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tan ni'jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A person's palm (result of his effort) can't deceive him.
proverbs.wisdom: It's what one achieves by oneself that endures

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ rírọ̀ ni í yọ obì lápò, ọ̀rọ̀ líle nií yọ ọfà lápó.
proverbs.translation: Soft words can pull kolanuts from a pouch, as strong words do pull arrows from a quiver.
proverbs.wisdom: Use words wisely; they can be effective.

proverbs.proverb: Àdàbà ńpa ògèdè bí ẹni pé ẹyẹlé ò gbọ́, ẹyẹlé gbọ́, tí tiri ló ńtiri
proverbs.translation: The dove chants incantations believing that the pidgeon is oblivious of them; the pidgeon is quite aware, but simply ignores them.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; those with wicked intents ultimately self-destruct

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ dúdú ò yá á bùṣán, ọmọ burúkú ò yá lùpa.
proverbs.translation: As it is tough to take a bite of an unripe plantain, so it is tough to beat a stubborn child to death.
proverbs.wisdom: Complex situations can hardly be addressed with unduly radical actions. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Lẹ́hìn òkùnkùn biribiri, ìmọ́lẹ̀ á tàn.
proverbs.translation: After a pitch darkness, most assuredly comes the dawn.
proverbs.wisdom:
No matter how it looks, there is always light at the end of the tunnel: keep hope alive & hang in there; it's not over yet; tough times are not forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Kí lo rí lọ́bẹ̀ tóo fi wàru ọwọ́?
proverbs.translation: What in the soup caused you to withdraw your hands?
proverbs.wisdom: What are the reasons for your unusual behaviour?

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó yẹni ló yẹni, okùn ọrùn ò yẹ adìyẹ; ó dẹ̀ yẹ adìyẹ, ẹni tó mú u dání lojú máa tì
proverbs.translation: There is what is proper; a leash does not suit the hen; even if the leash does, the shame is on the person holding it.
proverbs.wisdom: Some things are not proper and befitting; let's avoid them

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní tó rí òkú ìkà nílẹ̀ tó taá ní ìpá, ìkà ti di méjì.
proverbs.translation: Whoever came across the corpse of a wicked fellow and kicked it turned himself or herself into a wicked person, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Forgive and forget; we shouldn't always seek to get even.

proverbs.proverb: Àjọjẹ ò dùn bí ẹnìkan ò bá ní; ọjọ́ a ní la ńṣe àjọjẹ.
proverbs.translation: Sharing isn't pleasant when one party lacks; we are usually happy to share, when we all can give.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to give to others, but better to empower them; it's better to teach people to fish than give them fish

proverbs.proverb: Bó pẹ́ bó yá, akọ̀pẹ yóò wálẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long, the palmwine-tapper will dismount, eventually.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be patient, be hopeful; always take the long view: absolutely nothing lasts forever.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín'gbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun.
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver no longer carves calabashes, those already carved will remain.
proverbs.wisdom:
We are outlived by our legacy; the effect of what we do, good or bad, lives on.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá si ńlé lewúrẹ́ ẹ̀ ńbí kan
proverbs.translation: The goat of an absentee owner is the one that births only one kid.
proverbs.wisdom: What's uncared for underperforms

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹyẹ ò bá fín ẹyẹ ní'ràn, ojú ọrun tó ẹyẹ ẹ́ fò láì f'ara kan'ra.
proverbs.translation: If a bird won't seek the ill of another, the sky is wide enough for all to fly without colliding.
proverbs.wisdom:
Be positive; live and let live.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ ọ̀lẹ làyè ò lè gbà, ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: Only a lazy person has issues coping, every situation suits a hardworker, just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays

proverbs.proverb: Kí lo rí lọ́bẹ̀ tóo fi wàru ọwọ́?
proverbs.translation: What in the soup caused you to withdraw your hands?
proverbs.wisdom: What are the reasons for your unusual behaviour?

proverbs.proverb: Kárìn kápọ̀ yíyẹ ní í yẹni.
proverbs.translation: To walk as (or operate in) a team, brings honour to one.
proverbs.wisdom: There is safety in numbers #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó pamọ́ lójù èyàn, kedere ló hàn sí Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is hidden to man, is glaringly clear to God.
proverbs.wisdom:
God is all-seeing and all-knowing; nothing surprises Him and nothing is beyond Him.
#Yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Àgbájọ ọwọ́ la fi ńsọ̀yà
proverbs.translation: It's with a bunch of fingers that chests may be beaten (an expresssion of confidence)
proverbs.wisdom: There's safety in numbers

proverbs.proverb: T'ẹni bẹ́'gi lójù; igi á rú'wé.
proverbs.translation: The shame is on him who cuts a tree; it will sprout leaves again.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can stop what God has ordained

proverbs.proverb: Tí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò lè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no sweat, no sweet

proverbs.proverb: Yinni yinni kí ẹni ṣè'mí ì.
proverbs.translation: Praise a good person so he can do more.
proverbs.wisdom: Praise inspires; it's good to appreciate others

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tan ni'jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A person's palm (result of his effort) can't deceive him.
proverbs.wisdom: It's what one achieves by oneself that endures

proverbs.proverb: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tan ni'jẹ.
proverbs.translation: A person's palm (result of his effort) can't deceive him.
proverbs.wisdom: It's what one achieves by oneself that endures

proverbs.proverb: Nínú ìkòkò dúdú, ni ẹ̀kọ funfun ti ńjáde.
proverbs.translation: Out of the black pot nonetheless comes the white pap (corn meal).
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one.

proverbs.proverb: Kí àgbàdo tó dé áyé, adìyẹ ńjẹun.
proverbs.translation: Before there was maize, hens certainly were eating.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is indispensable.

proverbs.proverb: Òjò tó rọ̀ sí ewúro, náà ló rọ̀ sí ìrèkè.
proverbs.translation: The same rain that fell on the bitter leaf, fell on the sugarcane.
proverbs.wisdom: Bitter or vengeful responses are by choice; our reactions, regardless of situations, tell of who we really are deep down. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọmọdé bá ṣubú á wo iwájú; bí àgbà bá ṣubú á wo ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: Upon falling, a youngster looks ahead (for help); an elder looks back (for the cause).
proverbs.wisdom: Prevention is better than cure; It's good to seek help after a fall, but better to prevent a recurrence.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà, mọ̀sá, ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ.
proverbs.translation: Warriors must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to retreat would perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Know when to pursue, defer or quit. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ká lọ́ aṣọ mọ́ ìdí, ká lọ́ ìdí mọ́ aṣọ, kí ìdí ṣáà má ti gbófo.
proverbs.translation: Whether we tie a wrapper round the waist or tie the waist round a wrapper, to ensure the waist is not naked is what's crucial.
proverbs.wisdom: A focus on goals rather than methods.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tó rí ibi tí ò fọ́, ire ló ńdúró de.
proverbs.translation: The eyes that didn't go blind upon seeing evil, are waiting to see good
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come

proverbs.proverb: Ẹranko tó bá ṣiyèméjì lọdẹ ńpa.
proverbs.translation: Only an indecisive animal gets killed by the hunter.
proverbs.wisdom: Be decisive; indecision can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ikú ilé ò pa'ni, tòde ò leè pa'ni.
proverbs.translation: If there is no enemy within, the one outside can do us no harm.
proverbs.wisdom: Choose your friends wisely; worry less about the enemy without.

proverbs.proverb: Ọrun ńya bọ̀ kìí ṣe ọ̀rọ̀ ẹni kan
proverbs.translation: The heaven is collapsing down isn't a problem of any one person
proverbs.wisdom: A general problem is not a personal one

proverbs.proverb: A jókòó a fi àpò kọ́, a dìde ọwọ́ ò tó àpò mọ́.
proverbs.translation: We sat and hung a bag; we stood up and the bag was out of reach.
proverbs.wisdom: A perplexing scenario.

proverbs.proverb: Àìmọṣẹ́ ẹ́ kọ̀, ló ṣe orogùn, tó fi ki orí bọ omi gbígbóná.
proverbs.translation: Not knowing how to decline a request, is how the wooden stirrer gets dipped into hot water.
proverbs.wisdom: Learn to say, No; not all requests or offers are beneficial; some are traps in disguise.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó kọjú sẹ́nìkan, ẹ̀hìn ló kọ sẹ́lòmíràn bí ìlù gángan
proverbs.translation: What faces someone backs another, like the talking drum.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes...

proverbs.proverb: Ilá kì í ga ju onírè lọ; èyí tó bá ga ju onírè lọ, a sì tẹ́ẹ ká.
proverbs.translation: An okro plant shouldn't outgrow the farmer; whichever does will be bent low to be plucked.
proverbs.wisdom: Humility is crucial.

proverbs.proverb: Ṣé bí ojú ṣe rí nìyí, táa fi ńjobi lọ́jà Ẹdẹ?
proverbs.translation: Is this how one gets to eat kolanut at Ede market?
proverbs.wisdom: Used to react to a disappointing act.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú orí ká fi fìlà dé ìdodo.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be so angry with the head as to place the hat on the navel.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá lè ṣe bí aláàárù l'Óyìngbò, kò lè ṣe bí Adégbọrọ̀ l'Ọ́jà Ọba.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not willing to be a hired hand in a local market, cannot hope to become a wealthy merchant in a major one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be willing to start with what you have, right where you are. #òwe

proverbs.proverb: Ebi ńpa mí ò ṣeé fi ìfé sọ.
proverbs.translation: I am hungry is not to be expressed by whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: A serious matter shouldn't be treated with levity

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà, mọ̀sá, ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ
proverbs.translation: Warriors must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight, but not when to retreat will perish in battle
proverbs.wisdom: Timing is crucial; know when to pursue, defer or quit

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀ kékeré létí àwo gbẹ̀gìrì, bó bá kúrò lójú, kô lè tán lọ́kàn.
proverbs.translation: A tiny turd on the edge of a plate of bean soup may be overlooked by the eyes, but certainly not by the heart.
proverbs.wisdom: Watch the indiscretions; they may be overlooked, but they are seldom forgotten.

proverbs.proverb: Kí èèmọ̀ wọlé, kí ajá máà gbó, gbogbo ajá kọ́ lara ẹ̀ lé gbà á.
proverbs.translation: Not all dogs can be quiet and not bark in the face of a strange act.
proverbs.wisdom: People are different; you can't paint everyone with the same brush.

proverbs.proverb: Pé a lágbára bí òmìrán, ìyẹn ò ní kí a jà bí òmìrán.
proverbs.translation: That you are as powerful as a giant, does not imply that you should fight like one.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tempered: just because you can, does not mean you should; cooler heads should always prevail.

proverbs.proverb: Kòkòrò tó ńjó lẹ́ẹ̀bá ọ̀nà, onílù rẹ̀ ńbẹ nínú igbó.
proverbs.translation: The insect that is dancing by the bush path has its drummer right in the forest.
proverbs.wisdom: Things are often not quite as they appear; don't jump to conclusions before thorough and critical reviews.

proverbs.proverb: Ìjì layé; tó bá fì síwájú, á tún fì sẹ́hìn ni.
proverbs.translation: Life is a storm; if it blows forward, it will blow backward, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: A season goes, another comes; no condition is permanent; nothing lasts forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó mú iṣẹ́ jẹ, ò lè mú ìṣẹ́ jẹ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever got away with indolence, cannot get away with poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run kì í ṣe nǹkan, kó má fi àyè ọpẹ́ sí i; tó bá pá baba lórí, a sì fi irùngbọ̀n rọ́pò.
proverbs.translation: God never does anything, without the rationale for thanksgiving; if he makes a man bald, he'll give the beard in replacement.
proverbs.wisdom: We'll always have reasons to be thankful to God.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọdé kékeré ò mọ ogun, ó ní k'ógun ó wá, ó ní b'ógún bá dé, òun a kó s'íyàrá ìyá òun.
proverbs.translation: A youngster, naive about wars, beckons on it, stating that once war comes, he/she will hide in his/her mother's room.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ‌kògbà, kò ní fẹ‌, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if you pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a cantankerous person, he or she will yet remain cantankerous.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking, be positive; do your best and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Tí nani-nani bá ńnani, tí gbani-gbani kọ̀ tí kò gbani, á jẹ́ pé gbani-gbani  ló ní kí nani-nani máa nani.
proverbs.translation: If the beater, beats one, but the deliverer refuses to deliver one, the beating must have been endorsed by the deliverer.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be naive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour, but easily lord it over their benefactors, once satisfied.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot claim to truly know anyone, deep down.

proverbs.proverb: Òjò ò bá ẹnìkan ṣọ̀tá; ẹni ejí rí leji ńpa.
proverbs.translation: The rain holds enmity with no one; it beats anyone within it's area of coverage.
proverbs.wisdom: Discriminate against no one.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńgun ẹṣin, kó sọ ìpàkọ‌ mọ ní'wọ‌n; ìbẹ‌kẹ‌ṣẹ‌ ẹṣin á máa la’ni mọ‌’lẹ‌.
proverbs.translation: When on a horse, fling your head backward with restraint; horses with sudden jump often throw riders.
proverbs.wisdom: Never abuse privileges: exercise self-control; safeguards against abuse do exist.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún ata ńnú odó, báa lọ̀ ọ́ lórí ọlọ, iwa ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whether pounded in a mortar or ground on a grinding stone, pepper would remain inseparable from its character.
proverbs.wisdom: We can hardly pretend to be who we are not for long: with time, who we really are will show through.

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn.
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes loving relationships endure.
proverbs.wisdom: No one is perfect; tolerance is crucial. Happy Valentine Day to everyone.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà rere lẹ̀ṣọ́ ènìyàn.
proverbs.translation: Good character is what adorns a man.
proverbs.wisdom: Good character beautifies; it is attractive and adorable.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ní ká dijú kí ẹni burúkú kọjá, a kò ní mọ ìgbà tí ẹni rere máa lọ.
proverbs.translation: If we were to close our eyes so we would not see a wicked person pass by, we may miss a good person as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; vidictiveness can be costly.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ‌ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.*
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water in your trough on the rumbling of the cloud.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; never count your chickens before they are hatched.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí ẹni tó máa gun ẹṣin, tí kò ní ju ìpàkọ́, tí kò bá fẹ́ẹ́ jùú, ẹṣin tó ńgùn a jẹ́ kó jùú.
proverbs.translation: No one will ride a horse and not fling his head backward; even if he/she doesn't want to, the horse will make him/her do it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; our attitudes are quite often compelled by our peculiar circumstances.

proverbs.proverb: Akèrègbè ni yóò júwe ibi tí wón máa fi okùn sí lára rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: It's the gourd itself that will indicate where on its body the rope (to carry it) should be affixed.
proverbs.wisdom: People themselves will indicate to you how you should treat them; and when they do, believe them.

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò kì í gbóná títí kó má tutù.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long the fireplace has been hot, it will become cold eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is hot today, will one day become cold; tough times won't last forever; keep hope alive; it's not over yet.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run tó ńse ọbẹ̀, kò kúrò ní ìdí ààrò.
proverbs.translation: God who is cooking the soup, has not left the kitchen.
proverbs.wisdom: Never lose hope; nothing is beyond God.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks inordinately will misspeak; inordinate talk made the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: [Moderation is crucial; exercise self-control, always]

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A dunghill that's intolerant of filth won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom: Intolerance imposes limitations

proverbs.proverb: Ẹran tí a kò bá ni í jẹ, a kì í fi eyín dán an wò.
proverbs.translation: Stop taking nips at a piece of meat that you have no intention of eating.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't start what you won't finish; finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: Ọba tí kì í fẹ́ gba ìmọ̀ràn, irú wọn kì í pẹ́ fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Any king who is reluctant to taking advices, hardly takes long before stumbling.
proverbs.wisdom: Be smart: seek and treasure good counsels; to spurn such is to expose oneself to avoidable errors.

proverbs.proverb: Iṣu ẹni kì í fi'ni pe ọmọdé, kó má ta.
proverbs.translation: A yam plant cannot refuse to grow well, simply because the farmer (planter) is too young.
proverbs.wisdom: Age is no barrier to success; impossibility is a figment.

proverbs.proverb: Tí a bá fi ogún ọdún ṣán'pá, ọdún wo la ó fò?
proverbs.translation: If we flap arms for twenty years, when are we going to fly?
proverbs.wisdom: Make hay while the sun shines; promptly exploit opportunities.

proverbs.proverb: Igi tí Ọlọ́run bá gbìn, kò sẹ́ni tó lè fàá tu
proverbs.translation: No man can uproot a tree planted by God.
proverbs.wisdom: IIf it is from God, it is assured; His blessing is everlasting]

proverbs.proverb: O jó ní'fọ‌n, Ifọ‌n tú; o jó l'Èjìgbò, Èjìgbò fà ya bí aṣọ; o wá dé Ọ‌ràngún o tún ńjùdí; ṣé gbogbo ìlú lo fẹ‌ bàjẹ‌ ni?
proverbs.translation: Your dance desolated Ifon & shredded Ejigbo like clothes; yet at Orangun you were twerking your hips; must you destroy all towns?
proverbs.wisdom: Decrying notoriety: be a better version of yourself.

proverbs.proverb: Gbólóhùn kan lè ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́; gbólóhùn kan náà lè tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: One sentence can mess up a discussion and one sentence can make it better.
proverbs.wisdom: Words are powerful: they can build up and can pull down; use them wisely.

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́ kọ́ loògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; adopt radical measures with caution.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi dẹ‌kun ẹ‌rin rínrín, tó bá ṣe igúnnugún, á wokoko mórí ẹyin ni.
proverbs.translation: If what took laughter away from the crow had befallen the vulture, it would have been stuck brooding on its eggs.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; different stroke for different folks.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ‌dùnkún ì báà mọ tíńtín, dandan ni kó dùn dé'lẹ‌.
proverbs.translation: Even if sweet potato is just a tiny bit, it certainly must be sweet, all through.
proverbs.wisdom: We remain true to who we really are deep down, ultimately; we can hardly pretend to be who we are not for long.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ‌ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that desires to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag; good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Ewé kan kì í bọ́ lára igi, kí Ọlọ́run Ọba má mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: No leaf drops off a tree without God's foreknowledge.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing surprises God; nothing is beyond Him; lean on Him.

proverbs.proverb: Asúùfé ya àgbàdo; ó f'ojú jọ olè, ó f'ojú jọ olókó.
proverbs.translation: The one who harvests corn in a farm whistling (carefreely), could very well be the farm owner and could very well be a thief.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Àpa àímú délé ni kò jẹ́ kí a mọ̀ pé ológbò ńse ọdẹ.
proverbs.translation: Its penchant for not bringing home its games, is why the cat is not known for hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; don't eat your future; don't sacrifice it for the present.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ ibi tí à ńlọ kí ọrùn ó wọ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One can't be certain of one's destination and yet be weighed down by the load carried.
proverbs.wisdom: Clear definition of goals makes their achievement less stressful: seek and foster clarity.

proverbs.proverb: Àtùpà kì í níyì lọ‌ọ‌sán, ṣùgbọ‌n a máa gba'yì lọ‌jọ‌ alẹ‌.
proverbs.translation: A lamp is not valued in the afternoons, but does get appreciated at night.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a right time and place for everything; solutions are most appreciated during tough times.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi tí à ńlọ là ńwò, a kì í wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú.
proverbs.translation: Be focused on where you are going, not where.you had fallen (in the past).
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; leave the past where it belongs: in the past.]

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God  hasn't forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ Ọlọ́run kì í bẹ èyàn
proverbs.translation: Those who plead their cases with God, seldom need to plead with man.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable and nothing is beyond Him; you can count on Him.

proverbs.proverb: À fi ẹni tí yóò bá pẹ̀gàn Àjànàkú, lá lóun rí nǹkan fìrí; báa bá rí erin ká wí.
proverbs.translation: Only those who would deride the elephant would claim they saw it in a jiffy; its presence is unmistakable.
proverbs.wisdom: Give credit where credit is due; deride no one.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a fi gègé gún ara ẹni wò, kí a tó fi gún ọmọ ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: Prick yourself with the (sharp) penpoint first, before trying it on a bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair; don't impose on anyone what you are unwilling to impose on yourself; do unto others as you'd have them do unto you.

proverbs.proverb: Ààrò kì í gbóná títí kó máà tutù.
proverbs.translation: No matter how long the hearth gets hot, it will become cold eventually.
proverbs.wisdom: Whatever is hot will one day become cold; whatever has a beginning will have an ending: nothing lasts forever: change is certain; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ogún ọmọdé ò lè ṣeré fún ogún ọdún; ọgbọ̀n àgbà ò lè ṣe àṣàrò fún ọgbọ̀n oṣù
proverbs.translation: Twenty youngsters cannot play together for twenty years; thirty elders cannot hold discussions for thirty months.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing lasts forever; change is inevitable: anticipate and prepare for it.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ká a.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; God's response is always so complete as to be overwhelming.

proverbs.proverb: Àkùrọ‌ ti lómi tẹ‌lẹ‌, kí òjò tó rọ̀  sí i.
proverbs.translation: The river bank was damp with water, even before the rain fell on it.
proverbs.wisdom: Be humble; don't arrogate to yourself what is essentially God's blessing.

proverbs.proverb: Àìmọṣẹ́ kọ̀ ọmọ ajá, lọdẹ fi ńrán an níṣẹ́ ikú.
proverbs.translation: Not knowing how to say no, is why the dog gets sent on life-threatening errands by the hunter.
proverbs.wisdom: Learn to say “No”; it is not every offer that one accedes to.

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ‌ ata ò ṣe é fi bọ‌jú; ọwọ‌ epo ò ṣe é fi mú àlà.
proverbs.translation: A hand with pepper cannot be used to wash the face; the one with palm oil cannot be used to handle a white cloth.
proverbs.wisdom: Even with the best of intentions, some things are just inappropriate.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bínú sí ẹni tí a kò rí.
proverbs.translation: Do not be angry with someone you have not heard out.
proverbs.wisdom: Never rush to judgment; there is always a chance you could be wrong; always give people the benefit of the doubt.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà ọ̀lẹ ló ńba ọ̀lẹ lẹ́rù; ọ̀lẹ ṣe tán, ó ní wọn ò fẹ́ràn òun.
proverbs.translation: An indolent is preceded by his character but at the end complains that he or she is not accepted.
proverbs.wisdom: Our character often confronts us with unpleasant consequences; change your character to change any unwanted outcome.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ní k'ọ́mọ ẹni má d'ẹ́tẹ̀, tó bá ti lè dá'gbó gbé.
proverbs.translation: You never restrain your child from becoming leprous, as long as he can live in the forest alone.
proverbs.wisdom: Everyone bears the consequences of his or her choices.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò tíì kúrò láyé, kò lè mọ irú ẹni tí òun yó dà.
proverbs.translation: Whoever still has life, cannot be limited in what he or she can become.
proverbs.wisdom: With life, there's no impossibility; it's not over yet: keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Bí agbada ò bá gbóná, àgbàdo ò leè ta.
proverbs.translation: If the frying pan is not heated up, the corns cannot pop.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain; hang in there: don't give up.

proverbs.proverb: Ibi kan ṣoṣo kọ́ la ti ńrí ọ̀run.
proverbs.translation: The sky is not seen from only one single spot.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternative approaches exist; there are many ways to achieve a goal: don't be fixated on one.

proverbs.proverb: Ajá tó máa sọnù kì í gbọ́ fèrè ọlọ́dẹ.
proverbs.translation: A dog destined to get lost won't hear the hunter's (redeeming) whistling.
proverbs.wisdom: Those bent on a course of action won't heed wiser counsels; keep an open mind: there is some sense in nonsense.

proverbs.proverb: Ìrèké ò ní ibùdó; ibi gbogbo ló gba alágbára.
proverbs.translation: Sugarcane has no specific place of refuge; every situation suits a diligent fellow just fine.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence pays. #owe #oweyoruba #yorubaproverb #yoruba

proverbs.proverb: Ẹnu ẹyẹ ni í pẹyẹ; ẹnu òrofó ni í pa òrofó; òrofó bímọ mẹ́fà, ó ní ilé òun kún ṣọ́ṣọ́.
proverbs.translation: The mouth of a bird is its undoing; the wild pidgeon hatches just six chicks and brags that its nest is completely filled up.
proverbs.wisdom: Modesty is it; brag less.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear.

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ ńbá àṣá ṣeré, ó rò pé ẹyẹ oko lásán ni.
proverbs.translation: The chick gullibly plays with the hawk believing it to be an ordinary bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be risky, if not fatally costly; invest in knowledge.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tó ṣe igúnnugún tó fi pá lórí, tó ṣe àkàlàmàgbò tó fi yọ gẹ̀gẹ̀ lọ́rùn, tó bá ṣe àgbò bọ̀lọ̀jọ̀, á ti fa ìwo rẹ̀ tu.
proverbs.translation: If what balded the vulture and gave the crow goiter had befallen the full-grown ram, it would have lost its horns.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; people are different.

proverbs.proverb: Orí bíbẹ́ kọ́ ni oògùn orí fífọ́.
proverbs.translation: Decapitation is not the antidote for headache.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is it; adopt radical measures with caution. #owe #oweyoruba #yorubaproverb #yoruba #wisdom

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó gbé ìlù rẹ̀ kọ́ apá, ayé ńbáa lùú, áḿbọ̀tórí ẹni tó gbé tirẹ̀ kọ́ igi tó ṣeré lọ.
proverbs.translation: The person who hung his drum on his elbow still had the drum beaten by others, not to mention someone who hung his on a tree (branch) and walked away.
proverbs.wisdom: No complacency; make hay while the sun shines. #owe #oweyoruba #yorubaproverb #yoruba #wisdom

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà mọ̀sá ni ti akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ.
proverbs.translation: Warriors must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight, but not when to retreat will perish in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Know when to pursue, defer or quit.

proverbs.proverb: Òkò tí a bá bínú jù, kì í pa ẹyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A bird is seldom killed by a stone thrown in anger.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions taken in anger seldom achieve desired results; tone down the fury: it can be self-defeating.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí imú ṣe lè tóbi tó, kó lè gba ọ̀rọ̀ ẹnu sọ.
proverbs.translation: No matter how big the nose is, it can't take over the speaking role of the mouth.
proverbs.wisdom: We all are unique with our different strengths; envy no one: stay in your lane.

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wà á ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; complex issues must be calmly handled: cooler heads must always prevail.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ago aláago ṣiṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Don't carry out your duties using someone else's time piece.
proverbs.wisdom: Compare yourself with no one: you don't know anyone's story; stay in your lane; be focused.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling will find rising pretty tough.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; be bullish; be open to taking calculated risks.

proverbs.proverb: Oko dùn ún ro l'àgbẹ̀dẹ ṣe ńrọ ọkọ́.
proverbs.translation: If farming were that fantastic, would blacksmiths opt to make hoes (for others)?
proverbs.wisdom: Look beyond the surface: think critically; don't be naive or simplistic; things are often not quite as they appear.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó máa di akàn, bí ẹja ni í kọ́kọ́ máa ńrí.
proverbs.translation: What will turn out favourable eventually, often starts out with much challenges.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't quit; keep hope alive; if you won't give up, you will win, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá fi sílẹ̀ lẹnu ewúrẹ́ ńtó.
proverbs.translation: What is left unattended, is what the goat's mouth can get to.
proverbs.wisdom: Ultimately, we lose whatever we neglect: care for what you value.

proverbs.proverb: Àjọjẹ ò dùn bí ẹnìkan ò bá ní; ọjọ́ a ní la ńṣe àjọjẹ.
proverbs.translation: Sharing a meal isn't pleasant when one party persistently lacks; we are usually happy to share, when we all can give.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to give to others, but better to empower them to help themselves.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó roko tí kò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró.
proverbs.translation: A farmer who ploughed his farm, but planted no corn claims he's hurting the ground squirrel; he hasn't hurt any squirrel, but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Vindictive actions can be self-defeating: be forward-looking; be positive.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if you pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a contentious person, he or she will yet remain contentious.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking, be positive; do your best and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Híhó ọṣẹ la fi í bọ̀wọ̀ fún un; ọ̀ṣẹ tí ò hó ò ní'yì mọ́.
proverbs.translation: To lather is the beauty of soap; any soap that won't lather has no honour.
proverbs.wisdom: Develop and hone your talent and uniqueness, and be a blessing with them; and your honour beckons.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọkọ̀ kan ó re Ejínrín, ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún ẹ̀ á lọ.
proverbs.translation: If one bus won't go to Ejinrin town, thousands others will go.
proverbs.wisdom: No one, and nothing is irreplaceable; alternatives always exist, if we look well enough.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹyìn tí yóò di epo, yóò tọ́ iná wò.
proverbs.translation: A palm nut that desires to become palm oil will have a taste of fire.
proverbs.wisdom: There's always a price tag; good things do not always come easy; no pain, no gain.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá gbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused: ignore distractions; not all issues should get our attention.

proverbs.proverb: Agbọ́n sẹ́, oyin sẹ́, ojú olóko rè é gòdògbò godogbo.
proverbs.translation: The wasp denies (stinging the farmer), the bee denies, yet the farmer's face remains heavily swollen.
proverbs.wisdom: What we say pales to what we do: our actions define and expose who we really are;  be true in fact and in appearance.

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwó rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is inevitable: a season must need go and another must need come; nothing lasts forever.

proverbs.proverb: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kọ́ l'onísẹ́, à fi ẹni tó bá fi orí tì í  d'ópin.
proverbs.translation: To start anything is not as crucial as seeing it through to completion.
proverbs.wisdom: 'Finishiative' is superior to initiative: don't start what you won't finish; finish whatever you start.

proverbs.proverb: Kiní yì í, kiní i wa ni, ó yàtọ̀ sí kiní yì í, kiní ì mi ni.
proverbs.translation: This item is ours is different from this item is mine.
proverbs.wisdom: If it is not wholly yours, you cannot have absolute claim on it; group ownership is grossly  limitting.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ẹṣin bá dá'ni, a máa ńtun ùn gùn ni.
proverbs.translation: If one is thrown by a horse, one ought to remount it again.
proverbs.wisdom: If you try and fail, try again; it's not how many times you fall that counts, but how many times you get up: if you won't give up, you will win, eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí bíńtí ò tó, púpọ̀ yóò jìnnà sí i.
proverbs.translation: Abundance will be far from whoever is not contented with a little.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; it makes for increase.

proverbs.proverb: Mọ̀jà mọ̀sá l'akínkanjú; akínkanjú tó bá mọ̀ọ́ jà tí kò mọ̀ọ́ sá á bá ogun lọ.
proverbs.translation: A good warrior must know when to fight and when to retreat; a warrior who knows when to fight but not when to retreat will die in battle.
proverbs.wisdom: Timing is crucial; know when to pursue, defer or quit.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í rẹ ológbò, kó má lè ṣe ọdẹ eku.
proverbs.translation: A cat is never too tired to hunt mice.
proverbs.wisdom: Be steadfast, be persistent, be resilient; never quit: quitting is the only way to fail.

proverbs.proverb: Ká panupọ̀ lé ẹlẹ́yọ́rọ́ lọ ná, kí a tó wá fàbọ̀ sí adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: We ought to come together to chase away the fox first, before reverting to the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Handle the most pressing of two problems first rather than inefficiently attempt the two at once.

proverbs.proverb: Ìhòhò dodo làgbàdo ńwọ ilẹ̀; tó bá jáde tán ló ńdi onígba aṣọ.
proverbs.translation: The maize seed goes into the soil absolutely naked; it ends up with multiple peelings only after sprouting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ìgbẹ́ kọ́ lọdẹ ti ńpa ọ̀yà; gbogbo ogun kọ́ lakíkanjú ti ńyege.
proverbs.translation: It's not from all forests that a hunter kills a grasscutter; it's not all battles that a warrior wins.
proverbs.wisdom: You needn't win all battles to win the war: just win the right ones; pick your battles, wisely: don't get embroiled in trivialities.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbàlagbà tó bá fẹ́ fọ inú akèrègbè mọ́ gbọ́dò ṣ'ọ̀rẹ́ ọmọdé, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni ọmọdé tó bá fẹ́ mú nǹkan lórí pẹpẹ gbọdọ̀ sún mọ́ àgbàlagbà nítorí ọwọ́ ọmọdé ò tó pẹpẹ t'àgbàlagbà ò wọ akèrègbè.
proverbs.translation: An elderly person who wants to wash the inside of a gourd, clean, must befriend a child; so also a child who wants to retrieve something on a high shelf must be close to an elder, because a child's hand cannot reach a shelf; and that of an elder won't enter a gourd.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can do it all; we do need one another; cooperate and collaborate more.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ọmọdé bá lóun ò mẹ̀wẹ̀, pé òun ò mòwè, àá sì já ẹ̀wẹ̀ sí ọwọ ọ̀tún, àá já òwè sí ọwọ òsì fún un ni.
proverbs.translation: If a youngster claims ignorance of the ẹ̀wẹ̀ and òwè leaves, one ought to pluck one on his (or her) right hand and the other on his left for him.
proverbs.wisdom: Assert real (or feigned) ignorance of personal responsibility gently, but firmly; don't encourage abdication of responsibility.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn ò bá rìn ní igbèrí irọ́, wọn kì í paá mọ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: If one is not within the vicinity of falsehoods, one cannot be falsely accused.
proverbs.wisdom: Personal integrity is crucial; quite often, it determines one's experience.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó roko tí kò gbin ọkà lóun dá ikún lóró; ikún kọ́ ló dá lóró, ara ẹ̀ ló dá lóró.
proverbs.translation: A farmer who ploughed his farm, but planted no corn claims he's hurting the ground squirrel; he hasn't hurt any squirrel, but himself.
proverbs.wisdom: Be positive, be forward-looking; vindictive actions can be self-limiting.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ ló lésì, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ làá fèsì sí.
proverbs.translation: There is always an appropriate response to every statement, but it's not every statement that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused and ignore distractions; not all issues deserve one's attention.

proverbs.proverb: Àjọjẹ ò dùn bí ẹnìkan ò bá ní; ọjọ́ a ní la ńṣe àjọjẹ.
proverbs.translation: Eating together isn't pleasant when one party lacks; we are usually happy to share, when we all can give.
proverbs.wisdom: It's good to give to others, but better to empower them; it's better to teach people to fish than give them fish.

proverbs.proverb: Tí àdúrà bá gbà tán, apá aládúrà ò ní ká a.
proverbs.translation: When a prayer is answered, the person who prayed would be overwhelmed.
proverbs.wisdom: Prayers work; God's response can be so complete as to be overwhelming.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni bá ńsọ òkò sí adìyẹ igba, òkò ló máa sọ tí ilẹ̀ á fi ṣú.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is throwing stones at two hundred hens, will be at it until the evening.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; don't flock shoot; to focus on doing too many at once, is a recipe for doing none.

proverbs.proverb: Èéfín ni ìwà; kò ṣeé fi pamọ́.
proverbs.translation: Character is like smoke; it cannot be covered up.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can pretend to be who he is not for long; ultimately, our character shows through.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í ṣe fáàrí ẹ̀ṣẹ́ dídì, si ọmọ adẹ́tẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Don’t brag about fists in the presence of a leper.
proverbs.wisdom: Be considerate, courteous and tactful. Be sensitive and show empathy.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńbẹ̀rù àti ṣubú, àti dìde á nira fún un.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is scared of falling will find rising pretty tough.
proverbs.wisdom: Be bullish; take calculated risks; nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverbs.proverb: Ká mú ẹyin sí ọwọ́ ọ̀tún, ká mú ẹyìn sí ọwọ́ òsì, ká fí ẹ̀yìn rìn láti Ìsẹ́yìn dé Ìyìn Èkìtì, ẹni tí kò ní fi iṣẹ́ yin'ni kò ni fi yin’ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if one were to grab an egg with the right hand, a palm-nut with the left, and retro-walked from Iseyin (a town) to Iyin Ekiti, those who won't be grateful, still won't be.
proverbs.wisdom: You can't please everyone: do your very best and move on.

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù kí ojú kan tóbi tó, ojú méjì sàn ju ojú kan lọ.
proverbs.translation: No matter how big an eye is, two eyes are better than one.
proverbs.wisdom: Team spirit is it; together everyone achieves more; cooperate and collaborate more.

proverbs.proverb: Ìgbín ò lè sáré bí Ajá; ìyẹn ò ní kó máà de ibi tó ńlọ.
proverbs.translation: The snail cannot run as fast as the dog; that won't stop it from getting to wherever it's going.
proverbs.wisdom: We are all uniquely endowed, and complete enough to live out our lives; stay in your lane: envy no one.

proverbs.proverb: Òkun kì í hó ruru, kí á wà á ruru.
proverbs.translation: Never paddle wildly in a stormy sea.
proverbs.wisdom: Be patient; complex issues should be carefully and patiently handled.

proverbs.proverb: Bí èyàn bá dúró sínú oòrùn títí, bó pẹ́ bó yá, ibòji, á báa níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If one tarries long in the sun, eventually, the shade will come (when the sun sets).
proverbs.wisdom: Tough times cannot last forever; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Èyàn kì í mọ iyì ohun tó ní, à fi tó bá sọ ọ́ nù.
proverbs.translation: We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose the thing.
proverbs.wisdom: Take nothing desired for granted: we lose, sometimes permanently, whatever we take for granted; treasure whatever you wish to keep.

proverbs.proverb: Àbá làá kó dànù; ẹnìkan kì í kó aláàbá dànù.
proverbs.translation: You may only discard a suggestion, but not the one who made it.
proverbs.wisdom: A case against ad hominem; question and attack ideas not personalities.

proverbs.proverb: Odò tó ńṣàn kì í b'ojú w'ẹ̀hìn.
proverbs.translation: A flowing stream never looks (or flows) backward.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking; be focused: no one drives forward with eyes on the rearview mirror.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí ò fẹ́ wọ àkísà, kì í bá ajá ṣe eré e géle.
proverbs.translation: Don't play rough with a dog, if you don't want to end up in tatters.
proverbs.wisdom: Look before you leap; think before you act: actions come with consequences.

proverbs.proverb: Kí a tó dé ibi tí à ńlọ, a máa ńkọ́kọ́ dé ibi tí a kò fẹ́.
proverbs.translation: Before getting to our destination, we may have to get to where we'd rather not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused, be strategic: always look ahead; don't lose the forest for the trees.

proverbs.proverb: Màlúù tí ò n'írù, Ọlọ́run ni í lé eṣinṣin fún un.
