proverbs.translation: It's God that fends off flies for a cow that has no tail.
proverbs.wisdom: God helps those who can't help themselves; whatever is impossible to man, is possible with God.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ògiri ò bá la'nu, aláǹgbá ò lè r'áyè wọ̀ ọ́.
proverbs.translation: If there are no crevices in the wall, the lizard cannot penetrate into the wall.
proverbs.wisdom: Actions beckon, and quite often, compel reactions; to stop an effect, eliminate the action causing it.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í bá ara ẹni tan kí á fa ara ẹni n'ítan ya.
proverbs.translation: To be related to someone is no excuse to be unconscionably dependent on him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Good to take personal responsibility; never abuse your privileges: there is a limit to everything.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ rẹ̀ jù sí inú eèrùn, bí inú rẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú eèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid rashness; be wary of taking crucial decisions when angry.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble.
proverbs.wisdom: Ignore distractions; stay focused and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá akitiyan wa á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: If we won't give up, our hustling will one day end.
proverbs.wisdom: Finish whatever you start: never give up, never quit; if we won't quit, we will win.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ́ láàpa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè láàpa.
proverbs.translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made.
proverbs.wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; diligence pays.

proverbs.proverb: Àìsanra tó ajá ológìnní kì í ṣe ti àìjẹun ká'nú; bí ìran rẹ̀ ṣe mọ ni.
proverbs.translation: The smaller frame of cats' relative to dogs isn't for want of food; that's cats' genetic makeup.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; often, there is more than is immediately obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Yàrá kékeré gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, tí ìfẹ bá wà láàárín wọn.
proverbs.translation: A little room is sizable enough for twenty friends, if there is love in their midst.
proverbs.wisdom: Love is it: little is much if love is in it; with love, a cottage may well pass for a castle.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú u rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever would calmly and patiently dismember an ant would see its intestines.
proverbs.wisdom: Be calm, be even keeled, and be patient: virtually nothing is impossible, with these.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà tí èèyàn tọ̀ tó ṣubú, bí èèyàn bá ní sùúrù, èyàn lè tọ̀ọ́ là.
proverbs.translation: A path that one treads and fails, with patience, one may well tread it to success.
proverbs.wisdom: No closed case and no impossibility: if you won't give up, you will win; be open-minded, be patient and be persistent.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ.
proverbs.translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; excessive talk made the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys.
proverbs.wisdom: Moderation is crucial; exercise self-control, always.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ìgbà bá ńgbá'ni ká máa rọ́'jú; bó pẹ́ bó yà ìgbà ńbọ̀ wá gba'ni.
proverbs.translation: If a season afflicts, we ought to persevere; the good times will soon come.
proverbs.wisdom: Persevere and keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever; change is inevitable.

proverbs.proverb: Ò yẹ kí ìdí gbé àtàrí wò, kó mọ iṣẹ tí eṣinṣin ńṣe.
proverbs.translation: The buttocks should trade places with the head, to appreciate what flies do (to it).
proverbs.wisdom: Be hesitant to criticise: you can't be too sure of what others are going through, if you've never been in their shoes.

proverbs.proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We are inseparable from our character.
proverbs.wisdom: No one can pretend to be who he or she is not for very long; be patient, ultimately, the real character will show through.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún ata nínú odó, báa lọ̀ ọ́ lórí ọlọ, iwa ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound it in a mortar or grind it on the grinding stone, pepper will remain inseparable from its character.
proverbs.wisdom: Old habits die hard; we can hardly pretend to be who we are not, for long.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀.
proverbs.translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no end to learning: be oen to it; age is no barrier to learning.]

proverbs.proverb: Bí a ò kú, ìṣe ò tán.
proverbs.translation: As long as there is life, there is no end to what one can still achieve.
proverbs.wisdom: With life, there is hope; no impossibility; never ever give up.

proverbs.proverb: Kíkéré l'abẹ́rẹ́ kéré, kì í ṣe mímì fún adìyẹ.
proverbs.translation: A needle may be tiny, but it’s not an object to be swallowed by the hen.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't judge a book by its cover: never judge by appearance; underestimate no one.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni.
proverbs.translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer.
proverbs.wisdom: God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.

proverbs.proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jìyà, bó bá dàgbà, á tó ọdẹ ẹ́ ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting.
proverbs.wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni ọ̀rẹ́ dà, kó má ṣe bí'nú; ẹni abínibí ńda'ni.
proverbs.translation: Those betrayed by friends shouldn't be offended; even siblings betray one another.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it; forgive and forget; don't hold on to hurts.

proverbs.proverb: Àlejò bí òkété là ńfi èkùrọ́ lọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A guest like bush rat is the one offered palm kernel.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance matters: how you appear dictates how you'll be received.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán nínú ewé, táa se ọbẹ̀ nínú èpo ẹpà, ẹni máa yó, á yó.
proverbs.translation: Even if we pound yam in a leaf and prepare the soup in a groundnut pod, those who would be full, would be.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Ààtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: A refuse dump that won't tolerate filth won't be filled up easily.
proverbs.wisdom: Be tolerant; intolerance can impose limitations.

proverbs.proverb: Yinni yinni kí ẹni ṣè'mí ì.
proverbs.translation: Praise a kind person and he or she will be spurred to do more.
proverbs.wisdom: Praise and appreciation inspire and bring increase.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú ṣe kéré tó, ó fi ààyè gba ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: As small as the belly is, it has room for the baby (the foetus).
proverbs.wisdom: We always make room for what is important to us.

proverbs.proverb: A ní kí ẹ jẹ ẹ́, ẹ léegun lásán ni; a ní kí ẹ gbé e sọnù ẹ lẹ́ran díẹ́ wà ńbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Asked to eat it, you claimed it is a mere bone; yet when asked to discard it, you insisted it still has some meat.
proverbs.wisdom: Greed spurs indecision and discontentment; the greedy is seldom contented.

proverbs.proverb: Bí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba.
proverbs.translation: If one head is blessed, it will positively impact two hundred others.
proverbs.wisdom: Success can be contagious; a well-targeted intervention can positively affect several others.

proverbs.proverb: Gbogbo ẹkún kọ́ làpẹrẹ ìbànújẹ́; gbogbo ẹ̀rín sì kọ́ ló túmọ̀ sí ìdùnnú.
proverbs.translation: Not all tears signify sadness; not all laughters imply happiness.
proverbs.wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.

proverbs.proverb: Agbẹ́-igi-lére kan kò lè gbẹ́ inú u rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No sculptor can carve the internals of the statue he or she is carving.
proverbs.wisdom: There is a limit to what anyone can do: be reasonable in your expectations; most people are doing the very best they can, regardless of how it seems.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó ṣe ohun tó dun'ni lóòní le ṣe ohun tí yóò dùn mọ́ni l'ọ́la.
proverbs.translation: A person who hurts one today may well be a blessing to one tomorrow.
proverbs.wisdom: Write-off no one; quit being vindictive: be forward-looking; there are no permanent enemies, only permanent interests.

proverbs.proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín'gbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun.
proverbs.translation: Even if the calabash carver stops carving calabashes, those already carved will remain.
proverbs.wisdom: Even if we refrain from kind acts, those rendered still live on; keep up the kindness: they are never wasted or lost.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá pẹ́ lórí imí, eṣinkéṣin a máa bá’ni níbẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: Whoever takes unduly long in open defecation, may well play host to strange flies.
proverbs.wisdom: Undue tardiness often results in unexpected outcomes; make hay while the sun shines.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹlẹ́rù ló ńgbé ẹrù ẹ̀ kí a tó báa fọwọ́ kún un.
proverbs.translation: The owner has to first pick up his (or her) luggage before others will extend hands of support.
proverbs.wisdom: Take responsibility and ownership, before seeking help; don't expect support from others, if you're unwilling to do all you can.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó sùn là ńjí, a kì í jí apirọrọ; táa bá jí apirọrọ kò ní dáhùn.
proverbs.translation: The person sleeping is the person one wakes, not the person pretending to be asleep; the person pretending won't respond, if one wakes him or her.
proverbs.wisdom: Unsolicited advice or assistance is seldom appreciated.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan, bọ́ ọmọ tó rù.
proverbs.translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day.
proverbs.wisdom: Good things take time: be patient, but be dogged;  don’t force issues before their time, but keep feeding the issues without relenting.

proverbs.proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run.
proverbs.translation: God's messenger never grows weary.
proverbs.wisdom: God cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs; try Him.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gba àkàtà lọ́wọ́ akítì; a kì í gba ilé baba ọmọ lọ́wọ́ ọmọ.
proverbs.translation: No one can stop monkeys from squatting; no one should deprive a child of his patrimony.
proverbs.wisdom: Be fair and just; don't deprive people of what is rightly theirs.

proverbs.proverb: A ní kí ohun tó wu'ni wá, ohun tó dára ló yọjú; bó bá dára bí kò wu'ni ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: One beckons on what one desires, but the beautiful pops up; what if it's beautiful but it's not desired?
proverbs.wisdom: Our choice remains our choice: it's inviolable; beauty is in the eye of the beholder.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ọmọdé bá rí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tó ńgun ẹṣin lọ níwájú, ó yẹ kó wo ẹgbẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀ tó ńfi ẹsẹ̀ rìn bọ̀ lẹ́hìn.
proverbs.translation: A youngster who's anxious at his (or her) peers riding horses ahead, will do well to look back to see his father's mates trudging behind.
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ará ilé ẹni bá ńjẹ kòkòrò búburú, ó yẹ ká sọ fún un, nítorí hùrù hẹrẹ rẹ̀ kò ní jẹ́ ká sùn lóru.
proverbs.translation: If your companion is eating a harmful insect, caution him (or her); else, the effect on him won't let you sleep at night.
proverbs.wisdom: Be proactive; to be forewarned is to be forearmed.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó jẹ ọba tán tó tún ńwo òkè fẹ̀ fẹ̀ fẹ̀, ṣé ó fẹ́ di Olódùmarè ni?
proverbs.translation: Does the person who kept looking upwards in dire expectation after just being crowned a king want to become God?
proverbs.wisdom: Contentment is it; lack of contentment can be stressful.

proverbs.proverb: Àìní ìforítì àparò ló sọ ọ́ di aláṣọ pípọ́n.
proverbs.translation: Patridge's lack of perseverance is what gave it its dirty garb.
proverbs.wisdom: Perseverance is it; Lack of perseverance may deprive you of what ought to rightfully be yours.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí kò dúpẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀fà, bẹ́ igi dí ọ̀nà egbèje.
proverbs.translation: Whoever is not grateful for small favours, blocks the path to bigger ones.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; kindness calls for gratitude; and gratitude beckons on more kindness.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ mí só, èmi náà yóò só; olúwarẹ̀ yóò kàn ṣu sára ni.
proverbs.translation: My friend farts, I must fart; you will simply end up defecating on yourself._
proverbs.wisdom: Stay in your lane and embrace your uniqueness; be secure in who you are: don't compare yourself with anyone.

proverbs.proverb: Ìkòkò ńse iṣu ẹnìkan ò gbọ́, ṣùgbọ́n iṣú dé inú odó tán ariwo ó ta.
proverbs.translation: While the pot was cooking the yam, no one heard a thing, but no sooner had the yams got into the mortar than noise broke out.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid obtrusive grandstanding: empty vessels make the most noise.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ̀ọ́ rìn mọ̀ọ́ yan kí orí má mì l'ọ́rùn.
proverbs.translation: One cannot be so good at walking and marching that the head won't shake.
proverbs.wisdom: Tolerance is it; no one is perfect.

proverbs.proverb: A ki ẹsẹ̀ kan bọ odò, ọ̀nì fàá, tí a bá fi ẹsẹ̀ méjèjì s'ódò kí la mọ̀ pó fẹ́ ṣẹ'lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: We dipped a leg into the river and the crocodile snapped at it; who knows what would have happened had we dipped the two.
proverbs.wisdom: To be forewarned is to be forearmed.

proverbs.proverb: Ipá ńmú ẹṣin lọ sódò, ipá ò fún un lómi mu.
proverbs.translation: You can force a horse to the river but you can't force it to drink water.
proverbs.wisdom: You can provide opportunities, but you can't force anyone to take or make the best of them; you can't force anyone to do what he or she is determined not to do.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í yàgò fún ẹlẹ́ṣin àná.
proverbs.translation: No one gives way (or defers) to someone who used to own a horse.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't live in the past: where we have been is not as crucial as where we are going; have a strategic-mindset and focus

proverbs.proverb: Bí a bá ṣe'ni lóore, ọpẹ́ là ńdá.
proverbs.translation: If one has been favoured with kindness, one ought to give thanks.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í gbọ́ kúkù òjò da omi agbada nù.
proverbs.translation: Never pour away the water in the trough simply because the cloud rumbles.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; never count your chickens before they are hatched.

proverbs.proverb: Bí ikú ilé ò pa'ni, t'òde ò leè pa'ni.
proverbs.translation: If there is no enemy within, the ones outside can do us no harm. If there is no enemy within, the one outside can do us no harm.
proverbs.wisdom: Choose your friends wisely; worry less about the enemies without.]

proverbs.proverb: A kì í wo ìyẹ́ adìyẹ nílẹ̀, kí a wá fi ìrù àkèekèé rin etí.
proverbs.translation: No one has a hen's feather within reach and opt to scratch his or her inner ear with a scorpion's stinger.
proverbs.wisdom: Avoid needless exposures to high risks.

proverbs.proverb: Ọmọ aráyé ńp'àtẹ́wọ́ fún yànmùyánmú, inú ẹ̀ ńdùn; kò mọ̀ pé òun ńfi ikú ṣeré ni.
proverbs.translation: People clap for mosquito and it rejoices, oblivious that it is toying with death.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive: not all positive gestures are noble.

proverbs.proverb: Ọba tí kì í fẹ́ gba ìmọ̀ràn, irú wọn kì í pẹ́ fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ.
proverbs.translation: Any king who despises counsels, hardly takes long before stumbling.
proverbs.wisdom: It's smart to be open to and treasure good counsels: those who spurn them needlessly expose themselves to avoidable errors.

proverbs.proverb: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ajá tó bá ńgbó'ni lọ́jà, la ńdá lóhùn.
proverbs.translation: It's not all the dogs that bark at one at the marketplace that one responds to.
proverbs.wisdom: Stay focused: ignore distractions; not all issues should get our attention.

proverbs.proverb: Ọlọ́run ò fẹ́ irọ́; ọmọ èyàn ò fẹ́ òdodo; bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ ò pé mẹ́ta.
proverbs.translation: God hates lies; man hates truths; yet there is no third option in a discourse.
proverbs.wisdom: [It is better to always stick with the truth, even when there are no easy options.]

proverbs.proverb: Bí ẹ̀dá bá fẹ́ gba àwìn ẹ̀bà, ni wọ́n máa ńṣe ojú àánú; tí wọ́n bá yó tán, wọ́n á di ọkọ olúwa wọn.
proverbs.translation: People present a facade of humility when seeking favour, but easily lord it over their benefactors, once satisfied.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear.

proverbs.proverb: Ọwọ́ ọlọ́wọ́ ò lè yó ẹnu ẹlẹ́nu.
proverbs.translation: Never expect the hands of someone else to feed you to satisfaction.
proverbs.wisdom: Depend less, possibly not at all, on anyone: go catch your own fish.

proverbs.proverb: Jẹ́ kí ńfìdí hẹẹ́, ni àlejò fi ńti onílé sóde.
proverbs.translation: Let me just hang in here, is how the guest takes over the house from the host.
proverbs.wisdom: Think well about that inch you want to give, it may well become a mile: be perceptive, be circumspect.

proverbs.proverb: À ti gbé ìyàwó ò tóó pọ́n; owó ọbẹ̀ ló ṣòro.
proverbs.translation: Getting married is not an issue; meeting the marriage responsibility is the tough nut.
proverbs.wisdom: Look before you leap; think well before you act; it's easy to start some things, but tough to sustain it.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí kòkó ẹ̀ yè, kì í ṣe mímọ̀ ọ́ ṣe ẹ̀, bíkòṣe Elédùà.
proverbs.translation: A farmer with a thriving cocoa farm owes this not to his or her effort, but to God.
proverbs.wisdom: There is no self-made person: we are all God-made:; we must remain small in our very own eyes; we must be ever so modest.

proverbs.proverb: Ká dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ọrùn tó gbé orí dúró; ọ̀pọ̀ ẹran ló sún mọ́ orí tí ò ṣe nǹkankan.
proverbs.translation: Wẹ ought to be thankful to the neck for supporting the head; many tissues are close to it, yet do nothing.
proverbs.wisdom: Be thankful, even for small favours.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fura sí ẹni tí a ńbá rìn; ẹni tí a bá ńfura sí, a kì í bá irú wọn rìn.
proverbs.translation: Do not be suspicious of those you associate with; those you'd be suspicious of, should not be your close associates.
proverbs.wisdom: Build trust; avoid paranoia; be positive; be forward-looking.

proverbs.proverb: Tó bá kù díẹ̀ kí ọmọ olóore jìn sí kòtò, mànàmáná á ṣiṣẹ́ ìmọ́lẹ̀ fún un.
proverbs.translation: Just before a kind person would stumble into a ditch (in darkness), the lightning would light up his or her path to save the day.
proverbs.wisdom: Kindness pays: it's good to be good; kind acts are never lost.

proverbs.proverb: Apẹ́kótójẹun kò ní jẹ bàjẹ́.
proverbs.translation: The one who tarries to eat won't necessarily eat a lousy meal.
proverbs.wisdom: Delay is not necessarily denial; often delays imply the perfection of the object hoped for; keep hope alive: it is not over yet.

proverbs.proverb: Ohun tí a bá bò, ló ńníyì.
proverbs.translation: Whatever is covered up (or not easily accessible) is what is respected and honoured.
proverbs.wisdom: Familiarity breeds contempt: whatever is easily available typically loses value and worth.

proverbs.proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bópẹ́ bóyá akitiyan á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan.
proverbs.translation: If one won't give up trying, one's hustling will one day come to an end.
proverbs.wisdom: Never give up, never quit; if we won't quit, we will win eventually.

proverbs.proverb: Adániwáyè ò gbàgbé ẹnìkan; àìmàsìkò ló ńdààmú ẹ̀dá.
proverbs.translation: God has not forgotten anyone; ignorance of divine timing is what makes us fret.
proverbs.wisdom: Keep hope alive; hang on there: the best is yet to come.

proverbs.proverb: Òjò tó rọ̀ sí ewúro, náà ló rọ̀ sí ìrèké.
proverbs.translation: The same rain that fell on the bitter-leaf, fell on the sugarcane (yet bitter-leaf is bitter while sugarcane remains sweet.)
proverbs.wisdom: Our reactions tell of who we really are deep down; bitter or vengeful responses are by choice.

proverbs.proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tó jẹun yó tó fọ́ akèrègbè, ti gbàgbé pé ọjọ́ òǹgbẹ ṣì ńbọ̀.
proverbs.translation: The farmer who ate, had his fill, and broke the water gourd has forgotten that days of thirst are ahead.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic: think ahead; never slam the door on your way out: you may need it opened in future.

proverbs.proverb: Oò ṣá igi lọ́gbẹ́, oò ta ògùrọ̀ lọfà, o dé ìdí ọ̀pẹ, o ńgbẹ́nu s'ókè; ṣé ọ̀fẹ́ ló máa ńro ni?
proverbs.translation: You neither hacked a palm nor stabbed a raffia, yet you opened up your mouth under a palm for wine; does it drip freely?
proverbs.wisdom: No free lunch; take responsibility; pay the price.

proverbs.proverb: Àìdúpẹ́ oore àná a máa mú oore sú'ni í ṣe.
proverbs.translation: Lack of gratitude for yesterday's kindness does make future acts of kindness tiresome.
proverbs.wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; take nothing for granted: whatever is taken for granted diminishes; whatever is appreciated increases.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í mọ iyì wúrà tí kò bá sọnù.
proverbs.translation: A piece of gold (ornament) is seldom appreciated until it gets lost.
proverbs.wisdom: We seldom appreciate what we have, until we lose it; the available is easily taken for granted.

proverbs.proverb: Etí mẹ́ta ò yẹ orí; èèyàn mẹ́ta ò lè dúró ní méjì-méjì.
proverbs.translation: Three ears do not suit the head; three people cannot stand in groups of twos.
proverbs.wisdom: There is always a right and wrong way to do anything: focus on the right way.]

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tí a  ńbá ná'jà la ńwò a kì í wo ariwo ọjà.
proverbs.translation: Wẹ should be focused on the person we are trading with and not the din and bustle in the market.
proverbs.wisdom: Be focused; shun distractions.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni tó bá ní kí ọ̀rẹ́ òun má jọba ni kò ní lọ̀rẹ́ ọba.
proverbs.translation: Whoever blocks his friend from becoming a king won't have a king as a friend.,
proverbs.wisdom: Foster goodness: those plotting evil for others often share in the evil results; we reap whatever we sow.

proverbs.proverb: Ọ̀nà kan ò wọ ọjà.
proverbs.translation: Not just one route leads to the market.
proverbs.wisdom: Alternative approaches exist; there are many ways to achieve an end; don't be fixated on one.

proverbs.proverb: Ojú tí kò rí yànnà yánná iná, yẹ̀rẹ̀ yẹrẹ oòrùn, kì í rí yìndìn yindin idẹ.
proverbs.translation: A pair of eyes that won't endure the fiery flames of fire, the searing glare of the sun, can't hope to enjoy the glittering beauty of brass.
proverbs.wisdom: No pain, no gain; no guts, no glory.

proverbs.proverb: Tí ìṣẹ́ ò bá jẹ́ ká sọ òdodo, àìṣòdodo kò ní jẹ́ ká bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ìṣẹ́.
proverbs.translation: If fear of poverty makes us lie, lying will keep us entrenched in poverty, as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Honesty pays; dishonest lifestyle does exact hefty fees, at the end.

proverbs.proverb: Ikú fẹ́ pa alápatà ó ńkígbe; ọmọ ẹranko tó ti dá lóró ńkọ́?
proverbs.translation: Death stalks the butcher and he screams; what about the animals he's butchered?
proverbs.wisdom: Exact from no one what you are unwilling to impose on yourself; be fair and considerate.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í sọ òkò sí ẹyẹ tó ńwá ọ̀nà àti fò.
proverbs.translation: Do not throw stones at a bird that seeks to fly away.
proverbs.wisdom: Act in wisdom: do not pre-empt or worsen an already deplorable situation.

proverbs.proverb: Bó ti wù kí ojú kan tóbi tó, ojú méjì sàn ju ojú kan lọ.
proverbs.translation: No matter how big an eye is, two eyes are better than one.
proverbs.wisdom: Team effort is superior.

proverbs.proverb: Báa gún iyán, táa ro ọkà fún kòfẹ́kògbà, kò ní fẹ́, kò ní gbà, náà ni.
proverbs.translation: Even if you pound yam and prepare yam flour meal for a contentious person, he or she will yet remain contentious.
proverbs.wisdom: Be forward-looking, be positive; do your best and keep moving.

proverbs.proverb: Bí inú bá bí baba tó bá gbé ọmọ ẹ̀ jù sí inú èèrùn, bí inú ẹ̀ bá rọ̀, inú èèrùn lè má rọ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a father gets so angry as to throw his child into a raid of army ants, by the time he calms down, the ants may not be.
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be hasty in anger: calm down; avoid rashness.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í fi ẹ̀tẹ̀ sílẹ̀ pa làpálàpá.
proverbs.translation: Do not leave leprosy unattended while preoccupied with treating ringworm.
proverbs.wisdom: Think perceptively and strategically: don't lose sight of the forest for the trees: look at the bigger picture; things are often more than they seem.

proverbs.proverb: Àmójúkúrò ni í mú ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́ gùn.
proverbs.translation: Willingness to overlook is what makes for an enduring loving relationship.
proverbs.wisdom: If it is wrong, love will not see it; tolerance is crucial.

proverbs.proverb:
.

Ẹni tó ńlé nǹkan níwájú, ńfi àwọn nǹkan míràn sẹ́hìn.

Translation:
Whoever is pursuing something ahead, is actually leaving some other things behind. I 

Wisdom:
There's always a price tag: we must let go of what is behind, if we want to lay hold of what is ahead.
Èyí wù mí, ò wù ọ́, lọmọ ìyá méjì ṣe ńfẹ́ ìyàwó ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
proverbs.translation: What appeals to me does not necessarily appeal to you is the reason two maternal brothers have different wives.
proverbs.wisdom: Different strokes for different folks; people are entitled to their choices: live and let live.

proverbs.proverb: Bí afọ́jú bá lóun yóò fọ́'ni lójú, ó yẹ ká fura, nítorí tí kò bá mú nǹkan lọ́wọ́, ó lè tẹ nǹkan mọ́lẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: If a blind man threatens to make you blind, be wary; if he has nothing in his hands, he may have something under his feet
proverbs.wisdom: Don't be presumptuous; underestimate no one.

proverbs.proverb: Òròmọadìyẹ ńbá àṣá ṣeré, ó rò pé ẹyẹ oko lásán ni.
proverbs.translation: The chick gullibly plays with the hawk believing it to be an ordinary bird.
proverbs.wisdom: Naivety can be risky, if not fatally costly.

proverbs.proverb: Ọgbọ́n ju agbára lọ.
proverbs.translation: Wisdom is better than strength.
proverbs.wisdom: Pursue wisdom.

proverbs.proverb: Ṣiṣẹ́ ṣiṣẹ́ ò gọ̀, ó fẹ́ jàre ìṣẹ́ ni; ẹni tó kọ̀ tí ò ṣiṣẹ́ fẹ́ yan ìṣẹ́ láàyò ni.
proverbs.translation: The diligent isn't stupid, he or she simply wants to defeat poverty; the person who refuses to work, really seeks to partner with poverty.
proverbs.wisdom: Diligence is a choice: choose right.

proverbs.proverb: Èéfín ni ìwà; kò ṣeé fi pamọ́.
proverbs.translation: Character is like smoke: it cannot be covered up.
proverbs.wisdom: We cannot pretend to be who we are not for very long.

proverbs.proverb: Bàtà orí àkìtàn náà re òde ìyàwó rí.
proverbs.translation: Those pair of shoes on the refuse dump was once worn to a wedding.
proverbs.wisdom: Change is inevitable: a season must need go and another must need come; nothing lasts forever.

proverbs.proverb: Àdàbà ò náání à ńkùn'gbẹ́; pápá ńjó ẹyẹ oko fò lọ.
proverbs.translation: The dove is unmoved by the bush being set on fire; once on fire, it simply flies away.
proverbs.wisdom: Be strategic; in every situation, always have an assured plan B: it engenders calm in the midst of a storm.

proverbs.proverb: A kì í dámọ̀nràn àti tà'kìtì lágbàlá ọ̀bọ, nítorí ọ̀bọ fúnra'ra rẹ̀, ọba òkìtì ni.
proverbs.translation: Never toy with the idea of somersaulting in the vicinity of a monkey: monkeys themselves, are experts at somersaulting.
proverbs.wisdom: Be modest; don't make a needless show of your ignorance.

proverbs.proverb: Ẹni a fẹ́ la mọ̀, a ò mọ ẹni tó fẹ́'ni.
proverbs.translation: You do know who you love for sure, but you cannot be certain of who really loves you.
proverbs.wisdom: Be perceptive; things are often not as they appear.

proverbs.proverb: Kò sí bí àtùpà ṣe lè lágbára tó, kò lè ríran rí ìdí ara rẹ̀.
proverbs.translation: No matter how strong a lamp is, it cannot light up it's base.
proverbs.wisdom: No matter how strong anyone is, he or she will always need the input of others; no one is wholly self-sufficient, nor indeed can be.

proverbs.proverb: Orúkọ tí a bá sọ ajá ẹni lọmọ aráyé ńbá ni í pèé.
proverbs.translation: Whatever name one calls one's dog, that is the name others will call it as well.
proverbs.wisdom: Speak positively: words objectify themselves; never describe yourself or what you do in negative terms.

proverbs.proverb: Ilẹ̀ àánú Olúwa kì í ṣú.
proverbs.translation: God's mercy never runs out.
proverbs.wisdom: No impossibility with God: He cannot be contained or cornered; keep hope alive.

proverbs.proverb: Àbàtà takété bí ẹni pé kò bá odò tan.
proverbs.translation: The marshy place keeps aloof as if it is unrelated to the river.
proverbs.wisdom: When the going gets tough, pretty few will stick with you: mentally prepare for this; everybody loves the winner, but when you lose, you are on your own.
